This place is absolutely addicting. I go to New York about every other month, and always make it a point to stop here. Don't be deterred because it's not pristine!!!!!
One of the best bang for your bargain for  you BBQ Chinese style pork lovers.
Best 5.50 you will ever spend on food. The amount of food you get can feed a small family of 5. The quality is average to low but it makes it up with serving size. Come here for lunch.

The price is $3.75 smallwith rice not bad.I like da roast pork but the roast pig NAh too fatty.n ders no difference from other chinese resto.its more cheaper in Flushing main st.corner 28 u buy roast pork u get free anothr item of food.
No comment

The answer to the question "what would be your last meal on earth" garners several replies: foie gras sliders, uni from santa barbara, toro from tsukiji market, A5-11 kobe beef... but  chinese bbq pork would be a contender for me.  Wandered over here after a tour at the Tenement Museum @ 97 Orchard (totally worth doing if you're tired of shopping etc). It's like ordering at the deli.  Husband and wife working solo, and a line out the door, mainly of locals who know how great it is.  $3.75 you get the small aluminum container with rice, some napa cabbage and a pile of juicy, flavorful pork.  It is delicious and satisfying.  For $5.25 you get a larger styrofoam container of the same goodies.  Like others have said, it's all carry out.  So, walk across the street to the park watch some pick up bball, or the chinese ladies playing mah-jong.
No comment
Delicious char siu and perfect portion (although there can never be enough char siu). Great price too.

5 stars every time no matter what you get; simple the most affordable, generous restaurant in chinatown and perhaps Nyc. I go half roast pork (fat crispy skinned pork belly) and half bbq pork (the typical red sauced)

The place was all right. The portions are big and pretty affordable. The roast pork was good but nothing special. Nothing really stood out to me. After reading reviews I had high expectations but I can't say they've been fulfilled. Maybe I came at they wrong time (6:00pm) but I probably won't be coming back. If I came back I'd probably try the roast pig and duck, seeing as they were out at the time.

I don't get the appeal with this place, yeah it's affordable but it was not the best. I waited a while to get it, the smell itself made me want to stay in the line. My portions were fatty, I didn't enjoy the cabbage that came with it. I couldn't eat it, i ended up giving my leftovers to a homeless man who found me eating it at the park.

This place is pure heaven in the mouth. I tried the duck, roast pork and roast pig. Hands down the roast pig was the best. It was melt in your hot mouth amazing. While the pork fats are melting like butter, you are getting the crunch from the skin. The combination is unreal. The amount of food you get for the price is awesome and the quality was great to boot. I would highly recommend this place to anyone that enjoys this kind of food.

I actually never tried their roast meats over rice but they must be good always a line. I always get their fishball steamed noodles to go. Their steamed rice noodles are the best I've had since my childhood ordering them off the street. Other places just can't compare. For $2.50 a small pint is good enough for a meal. Delicious and inexpensive. No need to wait in line either. If you're ordering noodles go in and directly to the end to order from the lady.
Exactly as advertised. Cheap, simple and delicious.

I got the roast duck and roast pork. The duck was definitely the best I have had in my experience with roast ducks in NYC. Very freshly made, crispy skin and tender meat. The roast pork as also fresh during the lunch hour and very flavorful. This place is always busy so it's hard to imagine getting stale or cold barbeque. No eat in though which sucks... but deserves 5 star for the food they make.
Pretty good and great for the price. Get the pork, didn't think the chicken had much flavor.
Its cheap and filling i got the roast pork with noodles, i am not a fan of the sauce though pushed it over the top in terms of saltiness.

One of the best places, if not the best, in Chinatown when it comes to roast pork, and other awesome food as well. I believe that many will agree that this place screams quantity over quality, except that the quality is pretty good here. Every time I get a lunch box or just roast pork, I always, and I mean always, get a lot more than you would at the average restaurant in Chinatown. You get a lot more for what you pay for if you go for the lunch boxes(containers), which is one of the biggest reasons people line up here. If you like rice+meat(roast pork, chicken, duck, etc.), you won't be disappointed.
Got the duck. Was moist and incredibly delicious. The green sauce is a must when you place your order as well.

I love this place. Where else can you get a huge portion of meat and rice and veggies for 3.75. A very fulfilling meal for that price in NYC is like wow. The line to this place is usually so long. The first time I went here I probably waited in line for about 15-20 minutes. I usually get the BBQ pork with rice lunch special and the man just keeps chopping and chopping the meat that the lid doesn't even fully close.
I totally recommend this place for a quick cheap and delicious lunch! I loved the roasted pork duck chicken, it's totally worth  it!
No comment

Just one word: FANTASTIC!  I loved the food that I ordered and could not believe how cheap it was and how much was piled on.  It's a hole in the wall establishment but from what I heard its been there for a while and has been getting more famous over the years for their hearty and wholesome meals.  There is always a constant long line, so you have to be patient cause you will be rewarded with the most scrumptious food you can get on the cheap.  The one thing that I found interesting was that its a small staff of maybe 3 people tops hence why there is a wait.  There's no seating but on a nice day you can venture into the park across the street and sit and enjoy your meal or go back to your routine.

i finally came and gave the roast pork with rice a chance. i thought it was ok. nothing too special. the line was pretty long but i waited maybe only 5 mins? the roast pork (cha siew) tasted like almost any other roast pork i've had. i don't know if i really will come back but i probably will if i want a cheap bite.

Really good roasted chicken on rice. The prices are excelent, for $5 you have enough for 2 days. Only thing was that the duck is with bones, which was fine for me, but my collegues were moaning about getting their hands dirty :P
As Chinese,I have to say,this fast food  is traditional and cheaper!
I didn't want to believe the hype but the place is great! The roast duck and rice is so simple and yet so good! Obviously it's fatty and bad for you but it tastes amazing.

Instant food coma. The amount of roasted pork in a large rice box here was enough to feed my entire family of 5 for dinner. All we needed to do was make our own rice. The roast pork was not dry at all, but it wasn't filled with fat either. The sauce they pour over the pork and rice at the end has a lot of flavor. Just don't think about the amount of fat in that sauce. This is a great place to grab lunch or even dinner for a fraction of the price you'll pay in other areas.
Get the pork! Out of the chicken, duck, and pork, the pork was definitely the easiest to eat and tasted the best.

This place is THE BEST in Chinese barbecue meat. I heard the Asian guy that runs this place has a black belt in meat cutting as his work is truly masterful. The pork, chicken, and duck are all dripping in irresistible salty/sweet/orgasmic sauce and you can taste it in every bite. Get a large pork, chicken, or duck over rice for the best bang for your buck as it actually costs more for the same amount of meat if you order the meat alone. The small meat over rice is also a good deal but why not look under your couch for an extra buck twenty five to get double the food? I would get takeout from here every day if I was immune to obesity/hypertension/hypercholesterolemia/diabetes/scurvy/death. Cash only.

While wandering through Chinatown on a grocery run one day, I wanted to pick up something quick to eat at home. I looked up this place on Yelp and saw the great reviews and decided to check it out. Now I come at least once a month to pick up some meat to take home as well as a nice big boxed lunch. Wah Fast Food is a tiny store front with no seating but they do not mess around on the food. Their Cha Shao pork is to die for and the duck and the chicken are amazing too. The line is always the most torturous part as you can smell the sweet and savory aromas of the pork the entire time you are waiting. You order your food and they chop up the pork/duck/chicken fresh for you. I always make sure to order just some pork to take home and freeze for later. The menu is mostly in Chinese so bring your best Chinese friend if you want the most authentic experience. Last time I was here, I noticed they also serve this rice noodle breakfast dish with fish balls in a sweet sauce (chang fen) and it was fabulous. I absolutely recommend coming here for authentic, delicious cha shao pork and make sure to bring some extras home for later.
The CHEAPEST and TASTIEST Chinese BBQ food in Chinatown! Would recommend this place to anybody!! Order the charsiu and the duck!!

Went in from the street, not knowing its yelp pedigree and had an amazing meal. The steamed chicken dumplings were mouth watering and the beef broccoli fresh and steaming with flavor. We will definitely be back.
No comment

This is a hole in the wall to go spot.  I recommend the cha sui fan (boneless spare ribs over white rice) and cherng fun yue don (rice noodles with fishballs).  The only down fall is that the wait to order is long.  Get there when it opens or you'll be waiting close to 20 mins
Very delicious! Really recommend! It's very close to our bus station back to Boston. We will order more to take it back home next time.

Cheap, generous portions, greasy, but so good! Definitely need to try their cha siew and roast pork plus their fish balls with rice noodles. It's super heavy on the stomach (let that be a warning) but worth every penny. The line is always very long but the service is great!

Quick and easy. This is literally my go to spot for lunch ALWAYS. I'm always struggling between their Cha Siew or salted duck but either is a plus plus plus!!! I don't even know what to do when Mondays come because they're closed.
Really delicious and cheap food. Line went by quick.

$3.50 for a container that is beyond stuffed with meat and rice is the best deal ever. You'll leave smiling from ear to ear. Sure this place screams dingy and sure it has a B rating but let me tell you, this doesn't not change the fact that this little tim of food taste so good. Its banging like a biscuit good. The $5 container can feed 2, truly will leave you full and happy. I don't know if its the MSG, the greasy oily sauce they lather on it or the ridiculously cheap price but you leave feeling satisfied.

the pork was tender but very dry it did not have enough sauce the 3.75 meal does feel u up but it is not the best like everybody said on here i would never go out all the way to china town to eat this !

Let me start off by saying, the name of this place, deeming that it is "fast" food, is slightly deceiving. Either whoever came up with it unknowingly assumed that just because the food is cheap as heck, it's automatically considered 'fast food', or that calling it a fast food place is a good marketing strategy, or I could just be taking the whole thing way too literally...regardless you have been warned. And I'm not even saying it's not fast because there's always a line or even a lot of people, but that it takes a DARN GOOD WHILE to prepare the order for each customer (I was the fourth person in line and waited about a good 25 min). Given the whole thing is operated by only a man and his wife, in which I do give mad, mad props to them, especially for--ok here comes the relevant part of my review--making the cheapest, bestest dang roast pork in all of New York City, and probably all of the East Coast. It is just simply amazing--tender, juicy, and freakin' tasty! For only $3.50, a generous amount of it also comes with rice and veggies, and I guarantee that it will satisfy your taste buds and your stomach virtually any time of the day. It just doesn't get any better than that.

Hole in the wall fast food joint - I love it! The line moves a tad slow but it's worth the wait. Came here before boarding a long bus ride to Boston and I am so glad I did. Ordered the roast pork over small rice and cabbage. They really do pack a lot of roast pork and rice in the tiny container. I did not think I would be able to finish but I did. Delicious and perfect hangover food.
I got in line because I so all these people standing in line and I was curious.  So glad I did.  Good cheap Chinese fast food.
No comment

I've seen the price gone up from $2.25 for a BBQ pork over rice to something like $3.75 now. I think the BBQ pork is also dryer than what it used to be. Buuut, the flavor is still one among a million and you probably won't regret trying this at least once. Or ordering it every other day.

Best place to get a quick lunch. The roasted pork rice is packed to the rim with pork and the cheurng fun with pork intestines is amazing. Whenever I am in Chinatown visiting friends I always pay this place a visit for a great lunch.
The serving size is HUGE for the price...which is very low.  I go here twice a week.  In fact, I'm going right now.
If you want to eat something that tastes good and is 100% made as in China this is the place to go!
The food is awesome but I hated the wait time. Why can't they get another person to chop the meat. Btw they got a new young staff up front.
Best bang for buck place in chinatown. No wonder the line is so long! Definitely worth the wait
No comment
Cheap and gooooddd!! Unfortunately they did not have the duck anymore around 5pm, so had to go with only cha sui and chicken, still good though!!

I LOVE YOUUUUUUUU.  Yes, for $2.50 a meal, I'll say anything.  How does this place only have 30 something reviews?  It's so darn cheap and pretty tasty as well!  I bought this and added an egg on top at home and felt like I was at Big Wong (although the meat are not as good quality).  I don't mind burnt pork because I like burnt food, but some bits were hard and the duck I got must have been anorexic or something, but whatevs, it's $2.50!  The line moves freakin' slow though.  Whatevs again, it's $2.50!
Not only is this place awesome the prices are incredibly cheap. I usually get the rice rolls with fish balls for $1.50 and the roast pork over rice for $3.

I've been a fan of Wah Fung since their humble beginnings as a street cart on Hester/Bowery.  They were always about stuffing the food containers to the max, making them very popular with the chinatown price conscious consumers.   Their roast pork and roast pork belly are great...  but I still enjoy coming here for brunch more.   Nothing better than some fish balls with steamed noodles, a side of beef tripe/pig skin and fried triple delight!
No comment

Wah Fung is perfection. They give you a mound of roast duck and/or pork atop a bed of rice and cabbage that is so delicious and dirt cheap. It's not just fat or skin either - even the small contains a lot of meat. I love watching the guys chop up the meat in front of you after you've ordered. My dad is Cantonese, and if he lived in New York, he'd go nuts for this place.

Most flavorful roast pig and pork I've ever had. LOVE their noodles with the sauces on it. Can't believe how much food you get and how amazingly delicious it is. But the best part is how little you pay for the most amazing food in Chinatown.

There is a reason why this place has a long line every day. Their food is fantastic and they are very generous with their meat. Most places give you a large serving of white rice and small pieces of meat on top, but that's not the case here. Highly recommend buying the pork rice for 3.75.

My boyfriend & I needed to grab something before we waited for our China bus back to VA. He's not a huge fan of your typical Chinese food, but I thought he would be pleased with this. The line was out the door, but there isn't much space inside anyway. There's a couple working; the woman appears to cook the meat while the husband is the only one that serves. He takes his time, but I'd rather that sometimes especially when it comes to food. We each got a small pork over vegetables (it's just cabbage) and rice. For two of those and a bottle of water only set us back $8. We took it to go and waited to eat it on the bus. At this point, it was cold but still very tasty. It was very filling so even with the small, I could only eat half to start. It was a little greasy, but food tends to show it's true amount of oil when it cools down. I'd definitely recommend it for it's value and quality.
If food tastes so dam good, you just can't stop. I gotta say, this is the best roast duck and pork I've ever had.

My boyfriend and I got the $3.75 special and two cans of soda for $5.25 total. GET OUT OF HERE. There was so much food that both of us couldn't finish it. The chicken was great...my boyfriend wasn't a fan of the bones but for this price who can complain?! Loved the noodles too. Line was a bit long at noon (we waited approx. 20 min.), but it is worth it for the price and the taste.

This place has the best combo over rice in Chinatown! For only $5 or $6 you get bbq crispy pork, bbq pork, roasted duck, and roasted chicken, all over rice. This is the most amazing deal in the world! The portion is big and can probably feed 2 small people or 1 giant person. After eating this you just feel so pleased, like you no longer want more from life, you feel as if your life is complete. And you get this feeling for a very cheap price. I don't know how they make a profit, but it's definitely a huge benefit to the consumer. For the price vs taste of food, you can't go wrong with this place.

Line out the door, and with good reason.  Prices are good and food is pretty delicious for the price point!  The pork over rice was yummy, but i was a big fan of their rice noodle rolls with fish balls!  Comes out piping hot and amazing on a cold winter day.  Worth the wait.
This is the best place to get some Chinese BBQ in the city. I usually get the roast pig and duck over rice. It's a bang for your buck.

Hands down, best meal deal in New York. This is a bargain in any city in the US, but unlike Jacksonville, this food is off the charts good. It's just a stand up joint (to go only), a bit of a dive (LOVE the cash register) and there is usually a line, but it moves okay and what do you want for $3.50? Cash only.
Giant amounts of meat over rice with cabbage. Shuttupandtakemymoney.
No comment
No comment
The line moves a little slow but the food is amazing at such a cheap price! The staff is very nice food is always delious!!' U must try u will be addicted!

Cheapie Chinese at it's finest! Wah Fung may not be the most cleanliest place but it's what you would expect in china town. This tiny store front always has a line. So be prepared to wait a little! It'sonly $3 for delicious roast  BBQ pork, rice, and veggies. You get a huge portion packed into a small container. It's like a clown car trick, because it really is a ton of food! After waiting in the line you might be better off paying $5 and getting the roast pork and duck combo. But seriously, this roasted BBQ pork is caramelized to a juicy char, be cautious of the really fatty pieces. Try to come earlier in the day because if you come close to closing you'll end up with the scraps.
Best place to get chinese bbq in the city.  For $5 you get a full plate of roast goodness. I usually get the roast pig and roast duck combo

Amazing Cantonese roast meat for just insanely low prices.  The food is definitely five stars, but I have to give four because the wait can just get absolutely absurd.  It gets to the point where I'll go somewhere not as good (but still good) because I just don't want to stand in line for a half hour.  But, if you're in the area and hungry at not a peak time, you should absolutely go here.
Pretty good place. There is no room to sit in there, but what you get is awesome food for really low price. I got pork on small rice and it was delicious.
Stumbled upon this place through Yelp's geolocate function.  The pork was literally the best Chinese BBQ I've had and the requisite GI issues were manageable. I'll be back.

So delicious. Just get whatever. Everything is good and so cheap. It is also very exciting watching the chef cutting up the meat. Ok maybe that sounded weird but if you go there, you'll know what I mean. DROOOOL forever.

With a perpetual line out the door and sweaty man with cleaver hacking up meat on a wooden stump, this is why Chinatown is a magical place. I don't mean that some kind of Epcot Center cultural diversity kind of way. I mean that its restaurateurs can make good food that costs much less than the ingredients would in a grocery store. Case in point: pork over large rice, more food than a person can eat in a day, $3.75. And delicious.
No comment

THIS is a must-go when you're in the city.  I love this place to death.  It's a tiny restaurant (if that's what I can even call it) there isn't even a place to sit or anything you just take your food and go to the park across the street and eat there.  The man behind the counter is ALWAYS nice.  It takes awhile to get your food because he's chopping the meat and I love that.  Knowing it's not like precut or anything like that...not that it would matter but I just like it that way.  I always get the small size of roast pork.  That small size is enough for 2 people and it was under $4!  BEST DEAL EVER.  Not only is it the best deal ever, but it's the most tasty roast pork I've EVER had.  I have nothing but good things to say about this place.  It's worth trying and it's worth waiting in line.
No comment

Amazing, is the only word that can describe this place.  The owners are very nice and the lines moves fast.  I usually play some games on my phone to pass the time and next thing you know i'm eating roast pig, roast chicken, roast pork...all that goodness!

I heard so many great things about this place.  Definitely you get your bang for your bucks.  The cute chef fills your take out container to the rim with food.  There is definitely a line.  But hey, you're paying only 3.50 for lunch for two days.  I only tried the roast pork over rice.  The only minor thing I would say is that the roast pork was a tad on the sweeter side than I like.  But its pretty great for the price you pay.  I will be back to try the chicken and the roll rice crepes.
No comment

If you ever need a cheap filling meal, THIS IS THE  SPOT! For $3 you get a mini-respectable take out container size full of rice or noodles, cabbage, and bbq roast pork. Its not the leanest cut, but the fatty pieces taste the best anyways. Depending on what time of the day you drop by, the wait can be longer than expected. all this place fits is a single file line to get food and a squeeze fest on the way out. They even have a super size deal at $5 that almost doubles the normal portion!

I visited NY with a group of friends last summer, and one of my friends is a NY native who brought us to this hole-in-the-wall in Chinatown. Stuff is pretty tasty and crazy cheap; you get a bowl of roast pork with cabbage over, and it comes out to be about $5 for this ginormous delicious thing. I would definitely be a regular if I lived in NY.

Loveeeeeeee this place.  Tried every chinese cold cut (aka window food) possible here and they were all very yummy. The most common and best thing to get is the roast pork. Especially for a cheap lunch/dinner, a small pork order with rice will fill you up. they also have a large but for me, a small hits the spot good and does the job. i have ordered from here countless times, and only 1 out of the 5+ times were i able to finish the large size order. they also sell breakfast here, the rice casserole noodles with fishballs which is pretty good too but hands down, i come here for a small order of roast pork w/ rice. they are so generous with the order that for the quality and price, it easily makes it 5 star. wish they would open one in my neighborhood so i'll stop having to wonder what to eat everyday.
No comment

Yes, I really like their Roast Pork & Roast Pig on rice with a little bit of veggie to make it healthy :)  I'm sure that sauce he lathers on is chock full of  yummy pig grease as well.   I also love to order the stuffed fried eggplant, peppers, tarot, & Tofu sometimes as a side all to themselves, over rice, or over the Cheung Fun.   I haven't asked but do they have the Fried Turnip cakes?
No comment

Had their 三宝饭. Three treasure bowl? I think. It smelled good but a lot of the pieces were just skin and bone. I would get the pork bowl instead next time unless your really like chicken/duck. The 3.75 is probably better value. I would probably pick noodles over the vegetables too. But overall it's still good value and the meat that was there tasted pretty good.

This place is so good. We tried the roast pork, chicken and the duck. All were really juicy and flavorful. We waited about 30 minutes but it was worth it. They pack in so much food in each rice box. Would definitely go back!
I don't think you can beat this for 3$ in the area. The pork with rice is sooooo good. The wait can be bad but it's worth it in the end.
Love this guy! Small box of veggies and rice cooked nicely. Super affordable as well. Wait averages 15 min.
No comment
Only got $5, come here and get full. The owner is a class act. Eating here since it open.
Long line for greasy pork, but eating it in Hester Park was a Chinatown cultural experience.
Amazing Roast duck and the prices can't be beat. They often run out of food and shut down, so go early. $7 for the meal leads to an insane amount of food that can be shared by two. I will go again!

there is no seating, the line is mega long but its worth it because its just so cheap. the owner is so friendly and giving i don't know how he makes money. the roasted meat selection is freshly made because he sells out every day and once that happens he closes for the day. better go early enough! the roast pork is the best ever because he puts honey and loads of it so it caramelizes and develops a slight crunch on the end pieces. the veggies are a freebie and his boxes are always past the brim to the point where he has to push down with his body weight to close them. that my friend, is hospitality. he willingly gives you too much food for what you pay and i just don't know a business that functions this way at all. amazing!! his patrons are a mix of locals and those who take the chinatown bus so business is booming all day long!

The food is amazing and the price is ridiculously low. It's a must go and their roast pork is one of the best in all of NYC. The meat is juicy while the skin is so crispy. Eat at the playground across the street.

Possibly the best deal for lunch ever: a large amount of rice, cabbage, and an entire chicken leg for $2.75. That's way cheaper than halal food carts, in my opinion. Food is kinda greasy, and perhaps it made my stomach upset, but I adore the price. The sign in their shop says it's a lunch time only deal but I came before 10 am and still got the deal.
This place is perfect for eating variety of foods which is really good and yes reasonable also. The quantity is quite good as compare to others food joint. Will surely recommend within my network.

best char siu in Manhattan Chinatown. That is, if you like fatty, sweet, juicy, seared, caramelized, tinted-pink pork. There's always a line at lunchtime and dinner time. His large and small boxes are an incredible deal. There's a second line inside for simple noodle-based stuff or steamed rice cakes.

The best Chinese place ever, anywhere. The cheapest Chinese food place ever, anywhere. The best 2.50 that I've ever spent on food before. I ordered the ribs and rice and veggies. Vegetarians beware, you may want to avoid this place, as they chop up the meat right in front of you and hang it in their windows too....Only 1 two seat table in the probably 15 foot space, and was fortunate enough to sit there....Will always go back when in NYC!

awesomeness!!!!!! truly amaze'n fantastic unbelievable sensational delicious & all the other adjectives in the dictionary!!!! wah fung no 1 is 100% the right name because it is undoubtedly #1 numero uno the bestest i've ever tasted!!!!!! @$5 & $6 dalas large rice & pork or chicken or duck &/or rice noodles &/or thick noodles all made to perfection!!!! the lines get long & well worth the wait...... i recommend going a little early because the noodles go fast. this restaurant is a sure thing!!!! consistently perfect!!!! the young man who does the chopping of the meats is an artist & fun to watch. he & an older gentleman run a great ship, they work well together & obviously take pride in what they do!!!! i am born & raised in manhattan & have been eating in chinatown all my 48 years but only over the past few months have i been so lucky to find this diamond in the ruff. now i am there 2-3 times a week & totally addicted & extremely happy & full lol. ps... my girlfriend makes 3 meals out of one plate. they are large & easily shared but i dont share i finish the whole plate. thank you wah fung no 1 you truly are #1!!!!!!

Let me break this down for you. The food here is delicious, inexpensive, and worth the wait. I ate here 2 years ago on a whim because my friend Rick and I thought that the name of the place was hilarious, and we figured that the long line was a good sign. We were correct on all counts! The name IS hilarious, and the line DID indicate that the food we were about to eat was very tasty. A random meal from 2 years ago, and we still talk about it fondly. You can't say that about too many meals.

Wait, then wait, then wait. This place would be 4 stars if not for the price. Soy sauce chicken is a little dry and after the chopping, filled with tiny bone bits making it a little labor intensive to eat. Roast pork on rice for $3 is delicious. Same flavor as Chinese roast pork jerky if you know what I mean.

Even for Chinatown, this place is a steal. Four dollars for a HUGE takeout box of chicken, veggies and rice! It always hits the spot. The only issue is the wait. The guy seriously takes his time with each person, which is a good thing though, since you end up with a TON of food.
No comment

If you love roast pork, you need to try this place. And if you're a good eater, skip the smaller size and go for the large.  It is almost 3x the size for just a bit more money ($3.75 vs $5.00).  Either way, be ready to wait in line.  I waited about 20 minutes on a Saturday afternoon.
Mehhh their roast pork is not the same anymore :( Lacking the honey and texture.
Really looking forward to going here again...simply great and I don't love going to Chinatown but this is always worth the trip.

Best cantonese bbq in chinatown.  The line is always extremely long during rush hour.  But nothing beats the $2.50 rice box with choice of meat and vegetables.  Hole in the wall place, that doesnt have any real seating.  but the portions are generous and cheap, and the local butcher dude is friendly.
No comment

The Chinese-style roast pork is the BOMB here.  It's called, "fast food" in the sense that it's cheap and unhealthy for you, NOT the actual waiting time.  The fatty, salty, and MSG-overload yumminess is advised not to indulge daily!!  Expect to wait about 4-5 minutes per customer.   5 stars for this tempting little devil because I just can't resist its economical yumminess...

Hahaha, going to a high school there. I ordered take out from here regularly. In the stand closer to the entrance is your pork/chicken rice. In the back, is the fast noodle bar. i don't have much explanation for this place because u really need to go to it to understand the atmosphere. Simply full of long lines. This guy's version of bbq pork roast involves a lot of honey, i believe, making it extra sweet. Its a favorite among many locals. But every time i go there, i always question the sanitation of this store. Haha, but have no fear, the food is always good, and im still alive.
Wow!!!! $3.00 just as everyone said. Stopped in early and got my fix of roast pork and bbq pork over rice. Will definitely come by again it was good.

You will be sweating buckets while waiting in line due to cooking steam and fidgety people.  Don't come when you are starving- the wait is agonizingly slow, but it is worth it once you get to the front.  The $3 small rice/veg/meat combo is more than enough food for your average lunch, but you might want to order extra so you can have some the next day (ugh, that line!).  The owners/chefs are polite and meticulous,  preparing each box with care, ladling just the right amount of 2-3 extra sauces on top.  There are lots of other treats in the back but almost no signs in English.  Char siu (bbq pork) and chicken on rice were both perfect and delicious.  They also had a mystery meat that looked like a fried block of bacon rashers that even non-Chinese people were ordering.  More than anything this place is awesome and they deserve your business!

One of the best grungy, hole in the wall places for cheap eats in New York City. I've been going here for lunch, when working in the area, since 2009. I always get the large roast chicken, roast pork and roast duck combo on the bed of white rice and cabbage. Always fantastically good. Arrive before or at 11:00am for shorter or no lines.

Amazing. The pork is almost candied and glazed on the outside. Inside the meat is juicy and flavorful. Waiting in line I couldn't figure out what smelled like cinnamon buns, but the flavor of the meat is spiced with cinnamon and a few other autumnal type spices like anise. Very good pork. I also had the duck which was just ok, and the pig which was very good but not as good as the pork. At $3 for pork, rice and veggies I can easily see this becoming a meal staple. Only downside is waiting 30 minutes to get it.
No comment

I don't know what all the hype is about this place. I waited 20 minutes in line to get a roast pork over rice. While you get plenty of roast pork, the flavor leaves a lot to be desired. It is way too sweet! It tastes like BBQ pork jerky. I can only taste the BBQ sauce. It doesn't help that they drown the pork in a bucket full of sauce. I thought they had a bad day but I went back another time and it's no different. On an empty stomach, I couldn't even finish the pork. A lot of people don't know what good bbq pork is, there's plenty of others that have better quality and less wait. Not coming back here anymore.
Super cheap chinese food.  Yes there is a long line but it worth the wait.  They are super friendly and gives you a lot of food.

I come to this place all the time.  Well why the 3 stars???   Look I am not a picky eater and I scrape the plate on anything.  That being said, what I love about this place?  Great price and they stack the food, they don't pinch, you get your moneys worth in abundance and more.  Well why not 4 or 5 stars???   The taste of the food and its sauces.  I loooove duck. Its my fave, but unfortunately this spot lacks flavor in that area.  Roast pig is pretty ok, and so is roast chicken is meh.  The roast duck is just not good here.  Don't get me wrong, its edible and appears fresh, but it severely severely lacks flavor and the sauce they use is also just so repulsively bland and lacks flavor.  Lines can appear scary but they move quickly and are they are kind.  I just wish they new how to use their salts and spices.  Honestly,  if you lucking for a good duck and/or flavorful food and sauce look elsewhere.  nevertheless this place is definitely economical and I keep getting disappointed by the taste yet I still come back when I have an empty stomach.  yep, i'm Frugal I guess.
No comment

Wah Fung is a small place, and if you walk too fast you might just pass right by it. This place is a hit or miss really, and it may be hard to communicate if you don't really understand or speak Chinese (this coming from a Chinese girl herself who knows only a few phrases in Cantonese). Luckily there's a menu right behind the Chef. I ordered the large with all 3 types of meat, and I was rather disappointed, forewarned by previous yelp reviews that the duck had a lot of bones I still thought I should sample all 3 meats, and my favorite was definitely the pork (char siew) just because of the flavoring it had and the fact that it had no bones!!! Seriously I cannot emphasize this enough the bones in the duck varied from noticeable to these little pebbles that I did not even realize were bones until I bit down on it, and damn did my tooth hurt after. Overall this place is a small business but for its pricing which was 3.75 for a small (which I should have gotten) and $6 for a large with any meat, this lunch was definitely a steal. I'm definitely returning again for that char siew. But be warned cold charsiew from this place reeks of oil and pork, but once heated up again, its delicious LOL. Also  there's more to this place than just char siew, duck and chicken, although these are definitely the highlights. To the right of the chef theres another section right next to the sodas, there you can purchase fishball noodles, or some root vegetable thing that my friend ordered, or even some soybean soup.

huge portions, cheap cheap cheap, and quick service (thought the lines can get long). have to be honest that we just snacked on it as the meat was a little greasy for what we really were in the mood for. so we ended up heading elsewhere to get our proper lunch on but i am glad we stopped by. and i bet this makes a great hangover food.
No comment
$3 bucks for char siu, veggie and rice. The cheapest I ever ate in Chinatown. Lines might be long sometimes, but it's worth the wait. Tasty meat.
Yummy bbq roast pork in large quantities! Usually there's a long line that takes about 15 min to get to the counter, but it's well worth the wait for the low prices and yummy yummy food :)
No comment
The best chinese food for 3 bux! The line is out the door, that has to mean something!

Don't plan on getting your food right away here. The guy takes his time cutting up the meat. There's another place a couple of steps down and the guy there chops away like a madman so a lot of people go there instead to get their food quickly. But the food here was worth the wait! The roast pig and roast pork are SUPER good!!!! There's no seating, but my friends and I just took our food to the park nearby and ate there. No biggie. Also, don't be fooled by the word "small"--the portions are huge! I had to share mine with a friend.
The cha siew here is soo sweet and filled with flavor (most likely from the honey). It's good but there's usually a line.
This place is the bomb. You HAVE to check it out.  I keep coming back and back for more every single time I am in town.

There is no tables to eat on at Wah Fung. It's purely a take out place. I heard about this place and past by in the morning before work. NO LINE!! I got the roast pork with rice. I have to say....$2.75 is a great bargain! If you live near, get it for lunch. $2.75!!!! Need I say it again? There is as much meat as any other place that has roast pork over rice. He filled the box to the point of nearly not being able to close the top of the little lunch box. There is less rice than regularly priced places but who cares. It's the roast pork that matters, BABY!!!!!!!  I am so going to go there before work whenever I feel like it. And it is 17 degrees out there now!! I don't care!!! I rather have a tasty lunch for....let me say it again.....$2.75!! He doesn't skimp on the meat!! When it's warm out, eat in the park across the street! The last time I went here, the roast pork was overly salty though I had a hard time eating it. I think they over did it with the salt..

Decided to try this out for a quick dinner after work instead of stopping by a halal cart. The line was long and I was the only non-Chinese speaker, which made it very difficult for me to understand what to order since the 'menu' scattered on the walls wasn't very clear. Ended up ordering... meat with rice? I think they just threw whatever they had in a styrofoam box for me. It ended up being a great value for the price, but the taste was lacking and the lack of cleanliness in the place was off-putting.

You'll be seeing stars eating here.  Granted, the chef looks like he just murdered someone, but the spice mix and care that goes into each cut of meat is spectacular.  Try to come on off hours where you won't hit a 45 minute wait (foodies know about this place, trust me).  Especially good are the roast suckling pig and staple roast pork.  Also one of the best deals on planet earth ($4 and I promise you won't be able to finish the mound of meat).

Wow, so many great reviews about the roast pork over rice - i need to try that soon!! I usually get their noodles (crepe) with fish balls topped with his OH SO DELICIOUS sauces (yes, i always tell him i want ALL the sauces together except the spicy sauce). It comes in a styrofoam box and gets filled to the top, so filling so good so cheap so in love. I tried their congee too and it's good enough, mediocre. His crispy-pork (the orange-brown colored skin pig that hangs from the window) is also cheap and crunchy (like it is suppose to be). He and his wife is really nice so don't worry if you have to point at what you want. Like many yelpers said - he used to have a food cart on bowery and hester. his food was so popular that he was able to open this little joint 1 block away. I grew up eating his food after going to school nearby, soooo good

tried this last night, got roast pork over rice, the large and man portions are way too big. there's something to be said for serving the right amount of food, not the most possible. long wait, and after eating a little i had to shit my brains out. something not right with it...

this place is amazing, best food for the $ price range. i dont know how they manage sell a box of meat + veggies + rice for $3.75. the box is filled to the brim and everything inside was fresh and delicious. it beats any of the 2000 food carts in NYC, both price and quality wise, and i must add that the meat is real meat and not mystery meat that they sell at the food carts. i suggest you give it a try for 3.75, you have not much to lose.

i had very late lunch one time here where i had roasted chicken/steamed rice/vegetable---it was just so tasty for such cheap price!.  i would have opted to order the pork cuts instead of the chicken but they look so devilishly deadly for my cholesterol troubles! (but i may try it some other time). i ate my lunch right there and then where they have 2 chairs plus a table placed somewhere close to the fridge and the kitchen. it's not exactly the most ideal place to eat, given the rather untidy appearance of the space, but i was very hungry that time...i couldn't care less....and in the meantime that i was having my lunch, people continued lining up before the counter to place their orders (mostly to-go)...no wonder, the food's great!

This little hole in the wall actually has been here for at least 15+ years. We use to go there after school to get the BBQ pork. The guy and his wife are the nicest and most hardworking people!! As for the food, you can't beat an enormous "small" portion of BBQ pork rice with veggies for 2.50!! The pork is sweet, but very tasty!! More than 90% of the time, I can't eat the entire thing in one sitting. Yes, prepare to wait at least 10 mins because this guy takes his chopping seriously!! Well worth the wait. Sometimes I buy an extra order and its still good for 2 days. Go and enjoy it across the new park with plenty of seating across the street.

When I first moved to NY a year ago, this place was one of my spots.  The tiny foil boxes were packed to the brim with everything I expected and more.  Now, I'm not sure I'll go back.  Compared to a year ago, the quality has decreased slightly. If this was my first time eating here now, I would probably think I got what I paid for and be satisfied.  Unfortunately, I know what it was like and just have memories of how it was.
The duck is really good. They're fast, but don't speak much english. I stop here whenever I take the bus to NYC.

I never giver any Chinatown 5 stars cuz the service will never make them 5 stars ever.  With that said....the line is long for a reason and once you get to the guy, he's too nice to be mad and large amount he gives you with the care he makes each little rice box is just worth it.  It's also cheap as hell!  Just go....
No comment

A LOT of food for less than 3 dollars. Some people waiting online can not believe how much food the man behind counter puts in such a small box. It's a great deal. Best food I've ever had? Not really, but definitely a quick place for decent food at a really good price. Expect to wait at least 15 to 30 minutes on line.
apanese style Korean BBQ i

I think Wah Fung is an okay place to get Roast Pork. When I went, there was a line. I waited 15-20 minutes for their small Roast Pork with Rice. I think there are only 2 people work there and only 1 person is doing the cutting. They have other combinations like duck and rice and pig and rice. They also sell noodles, chung fun and fish balls. I was here to try the Roast pork. The Roast pork seems to be more fattening than the roast pork I had at other places. You can look at the pictures that other people have posted on yelp to confirm my observation.  Also, I think there's too much sauce on the rice. However, I guess if someone wanted to they can tell them not to put too much sauce on. Overall, if I didn't have to wait in line and wanted a cheap meal, it's an okay place to get Roast Pork. However, I wouldn't wait for it. Everytime I go, there's usually a line and I'm not going to wait for their Roast Pork.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The manhattan location is always busy but this location was walk in ready. Host and waitress were all really great and the non alcoholic drink that I got was really well mixed. The ramen - the usual you can't go wrong with it! It's a bit small but doesn't matter bc it's good. Matcha lemonade is a tad too sour for me but the pomegranate raspberry orange drink I got was perfect!
No comment

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Fantastic addition to the Williamsburg area! Make sure to make a reservation in advance. I stopped by here a month ago with some friends and had a really great time! Had a couple of items oysters, ramen and more. Split a bottle of orange wine, a great choice by the server. The staff was hospitable and friendly. Definitely worth checking out!
No comment

This feels like a slightly upscale tonchin compared to the one in Manhattan, the courses are small but amazing. Great for a date if you feel like spending over 100 on a meal. I would not skip on the chicken wing, it was the best and also most expensive single wing I've ever had. Worth it? Maybe if you just got paid.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Been here a few times and is a good place for ramen! Their classic tonkotsu ramen is done well, but other noodles such as the tan tan ramen are worth a try too. Would definitely recommend getting the banana pudding and trying the kakigori. The banana pudding was not too sweet and very light, and loved the addition of cream for kakigori with very sweet fruits.

Just as amazing as the original Tonchin in Midtown! Really pleasant quiet space with the best vegan ramen around. Also loved the cucumber salad. Their dessert menu looks great too - have to try the soba panna cotta next time.

It took 90 mins to get our ramen. Not acceptable. We got there at 8:00 p.m, ordered food at 8:15 p.m. Didn't get our ramen until 9:40. We ordered five appetizers, which should've come out together or one after the other, instead, they came every 15 mins or 30 mins. After the appetizers we waited a solid 40 mins for the ramen. I have never waited for ramen this long. The appetizers were amazing but ramen was nothing out of the ordinary. Go elsewhere, not worth your $$$. Also we didn't get anything comped for waiting so long for our food.

Had no prior reservation, so we waited close to an hour and a half in the cold winter temperatures for seats at the bar. But the wait was so worth it because we got the best ramen we have ever eaten! I have eaten great and authentic Japanese restaurants before, coming from Asia, but Tonchin beats it all. The best part about it is you don't have to pay an arm and a leg to enjoy this great tasting michelin starred ramen.

I came here on a Friday night per a friend's recommendation. Our reservation was at 7:00 PM and the restaurant was busy, but not overwhelmingly so. We all ordered the tonkatsu ramen and two of us asked for their spicy sauce on the side. A little bit of the spicy sauce goes a long way and I liked the soup as is and with a bit of a kick. The portion was very filling and you can tell they start out with a very good ramen broth base. We ordered a bottle of wine to share as they have a pretty extensive wine list. There weren't a lot of options to purchase wine by the glass and when I asked if they had a full bar the waitress just listed off a few liquors they had. If you're in the mood to drink cocktails maybe check out one of the other places nearby before coming here.
No comment

Ginger miso ramen and the cucumber salad was very good. Weird drink situation, though: they call themselves a wine place on their website and have probably hundreds of wines available by the bottle, but only two by the glass and no white wine. They also only have one cocktail on the menu.

Came here with a friend with no reservation at 6pm on a Wednesday. We were seated a high top up front. Within the hour this place filled up like mad! It definitely had more of a lounge vibe than some of the more traditional ramen spots. My vegan miso ramen was very flavorful, full of all the fixings and all in all delicious. We got the shitake appetizer from the bites, which came with big pieces of toasted bread. But the appetizer was basically hummus with 3 pieces of charred shitakes up top. It was a totally bizarre dish tbh. It ate Mediterranean in flavor, and was way too heavy on bread before consuming ramen. Happy I tried a new spot, but I'll be returning to the more traditional ramen spots around the neighborhood instead.
No comment
No comment

Best ramen I've had in NYC thus far! Smoked dashi ramen was so flavorful but not too oily, greasy, or excessively rich. Also loved that there was an attention to diversifying toppings rather than opting for little to predictable toppings. Would definitely come again-- especially since the staff was so sweet and the space was so beautiful.

Really dank ramen. We also shared the chicken wings which were cooked perfectly and had a small spice kick to them - really great flavor. I had the vegan miso ginger ramen- the noodles and broth were so yummy. I'll definitely be back here soon.
The fried fingerling potatoes were crazy good. And I would go back definitely for the smoked dashi ramen, incredible dark rich umami flavor.
No comment
No comment

Stellar meal! Everything we had was outstanding. The chicken wings are a must order as is the hummus (yes hummus at a ramen restaurant sounds weird but it's so good!). I had the classic ramen, and it was awesome. Service was attentive and friendly. The restaurant space itself was beautiful, it wasn't too loud and tables aren't crowded together.

Tonchin probably has the best ramen I've tried in NYC. I ordered the dashi ramen and finished the entire bowl. The broth is packed with flavor and the scallops were so tasty. For dessert I had the soba panna cotta - big fan. It was a lovely combination of flavors and textures between the cream, honey, olive oil, and toasted bits on top. Very nice waitstaff as well!

I was super excited to try this restaurant, but management needs to fix a lot of the operational issues here. We arrived at 8 for our reservation, we were seated at 8:30. We then ordered appetizers and our food, those took 30 minutes and the entrees took another 30 minutes. The appetizers were tiny and not that great. The ramen was somewhat better, but was extremely salty. Everyone seemed annoyed that we were asking when our table would be ready and when we checked on the food. Something is off here. I would not recommend going until some of these issues are fixed.
No comment
No comment

I'm not vegan but definitely recommend their vegan ramen. They have a nice selection of wine and my friends really liked their mocktails.  Must try their spicy chicken wings and end the meal with their matcha shaved ice.
New and amazing restaurant, one of the best places in Williamsburg. Really enjoyed everything
The Somalia here is fantastic. I think their name is Raquel? Served me all the perfect wines. Had the best experience. All delicious foods.

One of the best meals I can remember.  We had the original salad, the shiitake spread, the potato, the wagyu yakitori, the tebasaki wing, and then we split the classic tonchin ramen and the spicy tan tan ramen.  Everything was amazing.  However, the real heroes of the night were the tebasaki wing and the classic ramen.  Fried to perfection, the chicken wing exploded with flavor and was easily the best appetizer anywhere in Brooklyn.  The classic ramen broth is a thing of beauty.  We could eat that ramen seven days a week.  Fantastic meal and wonderful dining experience!

The restaurant has a casual, cool vibe and the fried chicken and miso ginger ramen were both good. Although we didn't order it, our waiter also brought us the kyuri (which was good), and then charged us for it. I've never had a waiter charge me for a course that I didn't order/ask for. Their ramen is fine, however, I'll never go back due to the sleazy way our waiter tried to get us to spend more money and would warn others to not fall into this trap.

More like 3.5 stars, but they just opened and are working out kinks. We tried a bunch of shared plates and each got a bowl of ramen.  The plates (shitake spread, chicken skewer, and salad) were all good  and generous enough in size and price for these times. I really didn't enjoy my smoked dashi ramen. The smoked flavor was overpowering and unpleasant after a few spoonfuls. My spouse liked their tonkatsu.  The space was sleek and cool, with a young bratty crowd that was half fun, half irritating to watch from a distance. Staff was generally super sweet and attentive, except for the unwelcoming and aloof gentleman greeting (or not) customers at the door. He set a bad initial tone for a very gracious spot.
long wait (waited for 2 hrs) and average food. the noodle broth was too heavy and the wine tasted like it was diluted with tap water.
Great date night place. Miso ginger ramen was the only pork -less option for ramen but it was phenomenal.  Overall great place. Will be back for more
No comment

The chili fried chicken was good overall. It wasn't particularly spicy but had a nice flavor. The batter was more crunchy than crispy. I did not like the tomato braised collard greens. All I could taste was tomato. The dirty fried rice went well with everything.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I fell in love with the chili fried chicken when Pecking  house did their pop up in Clinton hill! There  new location on Flatbush Avenue is really beautiful and kind of has that chicken Bar vibe, casual, clean and cool. This time I tried the salted egg and was not feeling it. It had a very gritty mouth feel. I had to force myself to finish it . The chili option is way more flavorful. Also, I had to beg them to let me buy chicken by the piece!  It's such an easy thing to add to the menu. I just want to chicken no sides. Please please please add a two piece and a three piece with no sides to the menu!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

First tried Pecking House at EatsCon and thought it was one of the best fried drumsticks I'd ever had, so was excited to go to their brick and mortar location. Chicken was just as good as I remembered and the ability to add foie gras to a chicken sandwich was a nice touch (and super delicious). The seating inside felt a little cramped, but you go for the delicious fried chicken (not ambiance). Would probably order takeout next time!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We've been meaning to try this place for a while and finally got around to it. Everything we had was insanely- insanely - delicious. The salted egg fried chicken was as close to perfect as it gets. Both the butter bean salad and the tomato braised collards were fantastic. And don't forget the mushroom po boy- a gigantic lip-smacking delight. Was the meal 2000+ calories? Without a doubt. But so worth it. Considering the quality, worth every penny. Plus free seltzer on tap. Can't wait to go back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

For a fast food style restaurant, you order and pay at the counter after you get seated. There were many selection of beers and wine listed on the wall. Fairly simple menu with limited selection of items. It was like going to a upscale Popeyes or KFC. We had almost all the items from the menu. 3 pieces of regular size fried chicken with 2 sides costed $27. A burger was decent priced around $10. I personally preferred the burger over the fried chicken. The fried chicken's flavors were super intensely and too oily. The original had the least oil and the spicy chicken was super oily, it was dipped in hot oil after the chicken was done frying. The egg covered fried chicken was not much of difference from the hot oil dipped chicken, the egg was always an oil sucking and form a super oily skin of the chicken. The chicken itself was super crispy which that was good. The sides were my favorite. I recommend getting the string bean, the bean and the rice. Those can help you simulate with the oiliness from the chicken. Overall I am not a fan of oiliness food and I am not expecting myself to return.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Absolutely delicious tender juicy and Crunch of this chicken is a delight. spicy but just on the verge of wanting a creamy drink; you can off set it with the gigante bean salad. Honestly, i dislike beans, but here-- delicious, vinaigrette tart and full of soaked in flavor. Truly, somehow at a fried chicken spot, THE fried chicken spot, the veggie sides are the quiet winners
No comment
No comment

Peking House started off as a waitlist a couple years ago. I was on that waitlist religiously. I also had the privilege of eating at the OG location in Queens. Eric has long been an awesome chef carving out a name for his incredible fried chicken and while the fried chicken is incredible, all the other dishes he offers is just as amazing Eric already knows that I live for his bone broth. Every time I go, I order quarts and quarts and quarts to go. This time I got to visit his new restaurant located closer to me than the last location. I wasn't sure what to expect. I was hoping that the place had not become gentrified or too hipster, which normally happens to good restaurants. Luckily, the food is just as incredible as it was back in Queens. I am lucky that I have access to some of the best fried chicken in the world spicy is the way to go however, if you have children, you can always order the spicy Szechuan oil on the side and pour it over your own piece This time I also tried the salty egg fried chicken, which was absolutely incredible. Not sure if my Asian heritage is the reason why I love it so much but it is definitely something worth trying. If you are feeling adventurous, the dirty rice is the same race they had in queens as are the fried brussels sprouts both simply amazing. Add the start of the show it's always the broad, bean side, savory, crunchy serve cold, and absolutely delicious. I am not usually a fan of beans like this, but these are delicious and I highly recommend you try them. The bone broth itself is the perfect cure for a cold, the flu, world, peace, and pretty much anything else wrong in your life, loaded with ginger and white pepper. It will shock you back into a state of absolute happiness also ordered the spicy chicken sandwich as well as the regular fried chicken sandwich with foie gras on top of it. The foie gras was absolutely incredible served fresh, and a really large portion for the up  charge. All in all this restaurant is incredible. I'm glad that they are back and will gladly give my business to them that as much as possible. Come try this place out. If you like fried chicken it is probably some of the best that you can get don't forget a couple years ago. There was a wait list of about 10,000 people for this chicken and if you try it you'll understand why.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Yummy food in the fort green/prospect heights area. Staff was really kind and helpful. Prices are decent. There is indoor seating and a free water/utensil station which I love and comes in handy if you eat some of the spicier menu options. The picky teenagers in my life loved it so it's a win all around.

The staff was very friendly and the inside had spacious seating. I got the salted egg fried chicken, and it was incredibly salty. I also got the red cabbage with pears, and the flavor was not for me. They also only had white meat when I came in. I might need to come back on another day to try others, but my first experience was not my favorite.
The chicken here is different. You notice the love, care, and flavor from the very first bite. The hype is real. Pecking house is really like that.
Tasty a heck. Good spice levels and quick service. Don't be put off if there's a line, it moves quick
No comment

I think they have workshopped this chicken too much. The spice level was really toned down since the pop-up days. There's not much of that hot chicken aggression left, instead you get a mild ma la plus a high level of sugar. The salted egg version is really nice but too salty. Sides are fantastic as always. Just wish they had bold spicy chicken here like Rowdy Rooster. Maybe they could offer an option of spice levels.
No comment

I tried the chilies flavored chicken, dirty rice and cornbread combo.  The seasoning on the chicken was tasty but too thick and the rice was uneventful.  However, the cornbread was surprisingly delicious.

Best Fried Chicken Ive ever had. Came in with a lot of hype but it exceeded my expectations. The sides are incredible as well and the restaurant is well lit and very sustainable. Chili fried chicken is so unique I'm shocked it took so long to become noticed. This is a must go in NYC dont skip it you'll be talking about it for life. Please expand to other cities ASAP.

With all the good reviews and an interesting menu, I thought this was worth a try. My first attempt was the Ma Po Tofu sloppy Joe, just because it sounded so good. I was disappointed - without the Szechuan pepper or soft tofu, it really lacked flavor and texture. Hard tofu might make structural sense, but along with a slice of avocado, it really did not work.  So since the chicken is top of their list, I did not give up and tried the fried chicken, one with hot chili and the other with salted egg. The chicken was way over-cooked, over-salted and unsatisfying. Yes it had a nice crust and a good crunch, but the salted egg sauce was too skimpy to make any impact, and while the chili was spicy, it didn't have much else going for it with everything so over-cooked. The breast meat was still dry and stringy.  The bean salad on the side was the best thing, and the mac and cheese cornbread was mostly just cornbread. At this price, I would go across the street for Sweet Chicks.

The sides were unique but the prices for it are a lil too expensive for what they are imo! The chicken sandwich was decent but not anything I was crazy about. The fried chicken, on the other hand, was definitely the best part. Get that, get a lot of it, and get it spicy! It's super crispy, has got a lot of breading, and is straight drippingggg in chili oil hahaha! The flavor wasn't anything like I'd tasted before, and was definitely star of the show. Really caught me by surprise and I enjoyed every bite of it. The meat is nice and juicy as well! Come thru if you've got some money to shell out!

Really wanted to try and like this this because of all the chicken hype, and was let down. The chicken was greasy - yes I know it is fried, but good fried chicken does not drip oil everywhere - and not flavorful, just hot. Chicken wings were very average. The bean salad was excellent, but that's really a sad commentary on a chicken place. The service was excellent, fast delivery, the food was hot and chicken crispy.
No comment
Pretty good food. No complaints from me. Nice fried chicken. You will enjoy a nice meal
This food is mediocre. There is way too much pineapple slaw on the chicken sandwich. The chicken with salted egg was a mushy mess. The sides are all under-seasoned. It's fine. Not good.
Get the chili fried chicken. So crunchy, salty, spicy with a touch of sweet. Don't forget the mashed potatoes!!

I love love love southern fried chicken and all the traditional sides. So, I'm biased. I had to mentally prepare myself for something different. We ordered the spicy and the salted egg. Also ordered the collard greens. Poutine. Cornbread. Beans. Pudding. In hindsight, it's a love it or don't (but not hate) kind of fusion experience. I personally didn't love any of it despite my trying to mitigate my own expectations. The chicken was juicy. The spicy crust was plenty oily and spicy. But the combo wasn't for me. The salted egg was interesting in that it was like a creamy crust. I guess what I love about fried chicken is the chicken skin and the batter ruined it for me. Not the fault of Peking House. I just really wanted Popeyes. Oh well. The sides were ok. I liked the cornbread and poutine the most - probably because they were most similar to just good old cornbread and poutine. Definitely worth a try and the meal will end up being a conversation piece for sure. If I come again with friends, I'd order the plain chicken.
Super yummy. I had the wings and they were nice and crispy. Will definitely be back to try more of their dishes
Food and service is great! Highly reccomend the chicken sandwich! The ambiance is real low key, no need to dress up!
Greasy basic fried chicken  in a not that great atmosphere partly due to the layout and partly due to the unnecessarily over/under managed ordering/service/seating approach
Juicy af chicken and kickass flavors. Wouldn't expect a place like this to pop up on Fulton, but I'm happy it's here! Coming back again soon
The chicken isn't bad but the mushroom sandwich is completely tasteless and bland and a waste of $16.
No comment
No comment
No comment

A very solid option for Italian/pasta in NYC! The pasta is fresh, flavorful, and delicious with a thoughtful combination of flavors and textures. My friend added the $6 burrata to hers and that was definitely the way to go. They were out of the clam pasta, although that was what I initially tried to order. We got cocktails as well and those were also delicious. I wish there was a complementary bread basket, I think for this kind of food especially at this price point, that would be a great addition. The pastas would have benefited from some bread to soak up extra sauce! Overall though it was a delicious meal.

Very beautiful ambiance in this location - white walls and accessories- cool light fixtures.  Service was on point and food was amazing.  We had the meatball appetizer and they were delicious- they just melted in your mouth!  Pasta was delicious also!  We will be back!
No comment

The decor was lovely. The Hostess was...not nice.  Like surprisingly so.  This is not a "destination" who can afford for the welcome to be so smarmy.  It's the theatre district, so you are going for a quantity over quality situation.  That being said, our waiter was ok, as was the food.  The calamari was good, but the aioli cup was empty (see photo) and it took forever to get it filled.  The pastas were fine with the addition of burrata. We were not hovered upon, nor rushed which is a plus for us.  I can't see us returning, as there are so, so many other options in the city.

Pretty disappointed by the food and service here. We each ordered a dish of pasta that took nearly 40 mins to come out, and we did not receive any complimentary bread which seems odd for an Italian restaurant. As for the food, I got the gramigna which was not great, it had an odd flavor to it. My friends who ordered other dishes were also not huge fans. Some of the pastas are extremely simple and could be made at home by anyone. Being as there are many other Italian restaurants in the city, I would not return but the interior was nice.

THIS WAS AMAZING!! I had great food (do not remember exactly what i ordered but it was delicious.) The highlight of the night was this amazing tiramisu that i will remember for the rest of my life. Cocoa powder decorated at the top to form a pécora bianca, or white sheep at the top. The service took a bit but it was great and i highly recommend.
No comment

Came here for a team lunch and it felt very corporate given the timing/location lol. But aside from that, loved everything about this meal. All of the apps were great (the cauliflower was the standout), they have great pastas and branzino, and the tiramisu is a must (it says for 2 people but it is HUGE and it really is better suited for 4-5).

This place is really chic inside and has great options for food. This is the second location that I have been to and both were really good. Staff was friendly and volume Wasn't too loud. Personally, I felt like this location was much cuter than the midtown east one but that may be due to pure size. We had the ricotta to start, the brussels sprouts side, and I had the cacio e Pepe with added burrata. To drink, we each had different types of Negroni's, both were great! My partner had the chicken Milanese, and I will admit that the other location had been much crispier, well, this one could've been fried a little bit longer

It's a very busy spot! Got sat down near the door because it was so packed. I had the steak and a beef pasta. I requested it to be medium  and I received a rare. But i just told the waiter if it could be cooked more but when i received it again it looked to be medium rare. The pasta was okay really salty. Not my kind of liking but it was an experience to try it!
No comment
No comment
I came here for lunch during the week with a friend and had a reservation. This place was very busy during lunch. We each had a pasta entree. The pasta is made in house and both entrees were great.

This location isn't it. We tried to go here for an early dinner a couple weeks ago. We walked in and they told us no reservations for tonight so we left, looked only and booked a reservation. Just doesn't make any sense. So we came back 20 minutes later for our reservation. Our waiter was not great, he kept forgetting what we were asking of him. The food was good, not great. The chicken Milanese was dry and hard to eat. The zucchini fries aren't really fries at all, not the best. The rigatoni was good but wasn't hot. The soho location is much better in my opinion.

There are a few different La Pecora Bianca locations in Manhattan. I'd heard that this Bryant park location was a great option for a midtown work lunch so I decided to give it a try. The options are a bit expensive but such is midtown Manhattan pricing. I love that you can add burrata to any pasta of your choice! My dining companion had the same order of rigatoni with burrata and we both agreed it was an enjoyable dish. I absolutely loved the Brussel sprouts. It's a really large portion considering it's a side. We shared it between the 2 of us and did not finish. I'd recommend for a midtown work lunch!
No comment

Some of the best italian pasta I have had in NYC! The garganelli pasta was 11/10 and so flavorful. Pizza was good (nothing spectacular), but if I would go back, I'd probably stick with ordering pasta to try more of their speciality dishes. The interior of the restaurant was also beautiful & servers were nice & friendly :)

I'm not even gonna hold you, that rigatoni was GOOD when I got it. My partner got that branzino and it was cooked beautifully but lacked seasoning, or at least a sauce of some sort.

Food was alright, nice ambience good spot for a date and good proximity to Port authority and Bryant Parked. Ordered the Whipped Ricotta Appetizer the bread was extremely toasted, very challenging to bite. For mains ordered the Rigatoni and Papardelle, probably wouldn't order the Papardelle again the Rigatoni had a mild kick
No comment

Had a business lunch there yesterday. The place is packed. We were seated downstairs where the tables are very close together and the noise level is very high. Mostly a fairly young well to do clientele. The food was very good, no complaints there and the staff was attentive and efficient.

Great place to pick up food or drinks. The vibe was great and it was packed both nights I was here. Everything we ordered was good.

Good pasta, great service, amazing tiramisu! The ambiance is amazing and they have a lot of locations in Manhattan. I have personally been to the one in Bryant Park and I was pleased with my food.
No comment

No comment

La Pechora Bianca is a classic staple in NYC. It's consistently good food and a delicious menu. A personal favorite of mine is the vodka pasta with burrata. It's got a great amount of flavor and is a generous portion. It's definitely a bit pricy. I'm not as crazy about their brunch menu as I am about lunch and dinner.

I was recommended this restaurant by my mom because she loved it so I decided to take my boyfriend here. La pécora Bianca is so cute. The place was pretty dim and gave off very cozy vibes. The service was quick and the food was really good. Prices were standard for an Italian restaurant in the city. Will definitely be back!

First time visiting this location and La Pecora Bianca continues to impress with their awesome food and service! Everybody in the restaurant was extremely friendly, helpful and attentive. The pasta dishes were expensive but truly worth it! I love ordering from their Union Square location but this place is exceptional too. 5/5 recommend!

My friends and I LOVE going to the bar and having Frankie as our bartender to have drinks and food. He is welcoming, attentive and always has a smile on his face! Now, let's get to a few favorite things on the menu. The Burrata is delicious and served with so many great things. And, the Garganelli pasta is out of this world! It is a truly a unique bowl of pasta that makes me so happy. So, if you love mushrooms, pesto, garlic and pecorino, you're going to LOVE having this to eat. Stop by one day soon and see Frankie!

I have been wanting to come here for years and it did NOT disappoint at all. Everything here was excellent, from the drinks to our ricotta appetizer to the star of the show: rigatoni with burrata. This is now a must do spot for me whenever I am in town
Really fast service at lunch time. I suggest making a reset if possible. The food was very good! Like a lot of places in NYC the tables are very close together.
No comment

Visited here during a recent trip to NYC. The inside is gorgeous. I loved the colors and decor. We started with an order of calamari that was thin sliced and fried golden brown. Delicious! For entrées I had the linguine and my husband had the gramigna. We both really enjoyed those dishes.
No comment
No comment

Every La Percora location I go to in NYC are equally all consistent with drinks, food and service. I met a friend recently at the Bryant Park location and while I waited at the bar I enjoyed a fresh aperol spritz, can't ever go wrong with one. The restaurant vibes are very relaxing and a great place to unwind after a days of work. We shared the Summer Melon Panzanella salad which was so fresh and tasty. We also shared a Margherita pizza and the crispy provolone which peared perfectly with my cheesy/salty/saucy craving. Make reservations for parties greater than 2.  Sit at the bar if you are 1-2 people, which is my preference usually.

I went here with some friends pretty last minute on a Friday. Didn't think we'd be able to get in, but we were so lucky to be accommodated!. Great service and excellent New York food for Italian.

Took the wife and lil brother in law here for dinner. It's a great vibe and I would recommend the mushroom GARGANELLI!.... It's the best pasta and all the other ones are inferior... Gods honest truth.
