Best vegan spot I've tried! Resembles the real thing - and didn't cause me any stomach issues, which is hard. I wish there was more guacamole. Not pictured is the quesadilla which could have used more stuffing and was rather thin, but was still stellar.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place was situated right inside the Whole Foods. It was small but had such a cute vibe. The guy working (I wish I remember his name because he was awesome) was so friendly and made sure we knew everything on the menu was plant based. I had the quesadilla- it was amazing! He also brought out different salsas for us to try- they were all delicious! Can't wait to go back!

Amazing tasty food with so much umami and flavor! It's also healthy and refined sugar free. The tacos are all super yummy. I also love the moles and tumeric cauliflower rice bowl. They even have cakes from my favorite bakery Rawsome! The service is consistently very friendly and fast.

Love that this place is vegetarian/vegan and puts a fun spin on Mexican food. However, it's a bit expensive and the proportions are inconsistent. Also there was a hair in my guacamole and I just lost my appetite. Hopefully, it'll be a better experience next time.

my friend's card got declined multiple times and we ended up saying we did not want the lemonade, after two minutes the lemonade came to our table for the grand price of 17$. Non alcoholic and it tasted super bitter. We ended up giving the lemonades to homeless people we found. 0/100
No comment

Super delicious Mexican vegan food. I got the coconut quesadilla and the black beans and the rest of my party got the pictured food including guac and the street corn. The quesadillas were super flavorful and I wish I had ordered 2!
Great place located on the whole food food court.  Drinks are potent and the vegan food is incredible.  I've tried both locations and they equally are delightful

Great quick serve Mexican spot located on the upstairs food court level of Whole Foods. The Buffalo chicken burrito is loaded with toppings. The Chorizo burrito is smothered in an amazing sauce combination and stuffed with rice and onions (definitely a carb lovers dream).

Was not aware this was a vegan place before we went in and have to say it was absolutely delicious. We got the nachos with added guacamole. Presentation was nice, service was quick, and they had free self service water - which for our 1 day trip to NY was a godsend.  Would definitely recommend!
No comment

Amazing vegan food. Everything tasted so well. I can't wait until I'm hungry to come back. The drink menu is extensive and really good. I really enjoyed the recommendations from our server, Pedro. Super kind, really knows the menu. Service was fast and thorough. They accomodated us really quick without a reservation for a Saturday night.

Ok so this location (Hudson Yards) was a little tricky to find because it's inside the Whole Foods but once you find it, you won't be disappointed. I ordered two different tacos (carnitas and chorizo) and both were out of this world. The carnitas were especially divine, I swear they looked and tasted like the real thing. Like if I didn't know this was a vegan place I'd have sworn it was the real thing. Very friend staff, the young man helped me settle on the two tacos I ordered as there is a bevy of options, so I definitely thanked him for that. I'll be coming back here for sure!

We are very happy to have visited jajaja during our trip to New York. Their food was so flavorful and delightful and they have a lot of options. We got the iconic nachos (can't go there and not try them), their burrito, and their taco tazon. I absolutely loved the coconut queso in the tazon. Oh and we got the churros too! They were amazing! The coconut dulce de leche they come with was sooooooo delicious! Prices were a little high but it's New York and it's inside a Whole Foods. My husband says that the burrito was tasty, filling and delicious. We would definitely visit again when we go back to the big Apple.

The nachos were very good (I liked the guac and cheese and the overall presentation), though they did get soggy a bit fast. The enchiladas mole were also quite good. There is a good amount of seating at this location as well, and the staff is friendly - I'd definitely come back again and again.

We were looking for vegan options in NYC and found Jajaja in a review on YouTube. The location Inside of WholeFoods took a little time for use to find, but the hunt was worth it. We tried the nachos, tacos, enchilada and horchata. The horchata was the only thing I might not order again, it was just ok, and didn't have quite the right balance of flavor of horchata that I'm used to - maybe it wasn't sweet enough, but it also didn't seem to have enough cinnamon, and there was another flavor in it that didn't belong that I couldn't put my finger on. The nachos were the star, as was the vegan chorizo taco. The salsa verse was a tad too sour, but everything else was excellent. The service was prompt and friendly. The area had a unique decor from the rest of the Whole Foods market so it felt like it's own separate space. Everything seemed very clean and sanitized: Covid procedures were being followed from what we observed. We'd definitely visit again. Nachos were the star of the show!
No comment
Amazing vegan Mexican food, we liked the bowls a lot. We will be back! They have a good selection of tacos as well.

I loved that this is inside Whole Foods... the corn on the cob CRACK! The coconut quesadilla is amazingggg so delicious and of course you CANNOT come to jajaja and not have the churito sticks . The only thing I'd say is here at the whole foods they didn't put the chunks of coconut in the caramel sauce for the churitos like the restaurant does. Maybe they forgot Idk. Still delicious!!!!
No comment
Delicious! Vegan! Very happy. Took a second to find because it's in the Whole Foods. The nachos need to be on a plate with napkins available lol
The food was amazing! The guacamole was the best I've ever had! Churros, street corn, and sweet potato tacos were all superior!

SO GOOD! My coworker who is vegan was raving about this place so today during lunch I decided to go try it with him and I'm happy I did because the food was amazing! I got the buffalo cauliflower tacos and the mexican street corn and enjoyed both very much. I can't wait to go back and try other stuff.

I was hungry today but didn't want to go to a restaurant as I've got a cold with a cough and thought neighbors shouldn't be exposed to it. I found Jajaja Plantas listed on Yelp and thought I'd give it a try. I ordered on line and paid by card for a contact less delivery. I was told my food would be arriving in half an hour. It came even faster than that. When I opened the bag, everything I'd ordered was there. I ordered enchiladas mole with Spanish rice and a lemonade. The food was warm to the touch and was quite good. I had no problem ordering a meal that was delicious and was delivered in a timely way.
No comment

Overall good experience. Located inside of Whole Foods. Burrito and nachos were good, at a decent prices for a vegan spot. However I wouldn't consider most "bowls/salads" listed on thier menu as Mexican cuisine. It's a basic salad with a fancy name. Location was nicely decorated and super clean!

This place is a vegan dream! I had the chorizo burrito and the churros with dulce de leche and they were both absolutely delicious. Adrianna was also extremely pleasant and helpful, I really appreciated her kind spirit. I'm so excited to try more menu items in the future!! This place is a must!!
Great location inside Whole Foods, you can grab drinks and Vegan desserts all in one spot.  Going through the menu, so far all the food is delicious, great vegan Mexican place!

overcharged and no vaccination check. We went to this place based on the reviews and past experience at another location. It was not crowded and it is located inside a Whole Foods. We ordered 3 Tacos each for 2 people. You pay at the counter and then sit down. No one asked to see our vaccination status, even though there were signs posted that they would check. After the food came, we were discussing that it tasted good and was well priced given the location.  As per the Menu the Tacos were $8 for 2 and $3 for a third one = $11 for 3. I had paid $28.30+15% tip at the counter (=$32.54) and opted for no receipt on their checkout device. This did not seem to be right, since we should have paid $22 + tax (8.85%) = $23.95. So, I went and talked to the checkout person. She rang up 3 tacos and informed me that it was $13. I pointed out that this did not match the printed menu or  the menu on the board above the checkout. She was dismissive and said that the menu was wrong in that case since the prices in her device were correct. I pointed out that this was not a good situation and they should fix the menu prices to reflect what they were going to charge. Her reply was she will pass my comment on to the management. I have never run into a restaurant with such deceptive pricing policies. We and likely most customers rarely check the details of the bill so likely they can get away with this kind of practice.
Great food and service. Recommend all their salads! Very well made vegan food. Cookies and drinks  also delicious.
This place creates amazing meat-free dishes! I cannot believe how tasty they are - it genuinely tastes like meat, even with the texture. Must try. Great for delivery as well.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

According to google this spot current says temporarily closed but we ate here 2 weeks ago without issue (March 2023). It's definitely less authentic vibes than some other china town dumpling spots but we realllyyy like the soup dumplings. Tasted fresh and delicious. Nothing to complain about and seemed reasonable price wise!

Very disappointed with my last visit on 1/3/23 . The service and the food was horrible . The Hong Kong fried rice which is usually delicious, the sausage was burnt also the serving size was much smaller than usual.
No comment

We came with a big group to get dim sum for dinner! Thankfully they were able to accommodate our large group even though there was a bit of a wait while they had to push tables together. The food came out so quickly and the price was very reasonable!
No comment
Top 5 Chinese restaurants so tasty & fast! Love I've tried a bit of everything except things with pork. Nothing has ever failed.

Very solid dim sum restaurant. I love the decor here-- very tasteful and elegant, and their outdoor seating is also set up well. Dim sum is good but nothing too noteworthy. Soup dumplings tasted fresh and had a ton of soup inside, and the skin was the perfect thickness. Service was pretty attentive. However I can't say that anything was too memorable to me.
No comment

I had high expectations for the spicy beef noddle soup since it looks really appetizing in the pictures. Def not as flavorful I thought it would be and was a bit too bland. I had to keep asking for more chili oil to even have any flavor.

I got severe food poisoning from 3 Times. It's the most sick I've been in my life. We believe it must have been from the chicken soup dumplings as I ate one and it tasted terrible, and my husband decided not to try them - he never got sick. I'm not sure if the chicken wasn't cooked or what it could have been but please look into your kitchen practices so no one else has to feel the way I felt.
No comment

I came here recently because I was craving the pan fried noodles but, I also wanted fried rice. I ended up getting both and they made a delicious pairing especially, with the extra soy sauce and hot oil.  Definitely will be getting this pairing going forward.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I visited this restaurant about a year ago - I believe they had recently opened. Let me start off by saying that the service was not the best. The restaurant itself is inviting and really nice but when I entered to order my food the server didn't even look up. Hopefully it has gotten better. At the time they had a smaller outdoor area so we opted to get takeout. I had the shrimp fried rice which was just ok, kind of bland. The portion size is big for what you pay; I had some leftovers for dinner. I actually reheated it with soy sauce and it tasted a little better. The scallion pancakes were my favorite thing and really delicious. They also gave us red bean puffs complimentary but I wasn't a fan of the texture. Not sure I would rush to try them again.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I swear I left a review for this location a long time ago but I guess it disappeared periodisappeared. I absolutely love there stir fried noodles with chicken! They are the best handful noodles I've had in the city. I've brought a few friends and family here and they love it just as much. I've also had the Spring rolls and bring rolls and shrimp fried rice, both are delicious.  My friend tried the soup dumplings when we went the last time and she enjoyed them thoroughly thoroughly. The vegetable dumplings were pretty OK we have them steamed. The period the wulong green tea comes in a giant French press and probably gives you about 5 cups of tea. Extremely extremely fragrant and fresh. I know I'll be returning soon.

I came here for dinner with my boyfriend and we shared beef and tripe, dan dan noodles, pork soup dumplings, and string beans. We really enjoyed the dishes, but did think that the dan dan noodles were just alright. However, we especially loved the string beans. Also, the service was extremely fast. We were able to place our order quickly and the food came shortly after. The waiters were really attentive and it was easy to get their attention. I highly recommend this spot!
No comment
No comment

This place was good! We made reservations but didn't need to as it was almost empty. Everything came out quickly and we got a billion different types of dumplings, noodles, etc. The service was also great! We're they the best dumplings I've ever had in my life? No but they were good. If you're in the area stop by!
No comment
No comment

Love the dumplings and used to order $100+ big orders of frozen xiao long bao and other goodies to steam/fry at home. However, they've stopped doing frozen items delivery. Unfortunately, soup dumplings are not nearly as good once they've been steaming extra in a delivery container as they are fresh out of the bamboo steamer. When I'm in Chinatown (which is a trek for me), I'll pick some up, but I'm sad they no longer deliver. It's less of a regular thing for me now (maybe good for my diet though lol).
No comment

I was here for the House special spicy braised beef noodle soup, which supposed to be chef's Signature dish.  However, the noodle they served was very different than the picture on yelp.  The noodle was too soft and not cook to order. The soup was watery.  I felt like a fool.  The green onion pancake was ok but very greasy.  This is absolutely the worst meal during my 10 days in NYC.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is a very beautiful restaurant, indoor and outside seating. The dish I had was the Chicken stir fry  noodles. This chicken was sliced thin seasoned to perfection, with julienned carrots, green onions, mushrooms and "Fresh" hand- pulled noodles. There was a small dish of some kind of amazing oil that truly compliments the dish. This was very delicious, and oh NO SOY SAUCE is necessary.
No comment

I don't write review at all but this one makes it. I ordered a delivery pretty late at night (an hour before they close) cause i got home late from work. Never had this place before but always see it pops up on ubereat so i figure to give it a try. Ordered the chicken mushroom chili wonton and the beef noodle. The beef noodle was good, a solid 3/5 but the wonton is under cook and have this doughy taste. First i thought nothing of it since it's my first time having this place, by the 3rd piece i realize there's no way a thin wonton skin can be this chewy and doughy then that's when i break apart the wonton and inspect it. The dough was definitely under-cook which pretty much mean i had atleast 2.5 under-cook chicken meat wontons. I know i ordered the food kinda late but damn, atleast make sure the food is cook before you clock out. Most likely not going to try again.

The rice cake was good, the house special beef noodle was meh and the siu long bao had thick skin and the meat inside was flavorless. Way overpriced for the portions. 2 stars for cleanliness of the store and the rice cake was good. Overall, not worth the visit.
The soup dumplings are to die for. All the food is excellent and the service is excellent. Their Shanghai noodles are so good and all the vegetarian options are also excellent. Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment

All that and dim sum...ok had to use that. Lovely staff with really well honed flavor palate and only slightly greasy fried rolls. Very Scandinavian decor with a touch of Asian art, but not busy when we went so if you are looking for a good meal without hassle, this is for you.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Service was bad, food was ok. Soup dumplings bland. Ice cup was dirty, straw was broke, chili oil taste more like oil then chili, please get better waitresses or waiters who are friendly.
No comment
Order was wrong and food was gross and sloppy which is bad enough. To make it even worse I found a hair.  Super disappointing and makes me nauseous thinking back on it.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We came here on Friday night, 10:20 PM and been told that dine-in is not available since they closing soon. However, they have their business hours on yelp showing close at 11:30PM and on Google with 12:45AM. So we had to order take out, but the waiting is 20min. And ironically, all the workers are Korean while selling Shanghainese food with Chinese menu. Foods are ok... not worth returning.
No comment

We were craving for soup dumpling so we decided to stop by and try this spot. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. It wasn't busy when we arrive but it did get busy towards the end. They are currently having a promo where if you dine in, you get a free order of pork soup dumpling. The pork soup dumpling are actually pretty good. We also order the fried rice cake with beef and turnip puffs, both are my favorite dish. I wish they have a broader selection of drinks but they just have milk tea or soda in the meantime.
DON'T GO!!!!! Avoid this place. The staff are rude and incompetent and the place is absolutely filthy.

Super solid Shanghainese place with very good soup dumplings. The XLB is definitely freshly made day of with bouncy skin and good filling; doesn't break super easily. Shrimp wontons were good too. Honestly everything was good. Very satisfying. Even the duck was tasty and I thought I wouldn't love it. Cucumbers were a bit meh but likely bc I prefer a different way of mixing it.  Nice setting and super friendly staff. They even gave us a free basket of XLB for promotional purposes.

This spot is very cute and the staff is very welcoming. The decor is modern, it's very clean, and the food is good. I would say skip the crispy duck as it's only a quarter and +$15 but the taro milk tea was soooooo bomb and so were the dumplings.
No comment
No comment

Tried this spot, ordered delivery while at work and honestly it was completely disappointing, bland, oily trash. Dumplings were all dough, mop tofu came with  no rice and was bland. Blown away by how you can make mop tofu bland, but by golly  they did it. Spicy chicken wings also bland, some of the worst wings I've ever had in NY the last 30 years. Never ordering or coming here again, go to Spicy Village instead, if you want authentic and solid Chinese food.
No comment
No comment

The restaurant is really pretty and clean. I love the interior and decor of the place. Wait staff is nice and friendly. Had the pork soup dumplings as part of the Yelp elite event and ordered some more to go as well. Warm and nice soup dumplings. Nice to go packaging as well
No comment
No comment

Very cute and very clean inside and out. The staff is extremely nice and helpful, immediately running to greet you as soon as you walk in. I ordered soup dumplings to go and did not have to wait long at all for my order, 10 minutes Max. Couldn't wait to get home and try them as they smelled delicious on the train ride home. They were scrumptious, tasty morsels that almost melted in my mouth. Soft and flavorful, I loved the sour kick. My only complaint is I didn't order more. My recommendation, they are rather small, so make sure you order enough or other menu items in addition. I'll be back.

I stopped by and ordered four pork soup dumplings to go. It took about fifteen minutes to make and the staff was very nice and welcoming. I've never gone to their other location but 3 Times is a good choice for soup dumplings if you're outside of the Chinatown area. Also their indoor dining area looked very quaint and clean!

It pays to be Yelp Elite! I really enjoyed being able to try this restaurant out. I had the soup dumplings and they were delicious. The host was courteous and the service was prompt. I'm looking forward to returning for more!
No comment
Amazing shanghai special beef noodle soup! Came back here with a group of friends and they also loved it! The calamari is also really good. Everything is also moderately priced
No comment
No comment

I really enjoyed dining at 3 Times which offers refined Chinese cuisine ranging from Shanghainese to Cantonese. My go-to dishes at 3 Times are the soup dumplings, pan-fried dumplings, beef pancake roll, beef noodle soup, and spicy wontons.  I enjoyed eating in pre-covid as the service was excellent however I usually just order frozen dumplings to go now and enjoy them in the comfort of my own home.
Came at 10:45pm tonight and it was closed for dine in said only online orders. Yelp says open till 11:30pm they should update it.

The 3rd time is the charm!!!  I was beyond pleased to have received my delivery promptly pleasantly, (and most importantly), with food cooked so to perfection, and presented in such a desirable manner with paper containers that hold the delectable flavors to such an optimal temperature that the food makes you want to both savor every bite, as well as pile it into your mouth in a mist unladylike way!!  Luckily, I didn't have to worry :). Go here, get a delivery  , or take out - do yourself a FAVOR!!

My gf and I had crab xiaolongbao and they taste weird. We knew something was off but we thought it's just the cooking skill. Not until we got home we started having stomachache and then we had the worst diarrhea ever. That crab was definitely bad. Foods are not fresh!
What a wonderful place.  The menu has so many delicious dishes.  The staff was so kind and helpful.  We loved all the dishes.  We will definitely be back.

Popped by on a Friday night with a friend when everything was booked in town and glad I did! They had a seat for us immediately and there was relatively short wait to receive our food - maybe 10 minutes or so. We got the Pan Fried Pork Buns which had a nice crispy bottom and were slightly juicy on the inside. I thought the Spicy Pork Wontons were very much on the mild side but flavorful enough. Our favorite dish was the Sautéed String Beans as it came with a slightly sweet dark soy sauce mix and very tender. The only disappointment was the dan dan noodles as they lacked flavor. Overall, I loved what they did with the space for a casual and chill dinner - very modern, clean, and spacious especially for New York. The decor is a mix of neutral tones and some modern Chinese photography on the wall. The bathroom is clean, always a plus.

I haven't had Nan Xiang in a while so I can't claim this is better 100%, but I believe this is at least on par if not better. The Xiao Long Bao soup is amazing and the pork is really good as well. The Beef Noodle Soup is quite good and the Beef Scallion is very standard. The Sheng Jian Bao though is amazing. Highly reccomended.

I love this place the first time I came, not too many people. Second time I came, was with 8 people and as soon we told them 8 people the manager/senior server was very annoyed, seated us with attitude and the entire time rushed us, put his hand up to my friends when they were talking. I've worked as a server and if it's a party over 7 then gratuity is included but like why be rude about it? We're giving you guys good business by ordering almost $300 worth of food and you're gonna treat us so horrible and rushed. Wanted to have a nice Chinese New Year dinner but couldn't even have that cause people like to be rude. Food was good, service wasn't

SORELY disappointed. I did come here based on the good reviews and feel rather.. lied to. The place is very spacious and EMPTY on a Friday night. The staff was rather unenthusiastic about seating me and placed me directly next to another party even though the place was empty. I had the shanghai fried noodles and the dan dan noodles and NEITHER were "authentic" or delicious. The staff also did not explain any current promotions. Honestly nothing special about the food here. Would not come back. Many other places with better food.
No comment

I'm rating 2 stars because the food was mediocre and moderately priced for the poor quality. The pictures of the food are more appealing than the actual dishes. Only note worthy dish were the soup dumplings. The service was beyond terrible. We had to ask for a can of Ginger ale, straws, napkins (all normal request items) several times. If you're near by definitely order DoorDash though -- the worker seemed to be super attentive to the in coming carry out orders. So much so that he argued with a DoorDash driver for 5 mins straight. (Tip your dashers! Their literally out here fighting for your food! Lol)  but seriously the food and service sucked!
No comment
No comment

Had a craving for soup dumplings in LES & stumbled across this place! Great service & food arrived piping hot. Soup dumplings were a touch on the salty side & confused to why food coloring was added to the shrimp & pork soup dumplings but the pan fried dumplings were delicious!

Friendly staff, easy to find seating and they regularly run specials like free soup dumplings with orders! The food is delicious and diverse. They also play interesting shows and images on the TVs in the restaurant, showcasing traditional food. Love coming here!
No comment
No comment

Waiter was super nice and kept refilling my water, changed from takeout to dine in due to personal schedule issues and they were extremely accommodating. Not to mention food was great, the braised beef was super tender
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really enjoyed this spot! Their food is a bit more on the pricier side compared to other Shanghai spots. But their food is absolutely amazing! It's not as greasy and very flavorful. My favorite is their Big Pork Bun. It was super juicy and delicious.
No comment

Don't waste your money or your time! We only took a few bites of food and had to stop because it was inedible. The shrimp fried rice was OFFENSIVELY bad. There was absolutely zero flavor...and not even sure there was soy sauce in there! We had to take matters into our own hands by recooking the fried rice!!!! The wrapping on all the dumpling options we chose was entirely too thick and as I'm writing this, I'm pretty sure I'll be sick tomorrow.
No comment
No comment
Great place to go with friends. It's BYOB which is always a plus!  Love the noodles here and the soup dumplings. Friendly service!
My friends and I were craving some Asian cuisine and came upon this gem! It was beautiful, clean, the food was delicious, and came quickly and the price was affordable. Will definitely be back.

Went here for a birthday dinner with friends last week before going out - their food is so delicious, the shrimp dumplings are great and everything has so much flavor. We ordered a feast of dumplings, scallion pancakes, beef with broccoli, kungpao chicken. Also the waiter was so nice,  and brought out taro puffs as a birthday surprise - so kind!! Thank you!

This is a great place to have a family-style meal with a group. Lots of good East Asian dishes for acceptable NYC prices. The soup dumplings were definitely my favorite! At the time we went, there was also a deal where if you spent more than $30 you got a free crispy duck entrée, so we appreciated that extra item.
No comment

Really good dumplings. Way better pancakes than Vanessa's. Service was attentive and able to accommodate allergies. The spicy house braised brisket wasn't overwhelmingly spicy it at all. Would definitely return.
No comment

PERFECT PLACE FOR EVERYTHING! Everything was so good. BYOB? And the liquor store is next door? Omg yes! Bae enjoyed the string beans but the noodles were the winner. AND, the service was ELITE! Shout out to Jason. Jason is a real one!
They were very patient while we decided what to order. Delicious Mapo tofu. Excellent Chinese broccoli. Very fresh.
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Downtown Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: I was looking for a good chinese place in NYC while visiting & came across 3 times. I was not disappointed! I loved their pork/shrimp soup dumplings, shanghai noodles, & eggplant dish! I will definitely come back if I ever visit New York again!
The food is really small. A crispy duck worth of 15 dollars has less than 10 pieces and they were rlly small like a bit small. While the sweat sour soup is like in a small small bowl

Stumbled across this place and noticed "Soup Dumplings & More" on the window. Very clean and spacious vibe. Truffle soup dumplings a bit pricey -- would recommend just sticking with pork soup dumplings since they're a bit stingy with the truffle flakes and the truffle taste is very faint. Decent amount of juicy soup in the pork dumplings though! Vegetable "soup" dumplings had no soup -- just dumplings stuffed with vegetables. Excellent service! Would come again for more tasty soup dumplings!

Take out portions were small and entrees were overpriced. Everything there was meh and for the cost I could have paid half the price and had double the portion in Chinatown.  I really wanted to support a nearly Chinese restaurant that looked clean and spacious but the quality and quantity of the food did not meet expectations.
Incredible soup dumplings! The truffle one is my favorite. The restaurant is very clean and modern. The service was quick and friendly. Highly recommended
This place is so great!!! Love the employees here and the red bean puffs are delicious!! Highly recommend this spot!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Delcious food and fast service! The tripe and beef was amazing, pan fried pork buns, radish puffs (make sure to get it, they are so fresh and flakey!!!!!), and dan dan noodles! You can also order frozen dumplings to bring home. We've done that before and they were so easy to make!
Delicious takeout. The dan dan noodles were fresh and a touch spicy, and the soup dumplings were delectable. Will order again!

This place has solid soup dumplings, and it's open late (later than any other soup dumpling place seems to be -- seems like the Yelp hours are wrong as I ordered through door dash well after closing time.) I got almost every kind of soup dumpling, and I recommend the Truffle Soup Dumplings and Sesame Walnut Puffs for dessert. I definitely will come back when I'm having some late night cravings.
No comment

Small Chinese Restaurant with delightful food near Union Square. I had the soup dumplings, Chinese Broccoli and crispy duck. It was all very delicious! Will definitely go back. I'm all about the food.

Kinda sad. Wanted to eat here. They close at 11, and we came before 10... there were a lot of open chairs.. but they wouldn't let us sit. They could only do "take outs" cause the "kitchen's busy". It was a weird experience. The guy was nice but idk, it was just a weird thing.
No comment

Tried their soup dumplings and they were delicious! The skins were not too thick and were perfectly cooked. They were able to get a lot of broth inside the dumplings, and the broth was savory and delicious. There was also a good amount of meat inside each soup dumpling. Some of the best soup dumplings in Manhattan!
No comment
No comment
Phenomenal soup dumplings on the lower east side. We love it here! Will come back again for more dumplings.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Absolutely amazing! Very fast service and amazing food. We loved the soup dumplings and the dumplings in chili oil.
The service is fine but the food is not as good as what people says, their food taste like every other Shanghai restaurant in New York . Nothing special

So they updated the menu recently and they now offer a range of stir fries and authentic Shanghai homey dishes vs what was predominantly a dim sum menu. Don't worry the main dim sum options are still there but if you wan to branch out and have some good seafood and veggies with rice it would be a good time to visit. I highly recommend the new additions - salt and pepper fishing and the shrimp. Very fresh and flavorful.

We got the crab soup dumplings, pork soup dumplings, radish pancakes and Dan Dan noodles. During Covid, we couldn't eat inside so we got our food to go. Everything was packed well and got home without any spillage/ drama which was great. The soup dumplings were juicy, the wrapper around the meat was the right texture and they were yummy. I really liked the fried radish pancakes but my husband didn't love them as much since they're not really a pancake but more like a deep fried, mini flakey bun stuffed with shredded radish. I think they were expertly cooked - warm, not greasy, super flakey and golden. The Dan Dan noodles were tasty too. Great neighborhood place, would definitely go back.
Found this dumping spot around the area. The server was extremely nice and courteous. The truffle dumpling was to die for. If you're in the area you must stop by and give this spot a try. A must try
Our family was very happy with this restaurant.  They said Fusion on the restaurant but it tasted very authentic and delicious.
Great place with the most authentic Chinese food! (Yet so affordable as well) Love it that the dumplings are so cute!

One of the most authentic and delicious Chinese/Shanghai restaurants I've eaten at in a very long time. Get the Pork Soup Dumplings, Beef & Potato Stew, Tan Tan Noodles, Drunken Chicken, and Scallion Pancakes. Too late for pictures.
No comment

One of my favorite go to lunch spots. Also I think the food is prepared with cleanliness and seasoned well. Some dishes are a bit saltier than I like such as the sautéed beans but overall I think they do a wonderful job preparing the dishes and the price point is pretty good too if I don't want them to compromise on quality or cleanliness.
Took too long. I placed an order for pick up. They were more than 40 min late from the time predicted. And it was right when they opened on a Sunday. No excuse.
Awesome food!  I'd come back any time!  Perfect for couple dates, and a great family dinner.  My taste buds are glad!

The place is very clean and well maintained, staff are friendly. I ordered the dan dan noodles so I can only comment that the noodles has very bombastic flavors that you can't really forget. The peanut sauce has a unique blend of interesting herbs and spices in it which you could feel it's made with great quality.

Excellent new Chinese restaurant in the lower Eastside. Clean, attentive and friendly service and delicious food. Soup was complex and delicious, but should have been a little hotter. Scallion and beef pancake roll with hoisin sauce was very yummy. Xiao Long Bao was good, not great. My wife loves DanDan noodles and gave these a thumbs up. We will be back  ... perhaps, next weekend  ... with friends/family to share our discovery and so that we can try even more dishes. They deserve a 4+ star rating. Am rounding up because they deserve to succeed.

This is a new spot in the Lower East Side and on the way I get home. On Friday night, it was not too crowded when I ordered 1 Peanut Jana noodles (peanut, pork, egg, green onion) and 1 beef noodles (supposed to be beef, egg, green onion, pickles). Unfortunately, NO beef in my noodles :( Why I had to get a veggie noodle for $11.25 ? That was so sad and disappointed when I opened the container. I may still give them another chance to try other dishes (dumpling,rice) but come on, please focus on the order!
At the end of my meal, I had to take a DEEP breathe because I was so full! All the flavors were incredible!! The service was great too! If I was a local here in NY, I would for sure recommend!
No comment

I love love the buns here!  I buy them frozen and my family and I can't get enough. The owners are very kind and their customer service is awesome!!! Will go back every few weeks to fill up my freezer!!
Got the Dan Dan noodles, good flavor and good price, but you get a portion equal to what you pay for.

Never again!!!! Gave the place a try based on reviews. I walked in for lunch with the kids, in the midst of the waitress taking my order an elderly Asian couple walks in and the waitress walks away, seats them and takes their order. Then she comes back 5 minutes later asking if I was ready to order, I finish placing the kids order. When its time for checkout, the waitress is all in my face stating that I only payed for the food. As a promotion, they have a free soup dumpling give away for dine-in only and she charged for 2 orders when one was supposed be free then demanded a tip upon check-out. She even stood in front of me as a way to not let me leave the restaurant without tipping her, worst service doesn't equal a tip.
Awesome food!  Definitely coming back!  The food is really awesome and I love the stony steamed pork buns!
The food is here is super delicious! We ordered take out and everything was hot and super tasty. Excellent soup dumplings, fried rice, green beans and porky bits. YUMMM!

It's a little out of the way but the food in general was good! Ofc get the cod roe and pork dumplings, and the truffle dumplings. The fish with green peppercorn that was recommended by reviewers was also delicious. I would def get that again if I go back. The cauliflower and broccoli dish was good too but $16 is a bit much. Get the free edamame when you check in! The service was rlly good. This visit was 5 stars but I give it 4 stars overall. Hope they keep it up!
Unbelievable food! Went to the LES location and exceeded expectations. Incredible, a  must if you want real dim sum!

Amazing food at an affordable price with fast service. This place is byob, which is great for saving $ when you want to drink. They also ran a promotion so I got some free soup dumplings. Very convenient for takeout or dine in.

After seeing their ad on Instagram, i ordered frozen wontons and siu mais. They are actually really good. I put the wontons in homemade chicken soup. Siu mais are good to have them for quick steam and snack. I love the rice and pork one. Love that it is not salty so you can add soy sauce! They let me keep the southern vege buns which was mistakenly delivered. I am not a fan of buns because of how little filling they usually have, but this one had pretty full filling inside. I wouldn't mind trying their pork buns in the future. Also a plus that they deliver to Jersey City!!!!! JC food sucks this makes me very happy. Their staff/owner are very kind and caring. I really appreciate their customer service.

Food was neutral. I was looking forward to the pork soup dumplings and was a bit disappointed. They were kind of bland not much flavor to the soup. I also ordered their fruit tea but was never delivered. The broccoli and beef lunch special was really good and flavorful so all around 6/10
Cancelled my Uber eats order 45 minutes after accepting it. The driver was waiting upside. Been waiting 45 mins and all other restaurants are closed now. F this place.

This place is so cute with really good, authentic dim sum. My Chinese side of the family would absolutely love this place. The servers there are also really sweet. I literally order this 4 times a week. Love them!
Pork soup dumplings are sooo good! Just had a little problem with the dumplings getting stuck and have paper on my dumpling. I'm still going back!

A group of 6 ate here last nights and we thought the food was good. Two hours after dinner - two of our friends got extremely sick and continued to throw up for the next 12 hours. 2 out of 6 people got food poisoning at this restaurant - we got dumplings and they think the meat in some of the dumplings were bad.

When I went there it was right after they opened. I was with a friend and we had dinner here. It's a very underrated place. I've never had such amazing soup dumplings until I came here. Love this place :)
Best xiaolong bao in the city. Gives Flushing restaurants a run for their money. Service was fast and effective
Food is amazing, portion sizes are good, the inside is very clean and well lit, great for lunch or dinner, also great for families.

I have seen videos and reviews of this place, so when my wife and I were visiting the big apple, we made sure to check out this place with the authentic chef from Shanghai! And boy it did not disappoint! One of the Best pork soup dumplings, crab roe flavored soup dumplings and Truffle soup dumplings! The xiao long bao were so authentic with the thinnest rappers imaginable....having been to multiple places in NYC and LA, this place by far does them best! The steamed egg with shrimps was to die for! But what really blew us away was the pork Bao! Doughy from the outside and juicy Flavorful from the inside! With a bunch of waiters that were extremely attentive to you on a Sunday Brunch time, and reasonable prices, what more could you wish for! We are definitely coming back!

Soup dumplings tasted fresh but could use a bit more soup. The scallion pancake with beef was phenomenal; definitely to die for. Service was great; the staff was attentive, kind, and welcoming. Would definitely come again.
No comment
You know a restaurant is sketchy when the description says "Lower East Side" in google maps. The food looks delicious just from the photos.

The LES location just soft opened a few days ago, and I decided to give it a try. Having tried the other 3 Times restaurant at 818 Broadway, the one here is kind of different in terms of the menu. Apparently they offer a dinner option here, which includes many delicious Chinese food. That's was a surprise to me because the food at the other location is already pretty good and they offer a lot more here! My friend and I ordered HK style sautéed crispy pork feet, 3 Times special braised snow beef, Chinese broccoli. I would say the food weren't too greasy at all. Actually they were cooked right on the point! I highly recommend the snow beef. It was so tasty! Would definitely come back.
Fantastic soup dumplings! This will definitely be a new late night fav since it's right by Delancey. Very modern vibe and good service.
No comment
No comment

Wanted dumplings so badly!  Ordered some frozen fried dumplings for pick up.  A little expensive, but dumplings were very good.  Good for a quick lunch.  Only thing I would add is maybe instructions on how to cook them for those that don't know.  Maybe add on website.   I would definitely order them again.

Went back to 3 times and had a pleasant experience. The servers were attentive and kind, food was great. The moon cakes and noodles with minced pork sauce were the highlight of the dinner. I was a bit disappointed they no longer serve their entree items so the menu is now the same as the location near union square, but food was still great.

Went there during lantern festival for the Ningpo Tangyuan, a glutinous rice ball with sweet stuffings. A little disappointed to see that the LES restaurant didn't have a lot of the entrees on their social media page. I I ordered the crispy croaker rolls instead, its basically fish wrapped in fried bean curd skin. It has a very crispy shell, the fish inside is steamed tender, it almost melts in the tongue. The only thing I dislike is so much oil is used to fry the roll, there was so much oil I could see it dripping. They give a sauce to soak up the oil; which I find in dismay is something like thousand islands sauce, quite thick and tangy, which doesn't help lessen the oily taste of the fried bean curd skin at all. Me recommendation would be to serve it with a sour or spicy sauce in the future?...the Tangyuan were fine, nothing special, I don't think it was handmade, but just be bought from supermarkets instead, but still a decent meal

Amazing place. The house noodles were so delicious and cheap! The shi bing tongs are perfect and huge! Very generous portions. Dreaming of both right now. So happy this place exists and look forward to coming back soon!

We were surprised by how great this place was. The soup dumplings were delicious. All choices were perfect. Great spot for amazing Chinese in the neighborhood. Getting their liquor license. Would come again!

Their food is delicious and the service is great! The woman who I assume helps runs the place gave me great suggestions and even clues me in that they had a 50% special on a dish of their choosing that week! would recommend the cucumbers and soup dumplings for sure.

For those who are saying the portions are small... how much do you need to eat?? People need to understand that eating Chinese food is not about filling up on one entree. If you eat an entire dish of 红烧肉by yourself, you would seriously feel ill because of how much fat there is. Sharing is caring and balance is key. Order some small plates if you are that hungry. Personally I think 3 times is very authentic and I support a business that wants to spread a Chinese breakfast culture. If you ain't about it, don't eat it lol
No comment

A newly opened dim sum place so we couldn't wait to try out. The braised pork belly was pretty authentic, but their signature crab dim sum was disappointing. Dim sum skin was made well and has a lot of crab meat, but the ground pork doesn't taste right... other dishes were ok!
Great, friendly service and delicious dumplings! The Chinese broccoli is a great side with the dumplings!!

Tried 3 Times for the first time and I'll definitely be returning! Everything I had was so delicious: Pork soup dumplings, pan fried pork buns, mapo tofu, sautéed eggplant and noodle with scallion oil (super good even cold the next day as leftovers mixed with the mapo tofu). I loved it all, the food was ready quickly and the staff was so nice and welcoming! Highly recommend.
This place has very delicious dishes.  Lots of veggie options.  Highly recommend. No alcohol yet.
Beautiful establishment, amazing service, and the best dumplings I ever had. Highly recommend!!!
Great new spot that opened up on Clinton, excellent dumplings and dim sum. Recommend D7 & A1

I'm surprised at the negative reviews. Me and my friend ordered the pork soup dumplings and scallion pancakes with beef. Both were really good! Our server was super kind, and I liked the venue, it was relaxing. Great service and I would definitely go again.

I live around the corner from this place, have been wanting to try it for quite some time. Ordered the soup dumplings, vegetable dumplings, and a pork bun. Food was delicious, price was great. The staff here is the best part, they're the nicest people around. Super happy I came here and will definitely return again!

I've been here a few times now and I'm in love. The portions are huge and the food is delicious! I've tried the noodles, buns, dumplings, and boba and they all exceeded my expectations. I'm so excited that Three Times came to LES and want to bring all my friends here! It's surprisingly cheap; you get so much bang for your buck here. Very casual and clean place. The employees have all been super friendly and accommodating. Overall great experience and great food - I would come here everyday if I could.
No comment
Great customer service and selection of Chinese favorites. The dumplings are delicious and the eatery space is big and pleasing to be in.
OMG!Food is fantastic!All staffs are very friendly!specially dumpling is awesome!

Loved this soup dumpling gem on the LES.   Incredible service, great outdoor dining options during COVID, and very tasty food - we especially loved the truffle soup dumplings, the friend mini pork buns, and the greens in broth - as well as the iced milk tea to drink. Great portions, incredible value for money. Cannot wait to come back!
The place was nice and clean. Food was okay only, my family said it didn't have enough favor.

Some of the most authentic Shanghainese food I've tasted outside of Shanghai. I'm so sick and tired of random chinese restaurants jumping on the xiaolongbao bandwagon thinking that most Americans or simply non-Shanghai natives won't know the difference. For years I went to Din Tai Fung bc of their reliability and quality but at the end of the day they're just a taiwanese impression of Shanghai food. 3 Times is finally the real deal and actually has better quality than most places in Shanghai. I don't even live in NYC but will happily commute here to get a taste of home.

We came here before going to the tenement museum a few blocks away.  The place is clean and has a well thought out modern look.  All of the dumplings were very tasty as were the specials.  Service was efficient and pleasant
taste good! Must try!! Love it so much! Xiao longbao is the best !I will be there next time!

Information for 3 Times on Yelp needs to be updated. I ate in at the restaurant last night and can attest to the fact that: 1- it's open and functioning normally; and 2- the food is delicious! We had several orders of the pork soup dumplings along with an order of scallion pancakes, southern pork bun and radish pancake. Everything was terrific--especially the soup dumplings--and the service was good too. I'm looking forward to going back as soon as I can.

Simple and authentic soup dumplings and wonton, as authentic as home style, really like this place. The salty duck is a little bit too salty but it would be better with rice. Service is top notch, always friendly and thoughtful.
Superb dim sum, particularly the soup dumplings. A wide variety of other delicious dishes as well, try the duck or the dan dan noodles. Crisp, speedy service and a well appointed small restaurant.

I had the shrimp egg fried rice and it was absolutely tasty. The shrimps were plentiful and cooked to perfection. I didn't need to ANYTHING to this dish because it was seasoned just right. This dish is a must try!

Came here with my brother and his girlfriend for part of our food tour in the lower east side. More than thrilled we stopped in, I couldn't give a better review. The waiters are super nice, friendly and helpful. It's a fun atmosphere with the ability to look into the kitchen and watch them make the dumplings. The soup dumpling and the pork buns are most certainly on my raider for the next time I visit! I can't wait to come again!

I live around the corner and have been wanting to try this place since it opened. The restaurant is very clean and nice inside. The soup dumplings and the pork bun were amazing! Highly recommend 3 times for a casual lunch or dinner!

The place is new in town. We had to try it. The place is very nice, clean and modern. We ordered a dumpling soup and noodles. It was very good. We took it to go but next time I would consider dinning in so it can be nice and warm. The prices are compatable to other area restaurants. Looking forward to trying something different.

I think they must have made some changes or reopened under new management or something since the negative reviews, because they just reopened on Sunday. Very good soup dumplings, and the staff was very friendly and attentive.
OMG! this is my second time visiting here I think they have new rice bowl it was amazing. I would definitely come back with my friends

I enjoyed foods here. Nice new addition to the lower east side neighborhood. Their signature dish Shi-bing-tong is like Chinese version of savory crepe with different fillings inside but skin is more crispy. It was very good. Their dumplings were also very good. Filling and skin proportion was good unlike some other place that  has very thick skin with little filling.  Noodles were quite impressive also. It's different from the usual lo-mien. It's not oily, simple with noodle and topping but it was very good. Staffs were very friendly and they have plenty of seats. I will definitely come back.
This is the place to eat when you are in hurry. They have one of the best buns and bubble tea. Love it. You guy should enjoy it:
The food here is very good! The staff is very friendly.  The environment is beautiful and the atmosphere is fantastic. They also play great music. I'd recommend this place to everyone i know!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had heard great things about Aurora and it's possible I just ordered the wrong thing, but I found the squid ink pasta with shrimp to be relatively flavorless. I had quite high expectations and the rest of my party enjoyed their pasta dishes, so they may have been having an off night. I started with an espresso martini which was perfectly shaken, foamy, and delicious. Portion size could have been slightly bigger but the pasta is very filling. The interior and garden are gorgeous and are a great backdrop for a date night or upscale night with friends, and the prices align with the area. I'd be open to coming back and trying something else, but don't get the squid ink pasta!

Aurora is super cozy, warm, has dim lights, the perfect romantic setting. I made a reservation with my family and friends, they seated us right away once we had the entire party ready. I ordered the ravioli which is a popular dish there and it was the best ravioli I've had, the cheese, mushroom, and sauce made the dish even better. Our server Juan was so kind, polite, and patient with us. I don't drink alcohol and I asked him if they had mocktails but they didn't and he still suggested a pretty good alternative. I had some of the octopus appetizer as well and I highly recommend it. I'm not a seafood type of girl but it has an amazing taste.

Absolutely love going here. The ambiance is so romantic; whether is be on a date or with friends. Service is always catering you and makes sure you're being taken care of. And the FOOD is so tasty and changes often so I like that when I come back every now and then that there's always something new
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is a hidden gem. I loved that they served what I believe to be authentic Italian cuisine. I came with a group of friends. We decided to do family style by ordering different things and trying it out. We ordered the arancini, shishito peppers, calamari, and the kale salad. For dinner, I had the steak (medium) which was delicious. I cleaned my plate! Our waiter was also attentive and suggestive. I love when they know the menu. I can't wait to go back because everything was great.
No comment

We had a lovely dinner here while celebrating a friend's birthday. We had a reservation and it was actually quite busy for a Tuesday evening. The restaurant itself is beautiful, lots of character, intimate atmosphere - the patio in particular is very pretty. We shared some appetizers and each ordered an entree. I love that they constantly change the menu and specials. They do a great job highlighting seasonal produce. We enjoyed all of the food and the cocktails as well. The pasta itself, which is made in-house, was delicious. I would certainly recommend this place!

First time visiting after walking around Williamsburg neighborhood with Jordan (pictured). Off the bat, the service was great. I decided to start the order with dessert and the waitress was excited to help me choose and provided their dessert menu. I ordered a tiramisu ($9) and Meyer Lemon + ricotta cake ($10) because I couldn't decide between both. Safe to say they were DELICIOUS. Jordan ordered Prosciutto di Parma ($21) to share, honestly it was pretty good. Left feeling light and satisfied, will definitely come back.

I visited this restaurant for a birthday celebration, and it was the perfect choice. The food was exceptional, and the staff went above and beyond to make our night special. The drinks were also expertly crafted, and the atmosphere was lively and fun. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for any celebratory occasion.
No comment

First time at Aurora. I ordered the spinach omelette which was delicious. Our server Roberta was so sweet, charismatic, and attentive. We sat outside, which was a beautiful green house type of ambiance that I appreciated. It was a little warm (they had the heaters on high), so I recommend layering up. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Aurora.
No comment
The bone marrow appetizer was delish! I loved the combo of mushrooms with greens! The ambiance was inviting yet cozy!! Service was quick!! Absolutely loved the pasta I had!!

Absolutely everything was super delicious! For apps we had octopus, calamari and the squash (?) salad - so delicious! For dinner we had the steak for two which came with two sides and the smashed potatoes were mega Yumm! Drinks are strong and yummy too. All the staff were very kind- Def will be back!
No comment
No comment

The entrees here are all absolutely delicious! Cannot recommended the pasta enough. Absolutely cleaned my plate. Drinks were fine, but pricey, appetizer was good. I have to say I was very disappointed with the dessert. Interior is very pretty and I cannot wait to see their outside terrace/patio area in the summer. A good spot for a delicious and upscale feeling meal (while not totally breaking the bank).

Super cute with a good, relaxed atmosphere. The service is actually pretty quick once you order things but the staff lets you go at your own pace without rushing you. The food is good, I'd definitely recommend the pastas. I think the lemon ricotta cake could've used a bit more flavor but I was still happy with it. And the drinks are good for the price point.
No comment

i was wildly underwhelmed with this establishment with both the aesthetic and the food. It seems most people come for the outdoor seating which looking great as you walk by but when you actually are seated, it falls short of the charm it seemingly eluded. but the food.. lackluster and bland.

My friend recommended Aurora and I'm glad she did! Very pretty indoor and outdoor spaces. We sat in the outdoor dining structure which was cozy. They have an extensive wine list and I was happy to see they had (very reasonably priced) Soave so we shared a bottle of that. I ordered the squid ink paccheri that came with toasted breadcrumbs, tomatoes, shrimp, and most importantly sea urchin. I could eat this dish over and over again, it was so incredibly good! The seafood in the dish tasted super fresh and the flavors meshed so well together. My friend ordered the ravioli with burata and eggplant which she also enjoyed. Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Located in Williamsburg, aurora is a nice Italian restaurant with amble outdoor area and a little indoor area. I sat outdoors on a summer night with a group of friends. We got the Croquettes, Fried Calamari, pork chops and spinach tagliatelle. The pork chops were probably the best thing we had to eat. It was very tender and juicy and well seasoned. The tagliatelle was good but could have been a meatier portion. The appetizers were also really good. Would return for the pork chops for sure!!! Also had the Grand St. drink which was really good. Great for groups. Good outdoor area.
No comment
I came here for dinner for NYE night. Great food. The pasta good and the Bread pudding delicious. Really liked the fried Calamari. Will be back to try their brunch.
I LOVE the Croquettes and the restaurant's patio area is beautiful. The service was great and when trying all the dishes, I see the similarities between here and Evelina.
No comment

Father's Day brunch with my family. Beautiful day to sit in their patio. The brunch menu was just what we needed. The service was good if not a bit slow but I chalk that up to a holiday Sunday.
We had the greatest dinner and Levi was an exceptional server!    We will definitely be back for brunch!   ‍‍

column3: East Side of Stamford, Stamford, CT
column6: Go to aurora and ask for Levi! He's the best. The cacio Pepe is amazing. We'll be back for brunch
No comment

Aurora is one of the best restaurants in Williamsburg! This was my third time dining there and they have consistently shown their great quality of service and food. We had a reservation and were seated right away in their beautiful outdoor garden area. Our drinks came out quickly and were good portions. We ordered the croquettes with risotto and grilled artichokes to start which were delicious. Our favorite dish, the tonnarelli cacio e Pepe was amazing! We also ordered the ravioli with spinach, ricotta, and mushrooms which was great as well. One of our friends who is originally from Italy was blown away with the food. For that reason alone, it is clear the Italian food here is authentic and a must try restaurant!
Not only amazing food and drinks but the atmosphere and vibes are unmatched! Perfect for a date night or special occasion!
No comment

5+ stars... Our server Juan José was nothing less than amazing and his attention to detail in accommodating our group for Jane's graduation made all the difference. The food is beyond delicious - literally everything was so good - with great great staff and service, and the out of this world food we will definitely be back. Aurora is a MUST try!!
No comment

No comment

This place is jam packed on a weekend so make reservations if you're planning to dine here. I came for lunch and had a wonderful meal. The food is fresh, tasty, plated beautifully and well thought out. The employees were very sweet to our dog as we enjoyed the lovely outdoor seating. My best friend frequents the place and raves about it constantly. I've only been once but the food was delicious.
No comment

Great Italian restaurant with homemade pasta. The menu was very pecorino heavy but staff was super accommodating in replacing it if you don't like sheep cheeses. I had the burrata ravioli which was a really hefty portion! Restaurant is really cute and outdoor area is really nice!

Excellent food, nice ambiance, good service. Try the paccheri with squid ink, tomato sugo, lump blue crab, wild shrimp, chili, and rustic breadcrumb; or the Creekstone Farms NY Strip steak, with crispy potatoes, broccoli rabe, and hazelnut romesco. Accompany them with a glass of Pecorino Terre di Chieti. End your dinner with some Barolo Chinato or Amaro Averna. So why not give it five stars? The food came out suspiciously quickly, almost as if it had been waiting there partially cooked. But perhaps I'm just paranoid.
No comment

Amazing food and the atmosphere is great. The staff was very attentive and the experience was seamless. We ordered calamari and the several pastas and they were all delish, al dente, and seasoned well. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone

I have eaten here on two different occasions with the most recent being 7/17/2022. My girlfriend and I decided to revisit this place after we had come two years ago for my birthday since we didn't get to try the pasta. We sat in their garden area towards the back right of the restaurant. I will say, the pasta did not disappoint. However, the reason for my 1-star review was the rats that were running around behind us. I didn't get through all my pasta when I noticed them and from that moment I couldn't eat anymore. Some other guests there also noticed the rats and one of them even went up to the area where they were to try to get a better look. When I called our waiter over and discreetly mentioned the issue, he nonchalantly told us "Well, this is Brooklyn. There is nothing I can do about it". He then asked if we wanted to move inside instead of apologizing about it first. At that point, we just wanted to get out of there so we requested the check. For them to give us a response like that knowing that is a clear health violation that can get the business shut down is unacceptable. It doesn't matter what borough you are in. A visual sign of rats is a clear indication of what is happening inside the restaurant and if it has a chance to affect my food? No thank you!

No comment

Amazing spot in Williamsburg. Visiting from out of town and a friend brought me here. We had reservations. We shared (3 of us) the kale salad, calamari and prosciutto with burrata cheese. Then we each ordered a different pasta. The portions were perfect size. We also ordered the Domino cocktail which has watermelon. Great food.

Food is beyond delicious and servers/bussers are nice and attentive -but I've gone there a couple of times with reservations and the weekend host tries to sit you outside as if you're a walk-in. It's rude- ask if the reservation would like to- don't just assume it's ok to bring them to sidewalk seating when they went out of their way to reserve a table.

I came here with my friend for dinner as we were in the area and I had heard really good things about it. We were able to snag a table outside (even though it was on the colder side), it was pretty warm in the sidewalk setup. We both ordered the Cacio E Pepe and it was delicious! The service was pretty good, though we did have to wait a while to get our check. The ambiance was really nice and it would be perfect for a date or catching up with a friend. Would definitely come back here again!

Can't recommend it at all. Indoor dining went way over the allowed 50% capacity, not to mention the outdoor space which was super crowded. The tables were ridiculously small and it was impossible to sit there comfortably. The music was super loud, we couldn't keep up a conversation as we couldn't hear each other. Out waiter was absolutely terrible: he spilled my cocktail all over the place, to the floor and onto the table then spilled the fries as well to my husbands lap an on the floor--it hasn't even crossed his mind to replace the fries with a new one given that the 1/3 of it ended on the floor. The food is mediocre, the burger patty was chewy. The cocktail was awful: it should've been a mix of different drinks (hence the name and according to what was on the menu) but I only could taste the very strong, cheap booze. A waste of money, not a pleasant memory whatsoever.
No comment

This place was top notch from start to finish! Exceptional food, atmosphere and service. We split the croquettes that were filled with risotto, mozzarella, tomato and basil. This was probably are least favorite thing that we ordered but still good. My sister had the risotto with aged ricotta, mushrooms, spring garlic and stracciatella. This dish was so creamy, rich and extraordinarily delicious. It was like a warm hug in your belly. I had the ravioli with cherry tomatoes, eggplant confit, basil and aged ricotta. The sauce was fairly light but very flavorful and also very tasty. We did things a little backwards but had another appetizer for our dessert. The sourdough, whipped ricotta, roasted mushrooms, lemon curd and oregano hit the spot and finished it off. Our waiter was attentive and friendly and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. We sat in the terrace which was pretty. I highly recommend this restaurant....definitely worth it!

Aurora is a nice little new school Italian restaurant. It restored my faith in Italian food after the horrible debacle at Il Cortile in Little Italy. Let me tell you, nothing compares to fresh pasta, fresh bread, & great cocktails. My only complaint is service: Our waitress took our order and left the job site. If it were not for the bussers, we would've been completely forgotten.

Nice place with a cute atmosphere. Staff is great and let's you relax without pressure to finish fast which is nice. Food was well cooked and had a ton of flavor and the pasta was portioned perfectly. They have a big wine selection and the waiter was knowledgeable and able to help pick up the perfect match. Lots of daily specials that are to die for! Good place for a special occasion dinner or just a classy night! Pretty much all of the dishes can be made gluten free and they also offer gluten free pasta, staff is knowledgeable about cross contamination and it's safe for celiac people.

I'll give this Evelina (right) a 5 stars. You almost can't notice the second drink due to the pure radiance of the Eve. Although the rosemary was in my nosemary when sipping, it was worth it. Will return.
No comment

Their patio and indoor area is very pretty but unfortunately most of the times they won't accommodate walk-ins except for their sidewalk tables, and usually with a long waiting time. I've tried to come 3 times and only have been able to eat here once. We tried the ink calamari croquettes they were crispy outside and creamy inside. The kale salad was also good as a side dish. The grilled octopus has a good flavor but texture is hard and dry, the portion is a tentacle (regular portion of most restaurants) but cut in HALF. they only serve one half...so no, I wouldn't recommend ordering that. Order a drink instead they are good.
No comment

The staff are so nice, I can't remember the name of the dish I had but it savory with a little kick of sour very flavorful! And I pair this dish up with white wine suggested by staff so amazing! If you liked Italian cuisine I think you'd better try this! Amazing deco and very good service mind!

I forgot to book a table at Lilia, so I booked Aurora instead. I'm not sorry that I did. Aurora is a tiny restaurant on Grand Street that serves amazing food. There is a lot of outdoor seating, so don't hesitate to book. The menu is very small, but very well executed. Our Octopus was fabulous, as was our Tuna Tartare. We ordered Striped Bass as our Main course and it was fabulous. I'm cancelling our reservations at Roberta's tomorrow and coming back.

No comment

Stunning brunch setting on their beautiful patio. Super rustic decor made even more beautiful with Ivy covered walls. The service is impeccable and the food absolutely delicious! My family thoroughly enjoyed decadent plates like Eggs Benedict, Carbonara, and Brioche French Toast. I absolutely devoured the Cacio e Pepe made with Gluten Free pasta. All this and drinks to top it all off!

Tiny spot with exceptional pasta. Arancini were perfect. Had the strangozzi with porcini and sausage and tasted the pappardelle Bolognese. Oooofa tastes like Italia on vacation! Homemade pasta and super fresh, delicate and delicious ingredients create an exceptional and relaxed dining experience. Service is on point. Aurora is a must try!
The food here is simply wonderful.  Ingredient driven. Well done.  Nice setting.  I highly recommend

Great food and environment. Price is a bit high but similar to other restaurants in the area.
No comment

Super cute and warmly decorated place. Appetizers were ok - not great. Creative pasta dishes - menu appeared a bit slim but ultimately enough choices for all of us. The pasta dishes were great. Service was good.
This is a great spot. The atmosphere is great. The outdoor seating is always a plus during summer days. This is place is have a nice dinner, even brunch. Food is good and Wine always recommend.
Food was so good!!! Atmosphere was amazing, service was excellent! (Thanks Elliot!) I definitely recommend this place and it was also recommended to me by friends who live in the area! Love

Amazing Italian food and amazing hospitality. The staff here are incredible, the food does not disappoint. Highly recommend the octopus appetizer and the prosciutto and burrata are to die for. They also have this special focaccia with fresh herbs I believe was rosemary baked into it that is so good. Got the pappardelle and squid ink pasta. Both fantastic. All of the deserts were incredible, the pistachio ice cream was out of this world. Cocktails and wine selection was also amazing. The entire staff were friendly, service was super quick, staff wore masks all around excellent experience. Evr is incredibly kind and gives excellent recommendations.

No comment

I've had this place bookmarked for so long. Finally got to come with family and I have to say... overrated! Nothing special and overpriced. The ambiance and decor was super cute. But that's about it. I really wanted to like it. Just bland.
Great ambiance! The pistachio dessert was great and the pastas are fresh and delicious. Great place for a wonderful dinner!

Aurora is a neighborhood staple! Always and forever will be ordering the rice balls and black squid pasta with lump crab. Then do yourself a favor and try a special bc I've had plenty and they're always delicious! Staff is familiar and nice for the most part, although not incredibly accommodating (one time didn't seat my party during a snow storm b/c it was 15 min before their opening time). Other than that really nice place to enjoy an authentic meal.
No comment

No comment

Foods were ok, very noisy and crowded. I reserve them on open table but they checked me as no show so now my open table account is deactivate ugh.  Tried to call them multiple times but directed to reservation. Nothing special about the food just ok.
No comment

Stopped by for Saturday brunch and was able to be seated outside immediately without a reservation. Tons of outdoor seating, including a beautiful patio! Highly recommend the crab & avocado eggs benedict; it seems pricey ($20) but it's LOADED with lump crab and is definitely worth it. The toasted filone with ricotta and mushrooms ($16) was also delicious, but the crab eggs benny was still the star. The drinks were a little weak for the price ($12 mimosa and $14 cocktail), but tasty.

I've ordered from Aurora multiple times, & the food has always been amazing. However, I ordered the branzino on Monday night, & woke up with a bout of food poisoning at 2 am. To be clear, I have no food allergies, nor did the branzino seem off in any kind of way. I suspect whomever seasoned the branzino didn't wash their hands properly before handling it. It sucks, b/c it was honestly delicious, but I can't trust a restaurant that doesn't adhere to strict cleanliness guidelines.

Everything we got here was delicious. Good outdoor environment and great vibes all around. Got the rice balls, chicken sandwich, and meat tomato pasta dish - all delicious. One of the best dining experiences I've had in a while (:

Had a great dinner at Aurora. I had one of the pasta dishes, tuna tartare and chocolate cake for dessert. The service was great and very friendly. The ambiance was also great. Would definitely recommend for a nice dinner if you're in the area!
No comment

Cute restaurant perfect for date night or brunch! So in order to access their outdoor dining area, the restaurant has you check in with the hostess inside and then they bring you outside. The restaurant should just have the hostess outside. Extremely convoluted system. We started off with the octopus which I didn't love. My fiancé loved it. They left this chewy skin like part on it. I had the peach summer salad which was really good minus the mint & my fiancé had the burger with  fries!! The fries are the reason to go plus the cute outdoor dining. The staff is super nice and they have the mobile hand held devices for you to pay so it's easy. Def must check out.
No comment
Amazing eggs benedict! The service is great. The outdoor seating in the back is so cute!
No comment
Wonderful place. Lamb Lollipops were amazing. Staff is great and friendly. The chocolate martini is strong.
No comment

We came on a Saturday without a reservation and we were seated immediately outside! The exterior is so pretty and the outdoor seating situation is beautiful!! The cocktails were delicious and we ordered the French toast and eggs Benedict. Both were phenomenal, the French toast bread was Devine and sooooo fluffy and the berries were so fresh!! Def want to come back and try their dinner menu and would come back for brunch!!

Food was excellent!!!! Home made pasta with the right amount of sauce and lamb. The fried calamari was fried to perfection and fresh!! The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was because the service was horrible and I'm being generous but only taking one star away. They have indoor and outdoor seating, best to make a reservation.

I enjoyed eating at Aurora. I had the Croquettes, squid ink risotto, lemon, fior di latte mozzarella and  I was pleasantly surprised. It was a delicious appetizer that was filling and the outdoor ambiance was nice as well. The food had fresh ingredients imported from Italy! My friend had the octopus from the brunch menu and enjoyed her meal as well.

Sat in the garden on a weeknight with a group of five and had a great dinner. Standout dishes were the delicate squash, ravioli and Tonnarelli Cacio & pepe. Also enjoyed the burrata and prosciutto, Montauk diver scallops, roasted sunchokes and mushrooms. Only thing I didn't love was the broccoli rabe (it's not my favorite anyway). Overall a great spot!

So good! Everything I have had here has been amazing. Patio is super cute. My daughter declared the burger the best she's ever had, and that's a high honor haha!
No comment

So we did not have a reservation but fortunately we were still able to get a table. My first impression of the place is that they have beautiful greenery but once I interacted with the host he was very snippy and I guess he had his friends at a table because I saw him go over there to sneak a sip to drink a few times. Anyway we were seated on the side walk which was still fine but it took the waitress awhile just to bring water to us and also to even bring the mixed drinks we ordered over. The drinks we had were nothing to rave about. We ordered the croquettes to start and they were delicious but the fried calamari we ordered was dry and oily. For dinner I ordered the ravioli and it was actually pretty decent, we also got skirt steak and it was good but the quantity of the dish was lacking. There was a few slices of steak on a plate but not much to eat. Overall I'm giving this place a 2 star because the hospitality was lacking, waitress was lacking, and food was just ok. At this price point the standards should be higher. A little disappointed but maybe next time my experience will be better.

Came here for brunch with some friends. Very few choices, not many things on their menu. I really liked the ambience, the garden, but I didn't like our waitress. She didn't have any patience and didn't know much about the menu. Also a bit too pricy.
The croquette was amazing and the scallops were on point. Made for an epic Valentine's Day with my special girl!
