No comment
No comment
Great terrace. Good meals as well. Staff could be more kind with clients however especially the ladies/guys at the entrance. Will go back for their brunch.
Love the food, service and ambiance! Especially in summer. We love the truffle there.
No comment
Went here for brunch with a group. While it is a beautiful place the food is extremely sub par.

With an hour to spare before a movie at Nitehawk, my date and I were looking for a close spot to grab dinner. We walked by Aurora which was pretty empty (it was around 6pm on a Friday) and decided to go in. The restaurant itself is beautifully decorated and has a lovely outdoor seating area which I highly recommend if you can get it, we were not able to sit outside due to reservations and by 6:30 the entire restaurant was packed so in the future I would make a reservation. Our server was wonderful, very nice and quick which was perfect since we had less than an hour for dinner. I ordered a cocktail called the Darlington, essentially a very upscale vodka tonic which was good but very small for the price. I then chose the Arctic Char, it was on the specials so I don't know how often they have it, but if they do when you go it is a MUST. Perfectly cooked fish, smoothy creamy polenta and amazing charred artichoke hearts. Pure heaven. Date got the fazzoletti with lamb ragù which he said was delicious. Overall a great experience and a delicious meal, will be back for sure.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Okay, this review is 2 years late. But I'm writing a review now because I have fond memories of it that just came back up when I think of which spots in NYC I love (I've since moved out). It's a delightful Italian restaurant in Williamsburg. The outdoor spot was so pretty and pleasantly bustling. I planned a friend's birthday dinner here (for ~6 people) and they handled it perfectly.
No comment
No comment

Definitely the best Italian in the area and some of the best we've had in NYC. The authentic food is consistently amazing and the impressive wine list leaves many options for perfect pairing. The brunch is particularly good for the very reasonable price. Several egg dishes come with the more subtle black truffle for a dynamite combination. The coffee is excellent. We've been back for dinner a few times recently and everything was equally as good. All enjoyed in their beautiful garden, summer and winter. The staff are always pleasant and knowledgeable. What more could you want?
No comment
No comment

Hosted my wedding ceremony and brunch here and could not recommend it more! The service was excellent, and management made sure to take special care of our guests. Excellent food and beautiful venue! Would recommend to anyone looking to host a small, private event.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The side garden is what attracted me in the first place, but the food and service is why I keep coming back. There's nothing that's a super standout and the prices aren't a super bargain to push this review to 5-stars, but they're pretty close. They had-me-at-hello with the bread basket. There's good stuff in there. Trust. I usually go with the specials, but the tuna tartar is an excellent standby.
No comment
This place had a ton of kids running around. We made reservations and had to wait twenty minutes too. The staff was super nice though and I enjoyed the squid ink pasta.
Great for brunch, relatively good for lunch and dinner. I've never had a bad brunch here but the meals flatten out later it the day. Very friendly staff
Unbelievable food. This gem is easily the best Italian food I've had in NYC. I go every Brooklyn restaurant week with a big group cuz we are guaranteed a good meal with great service

This place used to be one of the only games in town and was pretty good but my how they've fallen off. Warning flags were up early scanning the packed garden area and only seeing ppl who def don't live in the area. Fake personable but inattentive service (ask me if I'm an actor!), over crowded, unapologetically long wait for sloppily prepared, poorly executed dishes. Apps were good but had to ask for bread three times. Worst of all - the seafood pasta dish was inedible and tasted and smelled of spoiled shell fish. I told our server and we sent it back which was easy enough yet they continued serving it to others. I could smell it from the table next to us like smack in the face but middle aged English woman wolfed it down w out complaint. Gross. What used to be a nice romantic spot has become a de facto tourist trap. The wine list is still decent though.. Williamsburg in a nutshell I guess.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This restaurant is perfect. The outdoor patio is very cute, the food is delicious the service is great, love the olive oil and bread to start, the pastas and finishing with the busino ! I come here often and bring all my friends for a combo white hotel rooftop + aurora restaurant. Make sure to book a table I'm advance!
No comment

This place had a 30 min wait on a week night for 4 people! Good thing it was worth the wait. There was a very cute semi outdoor seating area that looked like a garden. To start us off, the waiter was very knowledgeable in helping us choose a wine.  I ordered the Strangozzi Alla Norcina which was amazing - definitely the best dish at the table. My friend had seafood pasta, which he wasn't a fan of. But everyone else really enjoyed their dishes. Overall great dinner. Hope to be back soon!

Saw this place for years finally decided to give it a try on Saturday afternoon it was my wife and my anniversary ( 23 years) , didn't realize they close in the afternoon, to get ready for dinner crowd, we had 3:30 reservations, got there 3:45 it was all good hostess sat my wife as I went to park, great atmosphere, looks like everyone that works there lives in the neighborhood,  very casual we had to order from brunch menu again no big deal seems like there's a little something for everyone... we shared 2 appetizers the kale salad with roasted pistachios and some other stuff absolutely delicious we also had the rice croquettes very tasty fresh and hot ... love it for our entrees I had a angus burger with pesto mayo and avocado it was spectacular, and my wife order fresh pasta with smoked eggplant and mozzarella it was great , staff was extremely friendly and on point, will definitely be back and will bring some friends
No comment

For Williamsburg, a 12 year old Resturant is hard to come by and for home made Italian food, even harder. Aurora is an absolute gem !!! Perfect for a Romantic evening date or family dinner. The Resturant is seasonal, so it doesn't always have the same dishes, if any of the following are on the menu, they better be in your table...Go for dinner,  MUSTS: Burratta, smoked Trout summer salad, Truffle ravioli, orecchie with tomato cauliflower and shrimp, tiramisu, caffe corretto. I recommend making a reservation.

We always love coming to this wonderful place. It's very cozy and the food is always delicious! Freshly made pasta and good wine. The service is great. Really make a point to go if your in Williamsburg! Excellent!

Came for dinner visiting NY beautiful restaurant.  Food was very good and all home made even the pasta was made there.  Overall I enjoyed everything and the ambiance is very quiet and chill.  Great spot to go on a date very romantic.  And all the food there is very authentic Italian!  Service also was very quick.
Patio dining, perfectly prepared Risotto and Panna Cotta that will bring me back this week! What's not to love! Oh, and now accepts credit cards...heaven.

The food for brunch was fantastic but the service was subpar. Hostess was rude and the waiter couldn't have cared less. Mimosa pitchers turned out to be $40 each which was way too expensive for what it was. Not worth the visit and if they don't care about your. business them I wouldn't give it to them

Good service and nice atmosphere. Ordered the Ravioli, and must say it was a disappointment, 4 ravioli's for $22 not including tax or tip. Finished my meal in 3 minutes and couldn't help but think that each ravioli was $5.50 - on top of that the burrata filling was watery...
No comment

No comment
No comment
Ambiance and service were perfect. Food was good.  Nice wine selection. Sit outside before winter arrives!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Enjoyed this Brooklyn/Wilamsburg gem. Had the red snapper and Burratta with a friend and colleague. Staff was courteous, informative and attentive. Absolutely worth it.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Such a cute little place. Reminds me of a restaurant Flour + Water in SF. I had the Tagliatelle al Limone & it was sooo tasty!! We also had an artichoek salad which was alright. My friend had a meaty pasta I can't remember ( I don't eat meat) but she said it was good. We had flan for dessert which we normally don't care for but this was delicious! They gave us a little biscotti with the check. Reasonably priced and love the atmosphere. I'll be back next time I'm in Brooklyn.

What a joy is to have randomly found this place!! We were a group of 3 adults and 3 kids, which are welcome and very well trated, and they sat us down immediately. It did not take long for us to make our minds and the food arrived gracefully quick. I had  Morrel mushrooms and white shaved summer truffles pappardelle.... Im still speechless! Snapper was also to die for and the caramel compote with crushed dark chocolate was the final touch of excellency. Touché

my favorite restaurant, love everything about it, FOOD always standing and fresh, environment is so cozy, staff very nice and friendly. Very rustic look , love the decoration. I really recommend this place!! , i love every single dish one of the menu!
No comment

No comment
No comment

I always have a lovely meal here. The pastas are very well done and most made in house. The salads are always perfectly done, seasonal and on point. Love to go for their lunch prix fixe. I highly recommend this place. I return often.

This place is amazing. One of the best meals I've had in a while. My girlfriend and I just moved to the neighborhood and have been trying a bunch of new spots, this and rabbit hole are tied for our favorite. The service, food and drink was perfect. And the portions were very generous which is rare in Brooklyn.

This is my staple go-to special celebration restaurant, because they are probably one of the few restaurants who does Italian fare like Italians. The food is fresh, pasta is fresh, wine list divine, atmosphere is enjoyable. Really like the place. The Aperol Spritz is also divine although I have since found a Manhattan competitor for this drink when I cannot make it across the river. Definitely go for the black truffle pasta, ragus, and the seafood mixta, and the tuna tartare. I've only been here for dinner, so my review is for such. Note my price includes a bottle of wine. Anything under $100 per head with wine in New York is as reasonable as it can get.

Tasty, delicious, seasonal, friendly, great look. Love the outdoor patio covered in vines. Love the changing menu. Good lives (I judge an Italian places based on their olive & cheese selection). A perfect spot for date night or catching up with a bunch of friends!
No comment

Had brunch here this afternoon - the dish was incredible, portion size was gigantic and flavor was intense. A little heavy on the grease/salt but that's also part of what made it so tasty so I can't complain, but I couldn't eat like that every day. We were given space to drink coffee and keep talking after finishing our food too which was nice. I'll definitely be back!
No comment

The worst risotto and restaurant. They say they put lobster in it, the lobster was not in it. If I was a lobster, I would get offended. The rice tasted like oatmeal, there was just one small little caviar. Massive plate with no food in it. Bartender was careless and unprofessional. He calculated the check wrong. There was a stem of a celery in the food. Procuitto was from deli, it said it is aged 2 years. Lies.  If you ever want to Italian food, cook it at home it would be much much better.
No comment

No comment
No comment

Amazing food. Great staff and service. You will never regret a meal here. Brought family from out of town and everyone is still talking about the meal. I was happy to spend $300+ here and plan on doing so again :)

Lovely late Saturday brunch. Had the scrabbled eggs with salmon and burratta, came very promptly and was as decent as other brunch spots in the area (so, average). Service was very good and prompt, and the outdoor covered seating with the greenery was pleasant.
Great food, we had an expired gift card that they still accepted.  would give 5 stars if they were on open-table / accepted reservations without a credit card.
No comment
No comment
Cute spot in the neighborhood, like the norwegian eggs.

This place is a solid 4 stars. Good food, good service, good ambience. we came in in a Saturday for brunch and there was no wait for outside seating ( lucky us!), so we got to bask in the sun while eating delicious Italian food. We'll definitely be here again!
No comment
No comment

One of my favorite restaurants in the neighborhood. Both brunch and dinner get five stars. The food is delicious. Service is always prompt and friendly, and the ambiance is great. I love the cozy inside and outdoor garden. It also never seems to get extremely crowded and it's actually a pretty good sized restaurant which I like. I hate sitting on top of people next to me. I hope they continue to impress me with their service and food because that's the key to having loyal customers.

2 weeks ago I had my Sunday afternoon wedding here.  I was looking for a rustic outdoor brooklyn wedding venue and found this on google.  The images I found from past weddings were so beautiful I had to check it out.  The food is all delicious and the portions are good.  The place itself is so pretty with the fresh ivy and exposed brick you don't need a lot of decorations.  I worked with Irene from their events team throughout the process and she was always there to answer any questions I had, plus she is super sweet.  My wedding was a perfect success and my friends and family couldn't stop talking about how lovely the place was and how amazing all the food was.
No comment
No comment

We recently had my son and daughter-in-law's rehearsal dinner here. It was amazing! I know it might be hard to believe but every piece of the puzzle was perfect. First, the seating was beautifully done. The waiter was attentive and patient, the drinks and food some of the best I have ever had. Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!
Went here for dinner not too long ago. Restaurant has a nice space in the garden. The pasta special and appetizers were tasty and drinks were good. Great date spot.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Very good free bread. Ordered fish of the day (striped bass) which was surprisingly bland.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Typical hipster place in Williamsburg. It's cute and rustic but like a typical hipster DB place, they wouldn't seat the entire party without everyone being present. It was Easter Sunday morning at 11AM and quiet. I told my party to go ahead and just start ordering and eating. They did. It was filling up by the time I got there but I ordered and the rest of the party ordered coffee/tea. I got a green fave bean salad which I finished rather quickly. It looked promising and fresh, but I'm not sure what ingredients they used. I started coughing a bit (I'm allergic to preservatives) so I'm convinced something in there - maybe their dressing - was NOT fresh. Waitstaff was pleasant but they wanted us out. This place is nothing special and with so many other places around, don't go out of your way to come here - especially from Queens - unless your friend who is leaving back to Japan selected the place.
No comment
No comment
Pasta is super fresh, homemade everything we had was fantastic. We had lasagna, pasta with vodka sauce, fettuccini. All pastas were perfectly cooked and delicious. Service was fantastic as well.

Out of all the luring Italian restaurants in the area this one should stick out among the rest. The appetizers arent overlooked and put to the side. They and the main course get the same perfect cooking and flavor. The wait staff are always ready to help and will help with any special requests for your meal. Highly recommend this place
No comment
No comment
No comment

Visiting New York for the first time, I was so excited to come down to little Italy and this restaurant made everything worth it!! In the picture is the chicken parm 10/10, I also got the fettuccini Alfredo and still think about it bc it was so good I wanted to lick the plate clean
Amazing food, cooked to perfection! Everything tasted fresh and the staff was very kind. It tasted authentic. We went on a busy day. Would come again!

For a tourist location the food was really good here! Basic decor but cute and we were seated pretty quickly without any reservation. I had the spaghetti and meatballs and it was really good. The spaghetti was light but still filling. Our waitress was ok.
Great restaurant in NYC, authentic Italian, a lot of options to choose from & great seating.

Very good food but the Fra Diablo is outstanding!  Also on their wine list is a Ripasso which paired beautifully. Other had the lasagna which they liked and the clams in white wine sauce which was also very good.  But the shrimp Fra Diablo was the best!

Came here for lunch, I got the spaghetti and meatballs and my husband got the chicken parm with fettuccini Alfredo. The meatballs were gross and the red sauce was very acidic. The Alfredo sauce tasted like cream.  The people next to us got pizza which looked way better than our food.
No comment

The food is way overpriced for touristy Italian. Lackluster bread served with butter in diner packets. Vongole pasta had no taste. Lasagna was crude...sauce tasted as though it was thrown together rather than simmered with care. Dinner for two with one appetizer and a couple of drinks was $175.
Chicken Marsala was gravy sauce and they poured the same sauce on my pasta.  Couldn't even taste Marsala wine at all!  Service was really slow too. Don't recommend.
Really enjoyed this spot. Food was fantastic- very fresh. Got penne all vodka w grilled chicken. Wait staff was wonderful
Great atmosphere, friendly staff.  I expected the food to be better and more authentic but overall it wasn't bad.  The vodka penne was a 7.5 out of 10 and the chicken Marsala was a 5 out of 10.
No comment

Great place in Little Italy. There were 3 of us and we sat outside. I had spaghetti and meatballs, my boyfriend had chicken fettuccine Alfredo and our friend had a chicken, penne primavera. All were great. We shared a great bottle of wine too and really enjoyed the bread basket. If I'm ever in town again, I'd eat there again. Service was really good too.
great food and even better service. The menu is pretty simple but it's really good. I got the lasagna 10/10
No comment
No comment
No comment

Just went here for espresso martinis so not much I can comment on. They were actually pretty good and were exactly what I was looking for. $73 for 3. Normal NY prices. Staff was nice and they were decently busy!

Unassuming shop located in the middle of Manhattan's Little Italy. Service was relatively quick, the food was good, and the staff were friendly. The outdoor eating space is a nice space to be enjoyed in good weather, and the indoor eating space can be opened directly onto the sidewalk/street. The menu appears classically Italian, and there are a number of options to pick from. The portions are quite generous. AmEx is accepted here.
No comment

Solid main entrees with reasonable price. I had the lasagna, my husband a vegan option of pasta pomodoro, my BIL the carbonara, and my nephew the Amici pizza. All were amazing, now, the appetizers were pricier than some of our entrees and we didn't like them, which was a bummer. The Spiedini alla Romana was soggy and the cheese not even melted. The Arancini was just bland. Now, the main plates were delicious. Services was efficient and attentive, plus we were seated rather quickly, when most restaurants with similar ratings had a 2-hour wait. We watched the soccer game and were not rushed at all to leave the table. Overall a solid option in the area.

Amici was a great choice  that one of my friends picked out for us to try the food was so favorable. We set outside it was a nice view of the street and the little shops around. The staff were all very nice. Overall we satisfied and very happy and would go back.

We choose to dine in here after browsing through Little Italy. They have big fans for indoor seating and aircon. We tried their bolognese, pizza and the one that stood out Spiedini alla Romana. Its something unique and love the generous sauce portion and capers. Would definitely recommend!

Had great reviews so we checked it out while visiting Little Italy in NYC. Pros: The atmosphere was really cool around the holidays! We ate in their outdoor closed in patio which had heaters. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Aperol Spritz ($14) was awesome!! Cons: $30 for chicken picatta which was mediocre. Also ordered a side of broccoli which was pretty bitter. It was okay, but we wouldn't be back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Deliciousssss food! Highly recommend going to this restaurant. Even though the vibes are pretty low key and it isn't done up the fanciest, the food is amazing. We ordered the Carbonara, calamari and chicken parm. The carbonara was cooked to perfection and had a nutty flavor. Probably one of the best carbonaras I've had in my life and I've had a lot in my life. Def going back again
Food is just average. Big problem is they put 18 percent tip charge on your check and then ask for more . This was for only 2 people. Scandalous restaurant that I will not return to.
No comment

The food was so delicious at this restaurant located in Little Italy. Our party of 5 decided to order different dishes and shared family style. Every dish was superb! Was was really unexpected was that the waiter gave us all a limoncello after our meal. Would definitely recommend this restaurant!

column3: Town of Oyster Bay, Long Island, NY
column6: Meh. My gf and I split a pizza because it was 2:30 and we were kinda sorta hungry.., but didn't want to ruin our appetite's for dinner later. Once seated the waitress asked for our drink orders and recommend a few drinks before we could even open the menu. One was an aperol spritz which my gf ordered. While good, certainly not $18 good, according to her. I just ordered a Diet Coke and was charged when the waitress asked me if I wanted a refill. Pizza was good though. Though, what was strange was the automatic 20% tip. 20% is the floor amount I always tip, but somehow this just felt wrong to automatically include.
No comment

column3: East Fort Lauderdale, Fort Lauderdale, FL
column6: Love this place! We come to the city a couple times a month, and always make it a point to eat at Amici. Everything we have ever tried there is fresh and tastes wonderful! Highly recommend!
No comment
Not worth the high star count. Not Italians cooking in the kitchen and you can tell by the gluggy pizza and cheap olive oil they use. Glass of wine was $17 and they added 20% gratuity to the bill
No comment
No comment

Nice clean vibe and their pasta is cooked to perfection!  Very cordial waitress and host.  Wasn't too in love with the lobster ravioli filling but all their sauces are great!  Outdoor and indoor seating available.
This place is AMAZING!!! Best lasagna I've ever had hands down. WAY above average service and overall great experience.
No comment
No comment
No comment

If you are here, I highly recommend getting the pasta. My fiancé and I got the pasta marinara. We also got the pizza but it was nothing to write home about. Especially for New York standards of pizza.....  definitely get the pasta!
No comment

If the food was hot I would've definitely given 5 stars. Food here was amazing. We went for the San Gennaro feast. We Had the octopus app. Veal pastas(2 kinds) and the pizza. The burrata was meh...should be served at room temp in my opinion to get ultimate taste.
No comment

Finally tried this place down my block and thank god I did! Swapped the penne vodka for rigatoni and had the most comforting, satisfying meal of my life. The servers are so kind and attentive, and also provided a complimentary glass of sauv for me! (probably a pity glass because I was eating alone???? lol) anyways COME HERE it is immaculate.

Wow !!!! What a gem !!! Staff was very welcoming and gracious , outdoor patio very cute. Food DELICIOUS!!!! I'm a pasta carbonara "snob" and theirs is perfection. Great house red wine as well. Already planning my return
No comment
It was good but food was not exceptional. Fun dinner but service was slow. Probably would try other spots next time

Comfortably sat outside. Very good service (4 star), very good calamari (4 star), salad fresh, but the pizza - comeon. I've had better frozen pizza at home, literally. I was a little embarrassed afterward that I visited one of the pizza capitals of the world and paid $20 for an 8" frozen pizza with extra cheese on it (1 star). I have a feeling that most of the "Little Italy" restaurants are some touristy theme of this. I'll get my NYC Italian elsewhere, in the future.

The owner makes it very obvious he takes pride in his restaurant and his guest. The food is amazing and the staff are very well mannered and friendly I've only been here a couple of times but make it a point to visit anytime I come to NY
Food, service, view were all exceptional.  The tagliatelle with truffles, gnocchi, salads, bread, all very good.  It was like a nice meal in Italy.

My husband and I were in little Italy for the day and couldn't decide where to eat...so many options. We walked by Amici's and asked a woman (who had just finished eating) how her meal was.  She raved that it was very good, and we should eat there, so we did. It did not disappoint. Our food was excellent and so was the server, Chris. He was pleasant,  accommodating and very attentive. I highly recommend this place. We'll certainly be back.

Great pasta, very authentic, and the parmesan was PHENOMENAL melt in your mouth type deal. The complementary bread and butter were a bit stale. The Italian service was very friendly, living up to the restaurant name, Amici. Pricing was a little high, but overall, great experience!
Excellent meals and cannoli.  Good service.  Great atmosphere. Very welcoming.  Reasonable prices.

Ambiance is average but the food and staff were wonderful. Very friendly and the chicken parm was flavorful and we had it in a vodka sauce instead-tasty! Also had the bolognese which was flavorful and the pasta was that perfect Al Dente that you want in pasta. We also get a free dessert with an order of 2 entrees. Tiramisu was GREAT. I always appreciate a waiter who is knowledgeable about the food process. Thanks Christian for the great service!

I decided to stop to look at the menu when I saw the 4.5 stars on yelp. The prices were lower comparing to the others on the strips. In addition to the manager came to greet us and told us it would be the lunch menu's price even though it was a Sunday afternoon. We found the food mediocre as described with the pictures.
No comment

When did Little Italy become so non-Little Italy? I felt like I was on 5th Avenue in Playa del Carmen, with the paid guys who stand on sidewalk at every restaurant and try to get you to go in. We were starving, ordered rigatoni and lobster ravioli, both very basic and bland. The vinegar on the table was not even balsamic, but a cheap wine vinegar. The Parmesan? Powdered, like the packets from pizza chains who deliver. Not authentic. The worst was the arugula salad with Strawberries (4 slices from one strawberry to be exact), sunflower seeds (not pine nuts) and a few cubes of a rubbery poor excuse for a cheese. Amici for dinner? Forget about it!
Food was amazing! Authentic and Fresh! The best meal we had while in New York City.  I wish I would've taken pictures to share.
No comment
No comment

We stopped in, for lunch, during this year's Feast of San Genarro (a fantastic street fair food orgy). We went partly because Yelp showed a wonderful linguini pescatore, which we discovered was not on the lunch menu. Fortunately, I asked and, yes, they could prepare it for lunch -- and it was terrific. My wife had the linguini with squid. The sauce was the same as mine, also very good. It was, however, a bit disappointing to not have a good Chianti Classico by the glass, and I wasn't going to pay $70 for a bottle whose remnants I'd have to cart around for the rest of the day. We did not have desert, since the Feast had a half-dozen fantastic gelato and cannoli booths.
No comment

The cutest place to stop and enjoy a glass of wine and some truly delicious desserts! We had the tiramisu and the gelato in the chocolate shell. Both were really good. We had wonderful service when we stopped in around mid afternoon. They even tracked down the accordion player to sing happy birthday to my daughter. I would definitely come back the next time I'm in town to try some of their delicious looking entrees.
Great  pizza and calamari along with terrific service by manager and staff. Very fun atmosphere.
This is a must.  Great food, great service and Covid safe.   The soup was amazing, the pasta was al denote and the sauces very flavorful.

During my first trip to New York, I had mistakenly didn't pack many warm clothes and found myself in the middle of blizzard in Little Italy. I was approached by Andreas, the host and main face of the Amici Ristorante and was invited in to his restaurant. It was a offer I couldn't refuse. The first thing I craved was there Chicken Parm, which was hands down the best dish of its kind I have ever tried in any other Italian restaurant! I was floored by the amazing hospitality and great food. This was 5 years ago and I have always returned ever since. Andreas has always continually welcomed me and the food was always superb! This is a MUST go to and hands down my favorite Italian restaurant!!
Good service, good food.  Delicious shrimp scampi.  I will definitely go back.  I picked this place to have dinner on my birthday had a gr

Found this cozy restaurant with a comfortable outdoor dining. A great oasis away from the hustle & bustle of the San Gennaro feast going on around us. Reasonably priced and tasty. The calamari was crispy and fresh. My husband loved the garlicky red sauce that came with it.  My ravioli was cooked perfectly al dente. I will be coming here again
Amazing foooddd!!! And very fun and kind people!! Great experience overall, definitely suggest you go here for a homey Italian experience
No comment

I'm sad to say that this is one of the few times when Yelp steered me wrong. With such a high rating we chose to eat at Amici and with so many great options surrounding it, we were deeply disappointed with the food. The chicken parm was thin and overcooked. The side of spaghetti inedible. My husbands ravioli was "the worst", the clams were not hot, and even the bread was stale because they said they cut it in the morning. Unfortunately I feel compelled to warn others of this let down of a restaurant.
The risotto is perfect and I'm out of words right now about how good it is. The seasoning of tomato sauce with rice was just so good and perfect and I am literally trembling after the first bite

Stopped here our first day in NYC and the food was amazing!!  Just as good as being in Italy. My favorite Italian dish is Eggplant Parmesan and this is the best I've ever had.  And the best cannoli too!  Can't wait to come back.  Would highly recommend.
By far, a beautiful spot! The bread and olive oil was delicious, air conditioning was amazing on a hot, humid day, and owner and servers were friendly! Much needed Sangria for the win!

We all loved our food. I ordered the mushroom risotto and it was outstanding. My only gripe was our server. He was fine in terms of not messing up our order but not the most friendly or helpful for patrons or attentive. This is huge in this industry with the plethora of choices in Little Italy but overall a very nice spot.
Very good pizza but I went just by myself alone and didn't get any bread or the amenities that use to have with other costumers
No comment
Delicious!! Ate here during the San Gennaro festival and it was a true Italian experience. The gnocchi was amazing the ravioli was fantastic and the meatballs were enormous!!

Have always wanted to go to Little Italy & eat authentic Italian food. Amici's did not disappoint .  The home made sangria was wonderful & every dish we had was absolutely delicious.  Service was good & can now check this off my bucket list
No comment

We went around 12-1 on memorial day to Amici. We ordered penne a la vodka & fettuccine Alfredo for lunch, and the food was great. When we got there it wasn't busy, but as we settled in it was getting busier, so if you're going on a weekend around brunch hours expect a busier crowd. Overall, it was a great time and great food.
Amazing dinner in Little Italy. We had the house ravioli, chicken Parma Sean, lobster ravioli, and pesto gnocchi. All were delicious!!

Been to Little Italy many times before but haven't tried this restaurant out until this week. It was amazing, the food was great and we ordered the cosmos for drinks and those were so good! The inside was very nice and a great ambiance. The service made this place a 5 star, they were phenomenal! We never felt rushed to leave or anything and it felt like we could just hangout there for hours, felt like home! Highly recommend!
I think you're good with anything you order the food is authentic and fresh. The shrimp was nice and juicy & the environment is great . They're drinks are excellent too!
No comment
The seafood mix pasta with red sauce was amazing and so was the bolognese was great as well!! super good pasta
Great food and service. Had the Cesar salad, pizza and  fettuccine. Will come back when back in town.
No comment
This restaurant has the best pasta I've ever had!! Amazing service - thank you Christian @Sarah - and amazing drinks as well!! Espresso martinis are the BOMB!!! Thank you Amici!!

Food was amazing! I've come here 2 times now and service has been extremely friendly and prompt. I order sangria which was to die for. Highly suggest getting a pitcher, was delicious and perfect. The portions were quite big and I was able to share the steak (that comes with salad/pasta) with my friend.
Amazing, reasonably priced food. I had the ricotta ravioli and the wife had the chicken parm. Both were off the hook. A must-eat in little Italy. Highly recommended!
Amazing place, food was fantastic, the Amarone was great and the guy with the red Ferrari jacket was the hardest worker in the restaurant.

My family's experience here was AMAZING! Even on a busy Saturday night during peak dinner time we got a table right away. They served us bread and water as soon as we sat down. The waitstaff was friendly and the food was sooo delicious! Highly recommend if you're in Little Italy.

Last time I ate there, the service was terrible and the food was above average. However, I gave it another try an outside of the olive oil been very bitter, the food and the Service was very good. I will go back again soon.
No comment
One of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been. Amazing carbonara and italian style pizza
No comment

This restaurant right here, man I have never been so amazed by the taste of pizza before this! My friend and I were just looking at the menu and I think it was the owner that came out and said "this is the place" describing the taste with a chef's kiss into the air, and man was he right! If you're a tourist or live around the area, this would be my go to!
Stopped in for the day and wanted pizza and wound up getting pasta instead. Absolutely fantastic meal.

Food, drinks and company were good. We had a bigger party than what they were ready for, but they quickly accommodated us. The place was full and tables are not distanced so have your masks ready unless you're going to eat outside
No comment

Pasta was very basic. I'd say nothing special. The pizza was absolutely disappointing. Tasted like a frozen flat bread pizza from a grocery store. Overall very disappointed for a place in Little Italy!
The food there is delicious, service is great all the staff so friendly. Definitely going back soon.
No comment
I love this place! From food to the serving they are amazing! And the service is great. I had the bread and it was fresh and the dipping is amazing!

We were delightfully surprised with how delicious the pasta dishes were. Two days later and that is all the girls can talk about. The pasta had the perfect flavor and was cooked to perfection. The Alfredo sauce was the best I've ever had and that marinara sauce still has my tastebuds watering. The pizzas were good but not the best we've had. The service was excellent as well.

Called them at 4:00pm on Sunday afternoon and asked if we could possibly get a table for 8 at 6:00pm that same night.  They said they were getting pretty busy, but could make it happen for us.  We showed up and sure enough they had our table ready.  Some of the highlights were the chicken marsala, lasagna, gnocchi, and the pizzas were good as well.
Came in for lunch and it was delicious. Pasta was fresh. Everything had such great flavor you can taste the ingredients. Great service very attentive.
This was the second best pasta carbonara I've ever had. 9/10 would recommend and prices weren't too bad.
Awesome pizza and wonderful service!!!  Our family enjoyed the authentic Italian food on our day trip to the city!
Delicious food! Awesome atmosphere in the middle of Little Italy! Would definitely go back again
Excellent food and service. Staff was very accommodating and attentive. Arancini was the best I've had

Everything was delicious. Based on the bread test, they didn't disappoint. The olive oil had a lot of herbs and garlic which made dipping even more delicious. The red sangria was refreshing on a hot summer day. A great experience all around.
Went with my girlfriend before a concert and it was great. Service was excellent. Definitely get the meatballs!
I highly recommend the Pasta all Vodka, really delicious. We sat outside and it was a fun atmosphere.

Located in Little Italy this place is a great Italian spot if you're in search for some authentic, hearty Italian meal. Bread is fresh and the olive oil with herbs they give at the beginning is next level. The calamari is lightly battered but tasted fresh. My friend and I ordered the chicken parmigiana and Penne ala vodka. Both were hot, tasty, and decently sized portions. Price isn't crazy out of this world and the service was up to par. I would definitely recommend this place to a friend and make a second visit.

Food was great , service was good. I paid through cash app. Three days after our trip I get a notification from cash app that a tip was added causing my account to go negative. Not appreciative of that at all.
No comment

The food was absolutely spectacular& The location was terrific as nothing really compares to the beautiful scenery on mulberry street. I give this 5 stars for a multitude of reasons but what set it apart was our waiters complementary shots and cannolis. Loved this place. Very authentic
Wow this was so good. Brought me back to Italy. Cute dining space too. Would go here again and again.

This restaurant cancelled my New Years Eve reservation that I had for 2+ weeks in advance without even letting me know. I could've shown up at 10pm if I didn't see the Opentable email and would've been completely screwed. When I called and asked for an explanation that manager  told me the staff wants to go home so they decided to close early and just said "that sucks" when I said I had the reservation for over 2 weeks in advance. Really unprofessional and terrible service, so don't be surprised if you show up to eat and your reservation is cancelled.
Great food, probably best in Little Italy. Never had a miss with anything I've gotten. (Although their spaghetti and meatballs are a personal fave.)
The food and service was excellent. Kristian was our server and was very helpful with choosing the right meals!!!
Amazing food! waiters are super friendly. definitely recommend to tourists or anyone who's in the area and wants yummy food!! 10/10!

Great service, food came out very quick, and pasta was absolutely amazing. I've been to Italy and I can definitely vouch to say this was authentic and one of the best pasta dishes I've had! Tried the pesto gnocchi and fettuccine Alfredo.

Food was amazing and even though outdoors, we were still comfortable and they have great heaters! But I do want to highlight the service!  We were a party of 9 which included my autistic nephew & family member that currently needs assistance to walk and let me tell you how the staff, particularly the host Andres, fully accommodated us and made us feel welcome and comfortable. I applaud businesses with an understanding staff! As a native NY'er, this is rare to encounter, specially in busy Little Italy. Hospitality is not only about food and drinks but also the service. Thank you!!

We visited New York in December. The atmosphere was amazing, food was really good especially Amici salad and tiramisu. But our server was beyond amazing. Christian thank you very much. Merry Christmas
I absolutely love this resturant. It's cozy and has wonderful food. The service here has also been immaculate. It was a great first dinner in NYC at this place.

I am amazed. I live in the neighborhood and have tried all the local restaurants, this by far is the best. Old school but knows how to modify. The same chef from 20 years ago with an amazing update to the decor. The staff couldn't be nicer. Highly recommend!!!
Was hopeful for this restaurant furled to good reviews despite not being crowded. But the food was mediocre, the service was both slow and the waitress knew nothing about the food or wine.
Excellent food and service! The pasta always fresh and their staff are all so nice. Truly a great environment and experience
No comment
Food was delicious and service was superb. Great experience!! Forgot the name of the pasta but it was delicious. I will come back on my next NY trip.
No comment
I'm from DC and the first place restaurant I visit is Amici's for lunch. Their lasagne is superb with fresh home-made pasta and a tasty sauce.  The host and waiter was friendly and attentive.

Loved it!!! My 9 year old son and I happened upon this place - the reviews were good so we decided to try it.  I had the clams and cesar salad and my son had the cheese ravioli.  He ate the entire plate and he's a small guy.  Definitely worth going to if looking for a cozy place in Little Italy to enjoy authentic Italian food.

Great outside seating area. Food wasn't too good.  Bread was uninteresting.  Wife's veal was filled with gristle.  My soup was very salty. Wine was mediocre. Can't understand how people rated this restaurant so highly.
This was honestly just horrible.... Waited an hour for my food .. and the food was just not ok so bad I'm sorry ... would not recommend to anyone!!!!
The food here is amazing, I'm so pleased with this Italian restaurant on my first NYC trip.
No comment

Stopped to eat during the festival.  Food was delicious and wait staff was very nice.  My husband had Linguini with clams, I had linguini with mixed fish.  We both had red sauce and thought the sauce was delicious.
The food was really good for the price. Staff was friendly and fast. I would recommend and eat again.
Food was excellent and service was great. We sat outside on the first day of the 95th Annual Feast of San Gennaro. Great location, fun atmosphere.

Service was a joke. Could've made better pasta at home.  Mandatory tip included which is a joke given the quality of customer service received as well as being uninformed of said tip. Mind you we were a small group of 3.

The best restaurant in a neighborhood full of good places to eat. The dining room is warm, inviting, and clean. The staff is attentive but not intrusive, and the food is delicious. My favorite is the muscles marinara appetizer, followed by a gnocchi with red sauce course, and finally, any fish entrée. Finish it off with an espresso martini.

Great Covid safe restaurant. Sitting away from the outdoor dining area closer to the restaurant under a nice heat lamp. Ordered the pizza, chicken and salad-- very nice and lovely waiter! A must if outdoor dining is called for.
No comment
No comment
If you are visiting New York. You won't go wrong with this restaurant. Be confident you will get good food.
Best ravioli I've had in the city. Great atmosphere, quick, and awesome service. Will for sure be back and I highly recommend visiting Amici!
Had a very good lunch with my wife this past weekend.  From the wine to the meal, everything was wonderful.  The staff was exceptional as well and we will definitely return

Everything about this place was amazing! The food, the atmosphere, the staff. I couldn't have asked for a better meal. We had chicken francaise and spaghetti carbonara. Never had francaise that was so flavorful. Drinks were also excellent and the caprese salad - the mozzarella was so creamy. I will be going back.
Amici Ristorante is very good. All the recommendations are worth to try. Outstanding flavor. Staff is incredibly polite and will help you with everything. Can't wait to go back!
Food out of this world! So fresh, the pesto pasta was outstanding. Wait staff was gracious.

Food Is okay. Service Is terrible. Waitstaff didn't know much about the food or wine. We were seated under a TV which they turned on at blasting volume w out warning or asking us. Made a nice little restaurant into an annoying sports bar. Def don't recommend.  Much better options in the area.
This place has great food for a competitive price. There were short on kitchen staff the day I went, but the manager communicated with us and made good with a free dessert. I'd go back.
No comment

I am a regular costumer since 10 years ago in the neighborhood and always they surprise me with any delicious plate that i try since the best fried calamari, insalata Cesare and my favorite dishes are Spaghetti alla Carbonara, Lasagna or Chicken Francaise, is one of the best Italian Cuisine in New York City also you must try home made Tiramisu, i highly recomend all my friends and i really this place dosnt disappointed at all.

I ordered the complete wrong thing and they were very understanding and got me what I had in mind when I tried to order. Very polite and take pride in making sure their customers are happy. I definitely recommend
No comment

Bad customer service, excellent job bringing clients in, once at the table, they care about rules client satisfaction, is not what you say, it's how you say things to the people who keep you in business.
One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Been here twice now and love it more each time. Service is great and price is great for location and food quality. Love this place!!

column3: University of Texas at Austin, Austin, TX
column6: This restaurant was wonderful!!! Located right in Little Italy. Such kind people and delicious food!!! Would recommend and want to come back!!

Stopped in for lunch, quick and easy. Lunch menu isn't fairly expensive but pretty small portions. Spaghetti and meatballs were delicious, some of the best meatballs I've ever had. Was not busy at all. No free refills, and had an empty water glass for a while. Not a bad Italian place.

We had an incredible experience at Amici, Delicious Wonderful pasta and appetizers. I had the Vongole Posillipo and Linguine Pescatore,  it was truly delicious. The wait staff were lovely and the ambience was great. Highly recommend!!
They had an outdoor indoor space with heated lamps. The food was delicious, they were super sweet and nice. They were very attentive and kind with their service.

Just tried this place for the first time and loved it. The waitstaff was super friendly and the portions were generous for the price. The sangria was delicious too. We'll be back for sure. Definitely recommend trying this place out if you're in Little Italy!
amazing Italian food in little italy! we were taken care of immediately and will be returning soon.

The guy at the door promised good food and did not deliver because it was more than good! I had the lasagna and almost licked the bowl, that is how wonderful it was. Will definitely come back here whenever I am in New York
Five stars well-deseved for super fresh food... exceeded my expectation with costumer service. Literally this place became my favorite casual to go spot. Try it out.... YOU WONT BE DISAPPOINTED
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here on a Wed night at 7:30pm with a friend and waited about 30 min. I personally really liked the Gnocchi and Beef Wrap, but didn't find the Tonton Hot Pot to be very special. If I ever come again, I'd focus more on the small plates/appetizers. It's pretty pricey, but I'd say average for any place here in Midtown. The Gnocchi had a really strong mentaiko and sweet taste. And what I loved about the Yakiniku Wrap was that the wrap (similar to Chinese scallion pancakes) wasn't soggy as all. The Tonton Hot Pot is a good level of spice, but felt the portion was really small for the price. And, there wasn't anything impressive in the hot pot itself. Overall a good experience, but I probably wouldn't come for the hot pot again.
No comment
No comment

Came at prime dinner time and it was decently packed. Ambiance was chill but if you are a party of 5, they will squeeze you in a booth for 4. The hamachi was the best app but I would avoid the monkfish liver at all costs--it was extremely fishy, which it should not be if it were fresh. The Tonton hotpot was ok but it was honestly mostly cabbage or fatty organs. Not a huge fan, won't be returning. Servers were polite with extremely strong water game.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This was a fun place to go for tapas. If you sit at the bar, you can't have the hot pot option but that was okay for me and my friend. We liked the mentai gnocchi and the okonomiyaki. Since the okonomiyaki is a little salty, it's good with the fried rice with pork. The shake ramen was a cold ramen that was okay, and they shake it in front of you. The pink lady roll is good if you're craving sushi. Overall, the price wasn't bad and I would be interested in coming back to try other items.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My date and I stumbled upon Hakata Tonton after a night of drinking and we were so glad we did! We wanted something light and delicious to satisfy our hunger and this place hit the spot. We ordered the Mentai Fried Rice, which was a tasty and savory dish that had the perfect amount of spice from the cod roe. We also got the Goma Hamachi, which was a beautifully presented dish with tender and flavorful sesame yellowtail. The service was friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting. We can't wait to go back and try more dishes when we're hungrier! Highly recommend Hakata Tonton for a satisfying and delicious meal.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food was mid. The price was average for the location but you can go anywhere else for quality Japanese food. This was not worth the hype. The service was great and everyone was attentive. The karaage was cold. I've had better karaage at Raku. The pot stickers was tasteless and super oily. The almond pudding was better at Kimura.

Had dinner here on a Wednesday after work. We didn't have reservations so just opted to sit at the bar, which worked out since we weren't getting hotpot. Service was fast and efficient. We just wanted a quick bite, so opted to try a few of the app plates. We ended up ordering the citrus salmon, pepper chicken, roast beef rolls, and garlic pork belly. Everything arrived fairly quickly, portion sizes were good for sharing with 2 people max. I loved the brightness of the salmon citrus, that was my fave dish, especially with the roe! Second fave was the pork belly, you can't go wrong with either flavor. They have a nice assortment of specialty cocktails, along with beer and liquor, which we did not indulge in tonight but good to know for options. We enjoyed our dinner here and would come back to sample more plates!
No comment

Not only was the motsunabe satisfying, but the other izakaya food were also awesome. I especially loved the uni scallop and the tonsoku (pork foot). Could not decide which dessert to get so we got the platter and got to try everything. What a great time! No wonder there are so many Japanese salarymen there.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here for a casual date night with my boyfriend. We got the citrus salmon, pepper wings, and small Tonton hotpot. The interior looks very fun with neon signs and loud music; it's definitely a good place for some drinks and snacks. The food was delicious and fresh, and I specifically loved the hotpot, as they were quite generous with the pig feet! Service was quick and professional, and overall we had a great time! Highly recommend coming here for an evening out with friends!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food at Hakata Tonton is like tapas/small share plates. Between myself and a friend we ordered 4 small dishes (forgot to take a photo, was so hungry!) and then shared the dessert plate. We ordered the ramen, baos, karage and truffle potatoes. The ramen we could have done without but everything else was delicious. My friend had to eat somewhere near Penn Station. Would recommend if you are in the area
No comment
Although the star of the menu is the hot pot, there are so many yummy small dishes that should not be missing.

I came here for dinner with a friend on a Thursday night. I was a fan of Hakata TonTon when it used to be downtown. I'm glad they opened a location in midtown since it's now near my work. We shared the pepper wings, the small Tonton hot pot (spicy miso broth, chicken thigh, pork feet, pork belly, dumplings, tofu, vegetables), and the green tea tofu dessert. The wings were crispy and the black sesame gave it a good crunch. The small hot pot was a good portion for two people. The broth was flavorful and had a good kick to it. My only gripe was that there were only two small dumplings and I wanted more haha. The green tea tofu dessert was the best dish. The tofu was so silky and definitely tasted homemade. Service was super friendly and attentive. The restroom was amazing, a decked out Toto toilet, floss picks, hair ties, mouthwash, Q tips, etc. I would definitely come back!
No comment
No comment

The wait wasn't too bad but I recommend making a reservation if they have. The portions are pretty small so I recommend ordering a lot. The okonomiyaki had cheese and that was probably the most filling item we got. The mentai gnocchi was good but too bad there was so little :(
No comment
No comment

Came here for my birthday and everything was delicious! The sashimi platter was fresh and the food was also cooked perfectly! The fried rice was delicious and a must to get. The katsu sandwich was okay, there was a hint of wasabi and I was hoping for more crunch, I would pass on this. I would definitely get the wrap over the sandwich as it was more flavorful and had a better texture.The potato was delicious, I really liked the combination with the subtle truffle flavor. Overall, a cute spot in Ktown away from the long waits. The portions are small but it is a tapas place so that just means more things to try! I would come here again as the staff were extremely friendly and attentive!
No comment
No comment

I couldn't find any reservations online and ended up waiting an hour when my friend and I came here at 6PM on a Thursday. We shared their Motsu Hot Pot Small ($35), Garlic Tonsoku ($12), and Wasabi Kanpachi ($16). The portions are a bit small for the price, but I really liked the appetizers. The garlic tonsoku was so soft and delicious. The wasabi kanpachi was quite good and refreshing and I thought that the flavors were pretty unique. There is a good variety of food in the motsu hot pot. While I also did enjoy that, I found it way too oily (especially towards the end of the meal).
No comment
No comment
No comment

Hakata TonTon is my favorite izakaya in nyc til date. I've been here twice and it never disappoints. The food is AMAZING and the servers here are quick and attentive. I've never fell in love with a restaurant so quickly but this was literally chef's kiss. Each dish I have tried exceeded my expectations. I always leave with a satisfied stomach and I even look forward to coming back. I've tried a third of the menu already within the two times I have went. I can't wait to come back again!

Soooo yummy!! Definitely did not disappoint. I went with some co workers expecting to wait a loooong time since there were no reservations open, but to our fortunate surprise-- no wait! We got an assortment of food and I got say I think my favorite was the hot pot-- so warm and filling and flavorful. We are three designers so we were also very impressed by the branding , the menu, and the dish ware!! The perfect spot for some friends to hang Nd catch up.
No comment
No comment

All their dishes had so much potential but just barely missed the mark. We ordered a number of dishes and the wasabi kanpachi and the okonomiyaki were the only ones we absolutely loved. Everything else was missing something. However, the prices were so reasonable that it's hard to beat!  It's very busy here so make sure to get a reservation early to get a good table.
Great they reopened. Thought it was one of the most tragic loss of restaurant closers during covid.  It's back, better, and bigger.
I thought that this place was very experimental and nice. Would recommend for the vibes
No comment

Loved this spot! Nothing on their menu disappointed. Everything had so much flavor and portions were decently sized! Service was great here as well~ They had a really extensive menu and I will definitely be back to try their other items! Highly recommend getting the yakiniku wraps & okonomiyaki !
No comment
No comment

The service here was superb, but unfortunately I wouldn't come back again.  I originally was excited to try this place after seeing the glowing TikTok reviews.  However, the portions are extremely small compared to what you see online in pictures and TikTok videos.  When the sashimi platter came I was shocked by how tiny is it.  For the price, you can easily order Japanese hotpot and sushi at places like Kimura in NYC.

My friends and I were so happy to finally see the return of Hakata Tonton since the pandemic, my absolute favorite NYC restaurant! We were also delighted that the original chef Chef Koji Hagihara has returned. We went opening weekend and he was there smiling and checking in with all the tables. All the staff were very friendly and seemed so happy to be back. The new space is a bit larger and more modern with more seating and a modern spacious ambiance. The menu includes about half old favorites and half new items with some improvements to old favorites as well. Everything was amazing as always! I missed the seaweed salad and salmon or tuna carpaccio but the Goma Hamachi, which was mixed table side, was my new favorite dish. The tonton hotpot was amazing as always, perfectly spiced melding of flavors and the pork and gelatinous cartilage melts in your mouth.
No comment

Hakata TonTon is a delicious new addition to Ktown! They were previously open before COVID and recently opened a couple months ago. We got the Ton Ton Hot Pot large ($61), which came with chicken thigh, pork feet, pork belly, dumplings, tofu, and veggies. I really enjoyed the flavor of the broth! Very savory and warming but not too salty. Docking a star because it was kinda expensive. Our waiter told us the large could feed 3, but the two of us easily finished the large and our rices and could've eaten an appetizer or two. Good addition to Ktown though!
No comment
No comment

We got the TonTon hot pot in large for 5 people and also ordered some other small plates like the karage, shake shake ramen, goma hamachi. It still wasn't enough food for me personally (I think l was just extra hungry that day) but I liked everything on the menu! I especially liked the shake shake ramen which they have in a big mason jar and they literally shake it in front of you to get all the yummy flavors mixed in nicely with the noodles and the sauce. It's a cold noodle with chicken I think. If you're in Ktown and don't want to spend money on overpriced mediocre Korean food, I'd recommend coming here instead.

column3: Central City, Salt Lake City, UT
column6: No comment
No comment

After we spent $550 for party of 5 you guys can try it and let me know. Let's see how's the business going. They never care customers when they think they are so popular. Food so suck. Try intestine hot pot.
No comment
No comment
Soup / stew was the best ... everything else was avg . I prob wouldn't come back . Menus very simple and small . services was great tho ! I think we liked the service more than the food
Good service, easy to make a reservation. I ordered the breaded pork cutlet don. Hakata gives you a free drink with check in
No comment
No comment

Great atmosphere, fast service, and fresh flavors! We got the hot pot, mentai gnocchi, and mapo tofu. The hot pot was so warm and comforting with a little kick of spice, but I wish it had less cabbage (there was a LOT of cabbage) and more pig's feet & dumplings. The mapo tofu had so much flavor and and comes with rice, probably my favorite dish from here! The mentai gnocchi was so unique; the roe adds a perfect savoriness to the pillowy-soft gnocchi. Great portion sizes, would come back here to try more appetizers!
The hotpot is sooo good! Very good service too! I live very nearby and would appreciate if you allow take out or delivery!

Between the two of us, we ordered a drink each and 4 dishes to share. It was just enough food without being too heavy. The ankimo (monkfish liver in a yuzu miso sauce) was my favorite out of the bunch. The sashimi platter and okonomiyaki were nice apps and the recommended shake (x2) ramen was just okay. Would not order the ramen again. I would come again for the hot pot because that looked really good!

Stopped in here by chance and everything was hella good from the drinks, service, food, and dessert !! We got the uni scallops, liver sashimi, goma hamachi, and the chicken karaage. All the sashimi was fresh and top quality, the liver with the pajang sauce was an umami bomb! The best karaage I've had in a long time! So crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside, we killed it! Didn't even get a picture. We got the kocha cheesecake and it did not disappoint, the fresh orange zest and homemade whipped was the best way to finish off the meal. The service was top notch every step of the way and the decor had a nice modern vibe. Will be back again the next time we visit New York!!
No comment
tastes good, the portion for a small hotpot is very large. The cocktail is a bit of a let down, but overall will visit with a friend next time.

We had a reservation for a party of six, but one person couldn't make it so they stuffed our party of 5 into a table for 4. They aggressively refused to give us our original reserved table. To make matters worse, they seated a party of 2 at a table for 4 next to us. It was Sunday night and the restaurant was not crowded. Food isn't bad, but not worth the poor hospitality.

Service was great but I thought the food was ok. Got a sashimi platter and a scallop roll and citrus salmon and the fish was fresh. Mentai gnocchi was good and the Maru Maru potato had good truffle flavor. The garlic pork belly was very salty and the chicken ramen tasted a bit like shin ramen to be honest. Dessert platter was nice and cute.
No comment

We were lucky to get a table here on a busy Friday night! Drinks were a little pricey but worth it. I would come back to this place for the  Maru maru potato alone. It was soooo good! Pink lady sushi roll was extremely fresh and high quality. I took off a star because the shishito peppers in the Kambu Green were undercooked.

The food was great. There were so many delicious menu items that i will definitely want to come back again to try them. Swevice was good. Bathroom was large and spacious and nicely stocked with extras like floss, mouthwash, etc.

Much more refined then prev location. Cute interior/menu. Service was ok, not superb. Presentation was great. Now taste~hmmm. beef intestine pot~underwelming. Chewing fat and rubber is not my idea of a goodtime, accompanied by only cabbage /chives doesnt help either. Maybe waitstaff should give a heads up about the texture.  Bit salty on the miso pork stick. Wanted to take a pic with the stick on and the waitress insisted she have to take it out asap. so that was wierd. So i didnt the pic i wanted~boo. I Felt like its missing a hint of more personal guidance from the waitstaff and we be good, but Price is well worth it for another trip.
A good place to go after work with friends, I like most of the appetizers more than the pig feet hot pot. Recommend you choose a cocktail to have all those small dishes.

The pork feet is great. But the roast beef seems just from the refrigerator. The service is also problematic. I ordered the whelp salad with server A. After I finished all other dishes, server B came and said they don't have whelp salad anymore. So I ordered the gyoza. Before I got the gyoza, server C came and wanted to clean up my table.
No comment

Wow! I really enjoyed my meal here. Originally, I had booked reservations here because I'm an uni lover. I saw some uni dishes and I wanted to try it. I didn't realize that when I came for lunch, the menu was different. But I was pleasantly surprised at the meal. It was unique and different. The dim sum was delicious. The desserts were also really good. I tried the tofu with matcha sauce and the sesame ice cream. I like both but prefer the tofu and matcha dish more. It wasn't overly sweet. I recommend! Be sure to make reservations. I saw a couple walk in and the restaurants was booked up for lunch on a Sunday.
Small menu selection but reasonable prices. Definitely able to walk in and grab a table. Super service, a nice waitress got a basket for my purse so it didn't have to sit on the floor.
Nice place. Good taste. Creative fusion dishes with a good preservation of authenticity.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I loved this restaurant in west village. They finally opened in ktown with more items on menu. Updated interior and menu. I personally liked it more when it was in west village. The food tasted better and interior felt much more Japanese. Now it's like a fusion restaurant/bar.

Hakata TonTon was such a treat! The service was amazing, the bathrooms have bidets/toiletries, and the interior is clean and comfortable. The food was amazing - everything we tried was a hit. I would definitely recommend coming with 2-4 people so you can try as many izakaya small dishes! It's hard to pick a favorite, but I'd 100% get the fried avocado, dessert sampler, karage, and shaken ramen again. 10/10 for this place

The food was so AMAZINGThe staff treated our table very friendly. The wait time was under 0 minutes. The response to menu recommendations were all on point. I would rate this restaurant an 11/10 because it was phenomenal.
Really good small dish in a fresh space. Drinks selection is great too. Would recommend.

It was okay. The service was nice of course but food is a little pricy. Ordered the soup, uni scallop which was great and the truffle potato. Wanted to take out some food but since they don't have containers they don't do take outs.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Dinner was definitely better. The first time I came to Soco was 4 years ago and I didn't leave a good comment lol. I came with a group of 6 the bill was crazy but the food was delicious, the drink was also good. The service was good the waiter was super nice, her tip was huge over $100 and that was automatically taken out. Soco was cool the vibe was good. Everyone enjoyed their food no complaints.

Came here randomly as we were in the neighborhood and so glad we did! The service was impeccable - water always refilled, food on time and hot. Our waitress was amazing, so attentive and friendly! We got the hush puppies which were very good, the burger, salmon burger, wings, mac & cheese and lobster shrimp and grits. Everyone enjoyed their meal, but the mac and cheese was the highlight! The manager came over as well to check on us too. The music / playlist was A+ and all around good vibes. A little dark, but not bad! Would definitely come back! And they have live music as well which we didn't have the chance to experience but would try next time!
Food was not good worst mac and cheese ever, only like the mussels from this restaurant
No comment

You can never go wrong with the food from Soco. A staple of the downtown Brooklyn scene for years now and they don't disappoint. I had no reservations but I was still seated rather quickly. Ambience remains ok, nothing too splashy. Service was great, the waitstaff was very attentive. Food was great and comforting to my belly.

Soco is a cool, chill place to go to brunch. The soco sangria is no joke! Both the chicken and waffles and the wings were-- *chef's kiss* and the service was delightful. If you are someone who is into a "turn up" type of brunch spot, this place isn't for you. However, they do provide the tunes, a mix of classic r&b and such. They are also available for lunch and dinner. Though I have let to try stopping by in the afternoon/evening, I'm sure those menus are just as amazing.
No comment
The food is amazing a little bit pricey but delicious. Cool atmosphere; backyard dining is amazing during the summer time. Good and friendly service and the drink are A1

I love going to SoCo. Every time I return it's like nostalgic, of real home cooked food very comforting but with class and sophistication for the presentation. It's warming and welcoming coming here. Being greet when you came in was like coming to an old relatives house who you haven't seen in years. We were seated by the very hospitable hostess and then greeted by our waitress sooner after. Their menu you short and sweet with a wide variety for every palate. We ordered apps; deviled eggs and smoked wings. I went with the BQE salmon burger which comes with a baked potato for my order and my partner with the chicken and waffles for his entree. Sealed the deal with a m&c for the table. The apps were gone as soon as they hit the table none other than delectable. The deviled eggs have a new touch with a crispy chicken skin on top and overloaded with mixed yolk filling. My BQE Salmon Burger was delicious! The taste of it was warm and buttery you can tell it was made to order and fresh. Soft and just right for the bun. The seasoning was all there if you wanted you could've ate the patty alone! However, it was made for the sandwich. Together on that bun, lettuce, tomatoes and that Zesty sauce it was phenomenal! I would definitely go for this option on the menu! The baked potato was lined with cheese and given sour cream on the side to light it up! This entree now is my favorite on the menu! I'll be back to try so much more!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great ambiance  When I came here I ordered the mac and cheese and jerk chicken wings, the jerk chicken wings was good which is what my friend had, but the mac and cheese was just a bit dry but edible. Would definitely try again to change my experience
No comment
No comment
No comment

Ordered a takeout version of the infamous chicken and waffles, and I have to say they don't disappoint! It was my first time eating here, and I have to say that this was one of the best chicken and waffles I've had. The chicken was not dry, and the chicken was still crunchy despite it being inside the plastic conditioner for a bit. (Pro tip for the restaurant owner: if you poke holes in the container, it tends to keep fried foods crispy for a while). Definitely want to come back to try some other things on the menu!!

It takes a lot out of me to do this as much as I would like to more often....but this place really exceeded my expectations, I was recommended by a friend & did my research on the food (just because I'm picky and I love food) I knew the food was going to be amazing, but boy!!!!!! Everything was on point. Food,Drinks & CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! Everyone was on tooo of everything & you can tell the staff is a really team, which is hard to find these days . Anyway this place was 10/19, def recommended. I had the hibiscus marg, whiskey mango, forts, max & cheeese, steak & mash, chicken & waffles, & jalapeño cornbread. EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING.

This place is not it!!! Please do not believe the hype. They wouldn't let me in with the same head wrap I had on when I ate there 2 days prior. The gumbo left a lot to be desired. Also some friend tried to book a table and at first they took the reservation then called back with different pricing and stipulations. There are way better places in brooklyn to eat...You should try o e of them because this is not it!!!

Oh we loved it. We will definitely come back. Service was awesome. Best and nicest staff. Very cute place full of good energy. The FOOOOOOD is greaaaaaaat. Just what you want to try on the cold night in NY. Yes yes yes 100% recommended.

I think this is more of a brunch than dinner spot. I went for dinner last weekend and wasn't the most impressed. I had the Cajun pasta which was good but woudlve been better if it was a bit spicier. The drinks were good but I think I'll stick to brunch when I come!
I love SoCo. Have been doing for years. I drive up from Philly for it. Staff is nice. Food is delicious . You will have a lil wait but worth it. Small intimate setting but a vibe.
Restaurant that does not have straws, all drinks are the same size and small. Also there a automatic $ 3.98 fee with a debit card.
No comment

No comment
No comment

Absolutely love Soco! My girls and I came here for Sunday brunch and had a great experience. We ordered the Creole Gumbo, Strawberry Shortcake French Toast, Red Velvet Chicken and Waffle, and shared the macaroni and cheese. Our favs were the mac and cheese and creole gumbo. I was told the French toast was too sweet (but what else would one expect?) and the red velvet waffle was just ok. The chicken was bomb though. Overall, this is a staple in Brooklyn (and it's owned by Kenya Moore's ex). Food is fire! Just wished we could have been seated in the dining room instead of being in the entryway...
No comment

I read some of the reviews here and out of all of them; I can say I'm absolutely SHOCKED. One of the waitresses, (I remember her name but for the sake of some reviews I won't post) and I bonded over being Sagittarius. I had this night reserved and it was a literal walk-in and seated immediately. The waitress was attentive to my date and me the entire time. The food was great! Nice portion; however, not too sure the pricing matched it. But I digress. Overall, clean bathrooms, no long wait for reserved seating, a welcoming host, and great food and drinks. I personally recommend it.
No comment

I stumbled upon Soco from Yelp and was pleasantly surprised by the experience.  The staff was very accommodating and welcoming.  My friend had the chicken and red velvet waffles and I had the fried chicken sandwich with the loaded baked potato.  Both were delicious and the vibe of 90's R&B/Hiphop playing in the background is just what we were looking for.  I'd recommend if you were in the area.
No comment
No comment

Where should I start... The restaurant was uncomfortably cold. When asked can the heat be turned up especially since we were seated near the door a woman Im guessing the manager said "there are not that many people leaving now so we should be good". That was a lie. We had to eat our food with our coats and hats on. Service- we waited 30 mins for our drinks and over an hour for our food. Not to mention the place was not packed at all. The waitress not once came to check on us and to ensure us that the food would be coming out shortly. She also walked away twice while I was asking her questions. I was so polite. She had an attitude like she was the one waiting for food for over an hour.
No comment
Fantastic service, and the food was outta this world. The buttermilk chicken and red velvet waffle entree was a massive hit. Worth driving out of your way to come here that's for sure.
Pure joy. Eat and be merry. Be back for more. If u are happy, come here to celebrate .  If u are sad, come here to find a releaf. Their BBQ ribs is to die for.
No comment

No comment

Rainy Sunday in Brooklyn. Absolute religious experience with the Mac and cheese. At our table we had your chicken jambalaya shrimp and grits,  chicken sandwich everything was fantastic. Soul music vibe. Utterly fantastic.

the food was alright, presentation wasn't good at all and the cocktails were not impressive at all for the price. cocktails also were lacking in presentation and all very tiny for $15 (but it's brooklyn so i get that's prob standard size) the chicken and waffles are 21 and u don't even get chicken breast it came w 2 drumsticks. very dark in there which is weird bc they have nice lighting fixtures but don't turn the lights on bc the owner 'likes it dark'. waited an hour for some of our food to come out but the waitresses were short staffed and very sweet! there were 2 running around bussing like 10 tables on their own. it has a lottt of potential and a big following it seems but i wasn't too impressed very over priced for a lacking experience and no ambiance whatsoever.
A great variation of food to choose from. Service pretty quick and music is always great.

The issue that I have is when I received my order there was only half a lobster tail but the menu states a whole lobster tail. The menu wording should be changed, Bcuz customers are going to expect a whole lobster tail as stated on the menu.
No comment
