No comment
No comment

I went to Soco years ago and the food was really good however I went last week and had a terrible experience. The food was unflavored especially the red velvet chicken and waffles. The chicken had no seasoning etc. My friend ordered the lobster shrimp and grits, she complained it lacked seasoning. It came with four pieces of shrimp and cost 40 dollars smh. I had ordered a second drink and the drink never came after reminding the waitress and waiting 1 hour for it...terrible customer service.
No comment
Went for Sunday Brunch. Absolutely loved the jambalaya. Highly recommend the Aunt Cruz's Mac & Cheese. Oh yeah the live music was amazing. Definitely try the jerk wings!
No comment

Great food, great experience, food was amazing. i went for my bday dinner , price was a little out there since i had a prefix menu (65 per person) but my group definitely enjoyed ourselves! will definitely go again !
Overpriced. Food was alright. Service was stellar. Friendly and attentive staff.  It's all about the crowd at this place.

DO NOT COME HERE!!! I would suggest a drive thru before I suggest this place. My salmon cakes were salty, the okra and tomatoes were steamed...  Kind of and not seasoned AT ALL. I tried to season the okra and tomatoes with cajun seasoning my friend requested to attempt to fix her entree and it did not help, so my other friend offered me some of their hot sauce which actually made it palatable. I went to eat the mac n cheese and lawd that was equally as bad!!! I refused to attempt to fix that too. Dry, unseasoned and burnt. I motioned for the manager and he was so nonchalant about me telling him all I just went through fixing my food to be able to stomach it that I asked him for suggestions since he appeared to not understand.  This place used to be great YEARS AGO but I WILL NEVER BE BACK! COULDN'T PAY ME! NOPE!
Food is awesome, try the wings, service was ok, nice vibe inside
No comment

Came here for my son 18th bday.. Got seated right away. It was about 6:30pm and it was extremely dark in there we were looking at out menus with our flashlights on our phones . Thats the only reason i gave it 4 stars. Anyway the music was a vibe every single person we encountered was professorial and nice. We ordered wings for appetizers and Mac and cheese. The bday boy loved the wings (I'm not a wings person) I absolutely LOVED the Mac and cheese probably one of the best I've ever had. My and hubby had a pitcher of Sangria ( no fruit lol ) it was thick not watery but i still didn't get a buzz. That's okay it was a school night lol i ordered the burger OMG!!! But it doesn't come with fries ( i had two small daughters they were disappointed there weren't fries) but the baked potato it came with was okay. I was so full from the Mac and cheese i took a doggy bag for burger ate it the next day for lunch while at work . Let me tell you that chipotle mayo is the . My hubby ordered the pasta he liked it, the bday boy ordered the baby back ribs enjoyed it. My cousin ordered the pecan crust chops she raved about it . Basically all the food was phenomenal we'll definitely come back( without kids) lol  we even embarrassed my son and sang him happy bday .. Two things i feel would've been better more lightings . And I'm not sure if you get any kids going or i just drag mine with me everywhere but if you don't have a kids menu then maybe a side of fries. all kids love French fried. Just saying !! Thanks for a wonderful dinner.
No comment

Soco is such a Brooklyn staple. I have gone for many years and never had a bad meal! This time, I had the fish and grits. It was superb. Very flavorful and creamy. I feel as though the fish could've been meatier, but the price point is good, so no complaints here. Also, for me, if deviled eggs are on the menu in any restaurant I'm getting them and it was no different here. The deviled egg was classic, with a slight fried chicken crisp. No big innovation to the classic, but great tasting. The only thing that prevented me from giving 5 stars was the wait for the food. Many tables were waiting simultaneously.

We sat at the Bar while we could be seated. Staff where very friendly and accommodating. Food was very good. Had the crab cakes.. delicious.. Mac and cheese... yum... and shrimp and grits with lobster!! Very comforting! Waitress knew the menu inside out and very lovely and personable! Great experience!
Great food.  Great service,. Great Atmosphere.  Even for a party of 21+................ Yelp needs to stop with a character minimum.

What we once knew about Soco is not anymore. Today my family and i were looking for some food and good drinks. We were a pretty large party more than 5. Long  story short we asked for recommendations on drinks, she simply couldn't help on that because "her taste buds weren't the same like ours" .The drinks came and they tasted like juice and watered down . Definitely not the same , and the waiter was hovering over us the whole time just waiting for us to put down our fork so she can take it . Ugh . Over it. Won't be going back there.
No comment

The hospitality in this place is FANTASTIC!!!! Everyone that works here ask if you are ok or do you need anything. My water glass was never empty. I enjoyed the strawberry pancakes was kind of disappointed you can't have fried chicken with it. The price was reasonable something I miss when going out to eat. Sorry no pictures I already ate lol

Soco was a great new spot to try for brunch! The food and drinks were great and the service was even better! Chantal was so personable and her recommendations were delicious. The restaurant being black-owned made it even better!
Soco is always a pleasure to go to. The Jambalaya is amazing each time I go. The Mac and cheese is also really good!! I love the vibe of this restaurant. And I need to go back very soon!

Saw rave reviews for this spot and I decided to try out their fried chicken sandwich. It was pretty good - wouldn't say it was the best one I've had but sure was quite delicious. The fries were seasoned well with a cajun spice and tasted great! Would love to try out some other stuff on their menu.
No comment
The food here is Fire . Be sure to make a reservation because the restaurant is usually pretty busy
Great food and drinks!!! Try the pina colada and Mac n cheese, service is a bit slow so make sure you have time to wait and enjoy the place.

Came here in 2020 for my surprise birthday brunch and we enjoyed it thoroughly but came back to a birthday dinner. The quality of food declined, the ambiance was a snoozefest, and the food took long as well an allergy request was forgotten and had to be remade while the remaining party ate their mediocre meals. Truly a disappointment for the birthday girl and her guests.
No comment

Where do I start. 37 minute wait for a Bellini. Server never checked on me I had to ask her about my drink. Finally manager took notice and after 10 minutes I got a drink. After looking royally annoyed I watched server check computer and go to back to get my food. Literally everyone seated after me was eating while I sat there with nothing. The place is lacking customer service and the presentation left nothing to be desired and I mean nothing. Don't waste your time this place isn't worth the effort or price tag. DO NOT COME
No comment
No comment

I came here for a lovely day out! The staff was amazing, the hostess, to our server V. However the salmon that was given to my son was raw on the inside and he was not feeling well at all. I was very concern because he is only 12 years old. They still charged me for both salmon dishes because when ask if I could have two pieces V stated we could not substitute. SO I ORDERED TWO 28 dollars dishes. OK anything for my SON! However the chicken HAD NO seasoning- it seems as if they just threw some flour and fried the chicken truly disappointed indeed. V did take the chicken and waffle of the bill give a plate to go of the salmon, However I would not eat or ALLOW MY son to eat anything from this place EVER!!!!! Damage done. V was very nice and give my son WATER and advise to stay hydrated!! BUT REALLY IF HE GETS WORSE ! THATS a problem! THE CHIEF needs to be SLAPPED and learn to follow DIRECTIONS I DID ASK FOR MY SON SALMON to be WELL DONE! I also WONDER if he/she WOULD SERVE such raw FISH to their OWN CHILD! UGHHH disappointment is an OVERSTATEMENT! WILL NEVER RETURN HERE! Please DO BETTER!
No comment

Service for extremely slow this visit. We waited 30 minutes to receive a lemonade and a Bellini and even longer for our appetizers. Deviled eggs were bland, so I would not recommend. The salmon cakes were okay, and the cornbread was delicious. You get a free order of cornbread if you check in on help! Our server was extremely slow. He didn't check on us at all.
Food and drinks are amazing. Staff is very professional and courteous. Definitely one of my go too's will also recommend.
No comment
They Must have a different chef because the mac and cheese and chicken taste and look horrible

Soco has fallen off. I use to crave and love coming here. My signature chicken and waffle was underwhelming. Chicken that came with the chicken and waffle looked like reject pieces. My friend's half chicken was tough and lacked seasoning. Very disappointed At least the Mac and cheese was still good, with a hint of truffle oil

First time back since COVID happened and the service was horrible. Sheesh, we came in at 9PM and still our server, drinks, appetizers and food took so long to come out. On top of that, they charge a COVID surcharge. Are you serious??? If you're so busy that your service is lacking, do you still need more money from people that's also trying to survive the pandemic as life struggles to get back to normal? Most likely won't come here agaPre-COVID, everything was great. I've never sent a Covid surcharge before at any other restaurant before and I'm good off of that honestly.

Came here for brunch with my family for my birthday. The service was excellent. I don't remember the host's name but he was very nice and seated us quickly (we did not have reservations). Our waiter was Elijah and he was also very nice and attentive. The food was really good. I had the lobster, shrimp and grits and my husband had the chicken and waffles. Nothing left on our plates to take home. The drinks were even better. Can't wait to go back
No comment

The food used to be great. I can tell they are cutting corners. They also raised the price of Mac and cheese as a side from $10, to $12 and now $14. Look at my picture and tell me if you think it's worth $14. Also when it was delivered it was freezing cold. I'm a 10 min walk from the restaurant and the delivery person came in a car straight to me. Make it make sense.
No comment

No comment

I am in shock at some of the bad reviews!! I must say you can't trust all the bad reviews.  This place is great!! From the bar, drinks food and customer service.  The food is delicious, the drinks are on point and the customer service is great!  Me and my friend had the fish and grits- taste like somebody grandmother making the food!!! Absolutely delicious!  Also had the deviled eggs, Mac and cheese and collard greens- absolutely perfect!  The rum punch is DIVINE!  The caramel martini is a vibe!!! Definitely will be back!!! Everything was great!!! Not sure why they have bad reviews but for me...it was excellent!!!!

The place has a nice ambiance and great customer service. The food is really delicious so I definitely have to remember to take pics . They have space in the back that feels like you are outdoors but it's enclosed which is nice
No comment
It been awhile since I've been here. The first time I went was around when the first open. Everything I order was delicious
The food was good the Mac was incredible. Next time will stop by for dinner... oh and the Hibiscus Tea

Love this place. I make sure to go there every time I'm in the NYC area. Idc how far I gotta drive. The Mac and cheese is by far the BEST Mac and cheese that I've ever had in my life. Like no comparison. I tell people about this place like I have ownership in it. The F-que wings are also amazing. I'm sure other stuff is amazing there too but I stick to the script and always get the Mac and wings.

Great restaurant customer service is pretty decent the food is pretty down right delicious the atmosphere is pretty cool common collective

Experience wasn't good. Food was not fresh at all didn't finish my dinner. Cornbread muffins were very hard and dry!! Organic chicken wasn't organic instead Looked like GMO never seen such a huge Leg and Thigh. String beans still had ends on Garlic mash was scarce on my plate. My Birthday weekend dinner was awful. My Caramel Mojitos was in a glass so tiny it was unrecognizable. I mean the GLASS!!! Was TINY!!! So disgusted. Hurts me to write this as this used to be my favorite place.  Please do better!!

I used to love coming here, but the customer  service & organization has really gone downhill. I called 6 times & emailed twice over the course of 4 days to try to make a reservation for a large group. Every time I called, I was told that it would be taken care of & they would get back to me. Ultimately, the day before I needed my reservation, they said they would send me a prix fixe menu to look at and decide on options & that once I got that back to them via email, they would send me a form to fill out for a deposit...the very same people who never responded to my initial emails & never addressed my issue when I called multiple times wanted me to plan on a reservation that hinged on me emailing them back twice before my reservation the next day. I love supporting black owned businesses in BK, but this situation was unnecessarily stressful & disrespectful. We decided to dine elsewhere. I will not be dining here again.
No comment

I have not stopped dreaming about this place ever since I've been. Everything we ordered was amazing but I really have to shout out the lobster shrimp & grits. I usually don't order drinks but the lemonade was . Customer service was 10/10- we were given the wrong order of corn bread and they immediately brought us a new order. The food is really filling and I definitely want to come back to try more!

Absolutely delicious! Black owned business. Second time here because I enjoyed it sooo much the first time. You won't be disappointed! Flavors on point

Horrible customer service! We had a reservation and had to wait a whole 30 minutes to get in, finally got a menu and the Food took us an hour to get it... there was no a/c in there!

Well was here to celebrate my sisters birthday and we spent $100 on drinks and appetizers while waiting for our table. It all when downhill when a party member was told she could not have dark meat with her chicken and waffles. Then she was told it was the chef choice of what piece she could have. Then she was told it would cost $4 to have dark meat.  The mgr was not accommodating at all and said it would be the chef choice. So basically she was told she had to eat what they wanted her to eat. Poor customer service. We left without eating, not happy campers!!!.

I came here to celebrate my birthday and was seated immediately. Our waiter was extremely friendly and professional and made sure we was taken care of coming back to our table from time to time to make sure we was okay. We ordered drinks which you can pay $2 to upgrade to top shelf alcohol and came fast, our food shortly after.I had ordered the herb marinated steak which was amazing and my girlfriend ordered cajun creole pasta, which she loved. We shared a aide of Mac n cheese which was AMAZING! You have to have it if you come here. Overall The food was amazing and the best part of the experience was the impeccable service the staff provided from the door and remained consistent til the end of the our visit at Soco.

I went in the afternoon, the atmosphere was chilled and the staff was very attentive.
No comment

Soco, Soco, Soco...After tonight I doubt I will return, use to be one of my favs in Brooklyn. Everything was going good until my friend saw a roach crawling on the wall next to her, we called a waitress over, she grabbed a napkin and came over and killed it. We were starving & drove all the way from Queens and decided to stay , no manager came over to apologize or to accommodate the situation. Please get an exterminator asap. Then our waitress disappeared on us for 20 mins , I waved my napkin in the air to cause attention , a bus boy saw me and came over and helped us with doggie bags and our check. I gave yall 3 stars because the creole pasta was good. Customer service is 0. God bless your business though.

This was one of the best meals I ever had! Came here for brunch with some friends. Loved sitting  in the back with the glass roof. The food was phenomenal I had the chicken sandwich and the strawberry short cake and Oreo cheesecake deserts. Everything was perfectly seasoned the sandwich was a perfect combination of salty and spicy,  the chicken was perfectly crispy. My friends had the chicken and  waffles and it was delicious as well. The deserts were also perfectly balanced not overly sweet. We also had the chicken wing as appetizer and the were some of the best wings I ever had. Been here before and will be back for dinner.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I have been coming to SoCo for years. I am now pescatarian and had stopped dining there because I felt like the menu contained more meat options. I was pleased to revisit and see they had updated their menu. The weather was nice so we asked to be seated outside, unfortunately because their plants are real, there were ants. Brunch used to be bottomless but now they offer just pitchers that was a tad bit disappointing. My friend and I started with the cornbread which was scrumptious! For our meals my friend ordered the steak and eggs, I ordered fish and chips, and we had the Mac and cheese to share. The food was good no complaints. Service was fine too. Overall experience was pleasant however the restaurant will need to do something about the ants for the outdoor seating.

We sat down at 3:30pm. The waitress didn't take our order until 35 minutes later. And it was not crowded on this day we seen her standing around. So once she finally came I ordered the fried chicken and waffle dish. By the way this event took place on 4/17/21 around 4:00pm. Our main food came out about 40 minutes later. The appetizers took about 30 minutes. On the first order I took a tiny piece of the chicken and it tasted weird. Something told me to break into the chicken before actually taking a real bite. I'm noticing the chicken is pink very pink. I start tearing the chicken closer to the bone and it was wet with pink blood. So I called the manager over he said oh you want your chicken well done ? I said excuse me I want it cooked, this is not steak where you request medium well, the chicken needs to be fully cooked before serving. I could be eating salmonella. And I let him know I'm actually pregnant. This is ridiculous. So he said okay we'll get you another order well done. This is the 2nd order you see in the picture to me still looking pretty pink I didn't eat it. I didn't want to take the chance. The waffle tasted like water flour and red die. It had absolutely no flavor.  The waitress never came to check on us. The manager never came to check on us after the 2nd order to see if the chicken came out better. The only thing on the table that was decent was the macaroni and that was decent I was starving I still had to end up getting something else to eat before I went home. The bill came to 118$. My friend ordered salmon cake appetizer and a shrimp lobster dish, she said her salmon was okay  she didn't enjoy her main dish. My friend paid 60$ cash I paid the difference. Omg while I'm typing this review I'm checking my statement and they charged me the full amount for the food $117.29 I'm definitely about to call my bank right now. They were suppose to charge me $71.
No comment
No comment

Soco was amazing! Came on a Saturday for brunch. We walked right in and sat at the bar. The space is a bit small inside but not uncommon for Brooklyn. They also have patio space in the back. I started with the Mardi Gras drink, which their version of a rum punch. It was very good and I definitely felt the rum! My friend ordered the smoked chicken wings and said they were unexpectedly delicious with the tzatziki sauce. I got the fried chicken and red velvet waffle. I'm pretty sure the chicken sits in a brine overnight bc it was some of the best I'd ever had! The waffle was good as well. Barely needed any syrup. The lobster shrimp and grits looked phenomenal as well. I'd definitely return here for their dinner menu.

While visiting my hometown of Brooklyn family and I decided to check out Soco. It was totally awesome! The food was GREAT! THE Atmosphere was nice and the staff was friendly and welcoming! Maurice, the host and Jessie our server was the best! I will definitely be returning to Soco, my new favorite spot!!

The wait time to be seated was very long and once seated the food took forever(legitimately 90 minutes) . Server was cool until she said the n word, three times. The vibe and music was immaculate though. Very talented violin player. Food was good but not worth the long wait.
No comment

As a native Brooklynite it pains me to leave a bad review for this spot. The food is satisfactory and drinks are adequate. For the life of me I do not understand why the music is so loud. You're attempting to dine and connect with a person or party but find yourself yelling. My party asked multiple times to lower the volume of the music but were dismissed. Won't be going back there because the food isn't good enough to endure the uncomfortable environment.

My experience was a zero.  I see why he trying to have Kenya pay alimony.  The food was blah.  The menu is small and rigid.  They can mot make alterations to suit your preference really.  After a long wait food that was sent back repeatedly  for corrections.  Do not go

I came in excited and left disappointed. My experience at Soco could have been better. Before I talk about the food the vibe was not it, very dark inside and boring. However, they played decent music. The food was not the best, I had high expectations for the macaroni and cheese. It was dry and bland, not a fan. The red velvet waffles tasted like a regular waffle, they obviously just used food coloring. Also the food was slightly expensive, spent close to 50 dollars on two things. This was my first and last time coming. #sorrynotsorry‍

I asked for scrambled eggs on my eggs Benedict, but the owner told me that he wasn't able to accommodate my request. He was very rude, only in turn to bring me scrambled eggs as a side dish. If he could put them on the side, then why couldn't they be part of the normal Benedict that I'm paying for?

I loved it here. If it wasn't so far from me, I would go all the time. Cornbread is complimentary if you check in on Yelp. Jambalaya is made with chicken sausage. YAY THAT MEANS I CAN FINALLY TRY JAMBALAYA. It was spectacular. It comes in a small skillet with plentiful food with big fat shrinps on top. Oh my. I was blown away. Mac and cheese was creamy and delicious. Everything was great. During the weekend, it's loud with people getting drunk and roudy. I will be back again.

I really wanted to love this place for several reasons. One the atmosphere was on point, very chill set up not extremely bright or dark just right. Second all the servers and greeters were kind and made the experience for my date and I. Lastly the drinks once watered down were full of flavor as well as the gumbo. At this point I had high expectations for the food but the catfish just didn't do it for me. It had zero flavor with and without hot sauce it couldn't be saved. My dates jambalaya was amazing overly seasoned but what did he expect lol. The Mac was on the sweeter side but I enjoyed it a lot. Overall I loved the place just would try a different meal, perhaps the chicken and waffles.

Wow what an experience. I hadn't been to soco in a while. Its under new management Wendell and massiah to name a few. I so enjoyed the atmosphere and the great energy.  My servers secara to name a few was awesome she constantly made sure that I was okay and had everything I needed. Everyone was attentive. If I could give them more stars I would. Management is on point .

The food here is beyond delicious.  Our waitress is superb.  The recommendations we're spot on.  We came for a celebration and that's what we got.  Great music too‼

First, the atmosphere was nice, good music. Socially distanced. Drinks were ok. But the real downfall for me was the food. I had the chicken and red velvet waffle. So disappointing. The waffle was so thick, it was like eating cake batter on this inside. And then chicken CAME OUT COLD! Yes. Cold. It was warm to the touch on the outside but bit into it and was met with a mouthful of cold wet oils. So many people leave these raving reviews and that was just not my experience. And to think i forced my bf out the house for this!  just don't rn y'all.
Nice ambiance. Sometimes the wait is off-putting but overall the foods good and the people are nice.

Came in with a group of 7 and was turned around by management due to "clothing policy". A policy that was not posted anywhere in sight, and when asked to show it, the manager just said he was the one enforcing a non existent clothing policy. Turned away due to wearing a jersey, meanwhile others inside were wearing athleisure-wear. Terrible communication by management and for a place that calls itself casual, it most certainly did not live up to it.

Cool atmosphere with nice music and great service. Food was on point and the drinks were ok. We had Chicken & Waffles, Pecan Crusted Pork Chops, Fish and Grits. Everything was delicious. We will be back.

We did a group take out from this place and they did delivery the food extremely quickly. Their menu is pretty extensive and everything definitely sounded good to me. The only downside to ordering from online was that there was not any drinks option at least on Seamless. I ordered the Soul Fried Chicken Sandwich which came with a side of fries. The chicken was super crispy and tasty. It was amazingly flavored and it was pretty decently size as well. The fries were also amazingly seasoned as well which I was pleasantly surprised with. The only downside was that we placed a fairly large order (maybe 9 different items) and it only came with two ketchups even though 6 of the orders were the Fried Chicken Sandwich with fries. They also did not provide any utensils or napkins even though there were some orders that definitely required an utensil but other than that this place was super tasty and I can definitely see myself coming back in the future!

This place was amazing! Nice atmosphere ... the host was very friendly and our waiter was great! The food was delicious! I came here today for my birthday and I'm happy we did ... everything was tasty from appetizers to side dishes and drinks. The pecan crusted pork chops, fried chicken and SoCo baby back ribs, Mac n Cheese was so yummy! Def. Coming back!
Where do I begin?! The vibes. The bottomless mimosas. The chicken and red velvet waffles. The Mac and cheese. One of my favorite brunch spots.

Came here for brunch this past weekend and sat in their outside area which is heated. Everybody wins! Got rum punch by the pitcher. Ordered mac and cheese with the fried Catfish and cajun fries. Mac and cheese came in a skillet with a cheesy crust but still creamy once you dug in. Delish! Catfish was a bit on the salty side so I had to use the lemon wedge that came with it to so that helped. Other than that I'd definitely swing by here again. Waitstaff is friendly and they let us sit and talk for hours without telling us to buzz off so A+ for that.

Great service. Delicious food. The jambalaya soup was perfect for a light meal. It happened to be happy hour and who could pass up on margarita?! I could taste the alcohol. Highly recommended!

EVERYTHING on the menu is spot on! I took my daughter there for her pre-birthday dinner. Of course I had the red velvet waffle and fried chicken! She had the lobster, shrimp, and grits and the Mac-n-cheese. We had an AMAZING time! The food???? Tasted like angels were dancing on our tongues!

I came here for my mother in law birthday. The food was ok. I haven't been here since they first opened. The wait in this place is ridiculous even with reservations. Sad! The Mac and cheese definitely taste the same. I was very disappointed in the fried oysters. for $15 or was it $17 it was the smallest pieces I've ever had. I had the fried chicken sandwich it was really good. Over all it was a ok experience.
Totally Disgusting!! Garlic Mash Potatoes. The fact that someone really packed this to feed to someone. This look like cottage cheese not mashed potatoes.

The food was actually good shout out to the chef. if i had to just rate the chef my review would had been a 4.

The food and service were both mediocre. Although we were seated immediately when the doors opened it took almost an hour to get our meals. Disappointed when I saw that the sweet potato pancakes were removed from the menu and replaced by red velvet pancakes that looked and tasted more like chocolate pancakes. The catfish in the fish and grits meal needed to be cooked more. The one thing that they are consistent with is the Mac n cheese. That was good!Although it's Covid the tables didn't seem to be 6 feet apart. They seen to be short staffed. This was conformed when the bartender came to give us a to go container. I can't say that I'll be back anytime soon.

Red velvet waffles, perfect fried chicken and cocktails that help one smooth out your edges. Wait staff personable and offers good suggestions. Great brunch so get there early and ease into the weekend.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: My friends and I were so excited to eat at this location. And the "host" was VERY RUDE. We walked up to him and someone in my party asked how long is the wait for 3, he did not greet us and in a very rude manner he said " do you go into someone house and not say hello?"  We we're all very confused and thought he was joking. She then she says to him well since your the host  I would assume you would greet us , he then replies that he's the General Manager. Which makes the situation worst, since he's the manager. After a while we noticed that he was not joking. He continued to be rude as hell and very dismissive even when a common ground was trying to be met. It's a shame because I've never been to this place and heard great things about the food but I will never spend my money at an establishment that treats customers as poorly as he did.

A friend recommended this place for brunch and this place is definitely a must try. The food was delicious especially the fish and grits, the strawberry shortcake French toast, and the lobster , shrimp & grits. Loved that they had carafes of mimosas and bellinis. Only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because of service was a lil slow. Had to ask several people and several times for spoons for our dessert S as. And don't get the strawberry short cake dessert, very bland. Wish they had vegan options

This was my second time coming to Soco. I brought my mother to brunch here because I remember the food being very good. I made a reservation for 1:30 on a Saturday and we were able to sit shortly after we arrived with no issues. The waitress was a bit inattentive even though it wasn't super busy but I'll chalk it up to her having an "off" day. I wanted to order their chicken and red velvet waffles but after the waitress told me about the $4 up-charge to choose dark meat, I settled on the Eggs Benedict. My mother (we came ordered the sausage and grits. We ordered a Mac and cheese to share. The best part of the meal was definitely the Mac and cheese. It was piping hot when it arrived and it was super cheesy. The portion was large enough for two, but I ate some there and had the rest for dinner.
No comment

The food was good love the creativity with the cornbread (jalapeño and cheddar). The wait staff was nice. The hostess Kevin was great. The reason why it got 4 star is cause I waited to long to get my food the appetizer came out with the food.  And also the bathroom was not baby friendly there was no changing table for him. So if you want to bring your infant it's not baby friendly. I recommend baby stay home if possible.

I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. Their were several things that happened while at this restaurant that disappointed me. Number 1 me and my family of 20 went to celebrate Haitian Mothers day on Sunday. When I got there the staff was given us attitude because we did have are mask on, The manager was also nasty about the situation, but as per CDC and the news if you are fully vaccinated you are no longer required to were a mask indoor or outdoor. When we sat down the water was filthy. The waiter had to bring us another one. we waited a good amount of time for are food. Another thing that upset us was the Covid charge, which we could not understand why we was being charged that. We was a big group who spent a lot of money at that restaurant and it was a big disappointment and we will never go back to it.
Food is great! The Mac and cheese is one of the best in town! The red velvet waffles are delicious and delightful! I would avoid brunch hours gets busy!
No comment
No comment

SoCo accommodated my group of 12 with delight. I recommend reservations for a large party with an option for the pri fixe menu at $50 pp. The staff was attentive and there were no complaints on flavor or portion size. Still an awesome fixture in Brooklyn. The music gave me life, a blend of Afro carribean vibe but was slightly too loud at times. There is a diverse crowd in the diversity but the restaurant is true to southern - Caribbean style.
No comment

Came here to celebrate my godmothers birthday. Reservation was made in advance which I would highly recommend on a Saturday night. Hostess at the door is cayuteeee, friendly, eye catching! We were seated right away in the area in the outer part of the restaurant. There was a large party also celebrating there and they were soooooooooooooooooooooooo loud. Aside from that, love the section we were in because it's like the cut. Crystal was our server. Order was taken within reasonable time. Drinks...simple....how do you mess it up. Virgin pina colada came out looking like pineapple juice. 3 men came over to check it out and then brought out what looks like a pina colada....on the rocks...that's different....no cherry, no pineapple. Lol...my mom requested a cherry at least and the manager brought out like 5. That was comical. What turned her completely off was when she said "what happened that y'all don't know how to make a pina colada?" He basically said you should come work for me....whew Chile was she offended lmao. I had a sweet tea, no issues. We ordered Cajun pasta, fried catfish, and marinated steak...all of our plates were cleaned. Food was good! Strawberry shortcake was a no for me, my aunt seemed to enjoy it. It's a busy night in Brooklyn, my expectations for amazing service wasn't high to begin with. My mom was annoyed, I was chill, my aunt enjoyed it all! It's was a decent night. I've been here a few times before with other people. Chill spot...worth checking out.
No comment
No comment

Went to this place late on Saturday night. The music was good and decor gave a nice vibe. The place gave me a "cheers" vibe. Look like a lot local people come to this place often. It wasn't busy maybe because it was almost for them to close. But on to the dishes... for appetizer we had the wings. they were delicious  and had a nice kick to them. We also had drinks the Manhattan and soco sangria(white) . The drinks were average wouldn't recommend. The main course I had the lobster, shrimp, and grits delicious. I would recommend. My friend had the pork chop with the mash sweet potatoes and collard greens. The pork chop was good but the pork chop needed seasoning. I think they only season the flour when making it. The sweet potatoes mash and collards was delicious. For dessert we had the pumpkin cheesecake. Babe! This was delicious better than Cheesecake Factory!  Overall I would come back and try other things on the menu.

I've been coming to Soco Restaurant for many years. All supported them even during the pandemic despite their slow service. This was a black owned establishment I thought my family and I would have always supported UNTIL the other evening my family from here as well as from out of town came  here to eat.  We were told we could not dine in because my aunt had on an African religious wrap on her head. The hostess kept saying it was a "hat" in which it wasn't. It was clear as day it was a religious wrap and her dressed matched the wrap. The ignorance was high and totally intolerable. We took our business elsewhere and stated we will never return to establishment that couldn't respect peoples religious values.
No comment

Bro the macaroni is crazy. Wtf is going on???? We just stumbled upon this place walking around on a Sunday afternoon. This is one of the coolest places I've been in Brooklyn. The music is not quiet but I LOVE IT. Look around the restaurant it's nothing but beautiful people with beautiful plates on their tables. Wow.

Food was really good ! Had the chicken and waffles, sausage and grits and cornbread ! The corn bread was little dry and cold however my friend ordered the jalapeño one and had a better outcome. The music was good , they played current hip hop and appreciated  seeing all the beautiful Black people working there and eating there.
I've been here 4 times and the food has always been spot on. The F-que wings, Aunt Cruz's Mac, and cornbread are my favorites. My servers were pleasant and attentive at all times.
No comment
No comment
Soco never disappoints! Everything was delicious, even picky kids enjoyed it. From staff to covid modifications, all top notch.
The only thing I recommend odd to make those drinks a little stronger. They were weak! Food was excellent though!!

Previous to the pandemic, I've dined at Soco on many occasions. However, last nights food wasn't as good. My party and I wanted lite bites to eat which were the mussels, teriyaki wings, Buffalo wings , Mac and cheese. The Mac and cheese is always good. The wings however were not. The wings were rubbery and the blue cheese was very watery. Not thick and chunky. The mussels were good but the bread that came out with it was cold. Service is good as always however, we felt a little rushed.

The food here is delicious. They are known for their red velvet chicken and waffles. If you like sorrel, I recommend trying the Hibiscus sweet tea. I was also delighted to find out they offer a chicken andouille sausage on their menu for people who do not indulge in eating pork. I ordered the "(chicken)Sausage & Grits" during their All Day Brunch Sundays.  This comes with an over-easy egg placed on top of your grits. The meal was overall very filling.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I thoroughly enjoyed my brunch at Soco today! Our waitress recommended a delicious brunch cocktail with cognac to start. We also had the cornbread appetizer from the yelp deal, which was delicious. I had the sweet potato pancakes with sides of bacon and white cheddar grits. The pancakes were phenomenal! They were beautiful and sooooo flavorful. The cheese grits and bacon were also  delicious and the portions were very generous. My friend had the steak and eggs and he also tried the mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was sooo good! Baked golden brown on top and so flavorful. I can't wait to go back!

The manager accommodated my girlfriend and I to the greatest degree he knew how. He turned an experience from one that might have been very disappointing to a very enjoyable one. He recognizes and involves himself with multiple aspects of the restaurant and because of that is able to provide top notch service.
No comment
No comment

I can't believe I waited all this time to go here!! Food was great. We had the smoked wings and mussels for apps and they were both pretty amazing. I had the chicken and waffles which was good but next time I'm going with the shrimp and grits. My husband had the jambalaya and the flavors in this dish were so intense and delicious!! We didn't get to taste the Mac and cheese because they were having kitchen issues but we took it home and had it for lunch the next day. We were not disappointed. We will be back soon for sure!!

Me and my girlfriends came here for Sunday brunch. The wait wasn't too long and the vibe of the restaurant was nice. There was a dj playing all the popular hits and the place had a good turnout of people. We got the Mardi gras special pitcher, which is basically a really delicious rum punch. I tried the blackened salmon, my food was seasoned well and had lots of color. I would definitely return to this place for brunch or dinner.

Oh man where do I start!! This is one of my fav places in Brooklyn to eat some good Cajun/creole food. The jerk mash up, the jambalaya...the creole pasta, garlic green beans and garlic mash with the mac and cheese had us all on cloud 9! The drinks were really good too but the atmosphere and vibe  was what really made me want to go back. Thanks for the hospitality and happy tummy!

I came here last night for the first time and I was not too impressed with my experience. I'm giving Soco 2 stars because the food was delicious, however the service was not so good. First I made a 8:30pm reservation for a party of 5. Upon arrival we were seated at a crammed table that was clearly for 4 not 5 people. We were elbow to elbow and the table set up was 2 of their small tables put together. When we looked to the right side there was a table available for a party of 6. We complained to our waiter and the general manager came over to speak to us. I forgot what his name was but he was very rude and unapologetic about the situation. He stated that he didn't have other options available and that we could wait upfront for 45 mins. I told him that didn't make sense since we had a reservation which we were on time for. He responded with he has a lot of reservations. The table of 6 was then separated into a table for 4 and a table for 2. I could not believe how ridiculous they were about the seating arrangement. We couldn't even comfortably eat because we were crammed. Also parties of 5 and above they automatically add the gratuity into the bill so read your bill carefully. I might try them again for brunch but I was not impressed with their service whatsoever.
No comment

I loved Soco, the food is amazing but here's the thing, rules and regulations now apply. Only vaxx groups can dine in, while unvaxxed groups must order takeouts. Clearly, I had no choice but to order take out and I was very disappointed. Firstly, the food portion was way smaller compared to the amount of food you will get in the restaurant. Secondly, the food didn't have that excellent quality I would normally receive when dining in. The star of the restaurant for me is the Mac Cruz & Cheese not sure about everyone one else but I love my mac nice and brown on top oozing cheese. Negative, literally did not get that when I went back home at all which was 35 mins back. The mac &cheese was in a small plastic container which I felt should have been in an aluminum pan instead, that will be suitable to go into the oven and lay flat. The Mac&cheese that was in a bowl, looks like it was picked up by an ice cream scoop straight from the refrigerator and place into the microwave. Then the cheese wasn't melting, even after putting it into the air fryer for a few minutes to warm up. I ordered cornbread as well, it was already hard when I got home, and warming it up was pointless still hard, I would like to curse, but I'm too cute for that. Don't get me wrong the shrimps, lobster, and grits and mash potatoes were good warming it back up but the cornbread and mac and cruzzy were not good at all to even do takeouts. The moral of the story is it's best to just dine in overall with the food, you will get it freshly hot and serve or eat as soon as possible outside or better yet in your car.

This restaurant has been on my list of NY eateries for quite sometime and I was able to check it off today! I am very pleased! It was a very modern and young atmosphere. Very nice on the inside and patio seating. Nice bar area. Staff was nice and accommodating. Went during Saturday brunch. While there were quite a few people there, there wasn't more than a 5 min wait for seating. The food was AMAZING!!! I had the buttermilk fried chicken with a red velvet waffle and the Mac and Cheese!!! Good portions and great flavors! Very cute for a girls day/night out or a date with your sweetie. Will definitely be back again!!

Soco is a nice restaurant, I've been here 3 times. I enjoyed my food the 1st 2 times (which is why I gave 3 stars). But today I did not enjoy it at all. The mimosa was good... however they initially served me burnt turkey bacon (not crispy.. but burnt.. damn near black) .. it was visually displeasing, so I'm not sure why they'd even send it out in the first place.. the scrambled eggs were tasteless.. & the grits were too thick... My boyfriend had the French toast, he enjoyed it, but was also displeased with the eggs.

First time going to this place. We were seated outdoors, it's a bit small and since the tables were a bit cramped together, customers were way too loud and I could not even hear myself speak. Also, too many ants crawling on the tables, on the walls and on me. Besides that I did have a good time and the food was amazing!

I absolutely loved this place so much!!! The vibe in the restaurant was upbeat and the music was great. It wasn't to loud or quiet. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. We went for brunch on a Saturday l, we got white sangria, Mac and cheese, wings and red velvet waffle with chicken. Everything was delicious and the wings were my favorite part. The prices were extremely fair and can't wait to take my friends back there.
I went out for dinner to celebrate my sister's birthday and everything was perfect. Great service and a very welcoming space. Delicious food. I will be back!

One of my faveorite places to visit. But this visit was disappointing. I've had everything from the amazing Mac and cheese to the tasty lobster, shrimp and grits. Today I tried the steak and I ordered it well done and it definitely was not. My dinner party was done eating before my food returned to me so I wasn't happy with that. Once my food came back I was relieved because by now I'm starving. I cut into the meat and it was still not well done (red and not cooked). Apparently there was stil a vein inside. Overall my dad and girlfriend loved the pork chops. So this is why the 3 stars.

Soco is so bomb! I've been here a few times. It makes for great group dinners, as well as awesome date night. The shrimp and grits are my favorite. The sauce is so flavorful and the lobster is so juicy. The salmon is also really good too. It comes out perfectly done and is well seasoned. Don't leave without trying their cornbread! They will not disappoint!

From the neighbor and decided to give Soco another chance. Came to Soco for happy hour. I'm use to be greeted immediately by a server ; instead the waiter took her sweet time and discussed her hrs of employment. Like ask your co worker at a later time ; what time your shift starts. I ordered the white sangria which was basically a shot of sangria. My cup was filled with ice. The waitress didn't even bother to ask , did we want to order food. I asked another waiter could we ordered and was informed she 's off. The waitress who was now on duty heard me request to order , and still didn't ask can she help. Was going to order food , but due to poor customer service I left.

I've been to Soco twice. Once for my cousin's bridal party and second with my boyfriend. So I've seen the hype nightlife atmosphere and the calm lunch atmosphere. I will say that the chicken and waffles and the Mac and cheese are both delicious menu options that I'd continue ordering every time I come to Soco. The night vibes are really cool but it's also a great place to have nice lunch with with someone. The service is always really good and no complaints about the food.

Came after wild & out show with my friend. We went on Valentine's days and we at at the bar. Service was well cant complain. The food was delicious and fresh. I really enjoyed my corn bread. To die for. Would deff come back.

Second visit to Soco did not disappoint. We had a 12pm reservations,  we walked in at 12:05 and the place was already full. We got seated right away and from there on the service was above par. If you like southern cuisine and you're in the Brooklyn area, make reservations and enjoy some food or it's on me (well not really) lol

I've visited here a few times. NEVER had a problem with them. Food was always good and so was the drinks. However today... NOT THE BUSINESS! For the most part, the majority loves ribs.. right?! So this time I chose to order outside the norm that I usually get. I ask the our server (who was very kind) about the ribs. She stated they are delicious. However I seen on there it mentioned "spicy".. so I asked her about how spicy are they. She simply said they are spicy. Which is fine.. to a degree. But because I love ribs, I chose to order them. WRONG ANSWER. They were entirely too spicy to consume. The bridge of my nose was sweating my nose was running just after a bite of one. So I asked them is there another bbq sauce they can add to tone down how spicy there are.. they offered me a glass of milk. Lol! Like come on. The food was barley edible. I couldn't really send them back because I ate the mashed potatoes and the coleslaw.. which was the only thing I enjoyed. Even my drink which was the red lemonade was filled with cherries of some sort but literally no vodka. I was then told this is how they are made based on what the "owner" wants.. it's his "vision" Okay?! But it my money they paying for it right? Like I didn't understand. I even heard a woman adjacent to my table have a similar concern. I felt absolutely taken advantage of and I'm absolutely disappointed. I love going out to eat and supporting restaurants in my neighborhood.. however they were so dismissive about it, I will never return. So basically I paid $28 for mashed potatoes and cold slaw and $14 for red lemonade with a lick of vodka. How disrespectful. Wow. You'll never get my business again after that. I had such a long day at work and was looking forward to eating here and they played me. You will never get my business again.
Very neat and clean. Our waitress Kelli was a superstar. She serviced the party we had and was really helpful.
Never will i  order take out from soco again 42$ for this im disgusted like really come on now.

Hi guys another Sunday brunch spot!!! Good ol soco I haven't been here in years so when me and my friend wanted chicken and waffles and it was way past brunch hours we ended up here, the best thing about this restaurant is that on Sunday they serve brunch all day for all the brunch lovers. Upon  arriving we was greeted by the host who ask us to scan the bar code to fill out a questionnaire for covid purposes, the place was pretty full and have very dim lighting, music was on the loud side of things so we literally had to yell to talk. The restaurant was pretty busy and they seem to be under staff because it took a while for us to get serve and a few items was not a available drinks and food wise (no champagne so no mimosas, no lemonade, no red velvet pancakes) so we had to tweak our orders a little. The food was good the French toast, the wings, fried chicken delicious my waffles on the other hand was very tin and not fluffy like what I saw other people have on there plate, finally thoughts if you a all day brunch spot in Brooklyn on a Sunday check it out.

I've been to this place three times and each and every time, I got sick. I would never waste my money. PLUS the owner is a jerk!

On the entrance my husband and I were welcome with a very friendly gentleman. He advised us to sit by the bar to wait for the rest of our party. We were served a fresh made cornbread with an exquisite smell.  The cornbread had a perfect gritty texture on the outside and softer on the inside. However, I wish the sugar was toned down a little bit. Our waiter, Malcom I believe, have an upbeat attitude with great aptitude on describing the menu and helping us decide. We ordered a Jambalaya. They were able to create a deep flavor in the jambalaya (sautéed Pepper and Garlic). AS the true authentic southern jambalaya, you can see in the picture the sausage, rice and shrimp simmered with tomato sauce. This dish was spot on. I would recommend this place.

They have a great menu. Many dishes suited for people who love meat and vegetarians. Also many seafood options. The drinks were well made and chilled without too much ice added. Everything came to the table hot and delicious. Great spot for a birthday gathering.

I'm up in the air with rating this place. I started off with 5*'s and had to remove a star from every encounter that made it go from great to good. So, when I arrived I met my friends at the bar. They already had a drink and the hostess told us our table was ready and we headed to our seats. At first, they placed us outside in the corner. I asked the hostess if we could sit inside with the music so we can feel the atmosphere where the music was playing. After 10 minutes we were seated inside. That worked out well. Our waiter approached us and seemed to be so frazzled. I would have thought he had 20 tables.  He took our drink and food orders and I showed him my free cornbread when I do a Yelp check-in. 10...20 minutes in 1 out of 3 people receive a drink. The other drinks are still being being made. I asked about the cornbread and he said its coming. 20 more minutes, my drink arrives and it's wrong. In fact I have no idea of the contents. 20 more minutes, the food and the rest of the drinks arrive. We ordered 2 shrimp and lobster with grits and 1 sausage with grits and a side of scrambled eggs. I again ask about the cornbread and I'm told its coming. Ok. How's the food? Honestly, I enjoyed it. 5 minutes later the cornbread arrives with butter. I would have thought that it was coming fresh from the oven considering the wait time but it was cold. They always say to watch what you ask for. So I'm 3/4 the way finish with my meal when my friend shows me a curly strand of hair in the butter. I wanted to barf up everything . My friend calls the manager, standing behind us, over to show him and to request another butter. As we sat and waited the manager decided to advise our server to address the issue with us. Such a bad move by a manager. The server proceed to show us a cup with sprouts in it and tells us we saw sprouts and not a hair. Good thing I took a picture. I was born with hair, I'm sure I know what it looks like. We explain to the server that it was hair and request the manager to return to the table. We than explain to him that was poor judgement on his part especially when all my friend asked for was more butter not a discount or a free meal/drink. All he said was ok, ok, ok. They must be hiring managers off of street corners because that was the worst response I've heard from a manager. My friend then ask him if he could bring her a new cornbread since he removed her plate with the cornbread. He obliged. All said and done the food was good except for the mishap and i would give it 4 stars. The service was horrible and the managers response with the service added insult to injury. Thus, the 2* rating. I really wanted to love this place. Hopefully, they will be humble in the future when it comes to customer service.

The chicken taste like they dipped it in water after they fried it the meat taste awkward and it was very dark in the inside yet under cooked. The fries were soggy and wet. This place gets 5 stars for the corn bread, mac&cheese, grits, and short rib pizza. 4 stars for the red velvet chicken and waffles. And 3 stars for the skirt steak. The drinks were yummy but took forever to come. Our waiter was sweet but got distracted so many times. Took about 30 min to get drinks. Then another 20 after that to get appetizers. Then another 30 min for our main courses. We asked for a medium skirt steak, we got well done and it was cold. He also forgot our cornbread and after reminding him, he brought it out after we were done with our meals. It's so unfortunate because this place is good but the service gets 1 star.

Came here for dinner with my friend. It was so packed out and so loud that I couldn't hear myself think. It felt like it was more like a club than a restaurant. We were seated right away and it took a while for a waiter to come up to us and take our orders. I showed them that I checked in so that we can try the cornbread. It was freaking delicious. I hate corn bread and this one was perfect. I could eat these all day at this restaurant. But I was a bit upset to find out after we left that they didn't give us the cornbread for free, they had charged us. But no big deal. Anyways, I ordered the jambalaya and I forgot what my friend ordered. But the jambalaya was pretty good, it was a bit spicy but that's how it's supposed to be. We also ordered the Mac and cheese which was pretty good. I don't normally like Mac and cheese either so for me to say it was good, means it's good. We also ordered drinks, I had some kind of drink with vodka and vanilla and caramel which was amazingggggg. My friend had something similar to a jalepeno margarita. And we both enjoyed our drinks very much. The price was a bit much but it was worth it. Our waiter was almost never to be seen plus it was super hard to talk to one another because it was so loud in there. I'd definitely try to come again when it's not that loud and crowded.

Came here for Sunday brunch. I was pleased at how quickly they seated us without a reservations. However the wait was pretty long. I haven't been to soco in about five years but in my opinion the food is just average. Nothing special, and no reason for me to trek out here from Queens. I had the steak and eggs, the steak was VERY overcooked (even though I asked for medium-well done), and I had a hard time cutting it even with a steak knife. The corn bread had some sort of after taste. My friends got the chicken and red velvet waffle and the waffle was very dry.I did enjoy the mac and cheese, but I do not think I will be returning.

Great food, great atmosphere (it's loud so if you're looking for something more intimate, find another restaurant. Amazing brunch drinks. I'll be back!

Great food, very nice bare tenders and a great atmosphere. I've been here a couple of times and I never had a reason to complain. It's get crowded on weekends because it's becoming popular. The best time to go is during the week, before it gets late.

Soco is comfort food at it's finest! I went on a Saturday night and was seated quickly. I started my meal off with some cornbread which was warm, delicious and paired with special butter. As a main course I ordered the bbq chicken with a side of mashed potatoes and was not disappointed. The highlight of my meal was definitely the Mac and cheese. Authentic and delicious, highly recommend!

I never write reviews but this place was great. The mac and cheese was amazing!!! I totally enjoyed my meal and my drink was delicious. The host seated me quickly and the waiter was pleasant and efficient. I was unable to finish my Mac and cheese and now I'm on a hunt for the best Mac and cheese in Tampa. When I go home to visit Brooklyn again, I'm definitely going back to Soco.

Good Atomsphere and vibe going on here. Very crowded so I would suggest making reservations. Food was ok, I had waffle and chicken. Chicken was very spicy and waffle needed powder sugar and cream cheese glaze. It was bland. The mussels are the best I ever had. Bartender is unfriendly.

I've come here so many times in the past and I don't know WHAT is going on with this restaurant. I literally told a couple of people today that this is my favorite restaurant and I will personally have to retract that statement. Lately I've been noticing it going downhill, but today took the cake. To make a very long story short, multiple items on the menu they do not serve, will not make any substitutions, the cornbread was cold and hard, and I was offered an array of sides to accommodate the fact that they no longer serve what they are still serving on the menu. Any items listed as chicken sausage dishes are now pork, so please ask!! The kitchen even decided, seemingly on their own, that they would not serve salmon during brunch, even though it is on the brunch menu. I was thoroughly confused and disappointed, left hungry, and waited for food that never came for an hour. Even after it seemed like I would be taken care of for the inconvenience, I still ended up with a $25 bill for a small Caesar salad and a drink. Soco will not be seeing me or anyone I speak to for a long time until they can sort out their organizational and managerial issues. The customer should ha e a seamless experience and feel like their time is valuable. I guess this good thing is coming to an end.

Stupid "no hat" policy. And there was no one in the restaurant. I could understand "no hat" for the lounge or bar scene, but I was going to have dinner with a friend. Oh well won't be getting my money. Smh off to Harlem to Silva's lol

No comment

I never rushed so fast to make a review for a restaurant. My best friend and I came during a busy Sunday afternoon in the mood for some brunch. We had no reservation and were still seated almost immediately. No lie guys, as soon as our butts touched the chair, someone plopped hand sanitizer and our utensils right in front of us - talk about perfect timing. For drinks we ordered two glasses of mimosas, a pitcher of their Soco sangria and two other drinks I can't seem to remember the name of but our server suggested it to us. The mimosas were very bubbly and different, the sangria was amazing (sneaks up on you so be careful) and the other two drinks were made with love and with the intention to get us tipsy (which it definitely did). Now on to food: My friend ordered the strawberry shortcake French toast with eggs, bacon and Mac and cheese (once again suggested by our wonderful server). I ordered the chicken with waffles and a side of the Mac and cheese. Let me tell yallll , the food was so on point flavor wise, everything was perfect. I wish I remembered our servers name, he was amazingggg and really made sure we had a great time. I'm a server myself so I know great service and he was a blast. We left a generous tip and he came back around to thank us and to our surprise - free shots on the house. We left Soco amazed with our belly full ready to bust, drunk and with leftovers. We went home and slept for 7 hours straight and even when we woke up we were STILL FULL. Thank you so much for an amazing time, can't wait to come visit you guys again. Can't wait to tell all my friends about this spot!
No comment
Strawberry shortcake French toast, sweet potato pancakes, bacon, firefly shrimp, wings, cornbread

Local..friendly staff..great vibes..went there for brunch..the wait time was fair and the service was on point..i got my free cornbreaddd...which was deelish..french toast was divine..the egg plattets not so much

The red velvet waffles is what brought me here via a Yelp search & they are what brought me back & will continue to do so. The Cajun cuisine will delight Louisianans & others alike. The back patio has a retractable roof. A DJ as well as LCDs will keep you entertained.

Great drinks great atmosphere we went on a Sunday afternoon for brunch and waited only 15 minutes. We ordered a number of entrée dishes and everything was great although my hashbrowns and toast or room temperature my eggs however was warm and hot. My friend had the strawberry shortcake French toast which to be honest is so good to look at and tasted just as great it was sweet it was savory it was fresh. We also have a hibiscus agave margarita and Asoka sangria which were all great the hibiscus margarita took us to that point really quick so we ended up ordering two more rounds.all in all everything was great service could've been a little bit more faster but it's a Sunday in Brooklyn and everyone is going to brunch so I could understand why service was a little bit slow.

I wanted to grab something to eat before my flight so my friend suggested we stop and eat brunch at Soco. Immediately walking it I was obsessed it was a country soul vibe with pictures of African Americans on the wall and a real sense of culture. I ordered the chicken and waffles and the Mac and cheese! I was not disappointed everything came out piping hot and the Mac was the very best ever!!!! While waiting on my food I had a couple of drinks at he bar we had Euri as a bartender he was the best and my drinks were amazing. I can't wait to come back and eat here again!

Soco Brooklyn was awesome! We enjoyed the atmosphere and the food was fresh and came out very quick. The service was top notch everyone was polite and attentive. We sat outside and enjoyed the outdoor patio. I recommend SOCO not just for the name, but for the traditional southern food with a modern twist! I recommend you make a reservation because it was packed.

I definitely give this this Restaurant a thumbs up!!!! The atmosphere is awesome and the staff members were  super friendly and professional at all times. The food was absolutely amazing one point my personal favorite was the Red Velvet Waffles and Butter Milk Fried Chicken. I also had to try their famous side of  the Aunt Cruz Mac & Cheese which was extremely delicious. Ohhhhhh I forgot to mention the drinks were definitely on stage as well, I enjoyed a Bellini for the first time and I would definitely order another one if or when I go back. My advice would be to definitely make reservations before you arrive there, especially if you plan on visiting this place on Friday and Saturday
No comment
No comment

This past weekend we decided to go to Soco for Easter  brunch. They do a temperature check, make everyone complete the Covid questionnaire and wear a mask until you are seated. Everything was fine until they decided to sit people very close to us; not social distanced AT ALL! The tables were not even 3ft apart which was very concerning to me. When I spoke to the waitress about it she made it seem as if she was going to talk to the manager about it and didn't. Instead she never came back to our table for rest of the time we were there and sent another waiter to take care of us. We had already ordered our entree and appetizers which made it difficult to get and leave. We tried moving our tables and were told it was not possible. Needless to say We will not be going back as it was very uncomfortable for us to enjoy our food and time and on top of that being ignored and treated as if we were asking for too much when asked to be distanced from other patrons.
No comment

@socobk is a local favorite! Let me start with saying, brunch on Sunday's runs until 9:30PM! Um yes please. The restaurant is a blend of southern dishes with an east coast twist to many of the dishes. These red velvet waffles and fried chicken taste like they were made by your aunt who makes the thanksgiving Mac N Cheese. No bottomless mimosas here but the food is worth the visit, they also offer great carafes that do the trick.  The vibe is super chill but don't let that fool you. The wait here can be lengthy, I would def suggest reservations if possible. Enjoy! @chas_eatsbk

First off, the food is the best! The Hospitality is amazing, they cook your food with love. Brunch is the best! So grab your girls or date, dress to impress and leave satisfied! The cocktails are delicious!

Soooo. Went to Soco once before and really enjoyed the food. Came back last night and now I realized why they have bad reviews. Food was mediocre. I honestly felt as if people didn't want to help/serve us because we were Asian. Stuck us in the corner of their store and it took us 10-15 minutes of sitting around to get a glass of water and no directions as to how to get a menu (seems there may have been a QR code? We ended up pulling up a menu up on their website as a last resort). I literally raised my hands up for minutes with no one caring and I can tell there were workers standing by the walls who saw me and pretended they didn't. When water and dinnerware were finally brought out, they were missing a set and of course that took a while to get anyone's attention to remedy too. Mind you, it wasn't even that crowded. Food came out at an unbearably slow pace and wasn't anything spectacular. This place absolutely deserves a 1 star. I won't be returning nor will I be recommending anyone else to do so. There's much better food with happier service elsewhere.

We were seated quickly due to our reservation.  Service with Juan was top notch. Food came quick and it was delicious!!! I had the Steak with potatoes and collard greens which was excellent!!! Baked Mac n cheese was heavenly. So happy we went to celebrate my girlfriend 's Birthday there.

I visited this establishment on Thursday with my sister and cousin. This is my 3rd time visiting SoCo and they never cease to amaze me. I ordered the skirt steak and it was very tasty. The steak was cooked well and it was tender. My cousin ordered their signature dish the red velvet waffle and fried chicken. The waffle tastes very good you don't even need syrup. I will continue to visit SoCo and tell all of my friends about this lovely place.

This place is trendy and the food is delicious. Clearly it attracts the foodie and Sunday brunch crowd but I know it is a place to come any time. The wait staff is professional and attentive without being intrusive. Easily accessed by mass transit and located in the middle of a transforming area SoCo is fun!  A nice place for a first date; sit in the covered patio. Also a great place for friends (share dishes the portion sizes are substantial). I had the sausage and grits this time and I've indulged in the Mac and cheese previously. It's All Good! Note: serves sirachi.

Soco offers some of the best southern comfort food I've ever tried. They're popular for their red velvet waffles and chicken, but two of my favorites are their mac and cheese and grits. The mac and cheese has a baked top and the perfect ooey gooey cheese underneath. It gets packed for brunch so make sure to take advantage of Open Table reservations!

THIS PLACE IS SO GOOD THAT ONE YEAR I CAME HERE TWICE FOR MY BIRTHDAY. I literally am always head over heels in love with Soco! It's a sad day when my leftovers don't make it long enough to last the entire week. Pick anything on the menu and I guarantee you'll love it! This is a high recommendation on my list for sure.

I visited SOCO around 7pm on a Saturday night and the wait was long. To be seated and it took a longer time for our food to be served, but the food and the service defiantly made up for the wait. The Herb steak is soooo good and the Cesar salads is bomb I love the dressing !

I've experienced 5 star restaurants and have not gotten the immaculate and amazing customer service i just received from Miranda at SOCO, she effortlessly dealt with rude customers and harsh comments with grace and the utmost respect!!! The place is jam packed and wall to wall customers and she is smiling and treating every reservation with kind hearted decency and love i will be here every single weekend ... it's nice to be at a black owners establishment with staff that treats every customer like they matter and are royalty. Came here for brunch with a friend and we sat outback. We loved the outside section and there was a DJ playing great music. My friend got a cheeseburger and I got the Clinton hill omelette. Both were really good and we got the free corn bread for checking in on yelp which was amazing:). Overall we had a great experience and our waiter was also super nice which is always a plus. Would definitely come back here and would recommend for anyone to go to their brunch.

Food is good.  Love their brunch and dinner menus.  My favorite is the Mac and cheese and the fried chicken. Great date spot.  I found the food to be a little pricey but outside of that I like this place.

The atmosphere in here is EVERYTHING! Live music,scenery,aromas, and the food !!!! Omg yes. I had sangria,lobster shrimp and grits ,and jalapeño cornbread ! Soooo goodddd!!!! And even when the live music stopped the track list was EVERYTHING ! I will definitely be back! And with friends lol

Brunch at Soco is always on point. We ordered the smoked wings and bbq baby back ribs to start. The chicken and red velvet waffles never disappoint. The staff is always friendly and the kitchen is always consistent with the food quality.

I arrived just in time for brunch. This place is calm and relaxing. There is also outside seating if the weather permits. The food and drinks are great. I had the shrimp and lobster with grits. My palette was really excited. Extremely flavorful. I had fun. I'm giving this place four stars because the music was too loud. Overall, it was a great experience.

The location was perfect. A quick walk to the subway on a really nice block. I notices a parking garage across the street. So we made a reservation and due to the subway system we were 9 mins late. The gentleman who greeted up who I believe was the owner said the gave out table away out ready but if we wanted to seat right away they had space in the front. If we wanted to sit anywhere else it would be a 35 or more minute wait. I was disappointed as I really didn't wanna seat by the door and wanted to see the back part of the location but I was also hungry so we took the seat up front. They do a mimosas by carafe rather than bottomless. 40 was a little to expensive for just the two so us so be passed on drinks. I decided on the Buttermilk Fried Chicken with the red velvet waffles and Mac a cheese. I wanted all dark meat but the four dollar up charge talked me out of it. I was glad I didnt. Normally white meat is too dry for me but this chicken was amazing! Perfectly seasoned and so juicy. And the waffle was just right. The Mac and Cheese was to die for! The people next to use shared their mimosa with us so that was a win. Brooklyn isn't a place to a travel to often but I would def check this place out again and make sure to be on time get better seating. January In nyc and sitting by the door can ruin a dining experience. There service was okay for the most part. The waitress did seems to have a lot of tables .

So, very interesting story, I was hungry. I mean what else is new? Oh and we were also celebrating so that's a real reason to go out. My friends and I were treating so we needed to find the right place. One of them suggested "SoCo." After looking it up I definitely wanted to give it a shot. Parking is crazy around the area, so plan early. Looking at the building, I loved the dark look. I couldn't believe how well it fit in this up and coming part of Brooklyn. Going inside I noticed the place is longer then it is wide. But it wasn't that bad. A+ for the live music playing, it definitely added to the vibe. The place was packed, I was impressed with how many people they got inside. The locals definitely know all the hot spots in Brooklyn. The tall boys we sat on were comfortable enough, I just personally prefer a booth. The staff was nice and so was our waiter. The orders got placed and we waited for our food. When the food came out we all got quite, you know that means it's time to eat. The odd thing is that if you ask each person at the table they will tell you something different about there experience with the food. Two people got the same thing, the chicken and waffles, one liked it the other didn't. I got the mac & cheese and felt it was to dry. I liked the corn bread and mashed potatoes, but my girlfriend didn't like the mashed potatoes. I thought that was strange. None of us agree one hundred percent what was good. The only thing we all liked was the corn bread. I do like the place myself and will return, I will just bring "Yes" people with me next time.
I cannot believe how small the chicken portion was, and how expensive. Go to literally any other place if you want fried chicken, so overrated.
No comment

I absolutely loved this place. The ambiance was great. I went for dinner and it definitely made for a lovely outing. I wish that I would have taken more pictures of my food. However to start off, I ordered the deviled eggs and cornbread. When I say I don't even like deviled eggs, but I was intrigued by the description on the menu so I gave it a shot. Boy am I glad that I did. The eggs have a crunchy pork topping which enhances the flavor times 10. Now let's talk about the cornbread! Baby!!! It was fingerlicking good. It was so sweet and savory. Definitely a must have. I had the fried chicken with the red velvet waffle and that alone was mouthwatering. I hate that I didn't take a picture. I will definitely return! Perfect for date nights or family dinner!

Overall, my experience at Soco was okay. The food was good and my waiters, Mike and Lucas where nice but my perception of the restaurant was tainted by the poor service I received from the hostess upon arrival. The restaurant was going to open at 12 p.m. and my friend and I arrived about 11:55 a.m. The hostess would not let us sit inside at least at the bar, she made us stand outside for 5 minutes until they opened. I thought that was poor judgement, from that point on the experience wasn't as good as it could have been. On a positive note, the mac and cheese was very excellent and so was the chicken and waffles. I would not recommend the cheddar grits as they lacked flavor to me. The hibiscus cocktail was very pleasant, so I would recommend that one.

Food is good, especially the chicken and red velvet waffles! The wait is pretty decent for a popular brunch spot,  but the customer service could be better.  We had a leak from the ceiling dropping on us and couldn't get anyone to move us to an available table. Music is good too!
Disgusting and service was horrible !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Never again !! Food was just nastyyyyy took them about an hour to take our orders and an hour for the food to come out smh
