The food here was pretty good. Sometimes its a hit or miss. I honestly loved coming here when they first opened but over time it has just changed. The red velvet waffle was  a hit when it dropped but honestly that red velvet waffle is way to sweet. The bbq chicken and mash is one of my favorite dishes and the last time i had it it was a little bland. The Mac and cheese is good it use to be bomb, but I will still order it . Lastly the Presentation is always pretty which I appreciate but I need consistency in my food. I don't hate it but I definitely don't go as often as I use to. The service staff  however is attentive that has never been a issue

This place is AMAZING! First off, the customer service in this place is wonderful. The staff are very attentive, they cater to your every need, they stay with a smile on their faces. I went last night, Saturday night soon as their kitchen opened so about 5:30pm, and the place was packed! We started off with appetizers, I had the gumbo and my mom had the mussels. She loved the mussels but let me say that gumbo WOW just WOW! I need the recipe lol... For dinner she had the Chicken and I had the brisket, full of flavor and so tender! I will definitely be returning! Especially for that gumbo,  I need more!!

I recenty went to Soco and I was not impressed at all.  The service was slow and it seemed like there were a bunch of people training, but no one had a sense of urgency to do anything.  My waitress (I can't tell you her name , because she never introduced herself) was all over the place.  For dinner on a Thursday night, she was in the back of the restaurant , then at the front taking orders, and at one point, it looked like she was the waitress for every table in the restaurant. When dinner came, all of the food didn't arrive and it took forever for my friend to get his mac and cheese and when we asked for it 2 different people said "oh they are bringing it up from downstairs."  What does that even mean? And why is it coming out 15 minutes after everything else?  The whole thing was bizarre and I think I'm over Soco.  The hype is over.

The brunch was delicious, I ordered the crab cakes benedict with a side of Mac n' Cheese and wow! We did decide to eat here on a busy day so the wait was long, but the music was perfect. Everyone at our table ordered sangria and enjoyed their food!

Went on Saturday night and it was packed. My friend and I ended up sitting by the door. The food was great and came to the table in an acceptable amount of time. Drinks were nice not strong but good. The waiting area was right behind us and this girl's "fur" coat kept smacking my friend in the head. Food was still good they were watching us eat it while they were waiting.Waiter spilled blue cheese on my coat I was expecting a discount on my check but that didn't happen. The food is good though. FYI: it wasn't alot of blue cheese and the manager wiped down my coat but still a drink could've been comped since my coat is going to the cleaners in Monday. The food was good though. I would go again during the week and earlier.

I'll start by saying, you need reservations to dine at this restaurant. And not like make reservations the night before give yourself more time to get the time and day you want. I've been here twice. First time I brought my bf here for his birthday, I made reservations so we didn't have to wait long. We only had one issue that night, which was that they were out of several items which was super annoying. But, after we ordered what they did have in stock everything else went well. The food was delicious and we enjoyed our time there. The second I went there was for Saturday brunch. We choose the drinks option. The mimosas were good and so was the food. I had gotten the chicken and waffles and he got the french toast. Both tasted great. Don't forget to make your reservations ahead of time!

This place never disappoints! I hadn't been to this place in years and decided to go back recently when a friend was in town. I had never been during the week so it was nice to just walk in because usually on the weekends you need reservations to get a seat. They have happy hour from 12-7 but only on certain drinks. Just beware they give you half the size of their normal drink size. Down to the food... the Mac and cheese is something special it is one the best I have had. The chicken and red velvet waffle is what they are known for and it was delicious. My friend had the salmon over sweet potato mash it was pretty good. Overall, this was a great dining experience. The staff was friendly, the music was good as well as the vibe.

I absolutely love their brunch. We came in on a Thursday and it was pretty empty. Server/wait staff were attentive and very friendly. I made my return to Soco for brunch after a 7 year hiatus  and it was amazing. Let's get into it the food was great. Mac N cheese is a must!!! The corn bread was good but not a must order item. This place was amazing. The chicken and waffles were amazing. And the MAC and cheese were to die for. I definitely recommend this place to everyone. The food wasn't just good but the service was amazing .

My homie was visiting from California and I had to bring her to Soco! We arrived a few minutes late for our 12:30 reservation but were seated promptly. The server was friendly, attentive and made good recommendations. My friend loved the andouille sausage with grits, the corn bread and mac&cheese! My shrimp and lobster with grits was good overall, but I wish the grits were warmer and the lobster was a bit overdone causing it to be rubbery. However, I'd still return to SoCo in the future.
Ive been here a handful of times and its always amazing. Usually quite a wait for the food, but i always leave happy. Always lively and busy. Great ambience. Perfect for a date night.

Great for eating in but horrible service for takeout. Although this place is primarily an "eat in" restaurant, they do allow for pick up orders. I've now ordered the same salmon Caesar salad twice now, and each time there's been an error. The first time I was given way too  little of dressing (not a big deal) but the second time I was given the smallest amount of salad possible even though I specifically asked for a FULL salad rather than the half. I was also charged for a full serving. I attempted to call only to be placed on hold for 14 minutes and then hanged up on. This place also has horrible phone service. My only issue with this error is that if they offer a half and a full, then how can the quantity I was given be logical? What would the half salad even look like at that point?

This place is awesome Brian our server kept checking in and making sure we was ok! Hostess kenya worked everything out for my friend and I had a problem with our reservations online. The place is nice and cozy and good atmosphere!
Went here for a cousin brunch and I will never regret it. Wonderful ambiance, great food and people. The live music was everything. Definitely a staple for me.

I would've given SoCo 5 stars if not for the wait time. I visited this locale for my birthday. It had been a while so I was excited. The bar staff (while I waited) was amazing. I had a lemon drop for the first time and I wasn't disappointed. The food and drinks pretty much made up for it all. The chicken and red velvet waffle is amazing and you'd be doing yourself a disservice if you don't try the Mac and cheese as it's too delicious. I would definitely go back for brunch with the girls or for a casual date experience.

I loved it ! The staff the food the atmosphere ! Loved it all the drinks were ok I had the agave margarita and the Soco island but other than that me and my boyfriend loved it all ! Will definitely be returning .

The management is misleading I've been in the past and the stuffed fish was amazing. Coming from down south, anytime I'm in nyc I take time out to visit this establishment for their stuffed branzino. After a long drive coming from midtown to enjoy a pleasant dinner I was sadly smacked with terrible news!! The branzino was taken off the menu. How disappointing! The remainder of the menu is so/so. Drinks are over priced and watered down. I give this place 3stars bc of the stuffed fish. Nothing worth talking about outside of that. Food and service was good! Not 5 Star because it can always be better. Food took a little long to come out. But they were very accommodating.
No comment
No comment
Love it here! Clean restaurant, food is good, love the atmosphere and very nice staffs! One of my favorite restaurants! Great place to go to for brunch too!
All around great. Food, service, and atmosphere. I enjoyed. Definitely will be back.  Brianna was my server. She recommended the meal.
No comment

I made a 10pm reservation and arrived at 10:18pm. Upon arrival this place was packed! I notified the lady in front that I made a reservation and she told me that that after 15 minutes they cancel reservations. I wasn't aware of this, but I can't prevent traffic on the Brooklyn Bridge when you are coming from a different borough. As I was seated the lady canceled my open table reservation as if I never showed up. I felt like that wasn't right even though I was 3 minutes late  waited about 15/20 minutes to be seated since they had several big party groups. I wouldn't say that the food was the best I ever had, but it was good. The staff was very friendly. Extremely loud and I could barely hear my date, but it was a nice restaurant.

2 Brooklynites recommended Soco. It is not disappointing. My only complaint....s-l-o-w service. Great waiter, intoxicating drinks ( I ordered a hibiscus mojito) our party of 9 ordered practically everything on the menu, skirt steak w/onions and fries, lobster/shrimp & grits, salmon, chicken & red velvet waffle, jambalaya, burger & fries. Everyone says they loved their dishes. Ambiance A++++
No comment
No comment
Good food, decent drinks . On sundays It get a bit crowded for brunch so try and call ahead if possible . Btw the  Macaroni is to die for
No comment

Talk about authentic southern food!! The grits & jambalaya beat Jacob Pickles & Sugar Freak! I love my food! The atmosphere's casual with live music! Such talent! Kudos to our waitress Crystal and the dude with the electric violin!

If you are hungry, you MUST come here! If you are thirsty,you MUST come here! Lamar was the best server we could ever ask for. His recommendations were on point and his customer service felt more like hanging with family. We all had the mac n cheese, steak w greens, pasta dish, a lobster dish, and the best of all, chicken and waffles. But not just any ordinary waffle, a red velvet waffle! No crumb was left behind! On any dish!!! If you are any where near this place, plan some time to go there. You wont regret it.
No comment

Soco has an outstanding atmosphere. I had the shrimp, lobster and grits ($33). When I recieved my plate the presentation was great however I was disappointed in the quantity of shrimp and lobster on my plate. I recieved 3 med sized shrimp and a half of a slipper lobster tail. I asked the manager (Eury) if we could do something about about the quantity of seafood and he told me he would charge me $4.00 for each additional shrimp and there was nothing he could do to accommodate me. I thought the dish was over priced however the taste was balanced and tasty

I went this past Sunday for brunch with a friend and was thoroughly impressed. The food was geeat but the service was AMAZING. Everyone was so attentive and took really good care of us. I enjoyed the music and atmosphere in general. I'm looking forward to going back and trying something else from the menu.
No comment

The staff here is soooo friendly!! We really enjoyed our dinner here. Check-in on yelp and get free delicious cornbread! F-Que Wings and Soco Baby Back Ribs were excellent... saucy and messy, flavorful and spicy. They were both a generous portion for a great price! Blackened salmon was very fresh, molasses braised short ribs were very tender, and buttermilk fried chicken was awesome too. The buttermilk fried chicken and really yummy red velvet waffle are def worth the $20. Wish we had time to try some desserts and wish we lived closer so we could come for brunch!!

I had a great time yesterday at Brunch.Much better experience this time around. The service was good and the DJ played some nice tunes. We really enjoyed our food as well. As you can see we ordered some of everything.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great brunch menu, drinks are ok! Good vibe & music. Be sure to make a reservation, wait could be long.
No comment

This is a great place for brunch and great music.  I had sweet potato pancakes with scrambled eggs and turkey bacon. Plus unlimited mimosas. They have a dj spinning good tunes. Definitely will be back.
No comment
Great brunch spot. They also have a lot of good creole food . Be sure to make reservation wait was over an hour for party of 4
No comment

Went to Soco for brunch on Sunday and was very disappointed. They sat the two of us at the skinniest table in the bar that I have ever seen. The walkway between the bar and the tables is so small, only one person barely fits by. Bad design.  The menu descriptions were not accurate. I ordered the hash browns, which were cut round browned potatoes. I even asked the server before ordering if they were true hashbrowns and her answer was YES.  I ordered the chicken and dumplings and the dumplings were filled pasta, not dumplings like one might think. My friend ordered the avocado toast. The server asked her if she wanted the salmon with it which comes with it and she said yes.  When I got the bill, we were  charged $18 extra for a few pieces of thin raw salmon.  Ridiculous.  I will not be going back!
No comment

I'm so amazed about the service here Elliott and Nelson was the best Nelson was very attentive my table was never dirty .. very good hostess, my food was sooo good I had the bbq chicken my friend had the shrimp lobster and grits I also. Had a side collard greens .. so tasty:. I will definitely be coming back .. Black business own . Love the atmosphere.. Than

Ive brunch at soco a few times since it first opened. I never ate here for dinner but the brunch menu is delicious. The Mac and cheese is amazing & the drinks. I ate at the bar this time & had the Carmel martini & brooklyn Bellini which was really good. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I was originally told it was a 10 min. Wait for a table. However, after waiting 10 minutes I was told s 45 min wait! The wait time is always ridiculous but I just decided to dine at the bar.
No comment
No comment

We came here for an impromptu lunch on a recommendation. I tried the burger which was amazing and my husband had the chicken and waffles which was also amazing. The restaurant is beautiful with a darker ambience. Drinks were good, food was good. Definitely a nice date spot  and I cannot wait to visit again.
Food was amazing. You can tell the food is good the moment you walk in. You can tell the food is good. Just look at the costumers!

The food and drinks were great.  The service was outstanding.  I was there on December 12, 2019 about 12:45. It was mid day so the restaurant wasn't crowded.  However, there was some older customers there celebrating a birthday.  I was there with a date and appreciated that we were able to have a conversation without blaring background music.  HOWEVER, the music that was playing was filled with inappropriate language. If I was in the privacy of my own home, then fine.  But this is an establishment with different age groups and races.  If I was there with my parens I would have complained about the music.  Again the food, drink and customer service 5 star but choice of music made me drop my rating to 3 stars.
Really enjoy this place. The food, music and service is good. Our server  Ruth was very helpful and courteous.
No comment
No comment

BREONA is amazing! She ran down everything for us and gave us options without us even having to ask. Very pleasant and attentive. Love the music here! This CORNBREAD... yes! The food is amazing.. And that says alot because I am picky. I was a little disappointed that the fish and chips was not on the Brunch menu today though. But everything else made up for that! This was a great way to end my cousin's Bachelorette weekend here in Brooklyn!

I enjoyed my brunch here. I order the macaroni and cheese with the red velvet chicken and waffle. The chicken was nice and crisp. However, my waffle was way too sweet for my taste buds. I enjoyed the macaroni and cheese very much. It had great flavor. The ambiance of soco is very welcoming and would definitely return again. Three stars are only because my waffle was too sweet
No comment

I love Soco. The Mac and cheese, pork chops, chicken and waffles, shrimp and grits and the salmon is amazing. However the stuffed Branzino was dry and disgusting. Please remove this item from the menu! It's mediocre and doesn't fit. Since my previous visits to Soco have been excellent I'll rate it 4 stars.
No comment
Visited with a great friend, it was packed a bit loud but the food was great and the service was decent not awesome.  I would visit again but I don't think I would go on a Saturday night.

3 years later and my pork chop was nicely seasoned. I also loved the collard greens and mashed sweet potato. Oh and the Brooklyn Bellini was everything!  Rob was our waiter and he was easy on the eyes with great customer service. Enjoyed my girls night here. Won't take so long to return
No comment
No comment

Soco was a nice spot! The aura was calm and relaxing. The music was not too loud. I think I ordered the brooklyn drink and that was okay. You would definitely need a few of those if you have a high tolerance. The food was pretty good. I've tasted better but it was delicious! I would recommend this place to anyone who's in the mood for some soul food!
No comment
No comment
This restaurant is so worth every dollar. One of my favorite places to go to and indulge in amazing southern food. They are always on point food is always tasty no matter what is ordered.
No comment
No comment

I came here for brunch to celebrate my birthday with my friends and the food was simply amazing.. we ordered a pitcher of sangria but we got our appetizers and started getting our entrees before it came so we canceled to order because it would've been forceful to finish. We were seated in the sunlight area which was beautiful only downfall was we couldn't hear the music that was playing inside which kinda sucked, they had a live violinist. Overall the food was amazing. Try the Mac and cheese, cornbread and shrimp and lobster grits yum!
No comment
No comment
No comment

From the ambience to the customer service  our waiter alone last night the food was so well prepared an presented the drinks were strong an just enough. Soco has a very adult atmosphere that is a great date night spot. I definitely will come back
No comment
No comment

This is one of my favorite restaurants. I have yet to have a bad meal and the drinks are just as delicious. My favorite is the Mac & cheese and the lobster, shrimp & grits . It's super cute inside and they have great service.
No comment
No comment

Been coming here for the past few years and this is definitely one of my favorite brunch spots! I usually take a seat at the bar so I don't have to wait for a seat. They don't accept same-day reservations which sucks since I never know I'm coming until the day of. The food is great. Never had anything I didn't like. I also go for the chicken and waffle. You will not regret getting it! The chicken is so juicy and full of flavor. Sometimes I don't even make it to the waffle because the chicken is so delicious. I've also tried the sweet potato pancakes which are also amazing. For drink I recommend the Mardi Gras, it's their version of a rum punch. Pretty good! One thing I didn't like about this place. I watched about 5 different people test taste one customers beverage. Everybody coming by sticking a straw in it to try it. Now that was disgusting.

PAY THE CHEF anything he wants.  The food is excellenttttt.  I mean EVERYTHING taste great.  Understanding the COVID has brought on a lot of changes and that I has to sit outside, management could have made better effort to make the outdoor setting nicer‍.

Soco never disappoints. Food is seasoned well, big portions, and the mac and cheese is perfect. Knocking off a star because there's always an issue with the bill when I come and overall service. It's  Not enough to keep me away since the food is consistently good.
No comment
If you visit Brooklyn, check out this place. Great ambiance and food. I loved the chicken and red velvet waffle.

ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE! Today was my 4th time coming here. Celebrated a friend's birthday for brunch and loved every second of being here. The food is delicious, especially the F-que wings and buttermilk red velvet waffles! Could come here everyday of my time, wallet, and weight permitted.
No comment
No comment

A group of colleagues and I were visiting the NJ/NY location and had a recommendation to check this spot out and good thing we did.  This place has a very cool vibe and serves up pretty awesome southern comfort food.  We had the chicken and red velvet waffles, jambalaya, gumbo, jalapeño hush puppies, red beans and rice, Mac n cheese and lobster:shrimp grits and everything was absolutely fantastic, everyone loved their meals definitely a place worth going back to again and again!

Amazing service from our server Matt. On a Thursday is the perfect day to go because you're in and out no wait. Mac and cheese and wings are a must. Chicken and waffles makes you wanna slap your mama. Drinks could be better or at-least the sangria could. Definitely will be back.

Soco is a very laid back kind of restaurant with nice urban hip hop and R&R music. The noise level can be loud sometimes. The food is very well made and has great presentation. The portions will have your fulfilled.

We were greeted and sat very promptly, they took a southern twist on fish and chips with a catfish and a kimchi aioli. The buttermilk fried chicken was moist and red velvet waffle, delicious. Only gripe I had about that was pancake syrup instead of actual maple syrup. But the real stand out in my opinion, the mac and cheese. Do yourself a favor and get that mac and cheese. If I could I'd eat a pound of it.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Nice ambiance. Food was good. Very well seasoned. Service was nice. Celebrated parents birthday here. They all enjoyed the food as well. The place got crowded pretty quickly.
I don't understand the hype about soco. The macaroni was really good but their food is ridiculously expensive. I won't come back
The best grits ever!! Great food and customer service! Dinner for two was $75 so it's pricey but definitely worth it.
No comment

Amazing. There's really nothing more to say about the place or the food. The ambiance, service and most importantly THE FOOD was just amazing. I had the red chicken and waffles, muscles, home fries, collard greens and mac & cheese (shared amongst the table of corse) and it was to DIE for. I also got the Mardi Gras pitcher. It was nice and strong. Sundays thet do NOT have boozy brunch, only Saturday's.
No comment
No comment
Nice for brunch with the girls. Great playlist but very loud music. It took about a hour for my food to arrive after ordering and everyone's food was warm.

Came here for brunch on a Saturday and it was a very nice atmosphere. I had the Farmers Omelet which was very good UNTIL a baby roach ran across my plate and then made his/her way to the rim of my glass of water! SMH! That is BEYOND disgusting. The manager took care of the bill as she should've. Needless to say, I won't be coming back here.
No comment

Oh my gosh! Where to begin!??every man who works there is fwone and the food is amazing!! The decor is simple and inviting, its a win for everybody. I had the fried chicken Sammie & salad. It was really good, however my friend got the lobster shrimp & grits w/ cornbread. I've been dreaming about it ever since. I mean it was all scrumptious! The service is great and if I lived in NY I'd be there allllll the time!

Came here on a Saturday night & fell in love. The place is a decent size for a restaurant in its area. The decor is very modern. There is one restroom for each sex. The sink is located outside of the restaurant. There is a full bar where you can eat at as well. Price wise, it's not pricey nor neither cheap but worth a try. I had a half of chicken & the mac n cheese. The mac n cheese is served on a small skillet but enough for 2-3 ppl. It is AMAZING. I swear I want to go back for this mac & cheese. Honestly I don't recall what drink I had because I was so in awe with my meal that I couldn't even finish. The quantity is very filling & I had to ask for a take home container. I will definitely be visiting again & hope their quality does not dwindle. You should definitely take time to visit this restaurant because you won't be disappointed

In town for a few days and had brunch with a few friends. The Mac and cheese was amazing and so decadent. The strawberry shortcake was also out of this world and perfection. Our waiter was pretty great as well. The music was definitely too loud and the lobster/shrimp and grits was pretty over priced but tasted good.
My experience at Soco was amazing. The food was delightful and the wait staff was very attentive. I will definitely be back soon.
No comment
No comment

My children took me here for brunch. The food was delicious. The drinks strong and tasty. The service was also very good, my only complaint was at the very end. My daughter went to the rest room while the rest of us finished our drinks. While waiting for her return and preparing to leave the waitress came over to rush us along. Although she wasn't rude it was still uncalled for since we were leaving just waiting for my daughter and had just spent over $225.00 for brunch. It left a bad taste to what been a nice experience
No comment

The Buttermilk Fried Chicken and Red Velvet Waffle is to DIEEEEEE FOR! This is not your ordinary chicken and waffle dish...sorry not sorry other brunch spots! You get three nice sized pieces of flavorful, tender chicken, atop a large red velvet waffle. The waffle tastes like an actual piece of red velvet cake! The waffle is soft and delectable, and with the powdered sugar on top, you may not even need to add syrup! Now, the Mac and cheese is also slammin'. I'm not too fond of restaurants' Mac and cheese, but Soco's is the truth! You get the perfect Noodles, creamy cheese, and I love how they let the top crisp. The drinks at Soco are definitely great! Not weak at all! This was my first time at Soco, and I think they just found a new regular!
Probably one of the worst meals I've ever had, there are plenty of better options nearby.

Horrible! Apparently this restaurant is owned by a black man and refuses to seat individuals wearing baseball caps not all hats just baseball caps. Who are you targeting and why?! Despicable "policy" that is cultural racism.

This is easily the best soul food out there (period). The service is fantastic, they have a welcoming and warm atmosphere full of life on any morning. The entire staff waits hand and foot on everyone who walks in the door. The Mac and cheese will traumatize you, it's that good. The chicken and waffles were so good that it's borderline inappropriate. And don't get me started on the wings. It put an end to all wings. SoCo is the end all be all. If I could rent the bathroom and live there I would.
No comment

My other half and I had brunch here this weekend and it was absolutely delicious! We received a sort of cold greeting by the front hostess staff but once we were seated Tori turned the whole experience around! She gave impeccable service from beginning to end. We ordered the popular chicken and red velvet waffle (yes it is as amazing as it sounds), the pecan crusted pork chops, a side of mac n' cheese and corn bread. We also ordered the $15 bottomless mimosas which was a great choice! I can't say enough about the delicious food, quality of service and overall experience (despite the cold greeting...I'll attribute that to how busy they were). We even made sure to tell the owner on our way out how great everything was. We will be back!

The food is delish, I've been here many many times.  My fav and go to dish is the red velvet waffle with the buttermilk fried chicken breast and the garlic Mac n cheese.  I am also a fan of their cornbread.  They get a five for food but a four for service because depending on your waiter your experience can be so so.

Very disgusting n the fact that you are now in the news wit 28 violations I would not recommend this place to anyone

The wait is TERRIBLE - some operational efficiencies review would be helpful. Also, why music so loud? We are tryna eat chicken and talk at the same time. Please turn down music as this is not a night club.

This is my 2nd time at this establishment. The food was great but the lady in the front who sits you to your table is very rude. She needs a class on customer service seriously. Overall I'll rate the food and my waiter very high but because of her I'll just give this place a 3 star she's horrible.

What can I say about this restaurant. Very clean very nice staff and good home southern food. This is my first time here and I will come back. Very diverse and good music. Bring the kids and bring a hungry belly. Beauty of Brooklyn. I had the catfish, grits, and and apple sangria.
No comment
No comment

I absolutely love this restaurant. I've been going here for about seven years and the quality of the food is always consistent. The ambiance is great and the environment is meticulously clean. Each time I visit I always have awesome service. The servers are very attentive and personable; I've even come to know some by name. One thing I can really appreciate is the work ethic of the workers. The collaborative effort everyone puts in is evident. Now back to the food...one of my fav dishes is the Chicken and Red velvet waffles w/ Mac and cheese. All in all I'm certain that anything you order here will be exceptionally delicious. The cuisine is Louisiana-Southern inspired so the dishes are savory with a kick. I do hope they can put beignets on the dessert menu, even if it's just seasonal. I definitely recommend stopping in.
No comment

I booked a 20 person brunch with Soco back on Jan 22. My party was for Sunday brunch on February 16th at 12pm. It was hell just reserving the party because whomever handled the emails took days to respond and they would not take my reservation over the phone. I ended up calling on the Friday before and reserving the party after going crazy with the person who answered.  My party arrived at 11:45 am. The store hours posted said 12pm no big deal.  12:10 a hostess peeks her head out to tell us their system is down and they wound l won't let ppl in until it's fixed.  Now after 12:30 and standing in the cold.  They let us in. It takes 20 mins for beverages and an hour for food.  We brought cupcakes for my daughter's birthday.  They happily held them for us to then tell us after dinner it would be an extra $20 for us to eat them in there!!!! I was appalled after Waiting an extra half hour in the cold you try to charge me to eat my own cupcakes!!! After a heated discussion with the manager whom refused to step out of the room to discuss the situation but rather have the debate in front of my child and her friends, she ultimately waived the fee. The food was excellent, the waitress tried her best but Soco was an absolute let down.  My daughter couldn't even enjoy her birthday brunch.

Two thumbs up!!! The ambience is awesome! Staff is super friendly and professional at all time. Food is amazing always on point my personal favorites are red velvet waffle/ buttermilk fried chicken also the steak is to die for and the drinks are everything. Definitely need to make a reservation if your trying to visit on the Friday/Saturday.
4th time here. Love it. The mac & cheese is to die for. They make u feel so welcome. The guy even closed my umbrella ( lil things count you know lol ) once again love soco !

First time. The wait was decent. I ordered the chicken and so-called red velvet waffles. The waffles are definitely not real red velvet... it's purely batter colored red with food coloring. Terrible. The gumbo was bland at best. Great Mimosas though.
No comment

Wow. This really hit the spot after a full day of exploring Brooklyn. Such delicious and satisfying food! We split the kale Caesar and the corn bread as our starter. Holy shit, so delicious. Flavorful and hearty. I had the smoked BBQ chicken and my husband had the sausage and grits. We loved both of these! My chicken was fall off the bone tender and the BBQ sauce that came with was spicy and sweet. The garlic mash and green beans were so savory and the perfect match for the sauce. As for the sausage and grits, holy moly! So creamy and spicy. The service was perfect and this place has a fun vibe. So glad we stumbled upon this gem!
No comment

Have you ever been somewhere where the experience is just...heavenly?! That describes my experience today in SoCo. My last time here was almost 5 years ago when they first opened & if I must say so it's even better now than before! Amazing food, amazing atmosphere, great live performance, everything A1! This place is a must!
No comment
Fantastic food and service. Had a great time. Just don't sit right under the speakers.
My friends and I we sat at the bar. The Bartender was super nice, great hospitality.The drinks were amazing. I have been there a few times and never been disappointed.
No comment

This is one of the best black owned restaurants I have had the pleasure of visiting in a long time. The service is very accommodating and the ambiance reminds me of an upscale club but with the sociability of a gala. The kitchen is fantastic and I highly recommend the brunch menu. The sweet potato pancakes were a sweet treat paired with the whipped cream and the dragonfly shrimp were very crispy and are paired well with the chipotle mayo. I highly recommend the County Sangria for a nice and steady buzz throughout the meal (if you're into that). This place is honestly a great place to feel the presence of a welcome and flourishing black community along with a hype playlist as you eat.
I ordered lobster shrimp and grits. It was delicious! Service was great. No complaints. I'll be back again!

Went here on a Saturday night. We ordered the side of okra and tomato, veggie flatbread and salmon with mashed sweet potato. It took 1.15 hours to get our food and 15 minutes to get our menus. The salmon dish was so flippin small that my partner is still hungry and the flatbread was basically bread with HUGE raw onions and tomatoes on top. Gross!!! The waitress was rude and careless. The hostess was extremely rude, she had no manners what so ever. I guess she assumed she was the manager . She took my name and number and said I'll text you. 20 minutes later she passed me and said "What's your name? I texted you?" And she kept walking. Uh rude! But I guess it fits the crowd . This place confirmed why I am no longer eating out.

The service was pretty good and very attentive. I got the classic chicken and red velvet waffles. The chicken was well seasoned but the waffle came out a bit soggy. The cocktails were sweet but strong. My date liked the veggie lasagna but it wasn't necessarily amazing. The Mac and cheese was a hit though. I'd go back and try something else.
No comment

Still very overpriced, and the quality has definitely gone down over the past five years.  Red velvet waffles are now mediocre at best, and still don't pair that well with the chicken- which is also just ok.  Mac and cheese and SoJazzy salad w/ shrimp still the best things on the menu; cocktails are decent too.

I been coming here for years. I met a girlfriend here, i met a business partner here, I had my first nightmare date here. I can't get enough of this place. People fly here for the chicken and waffles but honestly this place does everything great. Mardi gras cocktail is a go to, the happy hour is pretty dope (it applies to bar seats only but theres usually space.) Beautiful black women everywhere on the weekends or brunch.
No comment
No comment
I love Soco the Mac and cheese the French toast tho!!!!!!!!! POPPIN!! This is a place to try grits are good as well. Not a fan of the waffles tho.

This review is long overdue.  I cannot count the amount of times that I've come to SoCo's for dinner or brunch since it's opened.  It's a staple, my go to place for whatever.  I always come back because it is consistent, the service, food (quality and taste).  I've tried EVERYTHING on their menu.  My favorites are the wings, creole gumbo, sweet potato pancakes; lobster, shrimp and grits (so good!), fried pickled oysters, their biscuits (so good), braised short ribs, jambalaya, fried branzino, white cheddar grits (rich and creamy) and the fried chicken and waffles never ever disappoints.  The seasoning is perfect, nicely fried not too crispy and the waffle is fluffy and not too sweet.  Although I've tried many other places, I always come back to SoCo!

column3: Browns Mills, Country Lake Estates, NJ
column6: My daughter and I went to Soco for lunch. We had the pleasure of meeting Marc Daly the owner. We were seated in VIP, the best table in the restaurant. The servers were wonderful and so helpful. The food was delish especially the mac and cheese. Cant wait to go back

Went to SoCo over the summer of 2014... I love this place. Had a reservation and was 5 min past the allotted 5 min grace period. We called and the staff was very accommodating... The food, oh my gosh the food. The chicken and waffles were the best. Chicken cooked to perfection. The pork chops looked heavenly. I had a small taste and vowed that's my next dish upon my return... Keep up the good work!!!

I went here yesterday and the chicken was dry. The waffle was flat. And the mac and cheese was bland. I don't know what type of L train crack y'all are smoking but don't lie to me about soul food no more. Stop it. This was pitiful. The lemonade was good tho and the gumbo hit the spot (once you add hot sauce). But don't play in my face with these yelp reviews no more. I spent $60 just for me to leave still hungry. And during Black History Month too?!! Smh. I am offended.

A very nice spot to have brunch, Live DJ selections are on point. Chicken and Waffles is a (can't-miss) item on the menu.
Maybe the juiciest burger I've ever had! I went for lunch. I give it for stars because I wanted a mixed greens salad with my burger and she gave me a side of just argula because that's all they had.
No comment
The food was amazing. The waiter was really nice. Wait time was a bit long. But besides that, everything was great!

Soco is literally one of my favorite places to eat and one of the best restaurants in Brooklyn! It has both indoor and outdoor seating which is great for when you want a change of ambiance. The servers are always so friendly and respectful and some even go out of their way to serve you by asking about food allergies and refilling your drink (not just the water lol!) One downfall is that on occasion the music can be so loud and overpowering that everyone tends to shout to be heard and then the restaurant is just a loud mess. Some days they have live music (a full band or a violinist) and that's always great. Oh last but not least, their Mac n cheese is THE BOMB! I've never had anything like it. Make sure you get it when you visit, seriously!
The red velvet waffles was amazing.  The Mac and cheese was delicious. Cocktails were delicious especially the Mardi Gras and Brooklyn Bellini! The ambience is as great especially the outdoor space!

Fantastic atmosphere, excellent food, and decent cocktails. This is upscale slightly healthier soul food, I still miss Big Daddy's and Annie Laura's in Atlanta (well Decatur and Riverdale), but the people and the place here are a whole lot better dressed and my food did not come in Styrofoam. High marks for the barbecue chicken, mac and cheese, cheese grits, and greens, I did not love the pork chops, but my friend who ordered them was a fan. Didn't try the catfish but it also got praise from the person who ordered it. Our group was made up of New Yorkers, but two of us had spent 15 years or more in the South (NC and GA) and we have eaten our share of soul food. Fun find. The lounge next door looks fun, but we did not have a chance to check it out Next time!

Literally if I could give  less than 1 star I would. We came to this place out of recommendation of a friend who lives here. We are visiting for Afropunk from California. We came here after calling all morning and no one ever picked up. Then we try to make a reservation online and nothings available. So we take our chances and go into the restaurant. The apparent manager Sam says he can seat us for a 4 o'clock reservation, it is currently 3:20. We say no problem and go next door for drinks. We return for our 4 o'clock reservation and  the hostess immediately says she can't seat us because the guys are wearing tank tops. Mind you we came in dressed just like this 40 minutes prior and made the reservation and none of this was mentioned. We start complaining to the hostess and telling her that we made the reservation in person and nothing was said to us. And she says don't yell at me I've been on my lunch. We ask to speak to the manager and he says he was trying to make an exception because of the Afropunk festival but he just spoke to the owner and is unable to make an exception and turns us away. This whole time he had our phone number for the reservation and never called us or anything. He didn't apologize but just said he wish he could make an exception but could not. We waited 40 minutes to be turned away by this fake ass restaurant with these dumb rules. Whoever heard of a dress code for brunch? Don't eat here don't give them your money when they have no problem turning away business. We should have been told from the beginning when he saw the way we were dressed. Not to mention their was a girl in their with Damn near lingerie and nothing was said to her. I saw them turn away 2 other couples as well. FAIL BROOKLYN FAIL I'm attaching a picture of what my friends  had on. DISCRIMINATION

Came here on a Saturday night, made a reservation for 930. We showed up around 940 because there's no parking around the restaurant so it took some time to find a spot. When we got there our table was given away so we sat at the bar for about 30 mins. We finally got seated and ordered our food. We sat next to an incredibly loud table which was frustrating because I could barely hear myself speak. I mean screaming and shaking the table loud! The food was ok, nothing to brag about. Pooch hall, an actor from the tv show The Game, showed up and all hell broke loose! He stood right in back of my chair and took pics all night. Ppl were bumping in to me trying to get a picture with him... Honestly between our table being given away, the loud group of ppl next to me, and the chaos when Pooch showed up, I was completely turned off. The restaurant has no regard for their guests and should've addressed those issues as they were happening.
The food, staff, and bartenders are great.  I usually come for brunch and haven't had a bad time yet.  Definitely be prepared to wait, this place can get packed.

The food was amazing! The staff was very professional and pleasant. There's vegan and pescatarian options. Flavors will make you want to slap ya momma lol! New York Must Try!!!

We went here for a friend's birthday brunch. We were a group of 8 and some people were late so we lost the table. Space opened up at the bar so we were able to sit and wait while waiting for a new table.  The only thing I didn't like was that the hostess seemed to forget despite telling us that our table would be ready soon so that we continued to wait even after the table was ready. Someone from our party had to go ask.  This was around 3pm so the brunch rush was pretty much over.  The bar was pretty slow too because we ordered two pitchers of mimosas to start but they came literally seconds before we got our food. Everything was really delicious though and I have no complaints about that.  I had the sweet potato pancakes, which were huge. They were a little bit too sweet with the berry compote and cream on top but still yummy.  The mac and cheese was the star. It was creamy and soooo cheesy.  I'd happily get that again. My friends got the chicken and waffles,  which I'd try next time.  I would come back but with a small group and definitely stick to your reservation time.

Chic, contemporary atmosphere but food's underwhelming. Not even memorable. Service was a tad slow but it was a busy night. Drinks are good but not enough for a return visit.

I was invited to come and join some friends and mannnn I must say next time, I will be back here by myself! The place the food and the drinks were great!  I ordered the jambalaya rice with a ginger beer drink and I didn't want it to finish .. I was pinching every inch of it! The only thing i would say is that it gets package on weekend .. I guess Brooklyn people don't cook on Sundays lol. Definitely will be back !

Absolutely love Soco. The host accommodated my group after arriving late for our reservation.  Food was amazing. My waiter was great until we were leaving, hence the 4 star rating. He approached someone in my party on the way out the restaurant asking about his tip. I understand the eatery was packed for Easter Sunday but he clearly wasn't paying attention. We paid our bill with 18% tip included. Stayed for an additional 1/2 hr after bill was paid. I'm assuming he had our party mixed up with another party. In any event it was a little embarrassing having a waiter chase us down for a tip that was already taken care of. I'll be back because of great food and past experiences. However, I will stay clear of the waiter who served us to avoid another embarrassing moment.

The food is really, and I mean really good! I came here on Sunday for brunch with my girlfriend. The service was terrible. We waited for over an hour and 30 minutes for a seat. We got seated by the door after all that time and had to flag a waitress down, because no one came to take our orders. That woman we flagged down happened to be the manager, but the quality of service never changed. We got the sweet potato pancakes as an appetizer, it was brought to us with no syrup or water to enjoy. Following that, our drinks took 25 minutes to come out, and our entree took another 25 minutes as well. Over all I am very disappointed with our experience here. The food is great but due to the service I cannot justify coming back.

Service was super slow today. I've been here on a previous visit and had a better experience. What's up with no substitutions on menu items?? All I wanted was garlic mashed potatoes with my steak instead of Parmesan fries less the Parmesan (not requested by the way). Let's not forget the the 15 minute wait to be seated, yet the hostess/managers friend was greeted ahead of everyone to be escorted to the bar. Can you tell I wasn't pleased with my visit today? The bartender made it worth the trip because he made the drinks to my husband and my likings. The food was ok. True grits were the best. I wish they were more consistent in service.

Great food I had the strawberries and cream french toast (too much cream cheese in between the toast, I think it should be something that's placed on the side) the unlimited mimosa (added fresh muddles strawberries were perfect) Tabitha Our server was Attentive and Amazing! keep up the great work.
The food, atmosphere and service were all exceptional. The only negative being my $14 drink had no alcohol in it but I'll definitely be a repeat customer
I love this place - legit the food is amazing ! Hands down the best wings I ever had' and the waffle and chicken Oman super delicious !!!!!!

I've been to Soco more times then I can remember. My favorite dish is chicken and red velvet waffles. There Mac and cheese are the best I've ever had at a restaurant. I love the ambiance as well. To be honest it's hard for me to find a bad thing to say about this place. I would definitely recommend it.
Good food and good music. Next time I'm in nyc I will definitely comeback to Soco. The food came out fast and the waiters were very nice !

I went here for Mother's Day treated my mom she loved her food, we all did! The Mac and Cheese is out of this world! Oh my god it is sooooo good, I had the creole gumbo it was okay hate that they only gave me two shrimp lol. My stepdad had the chicken and waffles he cleared his plate. Overall it was amazing, I am in love with the decor! Only thing I dislike is the crowd it was so crowded but it probably was just that crowded due to us coming on a holiday. The dj is great and I believe it's a live band also. I had the Brooklyn Bellini it was so strong a little too strong. I would love to visit and definitely recommend it to others.

The server Aaron was very nice and attentive. He was always super polite and the food was super fresh. The catfish was very flavorful and the mac and cheese was very cheesy and good. There was so much mac and cheese you could take it home.

Arrived at SoCo on a Sunday around 1:30. It was so packed that they actually had to close the waitlist. We were hungry so we waited 40 mins for someone to leave the bar. When we sat the bartender was so amazing his name was Daniel. He was just very nice and accommodating to us even though it was super busy. I ordered the F-Que wings with the baked Mac n Cheese and it was worth the wait!! I advise splitting the Mac n Cheese because the portion is huge. My cousin ordered the chicken and red velvet waffles but her chicken was dry (so upsetting ). Oh and if you check in on Yelp you get free cornbread so definitely do that ! All in all if it wasn't for the bartender being so cool and cute the experience wouldn't have been overrated. I'm from Boston but I'll definitely be back !

Went here on a friends recommendation, the place has a really nice ambience. Along with the ambience the food was delicious and reasonably priced. I highly recommend the chicken and red velvet waffles, also the mac and cheese is by far the best I've ever had.

This place... So I kind of have a love and hate relationship with this establishment. A couple of friends and I decided on a weekend trip to NY from DC. We heard good things so decided to give SoCo a try. We made reservations on a Friday night and it was packed and busy with a nice booming Brooklyn atmosphere. There were a few celebrities in the house if you're into that sort of thing. The music was great the ambience was nice and the gentleman who walked us to our table was awesome. But unfortunately the service stopped there. After being handed the menu we waited about 20 minutes before we accosted one of the waitresses to come and take our orders. She was friendly enough and told us that it wasn't her table but she'd take our order. Everything on the menu looked so good and we took a glance at everyone's plate and everything looked amazing. I finally decided on the herb marinated skirt steak and it was divine. We also had an order of the cornbread and the lobster shrimp and grits, Yum Yum! The food came out in decent time. We never got an actual server, btw. The cocktails were also tasty. However, the bus boy hovered over our table and made us feel a little rushed after we finished our meals. Even though it was 11 pm and the restaurant was still relatively full. With that said, the food was absolutely delicious and he ambiance was awesome. I would return simply for the food. Hopefully the service will be better next time around...

Came for Brunch. It's a cute cozy spot. The music is loud (just saying for those that aren't a fan of that) and really good. It's not many options but enough and something for everyone. The table all different items and I did taste a few items. The Greek salad caught me off guard when we received the butt of the head of the Romain lettuces. The omelette was GREAT, the chicken sausages were the best I've had. The pork chop was dry. Chicken and waffles: chicken was good not too impressed with the waffle. The fish and chips: the fish was Welles seasoned but it was EXTREMELY oily. The service left a lot to be desired. It was slow and you literally had to hail them down for attention. And lastly the kitchen was SUPER slow. We were seated by 2:15 orders placed by 2:45 and meals received by 4:20 and NOTHING was piping hot. Overall it was a cool place but I don't think this would be a go to brunch for me.

I love love love this place!! The ambiance is great and the food is delicious...try the wings, fried chicken with red velvet waffles and definitely the macaroni and cheese...make sure you rsvp, it gets crowded.

My first time in Brooklyn, so I had to go this highly recommended restaurant. It was packed when I got here because it's clearly super popular but fortunately I made reservations AND they seated us early! The hostess -didn't catch her name but (she had blue braids) she was great! So my experience was starting off right. The only thing I'd say is the wait to give my order. It was busy though so I can understand that. I had the Marci Gras cocktail and it was good. For dinner me and my gf had: The F-que wings to start (they were bombbbbb) Barbecue chicken entree with mash potatoes. She had chicken and red velvet waffles and we shared the Mac and cheese and collard greens. Loved my food. My gf didn't necessarily love the waffle, was too cakey for her taste but everything else was good. Loved the ambiance. The next time I'm in Brooklyn I'll definitely be back here.
The atmosphere was terrific. The food was scrumptious. Prices were not bad and service was great.

Had a reservation for 6 PM & arrived shortly thereafter.  I walked in and wasn't greeted by anyone. I did walk past the sign that said "Please Wait to be Seated". I then went to the bar with my company & decided to enjoy the happy hour menu and specials. I ordered the Mac & Cheese and the Wings as an appetizer & I must say the Mac & Cheese is the best I've ever had, literally. Once settled though, a runner (short, with a gold chain) was talking all sorts of nonsense. He was complaining and speaking restaurant  business in front of guests. He needs to know how to play the game and learn a quiet voice. I then ordered the Mardi Gras & Sangria drinks & they did the job. The female bartender was excellent. A live performer started & she complimented the atmosphere very well. The background music was on throughout the night & it was on point. For entrees we ordered the Steak Frites & Red Velvet Chicken & Waffles, all thoroughly satisfying. Then walks in the owner & Ms. Kenya Moore & she made my night I will definitely be back, great place with good food.

Niiice decor and the host was so very helpful....didn't know you can't order food at the bar and have a table??? Well she fixed that rigjt up for us......food was decent and alot of college up and comings are there but the service was great....I question the girl bartender but the service other wise made up for her.....I have to go back and get my free cornbread!!! Mac and cheese was filling and great the day after....lol

Last night I went to dinner at Soco. For some reason their menu selection got reduced. Was disappointed they took the Branzino fish off the menu. It was an ok outing, nothing to shout about.  Soco was nicer when they were not so popular.  Staff does not get chance to prepare meals properly, when the restaurant is so busy.

Came here for Saturday brunch wit the girls. We found the perfect parking spot a block over but parking can get scarce. The atmosphere was so cozy yet exhilarating. Throwback tunes, brick walls and greenery in the yard where you can be seated. The $12 unlimited mimosas were the best part! Unlimited mimosas for an hour for only $12! The mac and cheese is to die for and so is the lobster grits. The staff is very welcoming and down to earth. I'll be back for sure.

Besides the wait, i was there for the pitcher of sangria. it was just me and my boyfriend and he was driving...i was very inebriated. i ordered the lobster shrimp and grits..it was pretty good but the lobster didn't taste good with the grits

The food is scrumptious... I ordered the shrimp, lobster and cheese grits.  Also, the Mac n' cheese is cheesy but just enough cheese... the fried chicken and waffles is delicious as well.  The fried chicken was crispy, seasoned well not salty and not oily just right!  The waffles was so well made.  The drinks are made so very yummy! It all was made to perfection.  The atmosphere is classy and relaxed.  The service is professional in that the waitress was knowledgeable about every item on the menu and was precise with choices of drinks.  Basically, what drinks compliments the meal ordered.  The food arrived in a timely manner.  Prices are reasonable.  (5  food quality, portion, service, atmosphere, cleanliness)
Food was great enjoyed eating the lobster shrimp and grits!!! Love the warm and friendly atmosphere of the place!!

Went for dinner with my wife and a friend at 6pm on a Sunday and had a great meal.  The food is legit (we had fried chicken & waffles, Jambalaya, fried shrimp, and short rib hash).   The atmosphere was casual and filled with love...  couples on dates, families with kids, large tables with groups friends, and ages from 8 to 68+ represented.  They had a funky electric violinist doing his thing by the bar which added to the cool vibe.

I watched what I ate all week just so I could dig in at SoCo this past Saturday! Everything we tasted was amazing. The margarita though, I thought it was a little weak. Anyway on to the food- I had red velvet waffles with buttermilk chicken (amazing), Mac and cheese (divine. Nice and hot), SoJazzy salad (great, I liked the fried goat cheese), Fried pickled oysters (yum. Had lots of vegetables). My friend had the steak and enjoyed it. Overall SoCo was a great dining experience. The decor is nice and they have outdoor seating as well. It's pretty big in there (bigger than I thought it would be). The waiter was helpful and attentive. Food arrived quickly.

Love the ambience of this restaurant! If you come on a good day love music will be there absolutely would tell a friend to come here for a date or even a birthday gathering...

Came before the rush so I got seated right away! Ordered the Chicken & Waffles, Skirt Steak with Eggs and a side of turkey bacon turkey. Ive read reviews where the red velvet waffle and chicken wasn't THAT awesome but I had to check it for myself! It was alright. The red velvet waffles was a bit too soft for me as mentioned by other Yelp Reviews but I liked the chicken! The skirt steak on the other hand was SO GOOD. It was cooked just right; the spinach & potatoes sides with the overeasy eggs really complimented the steak. The turkey bacon turkey was a good side; no regrets. As for the drinks, the sweet tea with mango is really really good. Hits the spot! Lastly, the unlimited mimosa for $15 per person is such a great deal. Tabitha, my server, always came around to refill that cup! She was lovely and attentive. One con would be that the food took awhile to come out but the overall service was great. I would definitely come back here again!

I came here one Sunday after church with my girlfriend. I've always heard about Soco and drove by a couple of times. I was pleasantly surprised. Everything from the food to the service was great. I definitely see myself coming back here again.

The chicken and red velvet waffle, Mac and cheese, and red sangria were all 5star outstanding!!

Roaches, roaches, roaches. They have the nerve to say it's the neighbors roaches and not theirs. Omg. I was so disappointed i walked a mile from my hotel to joes apartment. My 1st time here, and certain things truly bothered me. The bartender was AMAZING and the DJ playing the violin was absolutely amazing, BUT I ordered Gumbo, it came out cold with TWO shrimps. I sent it back, it came out HOT with only ONE shrimp. The waitress said it was supposed to have three shrimps so she brought me out two more, and there wasn't any chicken in it as well. I'm a foodie and I eat out a lot so I pay attention to detail. They will try to serve you anything if you don't focus on what is coming out, not cool! The place itself was cool but that truly bothered me!!!

Visiting my bestfriend from LA and she lives in the city so we picked this place for brunch. We were serviced by Nelson who was absolutely amazing it wasn't until we were finished that he revealed he was a busboy not our waiter. We didn't even realize we had a waiter other than Nelson! Nelson took care of our table the entire time and continuously checked on us through the entire experience. If you come here, come for Nelson!
Foood was all delicious ... chicken & red velvet waffle, F-que wings , mac & cheese and cornbread( free when check in on Yelp)

Wow this place blew my mind. This was one of the best Mac and cheeses I've ever had and I love my Mac and cheese. The cornbread was so amazing as well. I ordered the red velvet waffle and chicken and my boyfriend ordered the gumbo. Both were very good. My boyfriend doesn't typically like chicken and waffle (more specifically the waffle) but he said he really liked this waffle and so that was a shock to me. So that's a testament to how amazing the food here was. We couldn't finish the Mac and cheese and corn bread but that made for a delicious lunch the next day.

This is first time here by daughter took me out for my birthday the music is great a very nice atmosphere. I will take picture of my food when I receive it

Being from Louisiana, we know REAL southern/cajun/creole food and this place isn't even half of that. We ordered the pasta and buttermilk chicken and waffles, everything was straight up disgusting and on top of that our waitress was horrible. I'm so very disappointed. Please save your money and time and dine in somewhere else.

Nice local joint with good atmosphere.  Chicken and Red Velvet waffles is my go to order.

Had a great time....went for my sister's bday...I love Soco's feel and ambience...only downside was the lighting by our table could've been better.....was a lil dark...Food and drinks were good...i realized couldve just had the appetizers....that was the best part for me.....get the mac and cheese, cornbread and mussels!

They tried to sit us right next to the revolving kitchen door (no way)... So then me and my party sat by the bar. It took forever to grab someone's attention while it was at least five guys behind the bar. There was only one guy making all the drinks while everyone was doing absolutely nothing back there. We finally got our drinks. I asked for a caramel martini and was served something totally different. Oh he let me know there was no caramel after my drink was served. He also stated while serving our drinks that the kitchen was closed. So we couldn't order appetizers, something the hostess should have stated before we were seated. Will not be revisiting here ever again. Most restaurants in Brooklyn start of grand and get lazy with the food and service after a few years of business.
The food is good and the service is a bit slow but the atmosphere for brunch makes you forget all about that...or maybe it was the bottomless mimosas?

This place has a great vibe and the food is always incredible!  Some of the servers suck but most of them are very good.  It's nice to have a Neighborhood spot that people travel to from around the city.  Very popular on weekends.

I'll start first by saying I wasn't going to write a review because I'm a local customer to this establishment and have supported this black owned restaurant since they opened and the food there is delicious. The reason for the 2 stars (used to be 5 stars) The service here seems to be gradually getting worse and worse. Either you can't get through to the restaurant with the telephone listed on their site or in my case, you have an issue with an online order and have the experience that I had this past Friday 8/16. Firstly, The General Manager they have there is a clown. His name is Sean and he's the definition of why you can't give certain people authoritative positions In Hospitality. Without going into full detail, I ordered food online that never made it to the kitchen, even though the online app said it was ready for pick up. Instead of making things happen to avoid any additional frustration for me ( the customer) this "General Manager" is giving me a song and dance about his password not working to log into the website, and a bunch of other irrelevant stuff that I really didn't need to know. Never an apology for the issue or even a glass of water as I sat there visibly frustrated. As I sit there trying to shift my attention while I wait for my food, with a vehicle double parked outside thinking I was just picking up food and leaving, I assumed that this guy had already placed my order. I turned back around and he's standing next to me asking me multiple times if he should place my order? After taking a deep breath and calmly explaining to him that I rushed there from across town to pick up food for a elderly family member that requested it and that I placed the order over an hour prior to picking it up, I was exhausted and needed to know if an order was going to be placed or not. He boldly looks at me and says in verbatim "oh, well thats not how we do things here, you don't just come into a restaurant and expect food to be ready" I was disappointed and embarrassed for him. I was disgusted actually. I just got up and left. I've never seen a general manager act like that. There's another manager there that I usually see and he's always very pleasant and easy to talk to when there's an issue. Soco didn't need my hard earned money that day and they need to get rid of that "General Manager" Sean altogether.

The fried chicken was good, though I've had better. I liked the novelty of the red velvet waffles, though they were a bit mealy and not as fluffy as I'd like. The real reason this meal gets a solid 4 stars is that I absolutely adored the cornbread. It was perfectly crispy on the outside, and soft/buttery/sweet on the inside. I was blown away just by that. All told, I'd come back for that cornbread.

The server Robert, was very inviting made us feel at home took time to go through the menu with us, recommended my drink and it was fabulous. The dinner wow mouth watering steak the collards, uff. It's a definately a go to again..

It took 25 minutes to be seated with a reservation. When my party was finally seated it took another 25 minutes to be given water and then another 15 minutes until we were greeted by our waitress. Appetizers took over 30 minutes to come to the table and the food runner almost gave our apps to another table. Entrees also took over 30 minutes. Wasn't happy with the service, but if you don't mind waiting, the food is delicious. Don't plan to return unless it's a pick up order.

Great brunch spot! The sweet potato pancakes are melt in your mouth delicious. Also pairing the crispy flavorful shrimp appetizer with the creamy grits is a great alternate to the brunch entrees. And the drinks are worth the $.
I love the place, the chicken and waffles are great the mac and cheese awesome and so is the drinks
No comment

This place was great the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars because the music playing in the background, was a little too loud. I had to scream to talk my mom who was across the table from me. The waiter was absolutely fantastic. Overall great the food was amazing & the best part is I have leftovers !

I love everything about this place minus the wait. I've only been here for brunch and everything and I mean, everything on the menu is delicious! You can't go wrong with your order. Will definitely try coming here for dinner.
No comment
No comment

Very disappointed. Been waiting a long time to come here and it wasn't what I expected. I was surprised they take reservations and we were seated right away. The restaurant isn't very big, so between the music, and the large groups, it was very loud. Drinks are wayyyyyy over priced. The website also offers two drinks made with Hennessy, but Hennessy is actually $2 extra. They were still good, though. App was good. We had the mussels and the shrimp rolls. The real problem was waiting almost an hour for our entrees to be served. We all had the salmon, so how long could that really take? And the best part was the food was cold!!!!! Why wait that long for cold food?? Lastly, they charged us automatic gratuity for a party of 5. When we left there was a huge line outside, so I guess they're doing something right, but never again for me.

Pre Valentines Day dinner with my wife. This place had a nice crowd so if you do want to eat here, a reservation is highly recommended. Since we got there 30 minutes before our reservation time, they were really cordial and got us a table 15 minutes early. For drinks, I stuck with Apple Cider draft beer and my wife started with Honey Jack and cola then Rum and Cola. Kudos to the bar for the cold beer and well balanced drinks. We decided to do one appetizer and had the California Shrimp roll, delicious. Only wish they would put six rolls instead of five lol. Our entrees, I had the Buttermilk Batter Fried Chicken with red velvet waffle and garlic sautéd string beans and my wife had the chef special which was a surf and turf with nice rib eye, lobster tail, mashed potatoes and Brussel sprouts. Of course, we shared each others dishes like any modest couple lol. I'm not a fan of brussel sprouts but these were delicious with a nice bok choy style flavor. String beans, waffle, rib eye, mash, all the food was good. Lobster tail was slightly over cooked but was still good. Fried chicken was OK but I have reservations about it. Dessert, cheesecake and smore, both delicious and best part, not overly sweet but perfect taste. Our server was most excellent and entertaining and made the night even more delightful and we thank him for keeping it with us. Look forward to another visit in the future.
Amazing customer service and food was very good I would recommend this place and I definitely will be returning.
No comment

Soco is an oldy but goody! Never disappointed when I go here. The drinks are always tasty (strawberry lemonade is so good), alcoholic beverages are strong but not too much. Now to the food. My fiancé loves the chicken and waffles and refuses to order anything else. I've had the steak, the bbq chicken, butternut squash ravioli (which they recently replaced), mac and cheese, and the cajun fettuccine. All great and would order again!
No comment

No comment

I came here for brunch yesterday and the service was excellent. The food was delicious and so were the Bellinis. Everything was on point and tasted amazing. We had the wings which were perfectly done from the sauce to the meat, the shrimp and lobster grits were delicious and the strawberry shortcake French toast was great, it's very different from any French toast I've ever had (it's stuffed) very creative and yummy. I will definitely be back and suggesting Soco to others.

We had wings to start which were delicious (though messy, typical of wings). The highlight was the red velvet waffles with buttermilk fried chicken. Totally creative and well executed. We also got the iced tea which was out of this world! Would highly recommend it. Lemonade was good but ice tea was definitely superior. The restaurant was packed for brunch but not too loud, luckily.

No comment

Going to Soco was probably the worst brunch experiences I've ever had in New York. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. My friends and I had a 2pm brunch reservation and we didn't get seated until 4PM!! I could maybe understand the wait time had we just walked in, however we had to wait for two hours. They also did not offer us any discounts or apologies for the 2 hour wait time which is unheard of. We even had to go somewhere else because there was no real waiting area and the music was so loud. When we were seated our waiter was inattentive and it took us an additional 30+ minutes to even get our orders in. And on top of that, in my opinion, the food was too expensive for the quality. I would not recommend SoCo to anyone unless you want a 3+ hour wait and mediocre food and service. P.S. I'm from the South and this place doesn't hold a candle.

Came to SoCo this past weekend and really enjoyed myself. The service was great upon entering the door, the food was awesome and the music was real good. I was impressed and I would go back to this spot again.

Food was hit or miss. The blackened salmon had no flavor. The waffle with the chicken and waffle was too dense. Deviled eggs and jalapeño cornbread were good. Execution fell short.

No comment

This was a poor experience. From the nonchalant manager, to the bartender that gave someone else my credit card. This restaurant needs help. The only positive experience was my amazing server. The food at dinner was decent at best; steak was tough and over cooked, jambalaya was bland. The short ribs were good. My expectations were not met.

Let me start by saying the food was worth the wait!...First...we had an issue with the wait time, but the Manager Sean...was very helpful and accommodating in expediting our seating. Alina our Server for the night...a pure joy!...friendly and Professional. During our wait to be seated,  the staff at the bar was also warm and inviting...and serving up a great cocktail...The "Red Lemonade"..Thank you Alyssa!...I highly recommend this place...just make a reservation in advance.

If there were 10 star options then....you know. Soco's is easily my favorite restaurant in Brooklyn. The food is great, drinks awesome and atmosphere chill. Can't go wrong with that good ole jambalaya!
