Went yesterday arrived about 4:30 pm, after driving for 1 hour and 7 minutes (as per  google maps) with a hungry 10 year old, was told they are no longer taking people. I was told the wait would be at least an hour, which I was willing to wait, because I had REALLLLYYY been wanting to eat here. Well the young lady then told me they were not taking anymore "door seating" or something like that, and that waiting was not even an option. ITS 4:30 PM!!! Needless to say I was very, highly, and utterly disappointed.

I'll admit that curiosity led me to Soco. A friend of mine had previously raved about it. Being from the South, I was under the impression New Yorkers didn't know much about soul food. Boy was I wrong! I went with my friend to this jazzy restaurant on a Friday night. We forgot to make reservations. Luckily, the wait was only 15 minutes. We got seated and our waiter Rob immediately greeted us. I ordered the County Sangria. We started off with the Mac and Cheese. The huge portions didn't have us leaving the restaurant hungry. The mac and cheese was absolutely delicious. I ordered the Cajun pasta and it was the best pasta I ever tasted. My friend ordered the classic Chicken and Waffles. Depending on the appetizer, you may want to go straight to ordering an entree. The portions are huge, which is an added bonus!
I love this place especially the waiter Lucas.  He was very attentive.  The food was amazing also.
The food and drink were all amazing! Awesome vibe and decor- definitely going to return to this spot! (I CANT WAIT)
No comment
No comment

I've been here three years ago and the experience was great however this visit was just weird. My party was seated right away but not face-to-face. We were seated side-by-side. Very odd. The food was delicious just like my last visit but this time we decided to stay and talk. After about 20 minutes the server took our plates, serving utensils, napkins and cleaned the table. We were so taken aback because everything happened so quickly. We chuckled at the server's actions but let the greeter know how rude our server was before we exited. She tried to get the manager so we could express our dissatisfaction but I told her I would leave a review.

The food was okay. I really don't know what the hype is about. I really think they need to revamp the menu. The shrimp on the appetizer was trash. They serve you drinks in small glasses. The kids cups are bigger than the glass cups given out.  They even rush you after eating your meals. They clean up so quick don't really give people time to digest their food. They definitely do not say excuse when they rush to pick up the plates and forks smh.

My friend and I came to soco thinking we were going to have the best meal. It turned out to be a waste of our money. The Food was so bland, the presentation was amazing, we left and ate somewhere else after trying to eat what was in our plate not wanting to have our money go to waste!

The restaurant has a nice vibe and the drinks served at the bar are tasty and strong. However the food wasn't as good as it's hyped up to be. The veggie flatbread is huge chunks of vegetables piled on bread with melted cheese and has zero flavor. For the entree, I ordered the red velvet waffles and fried chicken. The waffles were extremely sweet and didn't pair well with the syrup. The fried chicken was just ok. My friend ordered the Mac n Cheese and that was the only thing I enjoyed besides the drinks. The restaurant offers nice music and heated patio sitting but I wouldn't recommend the dishes I ordered.
No comment

I went to Soco to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday and had a not so pleasant experience. Upon walking in we were informed that my bf had to remove his hat, understanding that there was a dress code my bf complied and removed his hat with no issue. However when we were seated, we noticed an Asian gentleman sitting next to us with a baseball hat on. So my bf decided to put his hat back on. 15 mins later as we are eating appetizers and having drinks the same man storms over to us, passing the Asian man, indicating that he had to remove his hat immediately. When asked why the rule wasn't being applied across the board the employee had no words. We asked for a manger and the check to pay for what we ate and left. We went to Wrays next door and had an amazing time. For a black owned business, this experience was unfortunate and embarrassing.

I ordered the lobster and shrimp on white cheddar grits, first time having grits that I really enjoyed, the broth also delicious. We also ordered the chicken and waffles, was told that the chicken was tasty but the waffle not so great, plus it came with a hair. Also ordered the burger, was told the meat was juicy and well seasoned but the portion way too much and the fries were nothing special. White sangria was tasty and heavyish on the wine. The Mac and cheese was the best I've had in a long time and the corn bread was delicious. I was supposed to receive the cornbread for free with a yelp check-in, was still charged for it, but they gave us a 10% discount of the bill for the hair. The music was a good mix of hip hop and reggae but somewhat loud at times. And not sure if the air conditioner is only either on or off but it was freezing at one point. Rating is a 3 1/2 overall. I would go back for some Mac and cheese and drinks.
No comment

This is the 3rd time dining at Soco and as always they deliver. They are closed for a few hours after lunch which is a bit inconvenient so Dinner starts at 6pm. The Gumbo and wings were great appetizers. For the entree round: the chicken and waffles(fan favorite according to yelpers), the steak (buttery, tender and well done) and The Mac and cheese (great go to for a side dish - every table had some) ! For dessert: the fried banana wontons were ok, nothing to boast about.

This is the place to go!!! For brunch , I haven't been for dinner or lunch . So for $15 you get unlimited mimosas and not just 2 or 3 but they COME AROUND , if u drink half ur glass the waiters come around and fill you up again , so basically best $15 ever spent lol. Now the food is great too can't compain about anything , they are known for their red velvet waffles and fried chicken which I never got but my friends have and they love it ,I've gotten steak and eggs which the steak was phenomenal cooked exactly how U want but they put it over spinach which I'm not a fan of , I've also gotten ceasar salad with shrimp but I really did not like it but only because they put the shrimp in BBQ sauce which is not my think but to their defense this is a southern food restaurant, over all fun and just Make sure u make reservations for brunch otherwise u will be waiting for an hour or more !

I must be the only person not in love with this place. But I have been two times and both times I swear I could have spent less money elsewhere and gotten better food. Their drinks are decent; the red velvet waffles are just red waffles and the chicken is blah. The mashed sweet potatoes legit taste like baby food, like pure gerber; I had to give them away and order a $10 side of Mac and Cheese. The Mac and Cheese is bomb, but that's pretty much the only bomb item on the menu. The atmosphere is good though.

No comment

Really delicious food, nice atmosphere especially in the back outside . The staff is very pleasant , I would def come again in the future . I got the red velvet waffles and chicken , along with Mac and cheese . Tasted AMAZING !!

Very good food and great atmosphere. I ordered he wings and the chicken and waffles and was not disappointed at all. The wings were amazing and type sweet, not spicy. The chicken was really good as well but the waffle made it.
No comment

I went to Soco on a Sunday for brunch with girlfriends and had a wonderful time.  We were seated in the rear which I consider would be good for outdoor seating.  We went in the winter and it was cold but the space was warm and very comfortable for seating.  The food was delicious. We ordered drinks which were also good and the waiter recognized a patron from a previous visit.  I would recommend this place as a first date or any date for that matter. Prices were comparable and the wait to be seated was less than 30 minutes without a reservation on a Sunday.
Great Food.... def will come here again and again. Free cornbread with Yelp Check-In.... it was delicious!!

This place truly deserves 5 stars. From customer service to great food to strong drinks, I had an amazing time. As soon as we entered the establishment, we were seated. The gentleman pulled the table out for easy access to my seat. We were immediately greeted by our server. He recommended drinks and in no time brought them to us. I ordered the salmon burger (two thumbs up) and the Soco sangria. My friend ordered the Mac and cheese and jambalaya. I am visiting from Houston, TX, but this will not be my last time coming to Soco.

Juan was our server and he was amazing! Super sweet and knowledgable about the drinks and food.  I ordered the brisket, which was delicious and my friend got the lobster grits and it's a must order when you get here. Thank you for the great service!
No comment
The blackened salmon was niccceee.  Definitely recommend and the Mac n cheese so delicious!!  Will be going again!!

I ordered through Uber eats. Lobster shrimp and grits cost $33. I received not even a full container of grits, 3 small/medium overcooked shrimp and 1/4 of a overcooked lobster tail. Straight robbery and complete bs. Very disappointed. Nowhere even near worth the money. I feel ripped off. Never again.

Love this place!! Had a couple of Brooklyn Bellinis they were great and strong. Only needed two of them. Great spot for a date night/brunch or to hang w girlfriends. Love the atmosphere, they have a patio area for drinking also. Food was better than expected, Mac n cheese is for 2 ppl, collards need more seasoning but were cooked w/o meat...good idea. Would def come back!!
No comment
I went for brunch. The waffles was everything. Plus, the mimosa was divine !! It was a bit small so be mindful of that.

Service was trash. We came in at 10:45 pm for food and they told us the kitchen closes at 11. Okay our fault I guess, so we decided to stay in and get some drinks. Service was still whack af. The waitress took mad long getting out drinks and the place wasn't even busy. The waitress and hostess were basically beefin in front of us and saying she ain't even wanna be there. Basically, if you got time to argue with each other like u got time to serve us something. Only good thing bout SOCO was my sugarcane drink  big favorite. I would send people to soco for the sugarcane drink.

Great restaurant. I'm a vegetarian so the menu isn't that veggie friendly. I order the vegetable lasagna and it was amazing!!!! My meat eating family tried some and they were impressed too! The restaurant staff was great too.  Very attentive but not too annoying. The wait staff was also attentive to make sure our empty plates were taken off the table quickly. I believe the general manager also came over to make sure things were going well with us too. Overall great restaurant, delicious foods and drinks.

I went to Soco last night and really enjoyed the atmosphere,music, and food. The service was great I would definitely come back especially being a black owned establishment.

Lovely food. Prices are a bit high but you kinda forget about that once the flavor settles in. You will be satisfied and you might even go back for seconds if you tend to eat a lot.  Understand that this place is popular and you might experience wait times that you are not too excited about. The atmosphere and relaxed and the service is good. Just about everything on the menu is good so feel free to experiment or keep it original.
Great food ! Had a great time and went with a larger group. Everyone enjoyed their food and we had a great time.
No comment
No comment

The food was phenomenal. Just a warning.. make a reservation first. I am from Queens on Friday night business in Brooklyn. A client told me to try SOCO. So we went without a reservation. They placed us in an enclosed outside area in the back of the restaurant. The seats were cold and the air was freezing. When we asked to go back inside the restaurant we were told those were for reservations only by the hostess. We asked the waitress who confirmed what the hostess told us. They also said the heater took time to heat up the outside area and it will get warm in a few.. it didn't. My back ached and I could not shake the coldness from my body. Eating dinner in your coat is not for me. And yes there were seats available inside
Mamma mia!!!! The mac and cheese... wooooo!!

I just want to start off by saying you must try the F-Que wings and the short rib hash.  This was my first time at SoCo, and it did not disappoint. The food was great and the service was good. I will definitely be back.
I will be back.. The chicken and red velvet waffle is genius! I had the blackened salmon and fell in love. However the price nearly broke my heart ..

The service was excellent. The hostess and both our waiters were so kind and patient. The food was amazing. I had the red velvet waffles and they did not disappoint. The chicken was ok. I've had better but they were still good and I'd definitely go back. The music was nice and I loved the ambiance

Delicious shrimp and grits. May be one of my favorites thus far in NYC. Not too thick and not too runny.  My favorite so far being From Soby's in Greenville, SC. Great music and vibe to go with the great food.

Went here for lunch , service was excellent,  food was very good, I had the mac and cheese and mussels , my date had the salmon with mashed potatoes and strings beans, her food was excellent,  definitely worth the price , next time I wanna try the drinks
No comment

This place is AMAZING. The food was awesome.The music was nice. Best Lobster, shrimp and grits I've EVER had. We requested to meet the chef. Very nice guy. We shook his hand and complimented him on his culinary skills. Were visiting from Cali but will be back the next time I'm in Brooklyn.

The service that you receive here is amazing. My friend and I dropped in after attending a Nudes and Booze event in the neighborhood. We were quickly seated and our waitress was extremely attentive. My friend ordered a modified Surf and Turf, I got the Cajun Creole Pasta and we got an order of the F-Que wings and the Aunt Cruz Mac and Cheese to share. I loved the the creole pasta. It was delicious, everything from the noodles to the shrimp were cooked perfectly. My friend loved the the 'Surf' in her meal. She got the lobster and it was good but she did mention that the steak in her 'turf' was really really chewy. The wings were AMAZING. Perfect sauce, not too sweet but we both didn't like the mac and cheese. Our waitress was amazing she took it back and didn't charge us for it. We ended our night with the strawberry shortcake and it was soooooo good. The cake is warm and the whipped cream is fresh, none of that stuff from the can you get at the grocery store, I wonder if they make it in house... I digress lol but yeah if you're in the neighborhood definitely check it out.... ooo I almost forgot, USE THAT YELP CHECK-IN!!!  That cornbread with the honey butter is BOMB!
Excellent Food, and nice portions Be prepared for the noise level and traffic!   Otherwise it's fun and reasonably priced.

Even though there were some issues with the reservations, Kenya the hostess was extremely hospitable and had a wonderful disposition as well as our server Brian I appreciated their service and will continue to frequent their establishment.  And the food is wonderful as well!

The food was very good HOWEVER THE WAIT IS RIDICULOUS LITERALLY OMG. I can't even exaggerate the time for the food. Literally 1hr. So stupid. Prob will never come back but food was good I don't think it was worth the wait tho!

I visited this restaurant for the chicken and red velvet waffles. By chance I ordered the cheese grits, and they were spectacular. The drink choices were also quite impeccable. The menu is affordable , and  the food is well worth the money .

The food here is to die for!!! Love love love! So amazing the restaurant is small but beautiful. The drinks and service is great. I made reservations so I didn't have to wait on the line which I might add was very long. I guess because of how small put popular the restaurant is. So I would advise people to make reservations before hand. I will definitely be visiting again soon.

So, this wasn't my first time visiting but it was the third time. And they say, third times a charm. So, I had a reservation for 9pm for my friends birthday dinner. I arrived at 9 pm sharp and let the hostess know I was waiting for 5 other friends and that they'd be joining me in 10 minutes. With no hesitation, she assured me that was no problem. They arrived exactly at 910 and then she told me to wait 5 minutes so they could set our table up. Fast forward, it is 930 and the owner or whoever and hostess seem to be avoiding us. Then, it's finally 10pm and I just can't seem to understand what was the point of my reservation if I still had to wait an hour and some change to be sat. The owner or whoever then comes up to all of us and states that he never knew we had a reservation. Long story short, there was a bunch of miscommunication and honestly it felt like we were being profiled which is sad since this is a black owned business. Finally, we get seated and we had to wait 30 minutes for water. The food was subpar and by that point we were all just tired. They offered us a pitcher of sangria but honestly that doesn't make up for the hour and change wait on my friends birthday. I would never ever recommend this place Or even come back.
This place is small, but the vibes are great! Their fried chicken and red velvet waffles are A-1! This is a great spot to go to for after work drinks or Sunday brunch or a nice date.

The food is what saved this place.  Our waiter that night needs more lessons in customer service or perhaps we just didn't get his sense of humor, not sure which.  Either way, the chicken and waffles and the corn bread are everything!  I will step out there and say, they are worth the long wait and mediocre service. (I would even go back next time I'm in NY)

Wow I can't believe I didn't leave a review for this place. I want to say I had the red lemonade though for the life of me I can't remember exactly what I ordered. What ever it was, it was strong! Food wise I ordered red velvet waffles with chicken. That dish was pretty good but the whole reason to order it is to try the red velvet waffles. I guess I'll just say that they were different. In the end the chicken, to me, trumped the red velvet waffles. The skillet mac & cheese was delicious. Must try. I'm actually overdue for a visit!

Nice atmosphere and good drinks and food!  The lobster, shrimp and grits was delicious!
No comment
No comment

The first visit here was phenomenal..you name it ..I was impressed and satisfied with the food and phenomenal service. The food was full of flavor and came out hot. The visit I made with friends so I ended up raving about it to family. The second visit was terrible in regards to the dishes. The seafood gumbo lacked seafood from what I ordered before (the except same appetizer) and the steak I ordered as my entree was tough and just overall a bad cut. The first time I went my same steak came with a steak knife the second visit it didn't. So unfortunately this restaurant falls under the "hit or miss" category for me. I felt like my first appearance here the food was made with love ..second-go-round NOT AT ALL!

Listen...the waiters and employees are so sweet and interactive, very welcoming vibe. The food was amazing, I got the chicken sandwich and it was delicious. Friend got the French toast and it was the best I've had so far. Went on a Sunday and there was LIVE MUSIC and it was SO good, it really made my day and set the tone. Perfect get together spot for friends and a cute spot for a first date or a date night with your significant other. Real cool and calm vibes but it's also buzzing! Def somewhere I would recommend to a friend visiting like I was.

I've dined here during the afternoon and evening. No wait during afternoon hours. Very nice outside eating area. Food is a little on the pricey side but worth it.  Each time I've had the Red Velvet Waffle with Chicken and Mac n Cheese.  The cornbread is also good and is free with this app.

Hands down my favorite restaurant. I loveeee their Mac and Cheese and I love their Brooklyn Brown. Their chicken and waffle is so good. The customer service is really good. I forgot what my waiter name was I think his name was Jabir or Jabari. Either way I had a fabulous time and I will always come back
Perfect customer service and food! The macaroni  was perfect. I recommend the fish and chips and sangria!! The atmosphere, music, and staff were perfect! I truly enjoyed my experience.
No comment

We came here for my mom's 65th birthday I had the chicken and waffles which was good, the mac and cheese is nothing to write home about, but the staff was very attentive and nice. I am a sucker for good customer service and not to mention they have cute decor. I had a good time and would like to go back for brunch.

I came here for my birthday dinner and the service was impeccable!! I had a large party and they made sure to accommodate me, as well as make sure everything was in order! The food and drinks were amazing and all of my guests throughly enjoyed themselves! I will definitely return!!

The food and service was ok nothing to grab my cell and a friend about. The Mac and Cheese was dry with too much garlic. The greens was not fully clean and no flavor,Glory can greens taste better. The menu was over price for what you get, atmosphere was nice thats why I gave it a 3.

Currently ending best friend day with my best friend here. Dinner has been lovely so far. Everything came quickly. The service is amazing. We're now planning to bring our boyfriends back here with us. SoCo for the win!!! I highly recommend this place. The food is delicious and the So-Colada is soooooooooo yummy. I love coconut
Ordered the chicken and waffles with a side of mac and cheese,  food was delicious and service was great.  One of my favorite restaurants for brunch.

Well my family and myself was waiting for a table for about 10 minutes or more (no table wait and it wasn't busy at all). 1 1/2 hour to closing the host put us in the back after I ask him could we stay in the front he said "no the front is close" which is three people in the front already so I was annoyed after that. Then the waitress didn't even ask us what beverages are we ordering I had to find her to put in the order. And the reason for the three stars was because the steak with fries and fried onions was good.

Even though this place is pretty pricey for a graduate student, I still bring my friends who love chicken and waffles to this place. I love love the chicken and red velvet waffles. The last time I went was during New Years Eve, and I had the fried oyster appetizer--can you say freakin amazing? I was surprised it wasn't completely packed, but that was good for us since we didn't have a reservation. The live music (violinist) in addition to the music was great. I can't get enough of this place!

The Mac and cheese can't be beat! I travel from Queens to Brooklyn just for that. The decor, atmosphere, and service make it a special night out. Highly recommend.

I am so happy I booked this place for my boyfriends birthday dinner. We were seated right away which was good. They seated us at one of the tables which I was disappointed at because I wanted a booth but it was reserved for larger parties but we dealt with it. The food service was so fast! We didn't have to wait a long time for our meal to arrive. We ordered the goat cheese pizza which was awesome but a little too much goat cheese for me. I had the jambalaya which is a must if you are trying new things like I did and my boyfriend had the skirt steak which he loved. We will definitely be coming back to try more of the menu.!!
No comment

Chill spot. The doorman is very polite and courteous which I appreciate as some of them tend to be mean and obnoxious. Ravioli with squash was good. Salmon burger was very good. It was well seasoned and a good size patty. The shoe string french fries that came with burger could have been better. The spicy coleslaw was tasty. The cocktail menu was enticing but at $12 -$14 a pop, we had to pass. Overall enjoyed our food and ambiance and would  return.

Earlier today me and my friends decided to do brunch off my recommendation of this restaurant. It was their first time and my probably 10+ time. This place has always had great food and good service but today wasn't one of those days. On a normal visit I would of given this place 5+ stars but today oh no hunny! For starters our waiter came over we asked a questions so she went to the kitchen to clarify something came back with the answer an disappeared for twenty mins. No drink order nothing. A man I'm going to assume was the on duty manager came over and took our drink order. While I watched the waiter run to about three different tables and collect their checks.The waiter finally comes back and takes our food order. This is when real hell began imagine watching people who came in after you get their food enjoy and pay. We sat for an entire hour and half waiting for our food. We enjoyed mimosas on the house but it still doesn't make up for the service. About three tables came in after us and got their food before us. The food was great the service was terrible very disappointed in my experience today.
The service was fast and pleasant and the food was very good. Nice family area and separate bar/eating area. The ambiance was appealing and the music was great. A little pricey but worth it.
Jam packed on a Saturday night and the vibe was great! The food is very flavorful and the drinks are delicious (Maple Sour!)
No comment
No comment
No comment

The service  was subpar and we waited at the bar for over an hour waiting to be seated. They never called to seat us so we just ate at the bar. We would have left if we weren't hungry. The food was decent.
Shrimp, Grits & Lobster Tail....Excellent.  Fried Chicken and Margaritas were good too.
Food is good!  Drinks are great!  Definitely a spot to hang out with " the girls" for a chill brunch!

The food wasn't bad however the customer service was terrible . Our waiter was super unprofessional , didn't write down any of our orders & brought us out the wrong dish . I probably won't ever go back !

Omg great food this place was amazing. Everything taste so good. We got here  right when it opened still got packed pretty quick. There were people already waiting out side. It's better if you RSVP so you can be seated right away. We didn't so we just had to wait 5 min idk why but whatever we waited by the bar. Defiantly will be coming back. I just have to say. Best grits I had in a while. Yum.
Good spot, good ambiance I usually get chicken and red velvet waffles with mac n cheese....I have no complaints

The place is beautiful he vibe is amazing the people are nice but the food just isn't worth it. Everything looks nice but there's definitely something missing. If this wasn't a restaurant I would give them 5 stars but being that food is their primary responsibility it's just 2 stars. People are nice and the music mixed with the jazz guy is cool but the food just doesn't taste the way the place looks.

Cozy atmosphere, excellent customer service. Baptiste was our host, he is very courteous,  his recommendation was on point, was checking on our table from time to time to make sure we were having a good time. The food was De-li-cious. It was my daughter's birthday and that was the place she picked for diner. Her 4th time at Soco I recommend this place to everyone.
Soco is a great restaurant! Mac and cheese and FQ Wings are delicious. Magnificent food along with ambience. Definitely worth checking out when passing through Brooklyn.

Wonderful food, atmosphere and service. great service.  Seated fast, even though the Resturant is pretty crowded. Sausage and grits were great!  Noise level a bit high, but overall, experience was enjoyable. Our server, Rob was the best. We'll be back!

So hubs and I used to go here pretty frequently when we were predominantly in brooklyn. The first time we were here they had a guy playing "pony" by Ginuwine on a violin! Lol needless to say I was impressed. The food is good, I've had the chicken with red velvet waffles, good not great but def worth it.  Also there is a patio in the back that is really pretty and romantic. We may go here for dinner this Valentine's day before we head over to hotel indigo to knock boots lol as H town would say. The menu is on the pricier side for Brooklyn but Brooklyn is the new Manhattan so it is what it is..

This grits w/ lobster and shrimp never disappoints! The grits are great which is no easy feat. The lobster and shrimp are cooked to perfection  and very tasty. I must add the atmosphere is also pretty classy, cool music and cool people always.

it's crazy because I go to church right down the block from soco and i've never been here until this past saturday. and what can i say i was satisfied. the Mac n Cheese is definitely a hit, and honestly it can be shared between two people . i had that plus their famous red velvet waffles and fried chicken which was also yummy. everything was great. i gave them a 4 instead of 5 because of the service. i wish the waitress was actually attending to us and not chit chatting with her friend at the bar. when i tapped her to ask her something she acted like i was interrupting her free time. which was upsetting because her gratuity was already included i wish i could have gave her what she really deserved and not that amount on the paper . but overall my experience was great and i'll definitely be back
No comment
No comment
My favorite brunch spot. I honestly come here for the Mac and cheese. The Lobster and shrimp with grits is Ah-mazing!

The food was great but the service is very slow. I would recommend getting the Mac and Cheese and the chicken. I wish they offered that as a entree but they don't. I gave up on ordering drinks at this restaurant because they are too sweet and the glasses are really small.
No comment

Came here for brunch with my boyfriend around 2pm on Sunday hours before the super bowl. The only reason why we visited this spot is because it is Kenya Moore's husbands establishment (if you are familiar with Bravo's television show "Real Housewives of Atlanta". The decor of the place was very nice, modern with a touch of a rustic vibe. We sat at the bar and got a pitcher of the white sangria, it had plenty of fruits but was on the weaker side. I had the chicken and waffles but instead of waffles i had mash potatoes and greens. Not a huge fan of the greens but the chicken was cooked PERFECTLY and perfectly crispy and the mash potatoes were really yummy. My boyfriend has the sausage and grits and practically licked the bowl, so definitely would suggest these two dishes. Only con was that the menus were pretty beat up and the seating near the bar is very awkwardly set up. Other than that reasonably priced brooklyn brunch!!!
No comment
No comment

Really good food and great atmosphere. Would have given 5 stars, but my last visit was off-putting. I was seated under an A/C vent and it was ridiculously cold. I normally wouldn't complain, but it was becoming unbearable. I asked to move, but they couldn't accommodate due to the size of our party. I was also told that they couldn't turn the unit down because it gets too hot for the cooks in the kitchen (at least they're employee-focused). I would have just canceled my order and left, but I had out-of-town guest that with me and I was excited about introducing them to this restaurant. So I stayed and tried to tuff it out. The final straw was when I got ready to leave. The owner/manager who was greeting people at the door, didn't even bother to tell me to have a nice day or open the door when I exited. Normally, this wouldn't have been a problem, but he did it for the next 6-7 groups that exited after me. I got the feeling he was upset because I complained about the A/C vent blowing directly on me and he could visible see I was miserable during my entire meal (didn't finish it and steeped out-side several times to warm up). I spent way too much money in this place to be uncomfortable and not appreciated for my patronage. I really try to support certain businesses, but the customer service aspect has got to be a point of focus. As a matter of fact, I've just upset myself while typing this. I'm taking away another star

I've been to soco 3 times and each time was equally as excellent as the last! I prefer to sit at the bar, the red headed bartender is awesome (I forgot her name only because I have a terrible memory) and her service was excellent! I had the red velvet chicken and waffles with the Mac and cheese and greens! It was delicious! We checked in and took advantage of the cornbread offer which was delicious! I'll definitely be back!!
No comment

Excellent! I enjoyed my meal and the hospitality of the service. My reservation for three online was granted and I had no wait time. My girlfriends and I had a great girl's nite out at Soco. I really enjoyed the appetizers cornbread & fried macaroni pie. The red velvet chicken and waffle dish was recommended by the server and was delish. My drink, the peach cobbler libation was great. Good taste with the right amount of alcohol. I would definitely come back. I see reservations work there, so I'll make sure to reserve again for my next visit.

Its Saturday and we came here as soon as it opend at 12 , and we got seated promptly . Wonderful service and super cute staff! I had the Farmers Omelette and it was delicious . Next time i must try the Chicken and Waffles because I had some off my sisters playe and it was amazing. The Mac and Cheese is AMAZING! Ugh! So many good things to say. I will be returning !

You better have a reservation on the weekends or forget about it!  However once seated, the service is pleasant.  I highly recommend the chicken and waffles! The maple syrup is the sh*t!

So delicious! The crowd is crazy great. The service is cool, the atmosphere is dope and the food and drinks hit the spot! Brunch or dinner - so good! Loved walking distance and it was always great. Favorites: mussels (app), red velvet waffle, Mac and cheese, shrimp and grits, and so much more
No comment

Was in town during the first day of spring snow storm. I was totally disappointed given the Yelp reviews for this establishment. I ordered the fried chicken meal with sides of Aunt Cruz  Mac & Cheese & yams via Uber Eats. The chicken was not good at all and the yams & Mac were bland one notch up from being inedible. Don't believe the hype of this place.

Had reservations at 6pm and didn't get seated until 6:35. So it started off bad and the food took a little bit too long to come out. Still In all my "buttermilk fried chicken" was on point. (Food is also pricy) and my "Soco island" drink was on point
No comment

Good brunch. Ok service.  Great portions.  Steak and eggs was delicious. Corn bread was delicious. Red velvet waffle and fried chicken was delicious.  Only bummer was it is so impossible, we were asked to give up our table for people waiting.  Fair enough, but we had planned on chatting and having coffee.  The hostess suggested we try Dunkin' Donuts next door. Luckily we walked half a block further to a fabulous coffee place and hung out to catch up.  Enjoy, but you may be hurried.

Great & one of the best delicious tasty southern restaurant in NYC!! Clean & efficient place & patient & politeful employees! Also beautiful neighborhood in Brooklyn, but besides that overall the food is & restaurant itself is well cook & good especially the red velvet waffles; recommend that meal to anybody! Last but not least This restaurant also have a nice little bar in there to relax eat a quick meal & just get to know your date or time yourself
Had multiple people recommend this as the place to brunch in Brooklyn. Went on Sunday, great drinks, cornbread and french toast! All were delicious!

Great brunch experience! The sweet potato pancakes and wings were amazing! The watermelon daiquiri was refreshing. Amy (server) was really nice. And there's a perfect selfie mirror in the bathroom area by the sink. Two thumbs up! I'd definitely come back.
No comment
Definitely wasn't what I expected. The service was very slow and the wings were meh...
Had an excellent brunch at Soco, fish and chips and eggs Benedict with crawfish plus cocktails.  Will visit more often.

The doors opened up at noon, right on time I ordered the lobster, shrimp and grits but it lacked flavor. My husband had chicken and waffles and it was amazing. My only real issue was the restaurant was very cold. If we do go back, it won't be until Spring or Summer time. It's hard to enjoy yourself when your freezing.

This place is pretty amazing. The ambiance is calm and relaxing and the food is great. Of course I had to try the red velvet chicken and waffles and I wasn't disappointed. The chicken was seasoned and cooked well! I also had the Mac and cheese, which could be a meal by itself! But overall I like this place alot. Will be back again.

Came for brunch with some of my friends. The food was excellent. My friends had the pork chop, pancakes, and b54 burger. I had the red velvet chicken and waffles. All were quite tasty. I had a special cocktail called the Mardi Gras which was dope. We ordered the cornbread and Mac and cheese as our sides. Everyone loved them. The Mac and cheese is so garlicky and good

The restaurant had a nice vibe and the waiter did come back often. There was a couple of draw backs.... my Food didn't come out together and I had to wait for condiments  my food was getting cold waiting. I had to wait for my Macaroni and cheese  ( it was worth the wait) it had good favor. Over all I would go back for the chicken and waffles with macaroni and cheese on the side
Amazing service, Brian you're the man! First time in Brooklyn. If you're looking for the perfect date night, this is the spot.

Delicious!! I've been to a few places for chicken and waffle and this one, so far, is the best! My hubs got the steak and eggs and he finished it in 2seconds. The Mac n Cheese not only looks good, but it is so crunchy, yet tender. Will be coming back
Love their chicken and waffles.Mac and cheese is rich in texture and flavor.Whether a day with the kids or meeting a new friend or even date night it is an awesome place to go.
No comment

Listen here. I know you're coming for the chicken and waffles. I know that! But let your friend get that! Have some of theirs! Is it absolutely amazing?! YES! But go for the Half Organic BBQ Chicken... Get some Mac and Cheese for the table and some ribs... I promise you... You will forget how you got there; you will forget where you parked your car; you will forget how long you waited for a table. You will be in for the best food you've ever had! Mind blown!

Here to update my review , dined at Soco a handful of times . The service never lets me down, my server was Daniel polite and attentive ! I enjoyed the entertainment , came for all day brunch  and enjoyed the sounds of a violinist playing over instrumentals . But the food def fell off . Spend your money else where . At 7 in the evening , the kitchen was sold out of the shrimp appetizer and Mac and cheese . I settled for the mussels which came with 1 piece of bread and a bunch of not so fresh mussels. For $22 bucks I had bland salmon on a bed of mashed sweet potatoes and green beans . This place is over rated ; don't believe the hype!
Our booking was for 4pm. It's now 5.50 pm and still we still haven't received even our drinks order. Disaster of a place. And can't hear yourself think over the bloody loud music.

I went here for my friend's birthday brunch the other day. This was like my second time coming here. The first time was years ago and in the evening. I don't remember the food at that time. However, when I went for the brunch, I loved it! I had the sausage and grits. It wasn't the southern style grits that I'm use to but it was on point! The sausage was excellent! It had a nice spice to it and the grits were very good as well. And the drinks were good. The service was good too. I will definitely be returning here again with my husband.

I feel like this place could be a little over rated.  I didnt get to try the red velvet waffles with chicken however I did have the sweet potato pancakes which was good. The drinks tasted like juice and they were a little pricey. Other than that it's a nice small spot.  Service is slow. Try and make reservations and if u do be on time or u will be skipped...  That's how I got my table lol

The drinks are great here , we tried a variety of their speciality drinks and all were good. We ordered a variety of food. I was not impressed. The chicken (and waffles) lacked flavor and was soggy opposed to crispy. The steak was a bit chewy too. This place is also very very warm. We asked the waiter to turn the air on and he told us "No it is automatic". It was uncomfortably warm, made it very hard to enjoy our dinner.

Amazing food. Great atmosphere. The hostess, Shaunda I think was her name,  was rude. She acted annoyed to seat me when my friend was literally in eye sight view by the door taking a phone call. The rest of the staff changed my overall opinion. I recommend the sweet potato pancakes.. literally like heaven. The macaroni and cheese was delicious as well.

This place is amazing! Very cool brunch vibe, we went at 12:30pm and only waited about five minutes. The wait staff was incredibly helpful and nice and the food was AMAZING. You have to get the mac and cheese it's quite possibly the best I've ever had. The chicken and waffles also is not to be missed!

IF YOU HAVE A CAR DRIVE HERE NOW!!!!!! Wow if only this place was reachable by public transportation...I would make the travel for it!! Such good soul food!!!!!!!! While everyone raves about the red velvet waffle with fried chicken, I think the best dish here is definitely the Mac and cheese. It was DELICIOUSSSSSSSSS!!! The perfect crunch with such gooey cheese. The chicken and waffle was good too but the red velvet waffle itself had no flavor. Tasted like a regular waffle. The wings are juicy and flavorful so definitely start with those. They have an extensive list of cocktails....the watermelon cocktail for 2 is amazing!!! Definitely get that! The ribs are super flavorful too!!!! Honestly one of the best soul food I've ever had and it was worth trekking to Brooklyn! I never got dessert here because each time I go Im stuffed midway through my entree!!!
My most favorite place to eat !!! The food is soo good and the customer service is wonderful !!

Ambience, service, food- this place is not lacking in a single area. Expect to wait if you don't have a reservation. Ended up ordering the BBQ ribs as an appetizer and the chicken and waffles. Chicken and waffles were aight, but the ribs took me to another planet. Get the ribs! (I'm not even a rib person)
Anyone who says, "nothing tastes as good as skinny feels" has never eaten here. Get the mac + cheese and the red velvet chicken + waffles. That's all.

This spot had been bookmarked for months and I was excited about trying the food after reading all the rave reviews. I ordered the chicken and waffles that were really good. I also ordered a side of the $9 mac and cheese based on the rave reviews from yelp and was greatly disappointed. The mac and cheese was truly a let down and waste of money.  The ambience of the restaurant is cool and the staff were friendly. Prices were affordable and I would return and wont touch that mac n cheese.

Came here for brunch during weekday. Food was above average. Had the mussels and chicken and waffles. Chicken was seasoned great but over cooked. Lucas, our waiter, was fantastic. Had a blast with him. The bartender was disappointing. Drinks were not mixed well in our pitcher or at all.

This place is well-appointed, with cool decor. The food looked promising as described on the menu but didn't live up to standard expectations (EX the greens are greasy and sweet). Though there was ample staff that were knowledgeable and polite, the service was very poor due to not having enough people working in the kitchen or behind the bar. After being seated at 2:30, we didn't receive our food until 4:00 or our drinks until 3:15! I really wanted to love this place but that kind of time frame is unacceptable. I'm not sure how long a business operating like this can stay in the game. I'd recommend they upgrade their operations/business management and not try to be so "different" in the recipes of staple items. I will not be returning or recommending this restaurant to others.

Ordered the salmon. Didn't care for whatever mash orange stuff it laid upon. Really wanted to try the chicken and waffles but I guess I over looked it on the menu. Setting is Very crowded. But I had great company

The Food At Soco Was Great**** I Had No Complaints....The Staff Was  Awesome!! The Bar is A little Small But the Drinks Was Good!!

I have eaten there twice this week. Service was prompt and friendly. Food was amazing! The atmosphere is welcoming and very relaxed. The dining is classy (better when you have a date). Reminds me of Croaker's Spot in Richmond, VA. Lastly, you have to get the Mac & Cheese; filling for at least 2 adults with an appetizer.

So I have been to Soco multiple times before this experience and never had a problem. How ever this time was a whole different ball game. I was there for a family friends birthday dinner. There were about 12 of us and they didn't know how to host a big party at all. Our waiter was rude and inattentive. To make matters worse, we brought in a cake {because it's her birthday duh} and was told that there is a $20 charge to keep it in the freezer. Seriously??!?! The owner was rude and refused to waive the $20 fee after we spent as a whole over $900 . I found that completely ridiculous and will not recommend soco to anyone again. They forced us to choose from a prix fix menu as well and the entrees were terrible . I hope soco steps there game up and focuses on customer satisfaction rather than making a quick dollar any which way they can get

Nice atmosphere. They had great seating. Although the I stayed by the bar the food was way better then I expected. I would definitely be coming back here for the Mac n cheese. Sangria was very good also.

Just had brunch here today with 9 other friends. We did not have reservations, but were there right when they first opened (12pm) so we're seated right away. Our waitress Sacha started off with a really bad attitude toward me and my friends, when we were very polite and respectful. The food came out in about 30 mins which wasn't too bad of a wait, considering after the 30 minutes we waited for our food, almost every table/seat was filled up. Some of the things we got were very bland and needed salt and seasoning. (Collard greens,French fries, and homefries ...) the jambalaya and salmon was personally my favorite things on the menu. The chicken and waffles looked better than it tasted. 20% gratuity is automatically added to the bill of 5 or more people. I absolutely will and usually do tip over 20% to the waiter/waitress if they provide a good service. Our waitress ignored us the entire time being there... probably because she knew she was already guaranteed 20% tip.. anyways, was ran out of drinks and water twice and she completely walked by us multiple times without even asking if we needed refills... we ended up asking the bus girl in the restaurant to let our waitress know we would like more drinks, and when the waitress came back she was very rude the way she put down our drinks and the way she talked to us... we are a very easy going group and just wanted to enjoy our brunch here :( Over all we were all expecting a better experience than we had today.

I was interested in visiting this location based off other yelp reviews. It has a very attractive menu as well. However the website failed to mention details on a dress code other than a "no hats" policy. It would be very helpful to know that tank tops are not allowed here during the summer. Needless to say I won't be returning to this location as the host was very rude when he asked us to leave. Ah well we were happy to take our business elsewhere.

So I was excited about this place after reading reviews on yelp. So I arrived and sat at the bar for a drink waiting for a table. Just put this way , my bar bill checked out at 8:06pm. I sat at my table watching the wait staff by pass me totally ignoring me for about 25 minutes. That was all I needed to see to exit.... but the food looked good... lol
No comment

This place is so good! I went for brunch with some friends on a Saturday and thankfully we didn't have to wait long for a table. They were having a promotion where if you check in through Yelp you get free cornbread, and damn was that cornbread delicious. Everything was delicious, and the staff were super nice. I'm definitely coming back here.

I like their spin on soul/creole cooking. I recommend making a reservation, to ensure you are seated timely. I love their gumbo and rice and beans, I always order on the side or as an appetizer. They offer a few more sandwiches on the lunch menu that aren't available for dinner. So that's cool. The shrimp Po boy is the only one I'll eat from up here. Not all soggy and gross like other places. Lobster and grits are good, my son always orders it nice flavor not too overwhelming. I order the steak a lot, I like skirt steak, it's best grilled and they grill it just right. I haven't had the chicken in a while. When I last had it I wasn't able to pick white or dark meat, for the price I think that should be an option. I'm a tough sell with fried chicken so it could just be me. That also bugged my hubby. The waffle was freshly prepared and a nice size. The wings are good. Proportions are appropriate, I never leave hungry, I usually have a doggy bag lol. I love the Brooklyn Bellini, Hennessy and champagne with a twist. The drinks are good, not too flowery and egg based, but not boring. I think they have a happy hour, I have to check it out sometimes. I've never had an issue with servers/hosts, everyone was attentive and gave good customer service. I really have to start taking pictures of this stuff before I scarf if down, sorry lol.
No comment

I came to Brooklyn for a concert at the Barclay Center. 8 of my girlfriends and I visited the restaurant on a Saturday night during a busy time and we were able to be sat without a reservation in less then 10minutes.  Our server(Robert?)was very witty and knowledgeable about the menu.Being a restuarant manager myself I was truly impressed especially since it was packed. The food came and did not disappoint. My salmon burger left me wanting more. It was delicious as well as the veggie flatbread, chicken and waffles and mussels.  Did I mention how tasteful the signature drinks were too!! All in all the WHOLE experience was a 10+. I will be making a special trip back to the BK with my husband so he can experience this mouth watering affair... Continued Success!
I have been back several times and it is my go to place. I love the improvements to the food and service.

The first time I went here I was in heaven. The Mac n cheese was probably the best I've had when it comes to flavor. Definitely worth a try. The chicken and waffles were good. The red velvet waffle is sweet enough no syrup needed. It actually tastes like cake batter. The chick was crispy yet moist. They didn't ask what kind of meat we wanted but we asked for white meat and they accommodated us. The atmosphere is nice I liked to sit outside but not really being outside since the weather is not right just yet. The second time we went ordering the same thing we were disappointed. The chicken was sweet almost like a coconut skin taste. The waffle tasted more plain not sweet as before. We were thinking maybe a different cook. Their sandwiches look good maybe I'll try that next. The great thing is both times we've went was during the week and parking was easy and not wait to be seated.

Prime example of poor customer service....we walked in and had to wait for someone to ask if we were being helped, were accosted by security to take hats off like it's not a monsoon outside. After finally being told it was a 5 minute wait for a table, someone else said we needed reservations. 10 minutes later we left. I cant fight for food it ruins the experience....I'll order to go if I ever go back.

I came here last night with some friends to celebrate a birthday, and Soco did not disappoint. I split the half BBQ chicken with my friend and it was tender and juicy with a hint of spice. The mashed potatoes it came with wasn't extraordinary, but it went well with the chicken. The mac and cheese was amazing and the sangria strong and not overly sweet. Although service was a little slow (and, this is a bit nitpicky, our waiter gave us water from other tables instead of giving us a new pitcher of water for solely our table), I will definitely return to Soco for more Southern fusion!
No comment

I just got back from having dinner at Soco and this one star is largely due to seeing a server's acrylic nail on my grits. As part of my meal, I ordered the F-que wings and the grits. Much to my surprise, when one of the servers (a black woman who is bald-headed and was wearing large hoops) came out with the wings and grits, her nail (she had long, red-painted acrylic nails) was touching my grits. Immediately I told her I do not want the grits because her nail was touching it. She denied it and proceeded to show me how her hand was supposedly situated on the plate. I told her check her nail, she showed it to me and said there's nothing on there. I told her replace the grits, I'm not eating it. As I waited, I watched her in the kitchen-I was seated facing the kitchen. She called my server and had her serve me the same plate of grits. In order to not make a scene, I scooped up the part where the imprint of her nail had remained, and proceeded with the rest of the evening. I spoke to the manager before I left since I think it was only fair to inform him before I wrote an online review. I have absolutely no doubt in my mind that this server did not mean to have her nail on my food. However, the point at which you will tell me I didn't see what immediately caught my eye as you were approaching me, her thumb's nail was in my plate and on my grits, then resend the same plate using another server is absolutely unacceptable and totally disgusting. There was nothing wrong in her saying, I'm sorry, it was certainly not my intent to touch your food, I will go ahead and replace it.

One of my favorite Brooklyn spots. I have been coming here for years. Recently had a friend date with my best friend last Thursday night. We enjoyed the SoCo Sangria, it was very refreshing on the first hot day of NYC. As always we ordered the F-Que Wings, Mac&Cheese, The Burger and Fries.All very good options. A place to visit and enjoy.

This place is amazing!!! Customer service was amazing. Seated in 10 minutes took our order quickly, brought our drinks quick (&this was a packed Saturday night) the food was WAY better than I expected

This is my first time at Soco and they good are amazing  the steam mussels super good figure out how they make the sauce because it was delicious  chicken and waffles will full you up that was amazing can't wait to come back and try something new.
