The wings are simply deliciously seasoned and prepared. The red velvet waffles and fried chicken as well as the mac and cheese are classic comfort food cooked to perfection. This place is great if you're ready for a hearty meal and if you have guests in town that want a authentic and delicious soul food experience!

I have dined here about 4 times for dinner and I enjoyed the food and ambiance every time. However, I celebrated my birthday this past Saturday at their Brunch and the service from the manager, Annabelle was horrible. First, at the time of reservation we were not advised the kitchen closes at 3:30 and does not open until 6pm for dinner. Our reservations was for 3pm and we felt rushed with our food. A friend ordered the sweet potato pancakes which she did not like and tried to order something else and was told she couldn't because they were preparing for dinner. If we were advised of this pwe would have picked another place because we like to eat and drink without limits. While speaking with the manager I explained we were not advised of their policy regarding the kitchen but we would like to enjoy more food and drinks. She said we would need to move from our table because the table was booked for another party but we can sit near the bar because there was no waiters available to bring drinks and wait until after 6 for more  food... However, we had an under age person with us that was not allowed at the bar. I explained this and asked what else could we do because we are still celebrating, she advised I can do whatever I like but we couldn't sit at the table anymore because she had another party with reservations for the space. Then sat us in a tiny area in front of the bathroom. By this time it's after 6 and there still was no party at the table she moved us from and we ordered over $300 in drinks and $500 for food. Another worker felt our frustrations and sat us somewhere else. I'm not sure where this lady got here experience from or if she was having a bad day but I really felt because we were young, urban people she treated us this way. Now, I will not patronize this place of business again. This is not the place for a good time while brunchin'... try Ricardo's in Harlem instead!!!!!
No comment

This week was Dine in Brooklyn, so my one of my sorors made lunch reservations for a group of us to eat at this establishment. The food was absolutely delish (Chicken and Red Velvet Waffles). The Bellini was excellent. Beautiful place and the best service! Cant wait to go back; have to have the Lobster & Shrimp Grits!!
Everything was amazing.  I had the pulled pork and Mac and cheese.  I wish I had the recipe for these and cheese. Heavenly. Our waiter Tim was great. Very attentive. I will definitely return.
No comment

I came here for my birthday last year, I like the ambiance...its trendy yet casual. The food was good and the drinks were great. I had the jerk chicken and my date had the chicken and waffles, both were very good portions and decently flavored. The service was very nice they sang happy birthday. Over all the evening was very pleasant.

Great for a night date or lunch date nice strong drinks great food what more can you ask for?! Love the food here! My favorite spot to introduce to my friends. Only thing is the sautéed collards need seasoning.
No comment

My suggestion, get there early! Everything was good I had the jambalaya (my first time) it was good with the perfect amount of spice. I also had the Brooklyn Bellini, strong but very good! Will definitely eat going back

So let me start by saying the good at this place was amazing. I have nothing negative to say about this place. Service was really good. I went on a weekend for Brunch and the food was delicious. I ordered red velvet waffles with fried chicken, baked mac and cheese and fried oysters. The food was so good and the baked mac and cheese is a must try. I would definitely recommend this place and will definitely be returning when it gets warmer since they have outdoor seating. Great place. A must try!!

I just returned home from dinner with the hubby. I had the steak with collard greens and a side of Mac & Cheese. Hubby had the short ribs with potatoes. Food was Delicious. We had a great anniversary dinner date ( without the kiddos!).

To start we had the cornbread and the popcorn shrimp. Both were tasty and great apps. We had the sausage and grits and the red velvet waffles/fried chicken as entrees. Sausage and grits was amazing. Super flavorful and rich. The fried chicken was the best I've ever had. Highly recommend this place.
No comment
No comment
Cool place, it's always packed. My favorite drink is the chocolate martini Red. The red velvet waffles and chicken is pretty decent.

We went here for Sunday brunch and after a few minutes got a seat at the bar. Apparently they had stopped taking names for tables until 4 pm... we ordered some drinks and waited a while to order food. We decided on the gumbo, fried oysters and flank steak and eggs. After 45 mins our food arrived. While everything looked and smelled delicious we were appalled to see the tiniest portion of flank steak hidden under 2 eggs. And sadly, for 18 dollars, I just couldn't enjoy it. After briefly speaking with the manager about it she agreed to send another piece. Overall the experience was good.
Had a great time here when I visited New York. Awesome place, great food and good vibes. Loved the wings and pork chops. Great service too. Very personable staff.
No comment

This is mine and my husbands go to spot for saturday brunch! $15 all you can drink mimosas paired with amazing buttermilk chicken & waffles. It is a must that you have to start off with the Mac & Cheese, it is to die for !!  The service is wonderful and atmosphere is nice and trendy.

Everything we ordered was good. The pecan crusted pork chop was a bit dry but still had a nice flavor. Every table around us kept ordering the mac & cheese and we collectively decided that we must be missing out on something so we threw a last minute order in and it was worth it. They must season the cheese sauce with something heavenly, maybe garlic? Either way, great music, great decor, attentive service, what more could you ask for??  I will definitely be back to SoCO. Be sure to do your Yelp check-in here for your free order of cornbread. Anything free usually tastes better. :-)

The grits are life changing. The cornbread is wonderful. The chicken and red velvet waffles were good, but I think I was over sugared by the end of the meal. This is no complaint against the seasoning or flavor of the meal; rather, be mindful of your own sweetness tolerance if you decide to order this. They give pretty generous portions for the price. I thought service could have been a little better, but the place was really busy (because it's so damn delicious) that I can't really hold that against them. Overall, I encourage everyone to check the place out. Support Black business and enjoy some life changing grits!

Exceptionally tasty food and even more exceptional customer care! Made a large order from SoCo through UberEats for delivery to my job. Part of the original order initially didn't arrive, which the carrier informed me. I was almost disappointed because I heard about how delicious the Chicken Family Meal is and really wanted to share the experience with the rest of my family. Before I could contact UberEats Customer Care, I received a call from Customer Care on behalf of SoCo's MANAGER apologizing for the inconvenience, and even better, reassuring me the other half of my order will deliver to my home address! Not only was my order delivered within the time promised, but the manager called to confirm my family and I received it! The food was worth the wait, served hot and delicious, and definitely worth the price! Thank you again Mark and SoCo for making my family and I feel like valuable customers!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I went here for a birthday dinner...They have really good customer service.....The food was good especially their wings....the bartenders also show alot of luv when pouring alcohol (Jose Cuervo silver and sprite $10)......The crowd is a mix of mainly young hipster black people.... However i do hate that the restroom is 1 person at a time....The patio section is decent however  alil on the small side....There is plenty of street parking around the area....I definitely plan on returning!

The food and vibe here is fantastic! Lunch and dinner provide a nice atmosphere and terrific food! I know the mac and cheese is what most people comment about but I looooooove the blackened Samon with the mashed citrus sweet potatoes! There is a full bar with fancy cocktails but I was so focused on the food I can't remember what I had! Either way my only complaint is that it was hard finding a good parking space :-)

There was a bit of a wait when I got there but the service was good. I ordered the red velvet waffles which overall were tasty but the bourbon syrup they gave me didn't compliment them and had a bit of an after taste.
No comment
No comment
I've been here a few times.  Very professional staff and a very classy restaurant.  Make sure you get the fried chicken and red velvet waffles!

I live in Brooklyn so I am able to go to Soco often for brunch or dinner. The food is amazing (which always prompts my return visits). However the service has been awful each time which is a huge disappointment. After my visit today, I have decided that I will not be back as the great food does not excuse the poor service experience.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Sooo I came here for the first time for take out. Man am I glad I didn't pass this place up. The menu is pretty straight to the point BUT don't be fooled! The quality of food is magnificent! I got the strawberry shortcake French toast. It was so good! I was actually surprised because it has a cream filling inside. It also comes with a side of fluffy whipped cream. DEE-LI-SHUSS!!!! My boyfriend got the 54 burger sliders. I think there is a letter before the 54 but yuuuuuummyyyyyyy! MM! The food portions are very satisfying and everything was made to perfection. The service was nice but we were taking out so its not like we had an ongoing experience for the time being. Definitely try this place. You will not regret it. It's a cute little establishment too so go on a date there or get some drinks. They have specials :)

Cornbread fantastic, staff friendly. Cheeese grits cooked in lobster broth however not a fan favorite. The combo of grits. lobster broth, sausage, and a fried egg wasnt a good pairing. I was not pleased with my food but will still go back. Beacause we had to wait so long for our food the manager comped us the mac and cheese. That mac and cheese was AMAZING!!!

one in every of my remaining favorite for brunch. The french toast is to die for! typically approximately ten minutes for a table. they've a patio place inside the again, it is cute however appears closed off in a way. I often endorse this place to many human beings while speak me of brunch spots.
Food was great.  service wS prompt. Very nice environment. I really enjoyed myself. I ordered the steak and egg. With bottomless mimosas.

This place has the best chicken and red velvet waffles! They truly do not disappoint! The wait time is not long at all and the service is amazing! Also their cornbread is to die for! Great location too! Absolutely love this place and look forward to my next trip there!
No comment

I heard such good things about SoCo so I had to check it out for myself. I made a reservation for 2 on Saturday at 6:00 pm. We checked in with the friendly host & were  seated promptly. We had cornbread (free after checking in on Yelp) & the Mac & Cheese as our appetizers. They did not disappoint. The cornbread was just right & the Mac & Cheese was the bomb! I ordered the molasses braised short ribs with collard greens & garlic mashed potatoes. It was soooo good!!! My friend had the lobster, shrimp & grits (another amazing entree). For dessert, we had the s'mores, yummy! Overall, I will give SoCo a 5 star rating. I will soon be returning to try their signature dish: Chicken & waffles. So many people ordered them & they looked scrumptious. See you soon at SoCo.
Make sure you get an appointment and come in time, but once seated the food and service is pure bliss. Loved it.
Food and service is great....my boyfriend and i went for the first time and I think we will be going back pretty often.

Place was very nice.  Came on a Friday night- very busy but we were able to be seated right away(party of two).  We checked-in for the free cornbread which was superb.  I had the blackened salmon and it was good but not the best salmon I've had- a little on the dry side. Presentation of it was nice though. My boyfriend had the half-chicken and he loved it and was a large enough entree that actually made him full (doesn't happen often!).  We also shared the Mac-n-cheese which was great but rich. He had the Ithaca IPA to drink and I highly recommend it, I tasted it too- had great floral notes.  I had Malbec and it was great as well but maybe not worth the $12 price tag.  All in all, great place in our neighborhood and we will be back to try other dishes.

SoCo was AMAZING! The food was incredible, drinks were AMAZING! I was in a group of five. I had the lobster shrimp and grits which was incredible, a friend had stuffed strawberry fresh toast and loved it, two had the sausage and the grits and enjoyed it, but wasn't a big fan of the over easy eggs, and another had the red velvet waffles and fried chicken (HUGE portion). Service was okay, but we were sitting at the bar so I wasn't expecting anything amazing.
No comment

From the hostess to my server , everyone was awesome and accommodating ! Being that I work in restaurants I know this isn't always given so I loved how they were ! Super friendly too! I checked in with  yelp and was given the free cornbread that  was ammaazIinnggg! I believe theres a top coat of brown sugar on the cornbread, it's not something I'm used to but was yummy none the less and free lol . I had the Mardi Gras drink , the nutmeg was strong but still very good. My boyfriend had a blue Long Island and he loved it. He ordered the steak frites with fries and fried onion skins and he said it was aammazziinng! He was saying how amazing the meal was a day later lol (he's ate good steak at steakhouses too so that's says a lot). I had the jambalaya, OMG! It was peerrffeccttiiooonnn!! Huge shrimp too! Very filling too. One of the customers did spill my drink on me and my server gave me a drink on the house which was very nice of her ! In the end she came out and sang hbd to my boyfriend with their strawberry shortcake dessert and he loved it . In conclusion this spot was perfect from the food , to the drinks , to the service! I loved it . The restaurant is very cute and more spacious then I thought and the music was nice too . Thank you Soco for the experience I will definitely be back soon

Absolutely my favorite restaurant in the neighborhood, and probably one of my favorite places in NYC. The food is excellent and they will never let your drink get low with the mimosa special. Everyone needs to try this place!!!

Food in good. But beware ordering takeout is impossible. Waited 1 hour at the bar (for takeout) bc the system was down and no one thought that it would be proactive to inform the customer so they just let us wait around, it was made clear it is more important to the bartenders to focus on making drinks (tips) then taking care of prepaid seamless orders. Over horrible experience after driving a long way JUST for $60 take (cold soggy mess)

The food is delicious but I've been to other brunch spots and I got great food for a cheaper price. The unlimited mimosa for  $15 is not unlimited. They cut us off so we did not recieve the whole hour cause the kitchen closed. We did not  like that at all. Also, the waiter charged my card twice which I dont understand how that error couldve happened cause my friend has her picture of her family on her card. Overall, the food is great but the atmosphere was bland. There are other great live brunch places priced for less with better services.
Love this place! Always a great vibe! Music is good, food is amazing; staff is friendly enough. I especially enjoy the Hibiscus drink (favorite)
Still dreaming about their Mac & Cheese. One of the best in the city. Top 3 in Brooklyn. Service is always awesome. Food is perfection. I wish I lived in Brooklyn. I'd be there way more often.
No comment
The food is sooooo good! Only thing is they do not have any good drink deals, especially for brunch. The drink I ordered was not that good either. But the food itself is 5 stars!
No comment

I have nothing bad to say about Soco.  From the food to the service they remain one of the first places I recommend for brunch or for drinks & dinner.  I'm not a huge fan of chicken & waffles that someone other than my mom makes, but I'd eat there's again.  Their drinks are great too.

I'm not sure what others may have experienced but I love soco and my favorite bartender is my girl Tasha!  We have been coming over 3 years and have received great service with good food. I am very fair and honest but I am picky about where I spend my money and I'm happy to spend it here with Tasha and the rest of the Soco crew. ; ) Try the bbq chicken and the mac and cheese.
No comment

Came here for brunch and ordered their lobster, shrimp and grits. It was pretty good had a lot of flavor the shrimp and lobster came out hot but the grits were warm. If the grits were as hot as the rest of my food I think I would have enjoyed it more. However, the meal was still good. And the atmosphere is nice as well. They play music and have pretty good service.

This place is fantabulous!! The ambiance, the mimosas and also the chicken sausage with cheese grits and scrambled eggs! Service was amazing! I had been meaning to come here all summer long and to finally make it, I was extremely happy! Service and people were super friendly! It was busy, but our wait was only about 15 minutes, which we were told it'd probably be 45 minutes...even better that they were able to get us in 30 minutes early. Will be back!!
No comment

Where do I begin?? The red velvet waffle, the buttermilk chicken, the mac n cheese, the sweet potato pancakes, the drinks, nothing short of amazing! Great food, lovely vibe. Definitely busy during weekend brunch.
No comment
Friendly staff. Food came in a timely manner and it was amazing. I hate everything red velvet but the waffles were great. Definitely will return

Incredible food and great service. Portions are huge--great for sharing! Went on Wednesday for the the first time and came back Friday night for a second round. Try the Mac and Cheese and the Barbecue Chicken!
No comment
Amazing soul food. Delicious! The ambiance sets a nice relaxing enjoyable mood. The staff were great, friendly and efficient. Definitely recommend!
No comment

First time in this place and I enjoyed it. We went on a Saturday night and was a nice atmosphere. My food was bomb and so was boyfriends. I ordered the lobster, shrimp and grits. I think they could've gave me some shrimps.
No comment

Did not deliver to my expectations. Food tasted like a cheap version of stereotypical southern food. My steak dish was cold and obviously not made to order. My wife did like her fish dish though. To top it all off, I felt hassled when asked to remove my hat at the door.
No comment
Nice ambience. The food was portioned right and tasted good. I had the barbecued chicken with garlic mashed potatoes along with mac & cheese and country sangria

Love this place especially the mussels appetizers. That's really all I go for. I'm addicted to them. The service is always great. I never had to wait for a seat and I always sit in the little outside area that they have in the back. Always a good time when I go there.

Beautiful space! I loved the ambiance and the servers' uniforms (jeans and a shirt). In observance of Father's Day, there was a special brunch menu. I ordered the $14 strawberry shortcake French toast. It was definitely different, but I was disappointed because the cream cheese overpowered the French toast. Though I loved the place, I would not recommend this dish. Whenever I revisit, I just might order the red velvet waffle and fried chicken, which my friend ordered and loved.

This is one of my favorite spots. Love the chicken and waffles meal, chicken has a little kick to it giving it a unique flavor while the red velvet waffles taste good. Also had the soul fried chicken sandwich which was good too. Mac and cheese was okay. I don't think you can go wrong with their chicken meals, they are cooked tender and very tasty. If you want to ensure that you don't wait a while to be seated, make reservations in advance. Will come back to try their other meals.
One of my favorite spots in BK. Nice ambiance and good food. My go to's are the chicken and waffles or salmon with mashed sweet potato.

I hoped to provide this review directly to the restaurant, but had no luck doing so on their website. Still, I hope this reaches the right person. With no reservation, myself and four friends were able to get seated quickly. The food and drinks were great, but the service left a bit to be desired. I felt the staff almost nudging us out the door. First, our server never offered us another round of drinks, despite our empty glasses. The staff was focused on clearing our table and boxing our leftovers the moment that we relaxed our forks. Then, when their hints weren't enough, our server flat out asked us to leave so that they could seat a party with a reservation. So, we took our coins up the street and bought two more rounds at Five Spot. Still, Soco left me with a sour feeling. I don't live in NYC, so I could chalk this up to differences in dining culture, but nah. We weren't there that long. And even if we were, we were paying customers who were willing to continue running up the tab. My friends seemed unbothered, so maybe it is a NYC thing, but I refuse to go back to a place that made me feel so unwelcome.

Soooooo good! Went for Sunday brunch while visiting NY. I was running late for a reservation and they were very accommodating. Small but trendy. Loud music. I ordered the Louisiana shrimp and grits DELISH! My husband ordered the steak and eggs.  Great flavor although they overcooked the medium steak 2x.  The waitress was great and sent it back and discounted our bill.  We also split mac and cheese, soooo good. Everything was FABULOUS!!!!! Highly recommend!

Food is okay, but they're very pricey. You'll see your bill and really look to see if a mistake was made. I take this place as a try once for the experience and go elsewhere after. Really nothing that sticks out too much about this place besides the jambalaya.

Love it love it love they call it southern comfort but to me it has a New Orleans vibes..I don't know if u call New Orleans cuisine southern comfort but I enjoyed my brunch I had the chicken and waffle they waffles are red velvet and it was delicious...our waiter was attentive and very nice...the decor was simple the seating is just a little too close to the next person but it's not too bad I'm starting to notice a lot of restaurants that are doing the same close seating thing which I don't really like...but I will definitely visit this restaurant again...oh I forgot to mention I also had their lobster shrimp and grits which I can say was very tasty I had the sauce on the side..I didn't care for the tomato sauce to much
2nd time dining here. Food is amazing, very filling. Nothing negative to say...great service overall! Would definitely dine at Soco's again!!!

I had this place bookmarked for a while and was just waiting for the opportunity to visit. Finally for my mother's birthday I decided there was no better reason. I had a group of 6 so I got to try a few dishes. I decided to order what they are known for and get the chicken and waffles, I am glad I made this decision. The waffle was so good and not overly sweet and the chicken was crispy and well seasoned. My sisters skirt steak was tender and the pork chop was very good as well. I loved the free cornbread that came by checking in on yelp. They also have fun and tasty cocktails. We shared a pitcher of Sangria and it was pretty strong. I definitely plan on coming here again.
Great decor ! Killer playlist! Choose the outside area of possible. They do enforce a dress code, they didn't let my brother in because he had a tank top on. The Mac n cheese is DIVINE !
No comment
No comment

I came for Sunday brunch I expected to wait but to my surprise it wasn't bad. The waiter Juan was attentive and made sure we were ok. The food came out on time and was so delicious. The Mac n cheese lives up to the hype. Do yourself a favor and come give them a try.

This is the best soulfood place I have ever been too. (And I have been to quite a few) Made a reservation for 2:30 Got there at 2:15, immediately seated in patio area. Our waiter came over right away. He was very nice, answered all of our questions, gave suggestions. (I think his name was Brian). The table ordered shrimp, lobster and grits, chicken and red velvet waffles, fried pork chop with greens and mashed sweet potato. And a side of Mac and cheese. EVERYTHING was good. Seasoned and cooked very well.  Even my picky sister loved it. I will def be back!
Our waiter Crystal was amazing!!!!! Our food was awesome. This was the perfect Sunday
Food was amazing and service was great as well...you have to get here early about 1pm...if not your waiting forever...love this place!!!

I tried the chicken & waffle because it was one of their popular items, but I didn't think the waffle was that great (it didn't even have the taste of red velvet). The chicken was good though (seasoned). My favorite item of the night was the mac&cheese.

Honestly, one could order anything on the menu and be quite satisfied. Came here for my birthday brunch and tried just about everything on the brunch menu. I was thoroughly impressed. Wonderful eat. Enjoy!
No comment

I came with my BFF to celebrate her birthday.  We made 10p reservations and I was presently surprised to find that we were seated before 10p.  Our waitress was nice.  She checked in on us a few times and was very pleasant. I ordered the Chicken and Waffles and my friend ordered the short ribs.  The waffle was tasty but I'd rather it be a little more crunchy on the outside but it was still very tasty.  The chicken was so-so.  Ive had better. We also ordered the chicken wings for the appetizer which was very good. It came with a sauce that tasted cucumbery (lol..just made that up) and it complimented the wings very nicely.  My only problem was that the damn tables were so close together. When we originally sat down we had enough space to sit but then they put another table in between us and the party next to us.  There was no way that anybody could fit through without pulling the whole table out. I was just glad that we left before they could actually seat anyone at that table.  Overall we had a nice time. They are a little pricey but it is worth it for special occassions!!!
No comment
No comment

When Soco's first opened the food was so good. I used to go often with friends and family. After today's experience I will not be going back again. The place has gone down hill customer service wise. I don't even want to explain what happened today but it ended up a shouting match with managers and servers, we paid over our check amount and was to that we shortened them $211. The server had no idea how to calculate the tab correctly. It took about 1 hour for her to figure out the bill. It was quite a mess. The food has also lost it's zest. The red velvet waffles and fried chicken used to be so good. I don't know what has happened but the chicken portions have gotten smaller and the waffle is horrible. Soco's has truly lost it's touch. People will still go because it's a "hot spot" or they know no better. Everyone will have a different experience but after going to eat there for years and now will longer go back, that is saying something. Our entire party of 8 was disappointed and will not be going back. Some of them it was their first time going to Soco's.  First impressions didn't go well. Bye Soco's it's been real. Lost some loyal customers today 2/17/19.
Beautiful restaurant. Nice ambiance. The day I went they had this amazing violinist. The food is good and the staff was very good also. I will be going back.
No comment

I went to Soco for my bday. It's really nice inside. The hostess was pleasant. Our waiter was quick & very attentive. The food was Fabulous. I had the red velvet waffles & fried chicken. Mmmhmm. My friend had the salmon with sweet potato & string beans. Yummo. I will be going back for sure!!

They lie about the wait. She told us we were next And then we stood there and watched at least THREE parties get seated before us. When we asked for the second time we got an 'I don't know'. That's unprofessional!

So for a couple months I've been excited to try this place. Well yesterday I went and I didn't enjoy it as much as I thought I would. The chicken with red velvet waffles wasn't cooked well enough for me. . I did enjoy he mac n'cheese thou. I would not be going back.

This past Friday was one of my many times dining at the restaurant. All my previous visits were stellar, prompt service, positive attitudes from staff and quality food. However this past Friday I hosted a group of 15 women for my sisters 35th birthday with high expectation of what I planned to be an enjoyable evening I was severely disappointed. Our waitress was extremely inattentive with minimal knowledge of the menu. The waitress didn't immediately take drink orders, we sat for a long period of time before we were addressed. After ordering our entrees our food arrived at our table approximately 90 minutes later. The waitress did not come to the table to offer consolation or and update, instead she held a nonchalant posture. The manager was immediately alerted and offered excuses for the poor service. At the end of the night the expectation in every establishment in the civilized world would be for the manager to compensate the party for the subpar service, but not this manager he never once offered any discount or even offered complementary dessert for the honored guest. This was not only a disappointment but it was an embarrassment for myself as the host. I've elected to inform my friends, family and professional colleagues and even those I may not care for to refrain from patronizing this establishment, I've never paid a $900+ bill and was totally unsatisfied in every senses of the word. A one star rating doesn't adequately support my displeasure.

Came for brunch with a fairly large group, maybe around 10 people and was seated within 30 minutes. I ordered the chicken and waffles because I was curious on how a red velvet waffle would compare to the traditional. I had high expectations from reading the various reviews on how great their chicken and waffles were but unfortunately, I was disappointed. The red velvet waffle was flavorless and didn't seem to differ from the traditional.

I've been here several times and the food was good the mac and cheese is always a hit. This time around not so much. Came on a Friday night with three of my friends, sat by the bar ordered five drinks and about 6 dishes.  Only thing that tasted good was the mac and cheese everything else wss blah. (Maybe they changed the chef ). O.k. fast forward bill comes and it's  $219 (for what?). These nutcases had the nerve to charge us 20% . They can't be serious.  It's not about the money I'll play whatever for food but the food better be fantabulous and the service to die for. I'm going to stop writing now cause I'm getting mad all over again.
Great food and great customer service! I had the fried pickled oysters, corn bread and the jambalaya. Everything was delicious. I'm definitely coming back!
Amazing food! Got the grits, which were immaculate. I highly recommend. Make sure you go when they have performances!
Wonderful meal. The same as it was when it first opened. I ate my meal for three days. Well worth the troop to Brooklyn.

I've been here multiple times since they first opened in the neighborhood and the food here is delicious. Amazing garlicky mac and cheese, crispy flavorful wings with a twist instead of your average buffalo wings, love the well seasoned burger with crispy thin fries, solid shrimp and grits, delicious cornbread and of course their really interesting perfectly cooked chicken and red velvet waffle, even the salads are balanced and awesome. It's a bit pricier for just a casual lunch or weeknight dinner in the neighborhood but a great spot for a date, family get-together or girls night. Sundays can get busy and loud due to the brunch crowd. The service is overall okay but can be slow at times.
No comment

My new favorite spot amazing food wonderful service and great music :-) I came here yesterday for my friends birthday and was blown away by the type of service I was getting .. The waiters were extremely pleasant I will definitely be coming here again. P.s they had a violinist playing as well which was another added bonus

I've been going to SoCo for years and they have never disappointed me. I ordered the Chicken and Waffle (red velvet). When I say the chicken was juicy it was JUICY! And of course the waffles were good, I put a decent amount of maple syrup for some sweetness. Oh! Make sure you check in and get free cornbread. It was delicious!!!

It was super cold so I was craving some soul food to warm my body up. I checked my bookmarks and Soco popped up! I made reservations for 8:00pm, showed up at 7:45 and was seated promptly. Everything was going great, I loved the vibe and then I met the servers. I was ready to order but nobody approached to take my order. I asked a passing server to take my order and he gave me a dirty look and walked away. Another server then approached me and took my order. I ordered bbq chicken, chicken and waffles, garlic string beans, mussels and Max & cheese. After putting my order in, then came the waiting game. The mussels came after 20 minutes; and then I waited another 20 minutes for the rest of the food to come. In total I placed my order at 8:00pm and I got my food by 8:40. Everything tasted delicious and they were all in huge portions. Sadly, I can only give this place 3 stars because the service was just that bad. I honestly would not return back to here because I can get good soul food elsewhere with better service.
No comment

A tad bit expensive but worth it. The food is Southern and the menu is what you would expect. Not Tex Mex but legitimately soul food. had a party of 5 and the food was good. It may have been a busy time of the evening because our waiter was nowhere to be seen at the time. It was a little frustrating to wait for a refill on water when your mouth is burning from the spices in the food. Aside from that, I enjoyed the decor and the table we had was perfect.

Pretty good food. Unlimited mimosa brunch only on Saturdays. I prefer to sit at the bar. My dude Brody from Portland is the killer bartender. Definitely try the red velvet chicken and waffles as well as the fried chicken sandwich. On Sundays this place will get overrun with loud black women. I love em...but they loud! LOL
No comment

Every time I've eaten here I've never had a complaint! The food is delicious and the staff is courteous and attentive. I do however wish they had more options around brunch time. Other than that I love soco

From the atmosphere, to the staff, to the food....5 hands down! I came here mid afternoon after work & got right to it. I ordered the (typical lol) chicken & red velvet waffles & a side of white cheddar grits when the food came. I had the sweet tea which was incredible & the bartender hooked me up with a little more of it for free! The food comes out....the presentation was amazing as I expected. The waffle was great & also my first red velvet dish ever & the chicken was hot, crispy & seasoned by Jesus Christ himself! It's kinda out of the way for me to just jump up & go to, but I'll definitely be back. Damn that chicken!!! Realistically you're looking at $20+ a plate, but definitely worth every cent! Or dollar in this case...Enjoy!
No comment
No comment

Overall experience is average. I would stick with Cajun/creole dishes. Other dishes are not memorable. service is lackluster, not as attentive as you would like. Noise level is high where you have to scream to hear each other. There are plenty of other great options in the area.
No comment
No comment
Food was good drinks were ridiculously small like $12 for 6 oz thats crazy. That alone dropped the 5 star to a 2
No comment
I love the food & atmosphere. The portions of food are large. The drinks are delicious. Great service. Affordable prices. I would love to visit again soon

I'm not happy when I have to give a black owned or anything restaurant  a negative review. Well after watching Atlanta housewives I was very much interested in eating here. So I when I got the chance I hopped on it. First being greeted by the door man who was very pleasant and asked me to remove my cap, which I thought was a bit much because I thought that only pertained to men but ok I entertained it and followed and was then granted entry and was then met by well let's say a person that could have used a tick tac and then was told that there was no seating. But the host was kind enough to swat us at the bar and it was happy hour so it was a win win I guess. Being seated at the bar we were met by a young African American sister who was very busy and was definitely I believe trying to handle the load of drink  orders they bombarded her. So I ordered my happy hour drink and my partner order a drink as well and we put in our order which was deviled eggs shrimp  lobster and grits and the blackened salmon and the Mac and cheese the salmon came with a citrus mashed sweet potato, which I'm not a fan of so i asked if I could have the red beans and rice and I was told that that could not happen.  So the waitress called over the host and he says no we can not change it but I can give u the garlic mashed potatoes instead I said cool . Food arrived and I was disappointed the Mac and cheese was terrible dryyyyyy like a desert  but the rest of the food  welll it was meh‍ I don't recommend u traveling from far to venture here. But if your a local and like rude bartenders well bon appetit

Stopped by on a Saturday night . It was crowded but excellent service nevertheless. Had the chicken and waffles , Mac n cheese , lobster n shrimp grits and the ribs appetizers . All were delicious . Maybe the best Mac n cheese and shrimp and grits I've ever had .  It was that good !!
No comment

I placed an order online for pickup and updates were made regarding the process & preparations of my order. When completed, I was charged. I took an Uber to go pick up my order. However, to my realization the restaurant was closed. So help me understand how an order was made/received & processed by the restaurant if the restaurant is closed?

Chose this spot near the Irondale theatre and it was pretty ok.  We ordered the mussels appetizer - pretty ok.  I had the fried oysters and ordered the mac & cheese.  ORDER THE MAC & CHEESE.  It was so good I couldn't leave the leftovers behind, so I took it home and had its deliciousness the day after.  yum.  My friend ordered the jambalaya - whoohooo - spicy!  Nice that we tried this place, but seems like it caters to mainly regulars...

After reading all these GREAT reviews about the mac & cheese, I finally went to Soco. I ordered 2 orders of chicken and waffles (one for me, one for the Boo) and an order of mac & cheese. We brought the food home, I placed the food into the oven for a few minutes and my kitchen all of a sudden had a strong garlic smell. The mac & cheese was OVERLOADED with garlic, beyond belief! We rarely ever throw food in the garbage and guess where that mac & cheese went? The photos I've seen of the mac & cheese are deceiving. There was not one ounce of cheddar, it was all white cheese. The chicken and waffles were nothing to write home about. Chicken lacked seasoning, had NO flavor at all and the syrup was heavily diluted, we just grabbed some good old Aunt Jemima from the kitchen. I should have saved my $54 and made my own damn mac & cheese for 1/6 the price. Will not be going back. So disappointed.

If I could curse on here, I would say I F***ing love jus place. I go here at least 12 -15 x a year just for brunch! Staff are friendly, food is excellent (especially red velvet waffles and chicken with a side of Mac n cheese). Drinks are very potent lol. Best date vibe as well. Also, you'll probably run into some of your favorite celebs here as well. Always recommend this place whenever friends need a date spot or someone is new to the city.
No comment
No comment
Food is amazing but the wait is ridiculous!!! Good lord...after waiting over 2 hours the waitress also takes forever to take our order.
No comment
No comment
Food underwhelming but drinks are good. I tried a few dishes but they all seem to lack something

Excellence in everything! Customer service, food, drinks, atmosphere. The wings are absolutely melt in your mouth fantastic. Mac and cheese....no words. I almost cried how delicious it was. Steak with the garlic butter cooked and taste to perfection. My new favorite spot!

Food is alright but the first time I tried eating here the bouncer or whoever wouldn't let me and my friend in unless she took off her hat (a fashionable fedora) and yet I see people wearing all kinds of hats (baseball caps, knit caps, etc.) in the pics posted. This place is far from upscale so I don't know what his problem was.

My friend and I came in on Mother's Day, and were able to grab seats at the bar almost immediately, so we didn't have to wait for a table. Service was nice and relatively quick seeing to as they were very busy. I ordered the sausage and grits, which was sooooo filling and delicious. I also got the mango'ed mezcal, and that was on point as well! Also tried their sweet ice tea, it was bomb! Definitely trying the mac n cheese and chicken and waffles next time!
No comment

Love Soco, been here 3 times &all 3 experience were GREAT! Never had to wait long for seating, always less than 5 minutes. The waiters are nice and the whole staff. The FOOD IS DELICIOUS! Always get the buttermilk fried chicken &the mac and cheese &it always does me justice!

Celebrated my sons 18th Birthday here last night. Just a small dinner for four but we all enjoyed ourselves.  Upon arrival I believe their may have been a mix up with my reservation but whatever the case the staff worked it out with no inconvenience to me. Very professional and courteous. I don't recall my servers name but she was great as well.  My son wasn't fond of the fact that our table was next to a door way that opens out onto the enclosed patio but he got over it very quickly. For appetizers we had the ribs and wings and both were very tasty ( I seriously considered getting an order of ribs to go).  For dinner I didn't love the sauce that my short rib was braised in and there was a lot of it but it was super tender. Around the table the red velvet waffles and chicken and mac and cheese was a hit. My son loved his grits but thought the seafood was a bit chewy which usual indicates that it is over cooked. He enjoyed his dessert I believe it was banana wontons oh and I had a bourbon mango something drink that hit the spot it was nice and strong.  Overall great time.

Amazing food and intimate atmosphere is the main things I have to say about this place. Came here for a girls night out but would definitely be back for a cute date night. Amazing southern cuisine in the city, you really can't beat it. Didn't even get a chance to take a photo because the real life picture was even better!
No comment
No comment
Waiters are kind of rude but the place speaks for its self the food is always good and hot straight out of the kitchen. I enjoyed myself and the music is always on point
No comment

I wanted so badly to love this place but I was underwhelmed. Music was good if you were able to actually hear it over the very poor acoustics. Check in was very poorly organized and confusing. We had the chicken and waffle, Cajun pasta, collard greens and mashed potatoes. Food was average at best. The chicken and waffle didn't even come close to the one I had at Sweet Chick. Wish our experience was better but unfortunately we will not be returning.

This food has a weird after taste. I ordered the chicken and waffles; the waffles were okay but the chicken was disgusting. The chicken had a very nasty after taste. And I also ordered the baby back ribs as an appetizer it tasted okay at the moment but after my mouth was on fire it was too spicy. I also feel that it's way overpriced. I will not recommend to go there !!

Omg, I gave this place five stars.I loved everything the ambiance was nice, the waiter was great, the food was great. The mac and cheese feeds four it was great.  The topper was I had a honey jack and ginger ale.

We went this past Sunday for brunch. Was greeted by a lovely lady and was seated immediately. I love the ambiance, very chic and hip. Staff was friendly. Food was AMAZING! We ordered steak and eggs, red velvet waffles with fried chicken and of course the mac and cheese (to die for). My mouth salivates just thinking of it lol. I really have nothing negative to say about SoCo. Definitely going back soon.
No comment

Extremely impressive!! We had heard about the vegan options that were available here and decided to give it a try. Our family is vegan, so my wife and I enjoyed an incredible meal at Soco. Our server, Kyle, was very well versed in the options that we had available. We got two appetizers; the Boiled Peanut Hummus (vegan option without butter on the toast) and the Korean Fried Cauliflower ( which does have honey). Both of these were outstanding . We decided to get their signature vegan option for the entree, which was the black eyed pea ravioli, which was also outstanding.    The entire experience; the ambiance, the service and the quality of the food was very much appreciated. We HIGHLY recommend this restaurant as it offers some incredible vegan options, although limited in number, and some incredibly unique non-vegan options.
No comment

I was not impressed from the hype that was given on this place. For $75, I spent I could cooked myself. Service was dull. Food was very dull. How do you have lack luster syrup with a waffle? It was just terrible. My friend and I were very excited since we were visiting from DC to come to this place and it was a complete let down. I advise you stay at home or go to your grandmother for better southern food! Or come here if you want dull service where the waiter checks on you once through the entire dinner and the host has to get your check... just messy! No ice in your water. Who wants luke warm when it is 85 degrees outside? This place is very overrated and I just expected more!

I went for brunch and i have to say it was a nice laid back place. The food & drinks were amazing, i had mac & cheese, fried chicken. My date had the chicken & waffles. The waiter was very attentive he got us a shot of whiskey on the house.
Their lobster shrimp and grits is amazing.Loved their desert strawberry cheesecake.Service was bit slow.Overall good.Definitely recommended.

Love , love, love this place. I made reservations and went there for my birthday.  The table was ready when we arrived and the food was just great. This review is long over due so I'm not sure if I had any negatives to say but I do remember I enjoyed every bit of my experience at this restaurant!

Came here for the first time yesterday and LOVED IT! Made reservations and sat down immediately. Our waiter Lamar was very attentive and personable, he checked in on us frequently and made sure we were doing fine. I ordered the Mardi Gras (so good and strong!) And the blackened salmon with a side of the infamous Mac and cheese which was worth every bite. My bf has the chicken and waffles which he also loved. Only con was the seating arrangement, tables were so close that the party next to us kept tipping over our table when passing through. Other than that, this is a perfect place for a date night, girls night, bday outing!

Yes my favorite place before a movie ... Carribean Martini on point, Blueberry margarita delicious, Macaroni & Chees Great ...heavy portion, shrimp rolls yum yum, pickled oysters good, red velvet waffle and chicken love it, fque wings also good !!! I love Soco!!!
No comment

Visited SoCo today. We made reservations for 2:00 for 4 people. We arrive at 1:55, sat at 2:05...... First person who came to our table was Nessa, whom was NOT supposed to be our waitress but came bc she seen us just sitting there, at 2:25. She was VERY nice and professional. We finished our food and ordered another round of drinks. Nessa drops the drinks off at 3:30. TINA comes right behind her and asks us to leave our table and go find some seats in the front due to them having another reservation. Excuse me?! NOT OK and VERY UNPROFESSIONAL. We also made a reservation and was ignored for the first 30 mins of our reservation. Spent $220 and the only thing worth it was Nessa, the drinks and the mac and cheese. THAT'S IT.

Ugh. This overly pretentious establishment.  I went to SoCo on a Thursday evening, last week and the "greeter" welcomed us. I was pleasantly surprised because my experience hasn't always been the greatest. They did however live up to my expectation. Before we even say, " for two" the very same greeter is telling me I need to remove my hat! Are you serious?? I am looking at him perplexed because I just can't comprehend what he's saying to me. Before I could even argue with this person, my friend says 'let's go." We went to Putnam's and had the most amazing food, customer service and quite a few compliments on my hat. Thanks for nothing SoCo. Last time I checked there were no Michelin stars behind your name. Get a clue. You just lost another one.

Man this place is spacious, hip, and has the best velvet waffles I've ever tasted. The service was spot on the environment was filled with a sorts of people from varies backgrounds. I had brunch there and let me tell you something, either make rsvp, come early, or be prepared to wait for a minute if youre in a party, if it's 2 of you then seating isn't an issue.
No comment

Came here with a friend after I saw pics of their infamous red velvet waffles. We ordered the chicken and red velvet waffles with Mojitos. The food and drinks were good; I guess I was expecting the food to taste better though.
This was my first time at Soco and I must say that the food was really good. The service could use some help, but overall I was satisfied.
Came here for dinner with a friend. Food was good,  staff were pretty friendly. Music was a bit loud but was overall a good time
No comment
No comment
No comment

I came with a few friends for a birthday dinner, it was quite a few of us. Our waiter Crystal was literally the best. She took care of us and made us feel extremely welcomed. The food was to die for and I'm not kidding. Before Soco I didn't even like cornbread. I had tried it many times but I didn't get the fuss over the dry bread that felt like I was munching dirt. Now Soco is the only place I go and order corn bread. If I could find the words to describe it I would but just know it's not dry dirt. I had such a pleasant time that I just had to write a review. In fact this is my first review ever! I give service a 10/10 and food an 11/10. .  I will be back!

So we went there this past Saturday for my friend's birthday ( March 23, 2019) the service we received was HORRIBLE from the waitress Crystal. At first she forgot some of our drinks and then the food wasn't good at all ( never had spicy salad before) We had a party of 12 and when our bill came our waitress Crystal took the cash that we gave her, instead of putting the cash towards our bill ( we saw her take the cash out of her pocket) STAY CLEAR FROM THIS RESTAURANT, CRYSTAL IS A DAMN SCAMMER. I was so disappointed by this restaurant.
No comment

Went to the restaurant at 8p on Friday. If want a table right away you have to make reservations.  The wait time is at least an hour.  The food was fine but will still return again.  I had the short ribs for my main course.  The portion sizes are big. If you get appetizer I recommend sharing.  My only negative is the wait time for drinks and food to arrive.  The waiter was nice and apologized for the long wait time.  He gave us corn bread while we waited.

Amazing food. Are here on my first trip to NYC in 2015 and made sure to come back here last month. I even order extra and brought it back home with me. It's that serious. I love the chicken & waffles, the cornbread, & the Mac & cheese. The atmosphere is nice too. Dress how you'd like but if you're wearing a hat, they will ask for you to remove it.

I came here on Halloween and ordered the Smoked BBQ Chicken with mashed potatoes and string beans. It was soooo good. The chicken was moist, well cooked with the right amount of flavor.  The string beans were sautéed in garlic and the mash potatoes almost had the perfect texture. I was completely satisfied. My friend had the buttermilk fried chicken with the red velvet waffles. I didn't taste his chicken, but I did try the waffle. The waffles were bleh.  It honestly tasted like flour and it did not have a waffle texture. It was sort of like sweet, gummy bread . Also it did not taste like red velvet either. He enjoyed it though (I can't understand how) . But I will definitely come again and try their other dishes (except for the waffles).  The wait staff was good, I had no issues with their wait service .
No comment
No comment

Went there twice. Red velvet waffles and fried chicken are sooo good. Chicken is seasoned well and not greasy. The waffle is tasty and moist. The ambiance is great, vibe is positive, and music is great. I love this place! I nice southern and Caribbean menu with some Italian. I'm trying the Mac n cheese next time. I hear it's awesome. Went there last night for brunch on a Sunday and I was impressed by the digital violinist. The area is is nice too. Clinton Hill is gentrified but the area is nice and quiet with a non crowded opposite of Manhattan.
No comment

Love this place. I've been here twice and have yet to have a bad experience. The people are all super nice and helpful. The food is always really good and the drinks are good and heavy (in the best way) I do suggest getting a reservation.
No comment

Amazing!!! The pecan crusted pork chop is to die for. The red velvet waffle and chicken is pretty good as well (though not as good)... the drinks were great (the peach cobbler was bomb!) The mac n cheese was a bit more like pasta Alfredo than baked mac n cheese, but it was good-- though a bit on the pricy side ($10 just for mac n cheese). Service was good and the live violinist played every good song you could imagine. Highly recommended restaurant!!!

I wouldn't go there again. I was put off by the terrible customer service that I experienced. I went with a friend of mine a year ago. We felt very uncomfortable, as the bartender's expression was as if he was doing us a favor providing any service. This is unfortunate because the atmosphere felt very snobby. This was not the case years ago.
No comment

Came for brunch! Man before noon, about 20 people lined up outside! Glad we had a reservation! Food was very delicious. We had Grits with sausages, Fried chicken Waffles, Hoagie sandwich, and the Lobster Grits. Portions were good and we finished our plates!
No comment
No comment
No comment
The food was good. However, service was very slow. This will not be a good choice if your in a mood to get in and out. Also, it's a bit on the pricier side.
No comment

So disappointed! I come here often. So often, but I decided to bring my family here for Mother's Day. What a bad decision! Wanted rob substitute fish instead of chicken in the chicken and waffles meal. Our waiter Crystal, rarely came to visit our table. Our food was cold and when asked to speak to the manager, Sean, he was very cold and I'm unconcerned with our issues and concerns. Very disappointed as I have been a loyal and frequent customer at this restaurant. It's unfortunate that the family members that I did bring, were turned off and probably will not come back.
No comment

column3: Town of Islip, Long Island, NY
column6: No comment

I did a reservation online the day before I went, I called the next day to confirm the appointment a female picked up,she didn't know exactly what I was talking about so I explain to her that I did a reservation online for 5 she told me there was nothing available for 5 but she have something for 6 so I said ok, she also said she would give me a call back and never did, so I called back and a female pick up the phone again and I explain the same situation to her she also was confuse so she also said she would give me a call back and never did, last time I called they told me to just walk in, I got there and waited hour and a half to be seated only one person name Matt ask if we would like a cup of water while we wait, finally we got seated and the food was ok after we finish eating  and payed the bill  the manager came over to us and ask if we could step over cause he have another big party I was very upset instead of him coming over there to apologize for all the miss communication and wait, he had the nerve to rush us up ,never again, this incident was on February 16th around the time 6:15pm to9

Visited SoCo this past Sunday around 2pm for brunch with my cousin and it was good, nothing special, but good. I had the chicken and waffles and she had the eggs Benedict. We were seated fairly quickly only waited about 15 minutes. Food didn't take long and her drink was strong.  My poor cousin ... lol she was still hungry after her meal. We also saw someone we dined next to hit the pizza spot around the corner after. All in all not a bad experience. I would come again if I was in the neighborhood but wouldn't go out of my way to do so.

I regretfully have to give my two cents about this restaurant. The first time that my girlfriend and I attended this restaurant we were delighted to great customer service, ambiance, and pretty good food which led us to try it a second time...an unfortunate decision. After a long work week, the only thing that we had on our minds, was good food amidst a relaxing environment for us to unwind and enjoy..what we received was discriminatory behavior based on my appearance in the form of me simply wearing a baseball cap no other crazy attire included  (I happen to be a queer woman of color mind you). I understand the concept of having a "dress code" to deter specific types of people or more importantly creating a certain kind of environment (non-hostile), but please train your staff to not only have concrete answers as to why these rules are set in place but more importantly as a business owner, BROADCAST this so that people are aware of this before spending money to get to your establishment, being seated, and then asked to leave because of a "baseball cap". And do realize the "people" be it black, white etc.. that you are attempting to attract come in different packages...sadly we won't be coming back.
Soco's food is the best . They never disappoint on the mussel appetizer , the chicken and waffles and the shrimp and grits
No comment

This place is incredible. The drinks are beautifully crafted, and the food, to die for. I usually order the red velvet chicken and waffles and they've always been prepared perfectly. The waffles are not too sweet and the chicken has so much flavor. I also order the mac and cheese and the steak. There isn't a thing on the menu that I've tried that I didn't like. And the vibe here is great, the crowd is always dressed well and the atmosphere is electric. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for some good soul food.

Fun brunch place! Definitely make reservations. Got there at 11:55 (5 minutes before opening time) and it was already crowded. Ordered way too much food but totally worth it. Favorites were the gumbo appetizer and the side of cheddar grits. Would recommend.

We are coming back here, not alone, but with some friends. It takes passionate food to make people drive to a different state for food. Joyous portions, well sautéed taste, and satiety, all at one restaurant, hard to come by.
No comment

I was very excited to try this restaurant after hearing great reviews from friends and it lived up to my expectations in terms of food and ambiance. However, I made a reservation for 5:15, arrived at 5:08, and was told that the kitchen does not open until 5:30 and that I should wait at the bar. Why allow me to make a reservation when the restaurant isn't open????? If I wanted to go to a bar I would have instead of this restaurant. I ultimately wasn't seated until 5:45. That was the only sour spot of my evening. I felt scammed into buying drinks rather than coming just for the food, which was my intention. Felt highly unprofessional and I hope the restaurant will plan against this in the future and only allow for reservations during hours in which they are open.

Absolutely delicious! Had a cozy table in the "greenhouse" filled with beautiful plants, under a rainy night sky. Chicken & RED VELVET waffles- oh goodness! Mac/cheese & salmon also terrific. Can't wait til tomorrow's leftovers- lol!

Soco use to be me and my daughter's spot a few years ago.  But we have not been back since she graduated from high school 6 years ago.   She now has completed her MBA and we had a bit of nostalgia and decided Soco will be the place celebrate this accomplishment.  First, although it was  not as busy the host took a while to acknowledge us, but when he did he was very nice and welcoming. However, while I waited for our group to arrive I notice a few things. The place is in need an upgrade. The tables and chairs are chipped and it seemed to be a bit old and musty for the gravitas of the festive occasion.   Food is still just as good, but as much as I use to love Soco, I will not recommend as a place to celebrate any special occasion.
Good spot. Chicken and waffles are probably most popular and the Mac n cheese tastes great as well. A lot of seating and space, definitely want to make reservations though.

This place was great, the food was delicious though a little pricey. $10 for Mac & cheese side, $14 for sausage grits and eggs and $13 for a martini. Drinks were good and strong. The whole vibe to this place was great, soul music in the background, eye candy for everyone from servers to bartenders. Great service. Only negatives: 1 & 1/2 wait, and prices.
No comment

First time here at this resturaunt and the experience was great!  Customer service from the time we came in the door was hands down the best.  The atmosphere was live I must say.  The drinks were the bomb and the food was great as well (especially the Mac n cheese). My only complaint is I wish I could've had a larger glass of water. But I will be definitely coming back!

This was the most amazing restaurant I have ever been to.  The food was absolutely delicious and I mean everything was SUPERB.  The music was amazing and the atmosphere was incredible this was the perfect place to have my birthday dinner celebration.   We loved everything.

Food was delicious. I wouldn't say it was mind blowing or a "must comeback" however if you're looking to try a plate of good southern comfort, you should definitely try Soco. The plates are nicely presented and the night atmosphere is great. The waiter is ok. She charged us a 25% gratuity when we only heard from her 3 times during our whole meal and when we tried to call her she wouldn't respond or we could not find her because she was busy. Maybe it was just a chaotic night since it was crowded but one should still maintain a professionalism which must be maintained. This is a definite must try however for any willing to experiment or try new things. Also be warned, its in the middle of nowhere. Only train close was the G :(..

The Jambalaya was great and so were the drinks. With this being said the response time for us to receive our food and drinks could have been a lot faster, we received our drinks 20 minutes after we had placed the order and like I said the food took awhile also. But other than that no complaints..
Nice quiet restaurant with decent space and kool ambiance.  A bit pricy, however the food was delicious.  The chicken and red velvet waffles was like none other.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

So this spot was recommended by a fellow Brooklynite as the "new brunch hot spot". The area of SoCo is firstly a great strip in Clinton hill. The hostess was very accommodating in switching my table to an outside one  (even though the restaurant was packed). Onto the food, you cant come to SoCo without trying the red velvet waffle and with fried chicken. Disclaimer: I'm not a waffle person nor am I a red velvet person, but it was AMAZING. the music playing in the restaurant provided a great ambiance for a Sunday brunch. Also, the mango lemonade is delicious. I'll definitely be back.
After a much needed break from SoCo I have returned and couldn't be happier with the service and the food.

It was my first time at this place and loved the food & atmosphere.  My guest and I ordered the jambalaya and chicken and waffles which was delicious . Will definitely come back. What I didn't like was how rude the hostess/waiter  was when I entered the restaurant . Both continued their conversation as if they put themselves before the customer. Very rude of them. Besides that ,the overall visit was a success. My father and guest enjoyed the Father's Day lunch.
No comment

The entire atmosphere from entry was very comfortable. We waited about seven minutes to be seated. There was a violinist that played popular songs, old and new, and he kept the crowd VERY entertained. The waiter, Danny, was very helpful. And brought water for us right away. He was very attentive, and he helped us choose our appetizer and entrees, of which both were very delicious. He drinks were also great as well. I ordered a Soco Island, and it was strong, but not overpowering, and still flavorful. Would I recommend this place? Absolutely.
No comment

Great atmosphere awesome food and pleasant people. It was my birthday and they treated me like family, even though I  got to my reservation late. They held their end of the deal with class and i couldn't be more graceful.

Nice spot to hang with friends or celebrate casually. Drinks are good red velvet waffles and chicken were my favorite . Parking is available nearby on the street can get crowded in the evenings call ahead especially if it's a large group

The Service was Horrible. The hostess was very rude to my party & I. She seemed overwhelmed & incapable of managing her position.  When we arrived, it was extremely difficult to communicate with her due to her lack of attentiveness. I had a reservation for 2:30pm for a party of 6, She literally sat down the next party of 6 because she Assumed my party was not in attendance.  After 25-30 minutes of waiting, we asked her to update us on our seating and She replied sarcastically with an obnoxious Attitude.  Her Behavior was Unprofessional and Totally unacceptable.  I was Looking very foward to eating here at SoCo but the service was not Inviting at all.
Bomb brunch!!!! Wasn't a long wait for a Sunday brunch . Very polite and great customer service from the host, bartender to our waitress . Cool vibes and great scenery!
No comment

So I decided to have dinner at Soco last Saturday.  Where do I start?..I booked a reservation online for 530pm arrived and had to wait 45 extra minutes to be seated because the kitchen doesn't open until 6pm (not shown anywhere on their website by the way)..hostess was hostile AND rude..music was way too loud..so loud you couldn't hear yourself talking..food was horrible..I got the jambalaya..the worst..was soupy and too spicy..they removed the short-rib flatbread from the menu (use to be one of their best items) yet it's still on the online menu.  NEVER AGAIN..I promise..NEVER

I was introduced to this place by Chef Roble via Instagram. And ever since that day I've made it my mission to visit one day . I live out of state . But I was visiting family on a weekend . So I decided to take advantage , and make a little trip out to SoCo. I ordered the Lobster ,shrimp & grits entree.  Being a Florida girl ...I'm extremely picky about my soul food AND seafood. Man , they did not disappoint. The lobster and shrimp were seasoned to PERFECTION! And the grits were the right texture..nice and creamy! I also ordered the chicken and waffles to go. I had it for breakfast the next morning it was pure heaven!  Culinary taste bud heaven! Can't wait to come back!

I've wanted to try this restaurant for so long and never was able to until today. The food exceeded my expectations. The Mac and cheese and Soco Island are must haves. My waitress Crystal was the bomb. Will definitely be coming back.

This was an amazing find! All the food is hearty and rich and it's very welcoming in its staff and atmosphere. The mac they serve us super rich and cheesy and the gumbo is slightly spicy but filling. My dad got the shrimp poboy and the jalepeno poppers and he loved both. It's right next to Pratt University so if anyone is visiting Brooklyn in the Pratt area I would definitely check it out! Hopefully they think about opening different locations westward so that Hawaii can try more of it

This place is horrible, they employ thieves. Food was ok then the bill comes, our waitress, Crystal, was given $208 in cash that was never applied to our bill. She overcharged all of us and pocked our money in the confusion.

Red Velvet pancakes are amazing. The chicken is juicy and very well seasoned. The corn bread is incredibly soft was very healthy portion size. Will be back again.

Its simple: great food, great attentive staff, and the mac and cheese to die for! I have tried several mac and cheese shops and this is by far the best! Make sure you don't leave without getting the MAC AND CHEESE!!
Very attentive sever. Our server was from France and did a great job. The food is also really good, very authentic southern cuisine. The shrimp poboy is the best menu item and I highly recommend it.

Came here with a group of friends for brunch and the food was very good! I love the ambience and vibe of the place! The staff was super friendly. Please note everyone in your party must be in attendance before they will seat you. No exceptions lol. I will definitely come back here again!

This is one of those 'one and done' kind of places for me. The food wasn't mind blowing or even out of the ordinary for me but it was overly expensive at the same time. For those that may be wondering, the chicken in the chicken and waffles dish is not boneless. There is also no sauce except for maybe A1 or BBQ sauce that you can use for the blackened chicken dish. When we had it it was extremely dry and bland. At the same time, this place is a little on the pricey side. I do not recommend this place as you can find other restaurants that serve better quality of food for cheaper. The décor and ambience were nice though...

the food here was delicious! i had the jambalaya and famous mac & cheese. it was yummy but very heavy food! so go there when you don't have anything planned afterwards. it's that good cooking that make you sleepy! lol

They start by asking you if you want bottled or regular water . Went with my friend I wanted the ravioli unfortunately they were out but our waiter suggested this amazing flavorful lasagna! If you are a vegetarian/vegan you'll love it! My friend got the chicken and waffles! His waffle was amazing! The atmosphere was mixed upscale and chill. We went on Friday night wasn't too busy around 8pm they had tables available and was seated immediately. I would recommend this restaurant. The food was worth it and our waiter was super nice.
No comment

I was visiting BK for the weekend to attend an event at Barclay's. My sister raved about this place and I had it in my bookmarks for a while so I uber'ed over. I had my heart set on brunch, but they were implementing a "limited brunch menu" to make room for their special Valentine's Day menu. (Way to remind me that I'm alone, single, and sitting at a bar for Valentine's Day, SOCO). That was disappointing, but all was forgiven once my food came out. I ordered the BBQ chicken, with mashed potatoes and green beans, with a side of mac and cheese. Everything was excellent. The bartender made tasty drinks. I will most definitely come again the next time I'm in BK. There was so many things on the menu I want to try.

The food was amazing the service was great as well we enjoyed the mussel & caesar salad as an appetizer . As our main course we had lobster shrimp and grits , chicken n waffles and Mac & Cheese .. Delish!!

So I had brunch here on Sunday and I must say the decor is nothing to shout about however the food is simply Delicious. I must say I only had the omelette but it was great. I wanted to try the butter and milk chicken and something else that was on the menu the fish but I didn't want to appear greedy. Also because I would not have completed the entire meals at I ordered them so I will be back to sample other dishes from the menu. Be prepared to speak loudly to the partner you're there with if you attend anywhere between the hours of 4 on. The only thing I did not particularly care for was , no quiet place to dine. I like the waiters and servers. Actually they all were like eye candy from The beautifully shaped plus size woman who greeted us at the door to the slender tall medium brown sultry sister who served us and the Beautiful long Mane of locs brother with chiseled forearms. You guys know who you are keep rocking the place with the diversity. We shall see you soon when we are back in New York

Came here to celebrate a friends 21st birthday. We were early for our reservation so we waited at the bar. The drinks are strong but very good. When we were sat at our table it did take a few minutes for anyone to check up on us however it wasn't a big deal because we weren't focused on the menu as much as we should have been. We all ordered, and the food came fairly quickly. The food was good, the Mac and cheese was amazing and one serving was enough for 3 people to share. All and all it's a great place to have fun and have a drink.
Food was amazing and please get AARON. He is so helpful and very informative on good options on the menu.

The pecan crusted pork chops, mac n cheese, collards greens,  and sweet potatoes were  ALL amazing! Sam was a great waiter and I can't wait to go back.

I have patronized Soco on many different occasions and every time the food is worst. Paying for cornbread on the table to start is very cheesy, that should be a gratuitous starter......  The tap water even taste like toilet water!!!!!!  I so love to support Black businesses but only if they are on point!!!!! STEP IT UP SOCO

Really nice place, fancy, swank, swish! The staff is super nice and friendly, zero attitude establishment, the food is beyond good, you dont need me to tell you. Just go and be amazed for yourself!

Considering we didn't have a reservation, the wait time was reasonable. Bartender service and wait service on point. In all , food and service was good! I'd recommend SoCo and will return!

other than the fact that sometime they are super crowded, the crowd is explainable. the drinks are great food is even better, staff is always amazing, beautiful décor. ive been here at least 6 times and will be back. price wise theyre about $$$ drink and food included. well worth the prices

So I love this restaurant and I like what the business actually stands for. However, what bother me the most tonight was I expected my order to be the same price as online and unfortunately it was definitely different in person. Personally, that misleads your consumer to believe they will receive a certain service but in actuality it's totally different. Cornbread was good and that was about it. Hate being disappointed by large positive Yelp reviews
