Freaking love their Mac and cheese. And salmon burger. Omg. Wish they had one in Long island. They need teacher happy hour though. Over all food is mouth watering good

My friend and I have been on a search for a great soul food restaurant, so we thought that we'd give this place a try. We went on a Thursday night, there was  decent crowd and the place was very trendy looking. We were seated right away, the staff was very friendly and inviting. Once the menus were handed to us, we began to surf through them and we were taken back by the prices, they were serving  mac n cheese for $10. We decided to get ribs, BBQ chicken (appetizers), & the chicken and red velvet waffles (entree). My ribs and BBQ chicken were good, but they were both on the sweet side (Asian infused). I was personally looking for a more smokey and savory taste. My friend enjoyed her chicken and waffles. Overall, we enjoyed our dining experience there, my only peeve was that I believe that the food was overpriced for Brooklyn.

This place is overrated. The service is subpar as the staff couldn't handle simple request like bringing pepper and napkins to the table. Our food wasn't cooked to the requested temperature. The drinks were also poorly mixed and they appeared disgruntled when we sent them back to the bar. The final straw was when it took 45 minutes to close out our bill. Please avoid this place if you want to enjoy Sunday brunch with your friends.
Waited to be seated for 45 minutes even though we had a reservation.  Was told our table was given up while we were standing there waiting.  Hostess was extremely rude and disrespectful.

I've been here at least an dozen times and last night was by far my most lackluster experience. I've start by saving the food was great as per the usually but everything else let something to be desired. I brought some friends from Long Island and had raved about this place. We have reservations for 8pm and showed up on time and we're told they were seating some larger parties and it would be a little while. Ok fine it's a Saturday it was busy. We did not get seated for 45 mins with very little communication from the hostess about the delay. The whole point of reservations is so you don't have to wait. We finally sat and were starving the waiter came over quick enough and took our appetizer order and things seemed to be going ok. We had to ask for water at least 3 times when our cups were empty. Our drinks came with no straws we had to ask for some and wait. Our waiter was friendly enough but a little scatterbrained not sure if he had a lot of tables. Our food took 45 mins to come out. We were so hungry by the time it came all and all the whole dinner experience took 2.5 hours from start to finish. The people sitting to our left said it took 30 mins to get a sprite and the women next to me waited 15 mins for syrup for her chicken and waffles. I really hope the service improves because we would love to return unfortunately this was a very bad first impression for our guests.
Honestly one of my favorite brunch spots. The food was amazing. The only downside is the place is always packed and its hard to get a table.
No comment

Overrated and inconsistent! First time I came here everything was to die! Nice ambiance, live music. Food does take long to come out but that's it.. This last time I went, tap beer was skunky.. Quality of poultry was not good.. Macaroni and cheese was extremely dry and greens Barely had flavor. The red velvet waffle was great as well as the sauce on the wings appetizer. I didn't finish the chicken from either dish because it tasted unfresh. For the prices and the lackluster quality of my meal, I won't be coming back. I would give 4-5 stars for my first visit by consistency is key.

So my work husband and I decided we would stop in to have some dinner on this beautiful day. This is my second time here, nice place, but can we get some lighting? So we ordered the Pecan crusted pork chops with mashed potatoes and collard greens. As we were waiting for our order two ladies sat next to us, they were celebrating a birthday, their waiter asked If they would like something to drink one of the ladies asked what kind of red wine they have he said he would be right back, upon his return he informed them that they were out of red wine in which they responded with "Awww". A few seconds later a gentlemen (Maurice, Mgr.) walks to their table and asked if they were okay and one of the ladies said "Yes, but a little disappointed that there is no red wine" he responded with an unwelcoming tone with the reason is that "they are going to start selling a new line of wines". He was very unapologetic, with no empathy or care. The two ladies tried to brush his rudness off so they ordered a Cosmopolitan, now I'm no drinker, but shouldn't that come in a martini glass??? Well it came in a shot glass.  Now our food arrived and let me say the pork chops were well seasoned, oh how I wished the seasoning would have mixed with the collard greens and where was the garlic in the mashed potatoes? So needless to say the two ladies paid for their cosmopolitans in the shot glasses and decided they were going to celebrate her birthday in the City. I hope she had a blast.

Had the fried chicken sandwich with pickles... Pretty average needed a bit more sauce... The dressing for the side salad served with it was nice also.

Not worth the terrible service! This place needs a management overhaul! First night in Brooklyn and ran into this place. Great vibes and decent prices and delicious dishes. We had the wings for apps and the chicken and potatoes - really good and fine southern taste. Staff is also on point and super attentive. Great place!

Came here yesterday for my birthday and I had a wonderful experience. The decor was really nice small but good enough. They had a violinist playing along with hip hop and R&B tunes which I thought was cool. Now lets get to the food part.  I had the pecan crusted pork chops that came with collard greens,mash sweet potatoes, and a wine sauce which was was Delicious!!! I'm only giving one star because as I sat at the bar with my girlfriends, I was  told that I would need to remove my SEQUENCE "baseball cap" or leave. I find it not only to be rude but ridiculous that I would be asked to remove my hat due to a policy that doesn't allow ball caps. My cap contained no team, was not offensive and is no way associated with a gang or cult especially with it containing again SEQUENCE w/ small bunny ears. The sir there that identified himself as management had no clear answer on how my hat went against their policy nor on why he felt that my head jewelry was a problem. I am all for supporting small businesses and recycling the black dollar but as of today I am deemed to stay away from this specific restaurant and will also spread the word for others to do the same. It was embarrassing as the manager had security also await my party and I by the bar assuring that we were leaving. I remain in disbelief.

I love this restaurant. Sometimes there can be a wait so be prepared. The salmon burger is very tasty and so is the baked Mac and cheese. I love the decor and the food is good everytime I go. There are never any misses on the hospitality. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is cozy.

I used to LOVE coming to this spot as the food every time was never disappointing. I went there last night and the food was mediocre. The salmon really didn't have much taste. Absolutely amazing!  I had the red velvet waffle with the fried chicken and mac n cheese, on the side. The presentation was beautiful. I died and went to heaven. Soco has been one of the best restaurants I've been to in my entire life. So delicious and amazing. The whole experience was life. I went with my boyfriend for brunch. I ordered the buttermilk fried chicken with the red velvet waffle, and my boyfriend ordered the Strawberry Shortcake French toast, and we shared a mac and cheese. I would say make sure you visit and eat your heart out.

I called in advance for a reservation, was told they are not accepting reservations that we can just walk in. We got there at 7:30 was told we had a 30 min wait and our phone number was taken. At 8:05 we went back in to see how much longer the wait would be, we were then told we would have to wait to see if those that made reservations would not coming then we might be seated, but there was not guarantee at this point if were going to get seated any time soon. Discovered this place first in 2012 for my birthday, ever since then it's been love. Regular Sunday brunch as well. Love this place. Love getting the classic buttermilk waffles and chicken. When I go now I try to explore more of the menu. Great customer service and atmosphere!

Visited NYC and stopped by Soco. The restaurant is really nice and the bartender was good. They offer happy hour on drinks which the rum punch option was delicious. The margarita look more like a sample. For food, we tried the cornbread as an app and it came with a tasty butter but the butter was cold and took a while to melt. I ordered the fish and dirty rice the rice was more of a veggie rice than dirty rice I had to add salt to it for flavor. The fish was good. This entree was $33 and I wish I could have said it was great! My husband had the filet and Mac and cheese. It was good. I appreciated they cooked his filet at the right temp. It's a place to try!

So apparently, Myrtle Avenue in BK is the place to see and be seen while eating good. With that, the next stop was SoCoBK. This place is small and very noisy, but cute. It sort of has a modern industrial feel and there is outdoor seating in the rear. The staff was polite and on point. The food was pretty good as well. The mac n cheese that everyone raves about was just okay to me. It is seasoned with some garlic powder like flavor and it's just a bad move in my opinion. The shrimp appetizer was burnt on the outside and raw on the inside like they had been fried in grease that was too hot and did not cook long enough. The sweet potato pancakes and the lobster/shrimp & grits were delish! Overall, I give this spot 3 out of 5 stars. I'll probably go again in the near future.

Absolutely delicious! Ribs amazing, grits fantastic, corn bread awesome!! Greens weren't my favorite but the pork chop was!!!!
We made reservations for a family night out. Our Reservations were kept timely. Food was delicious overall Dinner was great. Fantastic vibe and Brian was fabulous

I came to this restaurant a long time ago but I can't get the flavors of the dishes that I ordered out of my head (which explains this very belated review). I ordered the chicken + red waffles (this was my very first chicken and waffles experience) and upon first bite- I was hooked. Of course after such a pleasant first time experience, I started ordering it at every restaurant I went to but stopped after a few times. The chicken and waffles at other restaurants was nowhere near par with the one here. The chicken was absolutely tender and it wasn't strenuous trying to eat through it. The red velvet waffles was packed with more sweetness than regular waffles, which made it pair so perfectly with the saltiness of the chicken. The second dish that I ordered was the Mac and cheese and it had me putting all the pieces of the puzzle together in my head: I now understand why soul food is such a hit to so many people (and I started planning my next visit back to SoCo). Unfortunately, this spot is pretty far from where I live and painstakingly long of a commute but I haven't forgotten about you, SoCo. I'll be back soon.

On Saturday 5/5/18 at approx. 10:40pm I ordered food and nearly 50 mins later. I'm wondering where's the food?! (Two orders of split lobster tail, shrimp and grits) No update from the waitress at no time. I ask for a manager and then she comes over said let me look into it and then advised me that the server (Crystal) forgot to put the order in. That's absolutely unacceptable. I observe a couple that was seated prior to us wait for their food, get served, have their drinks, pay for the check and leave. Shortly after a group of ladies sit at a table adjacent to us. Get served their drinks and order their food, get served (Chicken and waffles, string beans, Mac n cheese, etc.) We conversed with them and they were shocked that we didn't receive our food yet and they got theirs. The manager comps two drinks one for me and my lady. She had been here a few times and told me how good the dish that we ordered was, but this was my first time. The food comes over an hour later. The server has the nerve at this point to ask is everything okay. I've been to establishments in different countries and have received better service then this. I also worked in customer service for many years and wouldn't even think about doing this to a customer. There was no satisfaction. I feel like I should of been compensated for those meals. I think upper management should take a closer look at the customer experience because I won't recommend any of my friends eating at SOCOBk.
Came for the first time this pass weekend .The atmosphere is great ! Everything is amazing the music, food and I can't forget the drinks you can feel them :):) .Definitely will be back !

Made 2 pm reservations to come here with friends on Sunday for a hungover brunch. Unfortunately, I missed my reservation and had to wait, but the host was really nice and accommodated my request to sit outside. After about a half hour wait, we were seated outside. I already knew I wanted to try out the red velvet waffle and fried chicken. We got two orders of that mac and cheese and free cornbread from checking on Yelp. Everything was very good. Their alcohol brunch is on Saturdays. $12 for unlimited mimosas. The drinks are an average of $13 individually. I opted out of drinking while a friend got a Bloody Mary. I took a sip and it was so spicy. I wasn't a fan, but my friend loved it. Usually I'm a little tipsy at brunch or straight up drunk so everything is delicious, but since I decided not to drink (bc I'm cheap) and I was hungover I was a little more critical than usual. The cornbread was exceptional though. Served with melted butter it was the best I've ever had. Three perfect cornbread muffins was great for the three of us. Not too dry, not too corny (yeah I said that), it was definitely a hit. The outer layer of the Mac and cheese that was baked to perfection was delicious. I wasn't crazy about the inner layer. The Mac was made with a lot of garlic and I can easily describe the inside as creamy garlic noodles. The main event, the red velvet waffle and buttermilk fried chicken was very good, but definitely overhyped. The waffle is good. The red velvet is more subtle than it appears which is good, because it's not dessert. The fried chicken is crispy on the outside, but also a little bit dry on the inside. Next time I would come back on a Saturday for alcohol and try out the wings and other things I saw the people around me eating. Oh and I would make sure I didn't miss my reservation!

Went here with my bf and friends for my birthday brunch. Normally don't do brunch but this was such a great choice! We were running late for our 12pm reservation we called to inform them they were nice about our tardiness and although the place was packed we were able to get seated right away by the tables near the door. Glad we got there when we did since soon after a swarm of people came in. As much as I wanted to try the red velvet waffles and chicken I ended up ordering the sweet pancakes and home fries-YUM!!! Swiped some of my bf's Clinton hill omelette and it was also good. The food took some time to come out but it was well worth the wait. The service was great, loved Robby-nothing worse than bad service to ruin your meal. My bf and I are already planning our next trip so we can try the red velvet waffles and chicken and the macaroni and cheese.

One of my girlfriends brought me here for brunch one Sunday, and I've been back several times since....I love love love this place....from the ambiance, to the staff, and of course the food.  This place is not huge but it's a decent size and can handle large parties. My boyfriend took me here for my birthday dinner, I've been dying to eat here,food look so good,we came here before but the wait was too long, so my boyfriend made a reservation this time, my bday was may,14,2015 but we went on may,15,2015,I ordered the herb marinated steak with sautéed collards and roasted potatoes and chimichurri,he had the steak frites 12oz ny steak creole butter frizzled onions parmesan dusted fries, my steak was so tough, I had to chew each piece like 15 times to be able to swallow it, it was not good, my boyfriend steak was just as tough, my mouth was so sore, when I finish that steak, my boyfriend was so mad  because he never usually order a steak from restaurants not less the restaurant is  a steak joint but he went against his everything he usually don't do, and was so upset, the rest of the stuff on our plates was good, they don't  have much of a selection when it comes too food, their alcohol menu is way bigger, I like the ambiance, the atmosphere was chill, we sat in the backyard which was nice, it was heated when we first got out there, my boyfriend enjoyed his sides as well but our steak was terrible, he was gonna ask to speak to the chef and ask him how could he send out a steak that bad, but I told him to let it go, I had a drink called the wild strawberry moonshine, and it was delicious, I should of had another, but we was going out after dinner so I decided no too,, my boyfriend had the ginger flame, it was good, I would come back here again to try something else, and have some more drinks, I really like the atmosphere, I would never eat the steak ever again, I also need to talk about the waiter, he was missing in action, most of the time we was back there, we asked for the check he forgot, and we had to ask him again..

Went here for my birthday brunch with group of friends on April 22nd.  It was picked mainly because it was one of the few brunch places that I could find that took a reservation for Sunday brunch. I also know it was trendy fun atmosphere with music and vibe and a mainly African American crowd which is what I wanted. I also saw they had bottomless mimosas promoted for brunch but when we got there we found it that is only Saturdays not Sundays....boomer..  This was my 3rd time eating here -  twice for dinner before this date.   And the food gets a solid C at best . Not horrible but nothing special.   I have tasted the chicken and waffles, the shrimp and grits , the salmon and the french toast.  Nothing was really special.   The only exception was the mussels my table shared for  appetizer which  was very good and the rum punch - which was absolutely  perfect.  We ordered 3 rounds of  the rum punch pitchers $35 each pitcher amongst all 6 of us.   We thought being a birthday celebration that So Co could at least give us a deal or special of some sort especially with a $400 bill.   When we asked the manager if we could even get a round of drinks  for the birthday , he said no.  So please note So Co gives nothing special for birthdays not even a free dessert.    Our waiter was excellent and fun - even singing me happy birthday while I did my tipsy dance.   Overall So Co is cool if you have big group and want a reservation and not chance a long wait .  Its a cool vibe but the food isn't special .

The service was pretty good, but the food was a disappointment. I had their signature fried chicken and red velvet waffle. The chicken was undercooked and so was the waffle. I hardly had any of it. The Mac and cheese was good but not the best I've had. I did like the red sangria. Their strawberry shortcake dessert was tasty but had a lemony zest that I don't particularly care for but that's a personal preference. It wasn't my first time at Soco and though I was never a huge fan it has been a couple of years and thought they might have improved. They have not. I won't be returning.

Service is good. Food bland and served warm, not hot. My friend orders pork chops and they placed steak sauce on her plate, right next to the mashed sweet potato. Who puts steak sauce on pork chops?! If the food was better, it would be a much better restaurant because everything else is pretty good.

Let's start off by saying the waiters are courteous and very nice. We ordered the Mac n Cheese, braised molasses short rib, the salmon , Corn bread and the okra and tomatoes. Let's first start with the Mac N Cheese, I would give it a 3 out of 5, it's creamy and slightly cheesy but it has an underlining taste of garlic or some sort of flavoring herb/spice of some kind, which I am not particularly fond of. I don't like the after taste it leaves on my tongue, like msg. The braised molasses was good, average flavored meal with mash potatoes and cheap broccoli or string beans. I didn't finish that meal because the taste become, too redundant and boring. The salmon dish , had absolutely no flavor, bland and horrible and the collard greens mix with the mass potatoes tasted too wet and flavorless ( it looks good but it doesn't taste good). A couple Parallel to us ordered the shrimp/lobster and grits for $29.00 , which only came with grits not costing more than 1 dollar 3 medium size shrimps (YES 3) and 1-2 inch's of microscopic lobster tail, (not 1/2 a lobster)  the female was very unpleased with the portion of her meal and she made it known. The cornbread was dry and the only thing I enjoyed was the okra and tomatoes, I don't see what all the rant is about this place, the food is overpriced for the portion, bland, or has some type of flavoring the decor is trendy but cheap (concrete floors), I mean really, the place looks like a trendy cafeteria.
The mac and cheese is EVERYTHING! Plus I love the atmosphere it's great for a date or ladies night. I can't wait to spend some summer nights there

Very disappointing experience. Check in and you'll get a free cornbread not always honored. The entrees are overpriced for soul food or southern comfort food. I really really love this place! The vibe, the food, the service, the drinks, the decor, the staff...... I could just go on and on! I went for my birthday with friends on a Saturday night (6/15/13). We were seated promptly at 8pm honoring our reservations to the minute. Our waiter knew everything about every item on the menu from the way it was prepared to the taste of each item.  His suggestions were spot on! Service was fast and very friendly at the bar, where we started for drinks, and then in the restaurant. All of us loved our food! A great all around culinary experience that I hope to duplicate in the near future!

I went to this restaurant on Saturday, June 9 2018. I ordered the salmon it was bland, no seasoning at all. My husband ordered the grits shrimp and lobster, it taste awful. Too much red sauce, it made the grits soupy. We're never coming back.

One of the spots I like to eat at in the city. Their mac & cheese is incredibly good. One of the best I've tasted. Nice place for dates and get togethers. Great food, great decor, and great wait staff. A pleasant experience I look forward to experiencing again.
Excellent food and drinks. The lobster, shrimp and grits were so good. The grits were the creamiest grits I've ever had.

My friend and I came in for brunch on a Saturday. Our first impressions were that it was slightly crowded and it seemed fancy. The host never asked us if we were comfortable inside or outside the patio - she just sat us outside. Our server was very friendly and kind. Very accommodating to our needs. We had the option of different types of waters: tap, bottled and one thing else I forgot. The brunch menu was expensive $17 for a b54 burger without cheese. $2 to add bacon, $1 to add white cheddar cheese with Parmesan French fries. My least favorite thing was the French fries- didn't have salt on it just Parmesan. Overall atmosphere is chill but food is overpriced especially since brunch options are limited.
This is one of my favorite places!!! Every time I come here I receive such great service and the food is always amazing!! When friends and family visit this is the place I choose to take them!!!!
You will not be disappointed. Great food and customer service. Luckily I live up the block!

If you order chicken and waffles ($17)and request dark meat, its a $4 up charge. I had fish and chips. And a side of grits extra $5 (serves one).  The fish was a lightly breaded deep fried fillet.  The atmosphere is good and everyone looks to be enjoying themselves. Given that I'm from the south, I'm not particularly thrilled about paying so much for peasant food. That's what southern food is peasant food. Corn, chicken, bread..poor people food but it will cost you at this restaurant.  There price keeps going up. If you want southern food, come over to my house.
No comment
No comment

We went here for a friend's birthday celebration. My favorite mac cheese is from Soca and their salmon is absolutely mouthwatering. I didn't care much for the drinks but their atmosphere during the night was pretty dope, they had a live violinist. However, the only disappointment was the waiter, he took way too long for any transactions to be done whether it was to get boxes for our food, getting the check, picking up the check, getting our credit cards back.. whatever the case may be he took way too long. Sorry to break it to ya but we waited, timed 40 minutes for what should be at most 15 minutes especially when there were only 2 other tables aside from us.
Crowded, but we were able to get 2 seats at the bar immediately. Service was good; food was good, but not as spectacular as I'd expect.

Came here for my niece's college graduation.   The food was luke warm.  I dont' t normally cook with salt but they obviously didn't today or forgot to use other seasoning to bring out the taste.  I had the gumbo which need salt and pepper.  The blackened salmon needed salt.  My niece had the chicken and waffles which was good.   My sister had the lobster and grits which was delicious. The drinks are okay. Service was not good due to the waiters were inexperienced.

I have been hearing about this place and finally got to go. The wait time is longer than what is told. We were told 30 minutes and it was almost an hour. So I would advise you to arrive a bit earlier. The fried chicken and red velvet pancake is awesome! For those who never had that, it's like having red velvet cake just as a waffle so it is sweeter than your typical waffle but is awesome with some syrup.

Soco was on my mind heavy yesterday! My boyfriend and I drove from queens in traffic but the trip was worth every minute. I ordered the Steak Fritas and he had the classic Chicken & Waffle dish. I don't think I ever tasted such a juicy, tender steak from any restaurant to date. yes! It was that good. Even a customer next to me approached our table saying her pork chop was delicious but wished she'd ordered what I had. The Parmesan fries were the cherry on top! I'll be back next week for more :)

Came here with a friend and he said it was classy. Was puzzled until I saw a violin player at the bar! Super cool, music was great. We checked in and had the free corn bread. Soft and fluffy. The pickled oysters were soft and tender and went well with the bed of pickled veggies. The chicken and waffles were one of the best I had. Service was attentive and my water glass was always filled. Highly recommend this joint.
No comment
Great drinks, amazing food. I love love discovering new places. This one is definitely one I'm going to go back to. Bring a sweater, though, cause the ac is kinda intense
No comment
Amazing food and great service. Always a pleasure to come back here and enjoy Chicken on a Red Velvet Waffle.

I've been to this restaurant several times. I usually get their shrimp and grits or wings & mac & cheese, all great dishes. The quality of their food is excellent and the atmosphere and management is also on point. Every time I've been , the waitstaff has been very attentive and accommodating. The backyard area is so charming and beautiful plus its enclosed which is nice.

Yesterday was my first time eating at SoCo!  And, I must say I really enjoyed my meal...I had the shrimp & grits,..that was my first time eating such a combination ...the shrimps were flavorful & the grits were thick & creamy ! Amazing ! I ordered the mardi gras to drink! It was nice & strong ! The atmosphere in Soco is very nice, I like the lighting and the outside seating! It does feel a little congested bc it's a small restaurant/bar ! However, SoCo is great !

Food was great! Service was so-so; took a long time to order and get receive the food. One interesting practice: automatically adding 20% tip on your bill during a holiday...hmm...

Get the gumbo!!! I have lived in the South for several years, and tasting this gumbo was absolutely divine! It's not salty, nor is it bland. It was filled with so much veggies, sausage, and flavor! I LOVED the gumbo!!! The grits with the andouille sausage was my entree (no pic because I got too greedy), and I must say.. Those grits were wonderful!! I will definitely be back here!
No comment
No comment
Good stuff!! It was a little loud inside but it looks very nice and the food taste pretty good! The service was good as well. I would come back again.

I've tried some of the best Soulfood Diners in NYC. Sylva's & her niece Melba's in Harlem and I've also tried Jezebels on Restaurant Row in Hell's Kitchen. So when I heard about Soco's in BK, I just had to give them a Bronx cheer. I had the Buttermilk Fried Chicken/Red Velvet Waffles, Aunt Cruz's Mac & Cheese. First the spicy chicken was prepared a little well too done for me to appreciate its flavor. The Red Velvet waffles looked appealing but was lacking in taste. Last, Aunt Cruz's Mac & Melba's was tremendous in a miniature skillet but ate like a casserole. The beef short ribs were seared just a tad bit over blackened. Since I was celebrating my 25th Wedding Anniversary, I had what was supposably their best sparkly white wine turnt out to be bittersweet. But I would like to add that my server (Amy) was courteous, attentive and seemed caring, so I made no complaints. The decor and ambience was somewhat Applebee's- ish. Well, this dining experience at Soco's cannot compare to the delectable ones I've  had at Melba's .

Really really poor service. Come with a large party back ones for 4pm. It's 437 and still table is not ready. Staff seem indifferent. What's the point of a reservation. It's the way the staff deal with these things that really matters.

Ok. So it took me a minute to try this spot mainly because I hate to be a follower of anything 'hot' and new. But seriously the hype is real!!! The chicken and waffles are amazing. Hubby had the shrimp and lobster grits - wow! You won't be disappointed. Just know that for brunch you will be waiting at least 30mins (unless ur willing to eat at the bar - which we did). You can however make reservations on opentable.
No comment
No comment
It was amazing! I had the fried chicken and waffles with the side of mac n cheese! Absolutely delish! I can't wait to back!
Food was amazing here.... cane here last year for my anniversary and it was to die for. Especially for a pregnant woman ! Yummy food all around and great service !

The food was delicious but the service was absolutely terrible. It took 45 minutes for our food to come after watching other tables that came later than us get their food first. The greeter had an attitude and to me was unprofessional the same with our server. The over all look of the restaurant was great, trendy and fun. Again, the food was delicious, the the staff ruined the evening for me and my party. I will not be back.
Attended Soco today service was excellent the food was delicious this restaurant is one of better place to dine in Brooklyn

Made reservations for a party of five for 8pm. Arrived ten minutes before our reservations. Waited over an hour to be seated. While I was waiting at the bar I saw a ROACH crawling towards me. My friends and I were shocked. Told the STAFF  and they didn't seem like they cared...seemed like this was the usual for them. At the same time they moved us to our table...contemplating staying or not. But the way the staff reacting towards us...we just left and went two doors down to Wrays... never again

No comment
Buttermilk chicken and red velvet waffle was amazing! Mac and cheese was slap your mama good. Will def be back!

Love this joint. Whether it's with my boys or sans enfants, the staff are impeccably lovely and so attentive. The bar girls, especially sweet. Cheers, to the lovelies, Crystal n Kita. Go meet them and indulge in some southern delights n good vino.

Went on the day after new years which was January 2, 2016 for a friend's bday brunch. They had no more wings, Mac and cheese, fried catfish, chicken and waffles etc. They pretty much ran out of food that day. They did however try to make up for it with house champagne and cornbread. They still made a mistake on our bill by charging us for Mac and cheese that we didn't even consume but that was sorted out.
No comment

Service was terrible. Went with a group of 5 people and the initial guy helping us was rude, gave us attitude when asking for something simple such as ice for our water. The second guy that came to serve us was good. The food took almost an hour to come out and they blamed it on the salmon saying "it takes a while to cook". I make salmon in 15 minutes but ok I guess. I ordered the Cajun pasta and received food poisoning. Never going back- don't waste your time

This place is super cute inside so I'll give them a star for that. My food was also pretty good so they get another star for that. Neither of those stars are enough for me to come back here if I'm in BK ever again any time soon. The service was extremely slow. Our waiter forgot about us - TWICE- first to greet us and take our drink orders - 10 minutes - and then to bring out our drink orders (20 minutes!!!). That alone turned me completely off. Then even worse - they tacked on an 18% tax on our bill...we were a party of 3 people - and everything on the menu was overpriced. This establishment is a JOKE for that. They clearly feel entitled, which is fine. Just not on my dime.
No comment

SoCo is fantastic. I've been multiple times for brunch and enjoyed the UNLIMITED mimosas. I've also been for dinner. The food is incredible, I daydream about the fried chicken and the Mac n cheese. The staff is friendly and checks in frequently. The decor is great, I enjoy the booths, the high ceilings, and the bathrooms. They have a small outdoor seating space in the back that I haven't been in. Be prepared they get busy for brunch, since so many others agree with my 5 star rating!

I ordered the red velvet waffle and buttermilk fried chicken.  The waffle was a bit on the soggy side, but the chicken was excellent.  My wife had the pecan crusted pork chop which was great.  Her green and mashed yams were sooo good.  Ordered the fried oyster appetizer, it was really good but very small portion for the price.

I dined at Soco on A Tuesday evening and to my suprise it was pretty packed. We chose to be seated in the outdoor part which was pretty cute but it was a limited space so if you like room then the outdoor part is not for you. They really had some interesting cocktails on the menu. We ordered fried oysters which really good but not worth the price to me. I had the red velvet waffles with fried chicken which was a big portion of food. Me and my friend end up sharing a side of macaroni & cheese which was the best damn mac n cheese I've had on planet earth. Definitely considering going there again.
Average cuisine.  GREAT drinks.... Love the atmosphere.

THERE IS A HEAVEN, and it is at SOCO with its fried chicken and sizzling mac-n-cheese. Best of all, your arteries won't feel clogged afterward! This place is happening .. DJ lightly spinning on Friday nights, food is ridiculously good, drink menu is creative and fresh .. I'm drooling as I'm writing this review. Service and ambience was on-point. Staff was kind and considerate, and always checked up on us at the right time and made sure the food was good, even on a busy Friday night. TRUST THEIR RECOMMENDATIONS! Unlike every other New Yorker, they're not trying to hustle you. Definitely worth the wait and the return trip!

I guess my expectations were too high. So here is my opinion. The Ambiance was perfect, the food was average.   You have to stick to the menu.  We tried to order what we wanted but they were not accomodating.  The waiter even argued with my wife about what she can and can not  get with her fried chicken. I have tasted much better chicken and the waffles was just ok.  However the f que wings and the cornbread especially the cornbread was amazing but I don't think I'm going back.
No comment
I didn't like it. Way over priced.  Not authentic,  if fusion is adding garlic powder to Mac and cheese they can keep it.  I suggest you choose another restaurant.  I won't be going back.

The food was phenomenal! Went there for Sunday brunch and overall a great experience from the food to the environment, but back to the food. Our table ordered chicken & red velvet waffles, jambalaya, sausage & grits, the blackened salmon and a side of cornbread. Everything was delicious, especially the sausage and grits.
Red chicken and waffles . Enough said! The food here is like crack . I love the Mac and cheese and biscuits are so good . Great ambience
No comment

Great food, great atmosphere, great service. The only thing that bothered me, and I know I'm nitpicking, is the small tables. My mom and I each ordered an entree and a side and they barely fit on the table. It could have just been where we were seated. But other than that it's perfectly fine. I recommend this place to everyone.
I had the grits, lobster and shrimp for brunch. The grits were so creamy, shrimp cooked to perfection but the lobster tail was extremely small. Service was good and the atmosphere was pleasant.
No comment
Fried chicken and red velvet waffles were awesome!!! Staff were friendly and service was also on point!
No comment
The best French toast EVER! The rest of my party loved their food. Everything was perfect!

Cool soul food restaurant on Mrytle Ave.  Serves up some kick ass Southern Comfort dishes, hence the name SoCo.  Nice, fresh staff and bartenders, cool decor, crowded when I was there.  Not in Brooklyn too often and soul food is not really my thing thing but whenever I'm in BK and in the mood for some good southern cookin...  SoCo gets my patronage.
Jambalaya was ok .. Drinks were excellent .. Bartender was so nice .. Must go back for the chicken and waffles

The service at Soco's was exceptional. My waiter attended to our every request. Even when my friend spilled water all over the table, the waiter rushed to our aide and helped us stop the water from spilling all over . The food was delicious. I had the FQue  wings and their famous mac and cheese. I will definitely go to SoCo again in the near future
I had a great time at SoCo.   The food was great.  The prices are very reasonable.  The Staff was very professional and friendly.   I totally recommend SoCo.

I am normally not a fan of southern food, but I have been trying it more often and starting to like certain southern foods. So this was my first time dining at SOCO in the middle of the week and it was busy. We didn't wait too long to be seated. But just a couple of things I have to point out, which catch my attention in a major way. First off, the wait for the food was very long and certain important details like for example: my girlfriend is pregnant and she must have very well done steak was still mess up after that long wait. And when called and let known that she is pregnant and that the meat needs to be very well done. We had to wait another 30min-1hour and the steak was burn on top, but inside was still bloody. So finally we had to get the manager to deal with this and have him take the steak away and just have a complete different order which didn't take too long as the other orders. The manger even came out and apologize and make sure we was ok with our meal, which was very good. At the end of our meal, we got better service and bill

Heard good things about this place but because I wasn't  wearing a sleeved shirt i had to leave. Sorry it's August and Summer in NY..#thumbsdown

Worst dining experience ever!..went there last night. Waited an hour and fifteen minutes to be seated. On top of that was seated right next to the door that was constantly opening and closing letting the cold in. Second thing, the line to be seated was right in front of our table. Only to wait another hour for the food to be served! Oh yes, and I almost forgot about the drink I ordered that took a half hour! At that point, it really doesn't matter what the food tastes like.

A great brunch spot for Brooklyn's young, trendy professionals! I came here on a Sunday with my cousin, sister, and her friend. We sat at the bar, due to the long understandable wait, and it was a geat decision. The bartenders were extremely friendly. We spoke about topics from the global Black plight to natural hair care. It was abit annoying that they did not offer bottomless mimosas on Sunday, but I think that we all preferred the feeling we got from drinking numerours  cocktails... if you know what I mean. Overall, a great place for a girls' brunch or a cute date. Be sure to stop by and try their Brooklyn Bellini

Im only giving this place a 3 star bc I ordered & picked up. Never sat down & actually ate at Soco's. I tried the Red Velvet waffles & chicken. It was a bit pricey but overall it was good. From the pick up the ambiance looked amazing tho. I'll try coming back to get the full experience & update my review

Oh I just love this place. I was torn between Nola steamed mussels and the 509 Caesar salad. I think I'm going to have the salad summer is around the corner. No but seriously if you want to eat in a stylish hip resturant and great food SOCO is the place to be.

I love Soco.  Last night was my 4th time there and as usual the service, atmosphere and food never disappoints.  The red velvet waffles and chicken are to die for.  The ribs on the appetizer menu were great!!  The mac n cheese...delicious and the drinks were on POINT!!! I had the mardi gras cocktail which was just right.  Make sure you make reservations so you can avoid long waits but you will NOT be disappointed!!!

I can't get enough of this place! I have been going here for years, and I never get bored with their signature dish, fried chicken and red velvet waffles. I also tried other dishes and I love, love, their brunch. I absolutely adore their macaroni and cheese as well. I have not had a bad dish here yet! From the fried chicken and waffles, to their salmon, to their organic chicken, to the macaroni and cheese, to the drinks, I have not had any bad food so far. Staff can be a little bit busy but and the food can sometimes take a little while to prepare, on busy days, but it's well worth the wait. That is my "go to" spot for chicken and waffles or a good decent brunch.

Although my prior  experiences dining here left vast room  for improvement im regards to customer service. I returned to Soco on  a Thursday night prior to seeing  a show at The Barclay. The food was great as usual. This time I ordered the pecan  crusted  pork chops which are my new favorite dish here. Also ordered the mac n cheese ...fabulous!  The customer service this time around was oustanding from the moment  we walked in the door. I will definately return.
SocoNONo....deserves no **** the food is disgusting....OK I will give it a one star for the cornbread and the Meyers soap in the bathroom..

The food and service is consistently good.  The fried chicken and red velvet waffles, and Mac n' Cheese are delish! I go there often and I've never been disappointed.  If you want good southern comfort food, go to Soco!
This place is extremely overrated and overpriced for the quality of the food. This was my last time trying to give this place a shot. Two stars cause our waitress was lovely.

No comment

I was so excited to try this place and was utterly disappointed! I made reservations for a party of 11 and we waited over 90 minutes for our food to come out. The party of 7 seated next to us came 30 minutes after we arrived and received their food before us. When our food finally came out one of the orders was "allegedly" given to another table and they expected us to wait another 15 minutes for that person to receive their food. And when the food finally came it was cold and not one person at the table was satisfied with their food. We waited forever for food that didn't taste good! When we voiced our concerns to the manager his resolution was to take the gratuity off the bill so we could decide what we wanted to tip our waitress. Why put the responsibility solely on the waitress? She doesn't cook the food or run the kitchen?! Needless to say none of us will EVER come back here!

Just left Soco and I have to say, we enjoyed every plate. My husband and I went with our two little boys  3yrs old and 9month old. I was nervous since it was a nice place but it was before the dinner rush so we took a chance. Glad we did. They were very accommodating to the boys. Very comfortable seating and AC was  blasting - thank goodness since today was about 90 out. I ordered the lobster, shrimp and grits, my husband the BBQ chicken and my 3 yr old the Mac n cheese. All was delicious! So glad we went in and gave it a try. Definitely will recommend this to friends. Will be going back for a date night!
